DYc6SH1WSY13knFOdI-ymg.review_text: Took the bf here for a nice lil surprise dinner after a musical show on a Sunday. Yummy seafood dishes! We ordered the lobster and the whole crab! Deliciousness! Amazing lemon drop martinis! Great service!  If you're like me and you enjoy dining with a view, then this is the place to be. Do the romance hehe =)

9oEBAWFlZTs2TB5i2P0aqQ.review_text: I've always heard about San Francisco's infamous clam chowder & fish and chips. We were going to eat at 2 separate places for the items, but found this place served both and had good reviews so we went here instead.   We started with the clam chowder in a bread bowl and the crab cake risotto fritters. The clam chowder was delicious, best I've tried. As someone stated in the tips below, just get the soup because they serve bread and butter for free, so our bread bowl was pretty much left un-eaten. The crab cake fritters were amazing as well. It was so much food so we shared the fish and chips. Fries were good, but the fish was underwhelming. The fish itself was flaky and light but the batter was unseasoned and made the whole thing just bland. I didn't care for the tarter sauce or cole slaw either.   Overall, pretty good! I'd come back just for the clam chowder.

GdkQR7PJ6dRPP_ezYs3cpg.review_text: The view is beautiful. Food and service is okay. My friends were traveling in SF for the first time and wandering around Fisherman's Wharf. That's why I was dining in the place, just to meet my friends. I probably wouldn't go there if otherwise.

c8nRvIM_Pqz8CbfYaTu8vA.review_text: I came here for "fresh" oysters and lobster which were highly recommended by lots of people. It tasted OK BUT this is what I got after this--viral gastroenteritis (another name for the "stomach flu". I had to run to bathroom every 5 minutes and I threw up like crazy.   I was sent to the emergency department and was told by the doctor this disaster was caused by virus in food. And yes, the food at this place is all what I ate before all the symptoms started. The "fresh" oysters here are absolutely poisonous. I paid more than 2000 bucks in the emergency department (and extra 300 bucks for my health).  I will NEVER go to this place again, and I'm worrying that those poor tourists (maybe without insurance) CANNOT withstand going to the hospital in the middle of the night. DONOT go here. DONOT risk your life.

uzuAMu2B9PFhNlHfm69hLg.review_text: Their food is delicious! My husband and I went while on our honeymoon and absolutely loved it. The food was great, our waiter was delightful, and the ambiance was perfect. The only thing I would change is the time we waited. But overall the wait was worth it!

Z2c1Sx1rfzg0I5-N8yBhgA.review_text: Clam chowder was something else, the bread was fresh out of the oven and all the rest of the food was exceptional.

GMY44WcTkOSIRR77SFsDCw.review_text: fisherman's wharf is a tourist trap.  I was skeptical of all those side walk hawkers promising the best food... yelp directed me to Fog Harbor and I owe you both a huge thank you!  it goes like this, the wife had to take an important work conference call, this area is crowded, she ducked into an alley.  the three kids and I found ourselves stuck on the sidewalk.  the kids started to melt down, one of my son's punched the other in the nuts , so he got hit back (as I explained, you hit somebody in the balls, you expect to get hit back, hard).   these kids needed to be out of the sun, and food in their bellies.    this place was nicer than I expected.  the staff was SUPER friendly to me and my three kids.  I caught glances at plates of food being eaten by other people and I saw what we needed, BLUE CHEESE GARLIC BREAD! ($8)  that and I got myself a beer, when in SF Anchor Steam it!  bread came quick, kids loved it and everybody quit crying and no more nad wahcking.  my daughter consumed an entire salmon BLT and loved it.  my oldest son loves soups, he had the chowder.  youngest son had the kids menu fish and chips.  HOLY FREAKIN CRAP that fish and chips was good and HUGE!  I've seen smaller portions from the regular (non-kids) menu at other fish houses.    after an hour in that alley, on a conference call. t he wife joined us and we enjoyed oysters!    we later agreed that Fog Harbor was one of the best (albeit nearly accidental) finds of the trip.  and a BIG thanks to the waitress that has SW themed tattoos behind her ears that matched my jacket, it was our destiny!

hTAKG103EUfeHrFA1TXFng.review_text: Absolutly worth to wait at the front desk - if you have too!  Service was friendly, food was delicious and the view into the harbor of Pier 39, Alcatraz in the background - just amazing.

2pO73ObkW3inHsy7hxyLGA.review_text: Was not at all impressed with this place. The tables were too close to each other and I felt very claustrophobic. We ordered fried calamari, baked oysters, clam chowder - have had better, chicken penne - pasta was dry, wild salmon, crab roll, and fried combo. Overall, the food was just okay. Service wasn't too great either.

znAu0tFeqEvAJ8GO1YnntA.review_text: Went there twice and each time it amazes me how good their seafood meals are! Love their clam chowder and it is definitely a must get.   If you happen to be there, do check out their coffee shop that sells biscoff cookie downstairs.

IveMgM8uG0qflyfWCyu2IQ.review_text: This is the place to be if you want to have a view of the harbor and sea lions. The food is excellent and service outstanding.  Even for being in a tourist area the servers treat you well. A must visit if you are visiting the Pier area.

QTSm9Z1092hv2rDSw12Sng.review_text: After a long day biking in the city we decided to stop here to get some seafood. Our server, Khaiman, was really helpful with advice on what to order and checking in on us the entire time we were eating. He was also hilarious. I ordered the crab roll which was delicious! (P.s. The portions are pretty big) My boyfriend got the seafood combo and loved the calamari. I got the blackberry press which is a type of lemonade that they make which was also wonderful. The only thing that was less than spectacular was probably the clam chowder which was a bit above average. Overall I would recommend this place and hope to come back soon!

MvzUoye4DKsBdB4dylgpDw.review_text: Why would this Finding Nemo lovin' girl like the Fog Harbor Fish House?   I'll tell you why. Lean in...  ...a little closer...  ...juuuuust a bit closer...  Because it does. The End.  (Just Kidding!) The food has great quality, you'll fill up on the free sourdough bread (the best I've had), they have wonderful meals and for a fishy joint, it's not all bad. Compared to OTHER restaurants that primarily serve seafood, I have to say Fog Harbor blows them out of the water.   You have a beautiful scenic view, there are large windows showing the skyline and water of San Francisco. They validate and you have many other attractions on the Pier 39 wharf. Do yourself a favor and use yelp to reserve a reservation. It was a God-send for me and my party.

hGwhhG14RlQj7FmCOFPlfA.review_text: This place was really great. I'm not sure why other other people are complaining but, it definitely was not a-OK type of place during our visit. We ordered 1/2 lb. crab with linguine, crab cake entree, salmon scruttoni (?) appetizer. The waiter was fun, fast, friendly, had some jokes up his sleeve. The view was breathtaking. I really, really wanted to try their vanilla creme brule but was too stuffed to even attempt. We had lunch so I didn't feel like drinking so I have no idea how that menu looks but the food was great, simple and just enough. We will be back.

UKSweOQ9zoPy4-9Ge0Ay1w.review_text: Of our 8-day vacation, my husband said our visit here was the low point.  Our waiter did not speak English, and so he did not know how to answer our questions.  For example, when my husband asked "What are your three most popular entrees?"  he responded "All of our seafood is fresh."  When I asked what was the least fishy-tasting fish, he told me the Salmon was great.  (We got a sampler, and although the salmon was fine, it was certainly not the least fishy - just the most expensive!)  I decided to place my drink order at the bar rather than try to communicate it to him.    The clam chowder was really good, but the rest of the food was not that great.  It was very expensive.  There has got to be better options in San Francisco.

LJJ2Rxr-EtUvzvLWqbUDig.review_text: Best clam chowder sourdough bread bowl ever--flaky and crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. And the baked oysters--the best my oyster-aficionado boyfriend and I have ever had. Reasonably priced considering how delicious the food was, and service was good--very friendly.

WSzAYzC82McHNgzeUNzjLg.review_text: Fresh seafood, fantastic view. The service can improve though. Our waiter was nice but too slow. We had a baby with us and he didn't take that into account when serving. Water wasn't refilled and requests were forgotten. We had to wait a while for our food, which i think he either forgot to put in or was too busy. Nonetheless, we did enjoyed our food.

EFE39kqoeODPZhOVzSRVVQ.review_text: Super friendly staff, small but varied menu, and everything was really tasty. I got the garlic half crab and it was drenched in olive oil; super delicious, but trying to crack it and get the meat out was certainly a challenge with slippery hands.  We went at a fairly busy time and were seated right away, and our food came fairly quickly, as well!

HPWI9uEYjTxmNWZABchoDw.review_text: A more solid 3.5 stars but I gave it a bonus 1/2 star.    Service was excellent 5 stars.  We were very well attended to the entire time.    We had the 1/2 crab Louis w/sub for blue cheese which was a nice side salad for 2 if you're not too hungry.  The dressing is one of the best I've had.  Cheesy and creamy just like my grandfather used to make!  Forget the Louis dressing and go for the blue cheese!  We also had the sliders which were pretty overage and overpriced.  I wouldn't order them again.  The crab sandwich was excellent.  Bread was freshly made and the crab filling was delicious.  We had the kids and they had the salmon which tasted very good and the $0.95 sundae was a can't miss  Overall a really good experience.

8OjeOQFD6rkEo6xXWlLvtw.review_text: definitely my go to place for dinner at pier 39!!

We4JRYPNdzRmfZ53-nIiLg.review_text: We love this place!  We stumbled upon it while wandering the tourist trap known as Fisherman's Wharf with our friend, who had never been.  The clam chowder here is by far the best we've had and the bread bowl it came in was freshly baked and really, really good.   All 3 of us got the Dungeness crab and it was really good.  It's usually hard to find a good place in the middle of all the tourist stuff, but this is definitely one not to miss.  If you like crab and clam chowder, this is the place to try!

EYOU4LJadl0cR1Adl75CPA.review_text: We were on a company event and it was my first time to visit this place. Never been to a true sea food place, but this was a good start. The food here was AWESOME and I had Clam Chowder for the first time and it was really good. I would go back to this place with no issues. So I recommend this place and of course the food as well.

PjRVdUnnFvG_2Xqs9kk4jQ.review_text: We ordered the shellfish platter and wild salmon, tasted great! The service was amazing and the waiter was very nice to my kid. The dessert was delicious. Prices are a bit high but still affordable.

783dRt1rHss5gIORRgTwow.review_text: First a hint. A AAA card gets you 20% off the food bill.  I was leaning towards four stars until the tiramisu arrived. It was not terrible just not very good. Too much lady fingers and not enough of what makes tiramisu tiramisu.   OK, lets start at the beginning. With me, three stars is not bad, it means just what I expected, nothing more, nothing less. In this case expectations had to be pretty high, given the prices. My cioppino was excellent and did not skimp on ingredients. Judit chose fried shrimp and fries and it is hard to mess that up. The service was spot on, the ambiance excellent. And we did not feel touristy. Then the tiramisu arrived.

mpm9olv35gqQePUdQvK62g.review_text: Came here last week for dinner while entertaining an out of town visitor. Venue is nice - big and touristy. We started with the crab and risotto fritters. These were slightly disappointing, was hoping for crispy hot fritters and received this lukewarm, kind of soggy conglomeration of crab and risotto. Also got a moscow mule and bowl of cioppino - the moscow mule was standard (a little weak), and this was my first venture into ordering cioppino, after tasting others' at different restaurants and really liking it. This one was very solid in quantity of seafood, with lots of crab, scallops, shrimp, clams and mussels, which made it a delight to eat. However, I think the seafood might have been cooking a little too long, because the scallops were near disintegrating and the crab tasted straight up like the broth. So, the seafood was fresh and plentiful, but the seafood all tasted the same, as if it had been boiling in the broth together for a long time. Shrimp and mussels were the highlight, they seemed to be have cooked properly and still had some firmness. The broth was simple and tasted like tomato soup, though some salt and pepper brought out the flavors well. Also, wanted more than a small sliver of garlic bread! Waitstaff was friendly.  Overall, very much enjoyed the meal, but there were a few things that stood out as pieces that could easily be improved upon.

eDePNuwdPGuP9M1fPNLX9Q.review_text: Great view, okay food, poor service and management.  My family and I have been there twice.  We chose this restaurant because they advertise that they can make most of their dishes gluten free (we have food allergies in our family) and have marked those dishes on the menu.    The first time we went I was served wine in a (very) dirty glass.  I told the server, and about 15 minutes later he brought me a new glass of wine.    The second time we went was on the Sunday of a holiday weekend.  My wife and I both ordered their warm spinach salad, but the server told us that they had run out of spinach.  Really?  On a holiday weekend?  Seems like poor planning, but not that big of a deal.  No worries, we ordered some other dishes, and waited for our food.  And we waited, and waited, and waited.... After 40 minutes our server told us that the chef had made a mistake - I had ordered a gluten free dish, and the chef made prepared it improperly.  So I had the server bring the rest of the dishes and sat there and watched my family eat for 15 more minutes while they made my dish.  Finally, after almost an hour, I got my tuna.  Admittedly, it was pretty tasty... but by that point I was hungry and in a bad mood, so anything would have tasted good.   For our trouble, the manager offered us 30% off during our next visit.  When I told him I was in the military and we were moving overseas and we wouldn't be back, he simply said, "Okay, well, we'd still love to have you back."  Didn't offer to take care of our appetizers or take the 30% off of our bill that day... would have been a nice gesture.    The view is nice, the food is above average, but the service is terrible.  Wouldn't go back even if we weren't moving.

P7V1gC2K41B7I2CJc3bkfQ.review_text: For natives, Pier 39 is rarely a destination.  But the area has the highest concentration of crab serving restaurants.  Based on a recommendation, I found myself staring at the Dungeness Crab menu at Fog Harbor Fish House.  I tried the crab cake sandwich and garlic roast crab with popcorn shrimp appetizers.  The shrimp was super tender and hot (Yum!).  The crab cake was delicious and filling and the garlic roast crab was as good as you can find on the wharf.  The views are my favorite and the service was attentive and kind. Parking is easy at the garage across the street and you can walk your meal of on the pier.  A great place for crab with a view!

mNvmpAY9H71Oj1K1BSKBPA.review_text: An absolute trio of perfection. Stunning water views, stellar food plus all-star service. Snugly tucked into Pier 39, walking through these doors firmly transports you away from the tourist set on the outside.  It's the crown jewel which outshines them all.  Fish = fabulous. View = staggering. Service = extraordinary.   It's all key to a fantastic dining experience. If you find yourself in San Francisco, lose your self in this wonderful restaurant. I did and absolutely loved it.

LBa7TzL_U2sMqt6AP1UECA.review_text: We requested and were seated at a table by the window.  The view is spectacular and worth the price of lunch or dinner.  Our waiter, Faycal, couldn't be more attentive, professional and friendly.  The calamari was excellent and the half wedge of iceburg with blue cheese was refreshing and delicious.  With so many restaurant choices at Pier 39, we chose wisely!

LaMQv6aumN__wAIgnE77-Q.review_text: Clam chowder was the best I ever had. Full of clam. The Ahi Tuna was cooked perfectly. Booked marked this for future visits and recommendations.

KGkVWWlaS7kETDfW3teAgQ.review_text: Sit in Khaiman's section, he rocks! Best waiter I've had in a while. The food is delicious and reasonably priced.

J2t5Owvyc8nZQYf2bq9UfQ.review_text: We went here on the Fourth of July, which was probably not the best time to go but we hadn't eaten and it looked like the best choice on the pier. Well, we waited for 2 hours to get a seat and by the time we got in there we were starving. They were packed and the place was so noisy from the bar that I couldn't hear my husband talk from across the table. The waiter had a really thick accent which made it impossible to understand him over all the noise. Once he got orders it took him 15 min to bring us some bread which I was dying for! and then about a minute later he brought the food, which was quick considering the amount of people there. I had crab cakes which were ok but not for the price I paid for them. My husband got the clam chowder bread bowl and he loved it and it was relatively inexpensive.  Maybe this place would be better on a regular day, but I am not in a hurry to go back again.

cUeRxIMS-IoUpCgXJ15cDQ.review_text: reading the reviews we thought that this was THEEE seafood experience.  NOT.  One star is for the views.  We had tasteless dishes that were presented with fine flair.  And the cocktails were good. But seating next to a couple who were arguing that their date wasn't going well, and then the next foursome that we college kids trying to impress each other, helped to ruin this experience. Don't consider the the blue cheese bread our's was dried out.  And the shrimp cocktail was blah blah.  The blue cheese dressing on the salad also was watery.  Sorry. but the truth is this was a terrible disappointment.

RLL1eWVnOC5IXq_X9x0yJA.review_text: We traveled to San Francisco looking forward to all the good food we went to fog Harbor at fisherman's wharf.  It was absolutely atrocious you can get better clam chowder and shrimp cocktail in Salt Lake at Market St. Grill I got the lobster tail and it tasted horrible I had to send it back. I honestly can't recommend this place nobody in my party of four like their meal.

p48wOkW2t_IQmAPHRxblPQ.review_text: A really nice sea food restaurant if you're near the pier. The view is great, especially if right before sundown. I also noticed that the restaurant is really well run. Through the open door to their back room I could see their ops schedule - very impressive whiteboard with names and rows. And the service lined up with that. Everything was quick, and no mistakes.   I also noticed that the restaurant was determined to get reviews. Case and point: I got a free appetizer for checking in and a free desert for giving a quick review (note that it was a review on their website. My yelp reviews can't be purchased with a desert or anything else!)   The food was good, hot, and came out quickly. It just wasn't that unique; it didn't have a chef's touch, which is the primary reason for my 4 rating. But I did enjoy the experience and would certainly go back.

YkQgfpCGB0lPG3VCgBo-Tw.review_text: The yelpers are right this place is really good both in food and service.   Had the Tuna poke, cup of clam chowder and the freshest salmon ever!  Also tried cable car, gimlet and margarita.  Everything was prepared extremely well and served quickly.   The place is crowded and you should expect a wait, but it is worth it.  Waiter was new, but really hustled.  Will certainly be back.

l9DKlN8Kg-5w7Qwd3AHDEw.review_text: Great location and view. Seated promptly, and no problem when I called that we were running late. Dinner was good, but nothing exceptional.

-vh3rQnqhurZwe_r49wRqg.review_text: We visited this restaurant from out of town and the food was amazing, the staff was courteous, but my girlfriend has food allergies and when she started having an allergic reaction the manager comped our entire table, nearly $100 worth of food and drinks, and personally aplogized. Never did we expect to be taken care of so well. Everything was great outside of the small reaction and I created a yelp account and downloaded the iPhone app just to share this with yelp.

N5CbhwrTckjqB8C4JtXrFQ.review_text: Great ambiance, it has a nice dim romantic feel to it. They have a fireplace outside with seats while you wait to be called inside. Sadly, thats where it stops. The service is extremely slow, waited a long time to get water, straws ect. It was getting frustrating. I was with 4 other people so we ordered a variety of things since it was our 1st time there. We ordered the crab & shrimp sandwich and it was ok not worth the $15 that its priced. The crab melt sandwich was not that good either $16 (I was feeling nauseous had to drink coke to feel better, didn't taste fresh).  Ordered the crab cakes and popcorn shrimp for our appetizers and they were not any better. The clam chowder in the bread bowl was great. They also serve free sourdough bread with butter which was good. I would not return or recommend.

pdzAXyi5GrseQIyEt1jz4A.review_text: We had reservations and arrived in time.  The hostess was ready to seat us but couldn't until another hostess came to the front so they would have someone there to greet customers. We waited almost five minutes for this other hostess to return so we could be seated. They had a beautiful table reserved for us with a fantastic view!  So I guess it was worth the wait.   My husband had the shellfish plate with crab, mussels, clam and shrimp.  He loved every minute of it and was a buttery mess by the end.  I had the crab cakes which were equally yummy!  It was served with a side of coleslaw that was just meh.  Our waiter was a very friendly, young blond guy who did a terrific job checking in with us without being overbearing.

XEiR8wnL5lqnj4G6uoaf-g.review_text: I love eating on the Pier!  We decided to try Fog House, which has a great view of the bay.  We went around lunch and had a short wait of 10 minutes.  We sat at the bar and I tried their pumpkin pie martini..yum!  It was very rich and true to taste!  A bit decadent for the beginning of my meal but good, none-the-less.  We were seated and asked our server for recommendations.  We ended up with:   - Goat cheese garlic bread: very rich in flavor (goat cheese mostly) but crispy and warm.   - Crab cocktail: it's crab season so the crab tasted extra fresh.  Perfectly chilled and served with traditional cocktail sauce.   - Menu special, Scallops: this was okay.  It was served with a quinoa salad but there was a bit too much balsamic vinegar to appreciate the taste of the scallop.   - Seafood platter for 1: served with crab, shrimp, mussels, and clams in a butter herb sauce.  We were disappointed with this.  The food was lukewarm, at best, and there was so much butter it drowned the taste of the seafood.  Since we came here with high seafood expectations, this is the reason for my mid-scoring review.  All in all the experience was just okay; nothing spectacular or fancy.  Our server gave us this card to text in a review of the restaurant, with a promise of a complimentary dessert at the end of the meal.  Well, I took the survey.  But I guess they have no way to monitor who takes the survey from each table?  I didn't bring it to her attention, as I wasn't really in the mood for dessert, but for a promotion that's supposed to gauge a customer's experience with a promise of a small reward at completion, I would think they could track better.  But again, this wasn't a make or break for my opinion.

oCBrLlKuOYvmAEnHb3-PRA.review_text: So, let me first say my internet went out just as I was sending my review and erased it, BUT I'm determined to tell everyone else not to waste their time and money so I wrote the whole thing again.  If I could give this place .04 stars I would.  Prior to this my worst dinner was at McCormick and Kuleto's but at least they tried to seem like they cared about their customers.  My bf and I went there last night to celebrate our anniversary.  Granted we weren't looking for anything too fancy or high maintenance.  After we were seated it was close to 15 mins. until anyone came by, so we sat there with no water or anything.  When the waitress came she was abrupt and pretty rude.  We ordered our wine and the oyster appetizers.  The oysters were small and I've had better quality at the super market.  For dinner my bf ordered the rib eye and I had the seared prawns over linguine with the house salad to start.  When the salad came it was WILTED spring mix, two cherry tomatoes, one slice each of red onion and cucumber, and super stale croutons.  The food took a long time after that.  The steak was ok, nothing special and my pasta tasted worst then a noodle roni dinner.  I've had much better frozen food from Trader Joes.  We didn't order dessert bc we didn't want to waste anymore time or money.  So, overall - service was horrible, food was just as bad, and halfway through dinner they started blasting the AC until another customer complained for them to turn it off.  I wouldn't go back here if they paid for my dinner ! Sorry, I'm just pissed about a wasted meal out.

Gh6IaRTPttJRLbRzbkjq-A.review_text: Most definitely more than $30 per person. Keep that in mind, since Yelp rates this as two $$.

33Dt2s97LqMrmBilwTMW1A.review_text: Food was good. Oysters were amazing but calamari didn't taste fresh. Service was subpar at best. Great view.

dsB0n6qTBLAxY4CaismRBw.review_text: This place is superb! Went here the dat after vday .. It was def packed and a long wait buuuut luckily i made reservations 2 weeks prior lol the food was awesome, the customer service was awesome. Everything was great. We had great seats by the water with an amazing view. Ordered a bottle of champagne ($34) dollars and made it a super classy meal. The CRAB CAKES ARE TO KILL FOR. So most and full of crab. Seriously delicious. The hype about this place was their clam chowder bowl which i thought was ok. I wasnt blown away by it but literally everything was great. Highly recommended place for an anniversary, birthday, or proposal dinner!

aaIdz0kpocn4XOwPpMha1g.review_text: 5 Star food, 5 Star location, 5 Star Drinks and 5 Star views. What let Fog Harbor down tonight was Pedro our waiter who was simply awful.  My wife and I shared a warm spinach salad and crab cakes for starters. The salad was enormous, fresh and tasty with just the right amount of feta and the crab cakes were perfectly cooked and seasoned. For mains we chose Lobster Tail with mashed potato and Seared Scallops and salad. These also did not disappoint as the serving size was excellent and the taste, brilliant. Just enough seasoning to enjoy while still allowing us too enjoy the natural flavor of the fresh catch. I would return again anytime as looking around he restaurant it was clear our waiter was the exception to what appears to be an extremely well run and professional establishment with excellent food.

nImwqf3mKc32xjkAl2CxNQ.review_text: Food is good but the service and host need a new job somewhere were they can be bitter at. So sad for such a beautiful and yummy place the ppl who work there don't give the respect or the service that such place deserves. Will not be coming again

0x4DpVC6xTYZAnPMD1U9qQ.review_text: Came here with my friend to celebrate my birthday two nights ago. I'd been craving clam chowder for over a week and I wanted to see if this place really had the "best clam chowder in SF".  I booked a reservation for 6:15 and called to change it to 6:45 and the lady on the phone was fairly accommodating and friendly. When we arrived, we were immediately seated at a table by the window (probably because I had mentioned that we were celebrating a birthday on our reservation) with a spectacular view of Alcatraz and the seals! Our amazing waiter, David, came by and introduced us to some special dishes on the menu. He also knew it was my birthday and told me they would prepare a chocolate dessert for us. When he came back with our drinks, we just ordered two bread bowls (we weren't crazy hungry because had sundaes two hours earlier). I knew about the Yelp check-in offer for the free appetizer but didn't now it only came with an order of an entree, but David was so kind and said he would bring us one out because it was my birthday.   The bread bowls were fairly large and definitely met our expectations. It was presented nicely (it wasn't messy like most bread bowls we order from other places) and not too salty or bland. Perfectly creamy. Had a lot of clams and potatoes too. Clam chowder is my favorite soup (and arguably one of my favorite foods in general) and I'd have to say this was the best I've ever had. Our only complaint would be there wasn't enough soup. The actual bread the soup came in was HUGE, but I'd say there was only about two cups of soup in the actual bread bowl. I was alright though (my friend was still a bit hungry but luckily we had our free appetizer!) because I was stuffed when I finished. I couldn't even finish the bread!   Our waiter came by many times to ask us how our dishes were and how we were doing and even sang me happy birthday when he brought us our free chocolate dessert! The chocolate cake was a bit too sweet but it was extremely rich and went well with the scoop of vanilla ice cream next to it.   Our bill only came to about $24 only because we had ordered two bread bowls, but it was amazing considering the fact that we got a free appetizer and dessert.  OVERALL: Clam chowder bread bowls - Best I've ever had and I'm a local! Not too salty and not too bland either. Only wish there was more soup and it was less pricey.  Blue cheese bread appetizer - I love garlic bread and I love cheesy bread but this wasn't that good. I've never really liked the taste of blue cheese so this definitely wasn't my favorite. But it won't hurt to get it for free if you check in on yelp!  Service - absolutely amazing. The waiters were all extremely nice, especially David.   Ambiance/View - has one of the best views of Pier 39. If you happen to get a seat on the left of the restaurant by the Bay, you'll be able to see Alcatraz and the area where the seals are. I specifically chose a reservation right before sunset and the view of the water was breathtaking. If it's too sunny they have blinds they'll be happy to pull down (or up) for you. Restaurant wasn't too loud and the restaurant was pretty busy (esp. for a Wednesday night).   **they'll also validate your parking ticket for up to 4 hours if you came by car  I'll definitely be coming back again!

RUOGZoG6MY7iJHa0bD8VCw.review_text: Being in a tourist location I wasn't expecting much. I was surprised at how exceptional the food was. My wife had a crab melt and I the filet. Both were excellent.

D-2r1STSvADVC23EuUY9ig.review_text: My girlfriend and i went for dinner last night and ordered a full dozen oysters，they were all fresh but one of them is just as big as my finger nails and the rest were all small ones.And he price is 2.5$ per oyster...gotta post a pic of dat tiny little poor oyster...   Others were all good，good servic，nice view，food tasted fresh（swordfish was good） but just wayyyyy tooo expensive compared to the size（yeah im talking about the oysters.）

TsjNxSRoL0xjAIBADZ6R3g.review_text: Best clam chowder I've ever had. A bit on the pricey side but well worth it. Great atmosphere and views.

xCliqEMU4NPeq3RrUWxxJw.review_text: You can't go to San Francisco without stopping at Pier 39 to act "touristy".  Fog Harbor has a cozy and classy entrance with a fireplace and nice seating area.  Inside, they had Christmas lights and trees to make the place look festive for the holidays.  I ordered a cup of the clam chowder and the fish and chips.  The soup was good and creamy, but my favorite creamy clam chowder is still the one at Boudin.  The fish and chips were a generous serving, but I wasn't crazy about the cole slaw (needed some sugar) and the tartar sauce.  Sourdough bread was fabulous! Nevertheless, Martin, the server, was outstanding!  You don't find many servers as helpful, friendly, and accommodating as him.  The check had an added fee of 94 cents and when I asked about it, it had something to do with a fee the city supposedly tacks on to provide for uninsured workers or something...Hmm...

yJWdLAiPU47pR41GMIdMoA.review_text: Great service! Put our name on the list, party of 2. 30 min wait. Asked if we can walk around the pier, lady replied check back in 20 min. We checked back in 25min and were seated immediately. Our waiter was VERY nice. We ordered 2 sourdough clam chowder bread bowls, and sliders. The bread and Clam Chowder were wonderful, especially the bread, but the caramelized onions on the sliders were just to die for. It's been over 24 hrs and I can't forget that taste. I loved the whole experience.

6gxvxs3kP4IvbxmImYqzHg.review_text: Great food! Excellent Service.  Great view!  Very good atmosphere, nice bar.  A great place to stop in on vacation, but don't get confused by the place downstairs, I walked in after looking on YELP and almost ate there... but different restarurant... Fog Harbor is much nicer and is on the SECOND STORY.  Little pricey for a lunch ($120), but well worth it.

c3EZVfHXcnhnzfZoKHjN5A.review_text: Much love for Fog Harbor. View was breathtaking and food superb.  We Reserved online using Open Table and they offered a complimentary amuse bouche.  Garlic crab was messy but very tasty. The sourdough loaf addictive. Crab Roll excellent. Fish and chips were a well done version.  Service was also excellent. Worth a trip.

uV34lZrCqCwGjYf-62m3AQ.review_text: I was delighted to be seated right away, but the experience was far from 5 stars. Our waitress brought us dirty plates. I requested new ones and they came back less dirty (probably the same ones wiped down).   We ordered the Cioppino to share and half a dozen oysters. The oysters were fresh and delicious. The Cioppino was average and not loaded with enough seafood. Two shrimps, two scallops...not to mention we ordered the additional pasta ($2) but there was none.   We decided to order a burger because it wasn't enough food. We waited for a while. Our waitress came back to tell us that the kitchen was busy and if we want to cancel our order. We agreed and she apologized about the pasta and the burger. $46 spent and still hungry, it would have been better if we ate somewhere else in Fisherman's Wharf. Despite the awesome romantic view of the ocean and nice ambience of the restaurant, the food and service were not up to par.  Avoid touristy restaurants I guess, unless they are the only available option.

ZmtW5Rb6yPZmEcVkdzq39A.review_text: Beautiful and relaxed atmosphere.  The cuisine left a lot to be desired.....lacked flavor and flair for the price and ambiance.

iXKcuqYopkftzxE4cP7etg.review_text: I was visiting the area on business from Atlanta and randomly selected Fog Harbor based in Yelp reviews and location. I had the Pacific Sole and crab cakes. The crab cakes were ok but not the best I've had and same for the Sole. All in all the view is awesome and I'd order the food again so although it wasn't the best I've had, it was good.

Tl-GcEU2Z0vPEw3akWDZbA.review_text: The food and service here is great!  The complementary sourdough bread and butter is a way to start the meal.   -crab and risotto fritters: definitely a must try! I enjoyed every bite. The soft, rich mixture of crab and risotto covered in a crispy layer.   -chicken penne: comes with sundried tomatoes and greens. The sauce is a light oil and was simply delicious.   -creme brûlée: the sugar coat (my favorite part) was on point and the bottom layer was soft and fluffy. One of my favorite ones to come!   -tiramisu: the cake was very tea and mocha flavored. But there wasn't anything out of the ordinary.

w3TOr5aR02TyLglQ9S6XPw.review_text: HORRIBLE SERVICE WITH KATIE (the server) she is so unprofessional and bad service... Never ever come back here again.....

_GAYx5b4z3jstHTWJHq7sQ.review_text: Crab rolls and shrimp cocktail are excellent and tasty!  Service is attentive and would totally go back!

57dFa12IJEsyMo0S1XDB0A.review_text: Fog Harbor Fish House is a gem with an amazing view of San Francisco Bay and the City. On Pier 39, surrounded by many other restaurants that seem to get more exposure, Fog Harbor has the best food and service on the pier.   The Cioppino is superb with loads of fresh seafood in a delectable broth. I could not find a pasta and seafood combination I wanted so after 30 seconds of discussion with the waiter, I had a custom designed meal with pasta, spinach, garlic, oil, jumbo shrimps, and pine nuts - absolutely delicious and only $18.00.  Anywhere you go on the wharf you will find good to great seafood but if you miss Fog Harbor, you will have missed some of the best seafood and service anywhere in San Francisco.

RoA9mDVDKEwsdNrH4MH3IA.review_text: We sat by a window where the view was nice. Also, our waiter was very friendly and our food came pretty fast. As for the food, I'm really not that picky, but it was just ok, nothing special. I think they wash their lettuce with warm watter....yikes! It was too soft (not crunchy) and the chicken tasted a 'bit plain. It wasn't horrible, it was just "whatever."

xO1fXjGulknU5nWbKghKMQ.review_text: The clam chowder was good, the fish and chips were great, and the view was amazing.  Go during a weekday for lunch, and you're set.

jVpKmCHCdKsPYhmFCkgzmw.review_text: Dungeness Crab & Mango Ceviche:  There was a good portion (about 1/2 cup) of crab mixed with mango.  It taste fresh and the lemon & mango complemented the crab nicely.  Fried combo:  The combo came with 1 fish, 2 shrimp, about a cup of calamari, fries and coleslaw.  Everything was fried crispy but not everything was seasoned properly.  The calamari was perfect and tasted great.  The fish was crispy on the outside, moist in the inside, and fresh but it lacked salt. Once I salted it, it was good.  Unfortunately the shrimp was bland and badly needed the cocktail sauce.  The coleslaw was bland and taste like just cabbage & mayo. It had no seasoning or vinegar and was very boring.  Hind sight, I would have ordered the fish & calamari but skip the shrimp.  My server Ashley G. was very nice and friendly.  She was offering suggestions to tourist visiting the area.  If in the area, I would eat here again.

c2h5eKhkLUS0sZnImGYs2g.review_text: If you're looking for a McCormicks and Shmicks it's the best of the brand. If you're looking for a out of the ordinary,"made your visit" seafood restaurant, look someplace else.

Px99XhnzvZXFKJC-gWFQIQ.review_text: First time here and really impress me, the foods and drinks are really good, Moscow Mule cocktail please try it guys, I really like it!! But here is the issue, me and my family here for vacation and we order some crab, but for some reason when the crab come out, it looks like the crab swimming on the butter pool?.....whats this? Well I dont know, so we call our server and tell him about the problem, and then he say he will call the manager, so when the manager come we let him know the issue, he was like im so sorry about the problem then give us the new crab for free, so this is really impress me, the manager is really nice and friendly, he didnt say anything just give us new dish~will come back again next time if I have a chance!!!!

HUS74wDi6wf7St1NNr2zuw.review_text: I expected a lot more from this place. We got there at 5:30 seated right away despite looking as if every table was full; big place. Service started out good then turned into the run of the mill like you were at McDonalds. Ordered calamari, shrimp cocktail, chowder in a bread bowl. The food was okay. Nothing that blew my mind away. The views however are great. Right on the water. But I wouldn't go here again.

HAhxEpkvRRw4exPjPY-BNQ.review_text: Service was great, large portions and quick service. We were impressed since the restaurant was huge.

Zz7wvkHp0mT8dSLgz_lgog.review_text: No bread or crackers included with chowder. Bread is .25 a slice. Bread bowl heavily pushed. No crackers available at all.  $7 a small bowl.  Good chowder though.

fmsbWi05oigvux5SsoZ9gA.review_text: My wife and I had dinner here the other night because we had a coupon for a free appetizer. It turned out to be serendipitous.  We live in the North Bay and come to the City often. When it comes to restaurants, we are nothing but a bit jaded. That said, we had a splendid meal at Fog Harbor. Instead of a main course, we ordered several items listed as starters because that gives exposure to more dishes especially when there are only the two of us dining.  We started with the fried calamari which was served with a lemon aioli for dipping. The dish was all rings, no tentacles. The batter was light, something like you would expect to find in a very good tempura bar. We also had the sliders, the crab cakes and the red curry mussels.  The sliders were great. Cooked perfectly (medium rare) and smothered in caramelized onions. My wife loves crab cakes and pronounced them as good as any she has ever had. I'm not much of a crab cake lover, but I thought they were good. I will never love crab cakes, so don't take my word as gospel.  Then I had the red curry steamed mussels. I am a mussel fanatic. I've eaten them over half the world, particularly in Belgium (where mussels is the national dish), and I can honestly say that these are the most delicious steamed mussels I have ever had. These are not the red curry mussels you will find in Thai restaurants. You are going to have to try them to see what I mean. By the way, although listed as a starter, there were enough for a main dish, especially when accompanied by Fog Harbor's terrific sourdough bread which is made on site.  I asked the restaurant manager for the mussels recipe, but he couldn't comply. I then emailed the company and was sent the recipe by one of the senior execs. That is service above and beyond.  By the way, we were there during happy hour, and were able to enjoy a very good house Pinot Grigio for $5/glass - an added bonus.  Fog Harbor is located at Pier 39, a venue most locals associate with tourists and would not normally think of as a place to go for fine dining. Wrong.  Fog Harbor is considerably better than most of the famous places in the Fisherman's wharf vicinity. To make matters even better, with the appropriate coupon (available everywhere in the City) you can park free, a huge benefit in San Francisco where parking fees are equivalent to winnings in the Powerball lottery.

QwMbQmeywX9cAb60T9TG5w.review_text: Came here for a late lunch today with my mom. The weather was spectacular so we thoroughly enjoyed our window seat which faced the harbor and Fisherman's Wharf.   We were seated promptly and offered waters right away. Our server (totally bummed that I can't remember his name) was great. He was polite, prompt, helpful and courteous. We ordered:  2 cups of chowder - chowder was just okay. Not to thick, not to thin, just lacked flavor.  We also had the special appetizer, crab & risotto balls. These were tasty, soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. Our server suggested these over the crab cake.    Lastly we split a crab salad sandwich with sweet potato fries. This was nice but not out of this world great.   Overall the restaurant is lovely with gorgeous views especially on a clear beautiful day. Service was top notch. The missing star is for the food. Although good, I think it could be a bit more flavorful.   4 stars along for the fact that they validate for the garage across the street. Saved me over $20!  I love the City and this is a nice place among the touristy trap terrible restaurants on Pier 39.  It's worth a try just for the validation!

LIsUZkj3K9LA7LtcWVUtZA.review_text: Tasty, decently priced, nice view. Of course it's a bit of a madhouse being on Pier 39.

v63zY6rXYpq4LOhwDnZ-Bg.review_text: The service was amazing in spite of how busy the restaurant seemed to be and the view offered up Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge which was nice to look at because it was so loud inside that it was hard to have a conversation.  The food came super fast, but we fish & chips and combo platter with fish, shrimp, and fried calamari, so other dishes might take longer.  The calamari was cooked perfectly but the breading didn't have a lot of flavor and the texture was a it dense. The fish batter needed some salt but the fish was nice and flaky.  The price ($21 per) was reasonable for the location and choice.  If it were quieter and the food seasoned a tiny bit better this would have been a four star because of the service and views.

BV0JHI3mIHWv1UYp3JCSYg.review_text: We came here on a Wednesday so it wasn't too busy and we were seated very quickly.  The view is fabulous even if you're not right at the window.  You don't want to be there when a bird poops on it anyways ;)  We started off with their sliders which were so good! I ordered the special of the day which was a stuffed lobster tail sitting on a mountain of mashed potatoes with spinach.  They also brought out sourdough bread and butter.  It was very yummy and a bit pricy but worth it.  I would come here again.

dn8aieYVEnvRjey4yj1UNQ.review_text: Okay, so this place is not cheap but you WILL NOT REGRET IT.  We had dinner here, I got the King Salmon and my husband got the swordfish.  We LOVED IT!!  You must try these dishes, so much flavor and the fish is local so it just looks and tastes so fresh.  I highly suggest you try this place, the staff is so friendly and it's a large restaurant, don't let the entrance fool you it curves around the back of the pier.  Very clean and we didn't wait long at all for our food (maybe 15 minutes).  ENJOY!  Wish we had something like this back home.

FlXBpK_YZxLo27jcMdII1w.review_text: Oh my god.  Best calamari ever. I make that statement knowing full well the gravitas it holds.   But seriously, Fog Harbor is a must when visiting the Bay Area.  I know that some people may consider it touristy, but whatever. It's delicious. The bread provided on the table is delicious sourdough...in other words, don't pay extra for a sourdough bread bowl.   I came here for lunch and enjoyed a crab melt, as did everyone else at my table.  Everyone thought it to be very delicious and a great lunch experience.  Our waiter was so adorable, I wanted to put him on my shelf.

UNbs96I5PVM-TJE1vUOyag.review_text: The service was nice but the food left a lot to be desired.  I ordered the special, Basa on garlic mash potatoes.  Fish is my favorite protein so if I don't like it ...it's bad.  I don't believe  it was cooked properly.  It seemed a bit raw and very greasy.  There were five of us and nothing was outstanding.    Hate giving a low rating but the cooks need some seasoning and cooking lessons.

5E6MWtGC4t2ctSthymtBuQ.review_text: We had lunch here via a reservation on Yelp.  They got us in early with a fantastic view of the pier.  The service was solid and atmosphere calming.  The food is what really stood out.  All options on the menu are sustainably chosen and extremely fresh.  I had the seared Ahi Tuna and it was to die for.  My parents each loved their dishes as well.  Come here, stay away from the chain restaurants, and you will not be disappointed!

Mfx_OSkQvRWTkh-dJSrurg.review_text: Awesome restaurant and a great staff. We came here to hold a surprise party dinner for a friend and the staff was incredibly helpful and accommodating in helping us get set up! Our waiter Khaiman was also great and made sure we had everything we needed. Even with a full house he made sure to make regular stops at our table to make sure we were doing alright. Will definitely be back when I'm on pier 39 again.

IC6j_3C7-LuOjEcHN-OHVQ.review_text: Food was great, Service fantastic, and the view incredible!

JAiiwAqOXrCy8O4RkcJyLA.review_text: A bit disappointed with the overall experience dining here for dinner. The overall atmosphere in the restaurant is pleasant and the view is amazing. For a party of three on a Sunday, the wait was minimal which was a plus.   For the food, my table ordered the seafood cioppino, seafood penne, fried calamari appetizer and the Moscow mule. Seafood cioppino was above average. More of a soupy tomato cioppino vs a stew like many places. Generous helpings of properly cooked mussels, clams, crab, scallops, shrimp and fish. Just wish the flavor was a bit stronger instead of resembling a tomato based seafood linguine. I'd say sotto mare was better. The seafood penne was very well done. Fish was perfectly cooked and the sauce was perfect, paired extremely well with the sourdough bread which was some of the best I've ever had. Soft center and flaky crust with chew. The calamari was well fried and flavorful, but the lemon aioli was very plain. The Moscow mule was watered down like crazy and might as well have been ginger ale mixed with water.   The service for this restaurant was disappointing considering its a tourist trap. My server failed to give me plate/silverware, bread and water refills requires multiple requests and drink came 15 minutes late. Expected a lot more and there wasn't even an apology for lack of plate and utensils.   I would probably not return based on the overall dining experience but the food was definitely some of the best of pier 39.

GQzhcVbZ8808SlUrz4TwBQ.review_text: Shocked to find such a pleasant surprise on Fisherman's Wharf.  Great vibe, great food, warm personable service. . . Shocked.  Among dishes our party of seven tried were Grilled Shrimp, Lobster Squash Ravioli, Chowder in Sourdough and Seafood Penne.   All judged entrees as solid.  Great respite among the chaos.

hgUWJKal08b_Rbm9qQb9AQ.review_text: Good eats, not touristy eats...  Delicious sourdough bread as a starter, ceviche was good, the clam chowder was delicious! The mixed grill was amazing the salmon and swordfish was the best I have ever had. I never order salmon because it usually is not the fish that I like but I found myself really enjoying the salmon here. I enjoyed the food so much that I found myself craving  the swordfish and clam chowder the next day, so I came back. To some that may seem UN original but eating at a few places that were horrible, I wanted a sure win! I was not disappointed.  We had Madison as our server and she was friendly attentive and did not make us feel rushed even though she was closing her shift. She always was smiling, which made our experience even more memorable. It seems that servers have forgotten the art of smiling. NOT Madison she was great.

rBoCb2dI49YHvCfyzhg9FA.review_text: The best clam chowder I've ever had. I'm not a connoisseur of clam chowder, but I've had my faaaair share. The day we went here, I intended to go to many other restaurants as part of my chowder day-- but I just couldn't because I knew that nothing would beat it!   An added plus-- great views, and fair prices. My new fav spot in Fisherman's Wharf!

e4CCD4D7iA4SCxryHNtzUQ.review_text: Came here with the fiance and mother after taking a walk along the Pier. We wanted to escape the cold and have some cocktails with a view. We were promptly seated by the window and the view was beautiful. We got there just in time to see the sunset. We each had a couple cocktails. All were delicious including their Moscow Mule which was served in a copper mug.  We shared the calamari which was decent. Not as crispy as I would've liked it but not bad. Overall, we had a nice experience. We didn't try their dinner but ambiance is candlelight with white table cloth, classy! Service was impeccable and we definitely would come back to try it again.

LSWOhXA2ak412Z8OAiMBfw.review_text: Somewhat disappointing. The view makes up for the diner-style food/presentation. Was expecting better. Service is okay...not 4 or 5 stars as rated. One person's opinion.

9g5TvDMWJKwKr0A62CVaIQ.review_text: Food was good. Service was terrible.  It was so bad that I had to get up and go get my check after asking the server for it twice.  Avoid this and grab a bowl of clam chowder to go downstairs.  If you have a couple hours for a meal, this is ok and the view of Alcatraz is cool.

RCfvanAk2uPWJgHUWlxrlA.review_text: We went for an early dinner to celebrate my anniversary so we were able to beat the crowds. The sun was setting so they had their blinds down. However, if you care to watch the setting sun which, from the restaurant, you have a perfect view, you'll have to be mindful of others who don't necessarily want the sun in their eyes.  We asked to have them opened and they offered us a different seat so as not to bother other guests. That was fine since they moved us to a nicer area although there were two families with children in that area.   The food was wonderful. The calamari and the aioli was wonderful. I had the Ahi and vegetables. Now I grew up in Hawaii were fresh seafood, especially Ahi, was widely available and you had the best of the best resort chefs and restaurants around.  I'm also not a vegetable person. However on both accounts I was blown away.   The seasonings and sauces were amazing. The portions I think were just right; they didn't skimp but yet you could finish your meal without feeling bloated or having to carry a doggy bag around Pier 39 all night.   Overall it was a wonderful night. The staff was very friendly and attentive. They seemed to be around when I needed them and absent when I wanted to be left a lone to enjoy.

jLlcNjDKwWQaYCrl2webMw.review_text: Great food! Great atmosphere! Had the mixed grill and it was amazing. Service from our server wasn't all there but overall I would recommend this place.

9-FL-x5YQXziSuCbwpSs9w.review_text: Great food and service. We have their ahi tuna and halibut special. Def. would recommend for some fresh sea food and good wine list

7yBulXymGkdZhEXXhWZtnQ.review_text: When we got there a waiter guided us to a booth and brought my brother and I kids menus. I got the fish and chips and the fish were big! They even came with lemons to squeeze. First we got some yummy blue cheese garlic bread. My mom and dad got the oysters while my sister got a salmon BLT.   The waiters were nice to us.We got a good view of Alcatraz and the top of the golden gate bridge while every once and a while the fog would roll in then pull back. I did not feel rushed and we could relax and enjoy the view.

UJuRr2pOT18O_N5G586f9A.review_text: As most locals do, I usually avoid Pier 39 like the plague because it's always so crowded. When I found out a work dinner had been booked at a restaurant at Pier 39, I wasn't thrilled. In hindsight, I'm really glad they chose that location because I wouldn't have discovered this great restaurant. Fog Harbor is well worth braving the tourist masses.  Fog Harbor is located at the front of Pier 39, upstairs on the left side. There is an outdoor seating area with a fireplace and comfy couches. Once inside, there is a small bar just to the right and tons of table seating, all with great views. We sat in the back right area of the restaurant, where we had a view of both Alcatraz and the Golden Gate Bridge.  Our server was really helpful and friendly. Every item on our order came out correctly and within a reasonable amount of time, and the food was delicious! All in all it was a great dining experience and I'm sure we'll be back soon.

Dui-ZVYgNzXEWdn2jgECNQ.review_text: Ate here a couple of weeks ago on our final night of our trip.  Very much enjoyed it.  Great service and I finished with the Apple Crumble Dessert which was amazing!!!  I don't eat seafood - so you don't need to like it to eat here....still lots of delicious options!

eb_qEtuhI3qVTPKaxwQ0ow.review_text: I've been here twice, so I might be biased. Love their wine sodas--a highlight to any meal. Their famous clam chowder is pretty good, but once you had a bowl, you are full! Their fish is very fresh and delicious. I feel like their menu is seasonal...they paired the Halibut with a mango salsa beautifully, but it was a little over cooked. Service is excellent even though there is a LOT of foot traffic in Pier 39. I would love to visit again!

styfWdPhBXrYcANL0VCORg.review_text: Had an amazing night here with a view of the bay and delicious seafood.  Highly recommend this place.  We had great and attentive service from Khaiman, look out of him, and were able to have a romantic evening out at fisherman's wharf all thanks to Fog Harbor Fish House!

2z5h7YESlwXTR0Hs7rBuag.review_text: lobster mac and cheese! tons of lobster, everywhere you dug in there were huge lobster pieces. it is pretty steep though, $30 for a decent size bowl. go for happy hour and sit at the bar for 1/2 off drinks. i knocked off a star because we had called in ahead about happy hour and when we arrived at the restaurant heard a bartender mumbling that when it gets too busy, they dont advertise happy hour and gave us an attitude about it. Besides that, the food was good !

4AYgSgKxNxw7K-TdEpufsw.review_text: I loved this place. Nice view of the pier, delicious food and fresh sourdough bread. I had the linguini with clams and it was delicious. The server suggested Kendall-Jackson, "Grand Reserve", Chardonnay. It paired well with the clam linguini. My Aussie friend had the fog harbor burger medium well. He said that it has been one of the best burgers so far.

E5qxWbvEYwtzvGhpE68z0Q.review_text: Delicious Blue Cheese bread!  Tried the Cioppino with pasta and was very good!

WixavnIz-Pe4n8CEYLWcMQ.review_text: Hit Fisherman's Wharf for some chowder for my friend, and this place looked like a good bet. It was nice but casual inside, but the prices were outrageous. $18 for a salad that was mostly lettuce. I mean, I'm not naive, I knew that the closer to the water you get the more you'll pay, but at least make it worth the cash. The $5 add-on salad was literally five leaves of romaine. The bar area looked fun, though. Would try again and just sit there.

VD-FEE9HYjzjbs1cYmLUxQ.review_text: i came here for lunch and we were pleasantly surprised by this place. not only did this place have a great view of fisherman's wharf, but the food was BOMB too!!  the cioppino was AMAZING! i love the tomato sauce that it was it! makes you want more just thinking about it. there was crab, clams, shrimp and a few different types of fish in my cioppino... squeeze some lemon.. and you have PERFECTION!!  the fish and chips were great too!!! perfect batter! perfect!!!  another must try was the clam chowder in a bread bowl! the sourdough bread was warm and chewy! the bread wasnt hard at all, which is important in bread bowls cuz some places have sucky bread!  great time at fog harbor! will come back when in town!

iIdPmqstqmw06kdIK12I2g.review_text: Tried 3 different flavors of dungess crab, first started with garlic, then Cajun and finally red chilly.  They were so full of flavors and just the perfect texture on each and every bite.  Cajun was my favorite.  The bit of a complaint is they wouldn't take reservation, so you'll have to come and wait.  There was a line but with a fireplace outside, the wait was not that bad.  Service was great, I canceled my entree while going thru my appetizers so I could order more crab :) and the waiter was happy to make it happen.  Strongly recommend!

QJn3LmmFbHQO3QcFFDe86g.review_text: Excellent shrimp, specially the chili shrimp. The bread was fresh and well cooked. The mixed fish grill was very flavorful, especially the salmon. I recommend it for everyone, specially people who like light seafood.

XLmCXdAuKhm105fOIc71hw.review_text: Great clam chowder, cocktails and view. ( as well as the bread and butter)  The calamari was too fishy, which makes me believe it wasn't fresh.  We ordered the half order roasted dungeness crab...very upsetting. It lacked flavor, and it was actually quarter of a crab!  What a rip off.  There are too many restaurants that serve the same kind of food so I'll be checking out the others next time.

SvhGUNhpFp6yMAwmjhQ90A.review_text: Best meal I've had in years. Seafood cioppino was amazing. The spicy tomato stew complimented the fresh scallops, shrimp, fish, mussels, and clams perfectly. Bread was great. Ordered a half Dungeness crab with red chili and garlic. Crab meat Melted in my mouth, fantastic . Bloody Mary's we're outstanding. Our server accidentally spilt some water on my friend and the manager gave us all free desserts. Chocolate banana bread pudding was out of this world. Great management and great food. Highly recommend this place.    Ps- check in on yelp for free blue cheese garlic bread !

hhvkQEAUxO-lSLeJo2nUSA.review_text: Clam chowder was delish and ciopinno was full of seafood and amazing. Would recommend this if you are looking for seafood in Fisherman's Wharf

qRfRNC7N0-pmtb9ycdczPw.review_text: Food was great! Pretty fast service, but maybe because they were almost closing. I had a complimentary dessert which was awesome. Unfortunately, the waitress who served us was pretty rude to my friend just because she couldn't understand her. From the start, it was all downhill from there. The waitress name is Katie. We would have given her a tip, but we believe she didnt deserve it. So we only paid for the food and left. When we left, she she followed us out and sarcastically waved at us and practically were saying dont ever come back here. I dont want to use profanities. Also, it was my birthday and she pretty much kind of ruined it for me. I understand that it was late and she is tired but she didnt have to be so rude and give us those fake smiles. She was trying to be sarcastic with the tone of her voice. Never ever coming back here.

oyQ8Pn6qxchUUcUiEIHQ0A.review_text: My husband and I went here for our 1 year wedding anniversary.  The restaurant looks great.  It is in a very crowded area of the wharf.  We were able to watch seals lounge on the docks during our meal.  We were really hoping for fresh local seafood but instead the menu s filled with alaskan fish or maine lobster.  The only local catch is the crab.  I had the halibut and it was dry and sitting on a bed of undressed arugala.  My husband's seafood platter looked great and tasted alright but was swimming in garlic butter.  We ordered an appetizer of baked oysters that did not come out for about 45 minutes but the waiter was great and gave us complementary small bowls of clam chowder to tide us over.  The service staff is very friendly and they have a good wine/champagne selection.  All in all I am glad we went there but I don;t feel the need to go there again.

AOeRbpwtaqRdjcGq1hdcTQ.review_text: Went for dinner.  Had the sirloin steak, which I enjoyed.  Went for lunch the next day and had the fried calamari, which I did not enjoy.  I recommend that you go to the visitors center on the same level and ask for a coupon book, which has a 20% off coupon for lunch or dinner at Fog Harbor.  Also, double check your bill as I received another table's bill during my lunch visit.

OA3bMgMFe4XIeLzxxMPW1g.review_text: Amazing view of the the bay. Oysters were so very good and the bartender was very attentive.

uYBQVTDy1kIyIljmr_Y4VA.review_text: I remember this place being really good. I came back and it was not that good. The food was salty and not to my liking. However, the service was amazing and the waiter was a sexy thang... Sam

QetiS_XoopVLQo__r2CB6A.review_text: Came here for the first time after a tour of Alcatraz. Our waitress, Madison, politely informed us that she was new and a little rusty, but did a superb job! She was extremely friendly, but also very professional and efficient. The dining experience was above par. They serve you San Francisco's popular sourdough bread to start, which is a big plus. Additionally, we ordered calamari to start, which was served with a really excellent lemon sauce. Although it was very busy while we were there, we were served our entrees promptly. I ordered salmon, which was served on a bed of peppers, leafy greens, and fingerling potatoes. It was priced at $32 that day, but well worth the cost! Didn't end up ordering dessert, but everything looked excellent. Great if you're looking for something a little more special but nothing too fancy! Definitely would recommend this restaurant.

RyMRdIjTGSPwyVQweMGDRA.review_text: I spent a good part of my life in San Francisco, and I have never had a positive food experience at Pier 39. ...until now!  This place is great for groups!  The seafood is fresh, the view is amazing, and the service is en pointe.    My friend just graduated from medical school. To celebrate, she and her husband planned a lunch at Fog Harbor for their family and about 20 of their closest friends. I was really impressed by the way For Harbor was able to accommodate such a large group with such ease.  We were each allowed to order from the regular menu; no pre-fixe menu needed.  Huge plus!  All of the food came out at the same time and nobody's order was incorrect.  On top of that, the food was definitely delicious. Don't miss the calamari, clam chowder, and crab roll!  I'll be coming back to eat those dishes again. As for the prices, they do run a little on the steep side, but it's not totally unreasonable for a seafood restaurant in one of San Francisco's busiest tourist spots. If you have kids, there is a pretty good kids menu, high chairs, and they give crayons and stuff to color on.    Quick note, they validate parking for the Pier 39 Parking Garage. One hour free with validation.

2kXwO-G5H9kMTxrxIyAtOw.review_text: This is a surprisingly great restaurant right in the heart of Fisherman's Wharf.  My mother and I visited San Francisco over the recent holiday and spent one afternoon strolling from the Ferry Building down to Pier 39.  There were already good reviews of this place, so we made a reservation through Open Table (which was nice and easy on a Sunday afternoon) and did some souvenir shopping while we waited for our late lunch.  The hostess seated us at our reservation time to the minute, and we had a great window seat looking directly out on the pier, the Rock, and the beautiful bridge.  Our server Barry was excellent; he was friendly and attentive without hovering, and he got everything right the first time with no hesitation.  I think I overheard him say that he just moved to San Francisco.  I mention this because it sounded like he was trying to play down a heavy British accent - don't you know us American girls (well, at least me and my mom) love that sort of thing?!  All of our dishes and drinks came out perfectly.  We had an appetizer from the specials list - the Dungeness crab and spinach dip - which was delicious, and mom had the "Escape from Alcatraz" cocktail, which she loved.  I had the Gewurztraminer, which is impossible to get by the glass in Florida, so I was thrilled.  For the main dish, I had the Halibut special with quinoa, pine nuts, and arugula, and mom had the garlic whole Dungeness crab.  Both of our dishes were wonderful - perfectly cooked and seasoned, and everything was obviously fresh and carefully prepared.  The meal wasn't too expensive, and certainly worth the price both for the quality and the volume of food we received.  It is definitely a worthwhile spot to relax, refresh, and refuel while seeing the sights!

R2247iVcSL6CBUItgheD3w.review_text: Bff and I got very greedy coming here. We were one of the few patrons, as it was 11am on a Thursday morning. I started off with a refreshing blueberry press and we shared a daily special ceviche. Not the best ceviche, but it was decent. Then to add on top of that, I ordered the steamed clams and my friend went with the cioppino. Thank goodness for the "appetizer" size of my clams. Still waaaay too much food, but so delicious. Service was excellent. Prices are on the higher end, so expect to shell out some moola. And don't forget to get your parking validated.

z0xHfcx_DIgC6SIEsM6Ryw.review_text: FANTASTIC July 4th!!!  Food was delish and the view can't be beat.  Greg the Manager was a wonderful host.  BEST 'tourist' spot for locals.  Did I mention the inventive cocktail menu???????

6Bkvmbq6HY28lC-44h05XQ.review_text: I'm giving this place 5 stars for service but 2 stars for food.  I guess that's why it comes out a 3.  Super smiling faces and genuinely nice people that work here but unfortunately have to serve mediocre food.  And for these prices I do expect more flavors.  Their Dungeness crab cakes were hugely disappointing with much more filler taste than crab.  I don't know if they make their crab cakes fresh but if they did they still taste like pre-processed ones with lots of bread crumbs and salt added.  Even the remoulade sauce tasted processed also.  I really wanted to like this place because the bartenders and drinks and hostess were excellent, but the food fell short.

aGUZKSRPA-MHHj6b8GhOww.review_text: Whole Dungeness Crab is either steamed or garlic roasted and served with your choice of wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables. I chose the steamed method with just sautéed vegetables. If you enjoy the inside of the crab, let your waiter know that you would like them to steam it whole and not to break it open and clean it out. The best part of the crab is inside. It reminds me of crab bisque. Grab a spoon and dig in! A tip to the kitchen: if someone orders it like this, serve it with the legs up and do not crack open the body shell so the "soup" doesn't drain out. You can also dip your crab meat into it for a luxurious flavor. The drawn butter is good too just like with snow or king crab legs. The crab was steamed to perfection and the meat is sweet and juicy. Fog Harbor receives crab deliveries every day, freshly caught off the California coast, transported in ocean water filled tanks, held until you order it up. You can't get anything fresher than that! The vegetables were sautéed to perfection -crisp with a wonderful butter flavor. Add a little salt and pepper and you're good to go. Thumbs up, way up!

Y8SZbysW5TNHAMn5mYKfNw.review_text: We had the Swordfish and the Mahi-Mahi. Both were delicious and the delivery was very fast. The waiter was friendly and asked for the drinks first which was good; we were thirsty.  After the meal we spent some time and felt no pressure to go. 4 stars.

H3dv79xef-wVEEtC8GptYw.review_text: Disappointed experience!   Our dinner. arrive before the waitress brought the complimentary bread. Glass of water never arrived.  My salad was OK but right at the last bite there was a piece of plastic within the veggies.   I would not come back! We got better service at Bubba Gump, just walk a little bit more and you will have a better experience (and view)

JieuBguggKpA_9EDCj-k3A.review_text: Brought out of town visitors here and everyone left happy.  My wife and I shared the garlic crab and really enjoyed it.  Most in the party had chowder and they loved it.  We had a large party with prepaid tip and was surprised to still get excellent service.  This review is specifically for someone wanting a touristy thing on the pier.

JCtU28FH-YySgZd4HxHwDw.review_text: I'm a East Bay Native and have been to the city for many a tour guide trip for guests from out of town and this was my first time eating at Fog Harbor. We had a party of 13, half of which were from various parts of the country and not local to the Bay Area. The experience was hands down one of the best dining experiences I've ever had at a restaurant.  The service was impeccable and the food was to die for. We had a wonderful gentleman named David G as our server. He was attentive and charming and just did an awesome job tending to our large party and his other tables. Will be coming back here again with more friends! Thank you David and Fog Harbor for giving us such a wonderful dining experience! (David deserves a raise or a paid vacation, or both! You are blessed to have such a wonderful server on staff!)  Ordered  Wedge Salad with ranch instead of bleu cheese: it was a half a head of lettuce! huge and good :) Blackberry non alcoholic drink: tasty & refreshing Burger: super yum, caramelized onions were super tasty on this Chocolate Banana Bread Pudding: to.die.for! also tasted the chocolate ooey gooey goodness (mix between a chocolate flourless cake & a molten lava cake) it's like having brownie batter that is half cooked...in my book, super yum! The FRESH baked sourdough bread was AH-MAZING!!!!!! crunchy on the outside and super soft on the inside, I would taken home whole loaves of that had I had a ziploc in my purse :)

zQxDUhxKOHdZygnNRZ-4ng.review_text: Really good food for a touristy place! Had the crab and really enjoyed it.  The drinks where great too!

QhL55KT5I-3MMmZaIdKQwA.review_text: Food is better than other restaurant on Pier 39. Good view and reasonable priced. There is short wait during dinner time.

sPqHcRC--tRanPC-g4pNwQ.review_text: Dine About Town 2014 Review! Before anything, Jennifer A.'s tip caught my eye: "First, go to the visitor's center also on the upper level and get a 15% off coupon for this place." Despite its touristy location, Fog Harbor delivered a DAT meal that was surprisingly delicious and affordable. I would definitely recommend making a reservation through OpenTable because it was packed on a Saturday evening. Our table was started off with complimentary sourdough bread and butter, which is always appreciated. For the appetizer, I opted for the AHI TUNA POKE, which is marinated raw tuna, avocado, mango, and a sesame-soy sauce and wasabi aioli (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). It's normally $16 for their full serving, though we only got a poke pile rather than the poke slices shown in other pictures. The tuna is decently fresh, the mango is refreshing (though not very ripe), the avocado is smooth (also not very ripe), and the aioli ties it all together. My friend chose the BAKED OYSTERS as her appetizer, which came with 4 fresh shucked oysters topped with spinach, bacon and a creamy parmesan sauce (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). Each oyster is normally $2.50, and she enjoyed the rich flavor of each one. For entrees, one friend decided on the SEAFOOD CIOPPINO, which is crab, fresh fish, shrimp, clams, scallops and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth served with pasta (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). It's a hefty portion normally priced at $30! She said that her favorite part of the dish was the crab. Her boyfriend ordered the CREEKSTONE NY STEAK, a 10 oz steak grilled and topped with whisky peppercorn sauce, served with garlic mashed potatoes and sautéed vegetables (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). It was also a generous portion, normally priced at $27. I chose the GRILLED SALMON, a fillet served on a bed of roasted corn, arugula, red peppers, fingerling potatoes, and tarragon with a citrus beurre blanc (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). Normally $28, the salmon dish is worth it. I have to admit that I was pleasantly surprised by how juicy and moist the salmon meat was, especially given how often I've been underwhelmed by salmon dishes. But, goshdangit, Fog Harbor did it right. *snaps* As our desserts, we each ordered something different: The VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE, a smooth, creamy custard with caramelized sugar top and a Biscoff cookie, normally $8.50 (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). My favorite, hands down. I tend to avoid crème brulees because past ones I've tried have had sugar tops that were way too thick and overpoweringly sweet and sticky. But the sugar coating is delicate, allowing the custard to really shine through. If you're a fan of egg custard, especially subtly sweet custard, you'll be a fan of their crème brulee. The MOLTEN CHOCOLATE CAKE with a rich creamy chocolate center, served warm with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream, normally $8.50 (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). Many reviewers have complained that this isn't a true molten cake because the inside doesn't ooze melted chocolate, and I would have to agree--it's just a warm, gooey chocolate center. The vanilla bean ice cream is tasty, and I liked that the chocolate cake wasn't overly rich since it paired well with light, fluffy whipped cream. The CHOCOLATE BANANA BREAD PUDDING, a huge square of Fresh Boudin's sourdough bread baked with chocolate pudding, served warm with crème anglaise and vanilla ice cream (most similar to the pumpkin bread pudding, normally $8.50) (yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…). I asked for the crème on the side because I didn't want it to soak the bread (not a huge fan of soggy bread). The crème itself is very light and was fun to dip, and the banana and sourdough undertones make for an intriguing combination. However, the chocolate is so rich that it overwhelmed even my sweet tooth...ridic. All in all, I would recommend the GRILLED SALMON entree and the VANILLA BEAN CRÈME BRULEE dessert. Don't forget the 15% coupon!

UNsG6_A21OGnNg-jGxDghw.review_text: So I have mixed feelings. On one hand the service and my boyfriend's meal were very good, but my tuna steak was fatty and tasted weird. I am a huge seafood person and so I know the difference between good and bad seafood. The waiter offered a new tuna steak, but I had better at many other places and it was not worth the money.   My boyfriend's pasta was good and so were the crab cakes, but I believe that for a 4 or 5 star rating a restaurant that is a seafood place would have all of its seafood at a high standard.   I would recommend the restaurant and I would go back myself, but order the pasta or crab cakes or something that is fully cooked.

hzKQOJI8-7TM-BstJpSVCA.review_text: Located in the heart of pier 39 you can expected this place to be packed. During lunch time on a Sunday we were told it would be about a 30 minute wait. We decided to sit at the bar instead of waiting for a table. Our bartender/server was very rude. I am not sure if she was having a bad day or what but working with the public she needs to work on her people skills.   We put in our food orders and beer. After we got our beers we were delivered fresh warm sourdough bread. The bread was what dreams are made out of. I knew this place had promise.  Our food came out in a decent amount of time. Meaning I still had one slice of bread let to enjoy with my meal. The greedy monster didn't completely come out. I ordered the salmon club salad and it was good. I was surprised not to be asked how I wanted my salmon cooked as I normally order it rare. It was tasty but not worth the cost.  My husband ordered the fried combo that included fried fish, calamari and shrimp. I had a taste of the fish and calamari which was decent.
