However my husband wouldn't part with the shrimp because they only gave him two. Wtf??? The two sides were the traditional fries and coleslaw.   Overall the food was decent but seemed overprice. I guess not overpriced per the location but I would considered a bread bowl at boudin or a food truck next time.

DNGlXtmmTK5xcUu4X2AVAg.review_text: Definitely worth the price. The clam chowder was delicious as was the sourdough bread. The crab salad was amazing as well. Plus the views of the pier are hard to beat

wrwdR7aEzx4cu-5uArKsPQ.review_text: Yummy food and a beautiful view. Started off with a cucumber gimlet that was very refreshing. We enjoyed a couple oysters on the half shell which were delish. For my entree I had the Ahi Tuna which I asked for extra rare, it came out perfectly cooked. Or should I say hardly cooked. It was just the way I like it. It was topped with a wasabi aioli and fresh ginger. They complimented each other really well. Noir server Dirk was friendly and very attentive for us being a group of 11. It was nice that he didn't have a problem splitting our check. My husband and I will definitely be back. Looking forward to trying more yummy seafood dishes! :D

87SxpHyUeUM8RlademhK7Q.review_text: Nice atmosphere and pleasant staff. The mixed seafood grill was great, but the ahi tuna was a real disappointment!  The texture was very soft and the flavor was very bland...I think that it was the worst ahi I have ever had.

pHLCm78t02HQWmEE7eBcng.review_text: Pros:  convenient location for tourists.  Great view.   Cons:  Bad food. Slow service. Bad cocktails.  Rude hostess--the heavy-set hispanic woman with glasses is horribly impolite.

2I3OFA1b91p1KXOCCyJdPQ.review_text: I was looking forward to this as reviews were good, and it was the first day of the dungeness crab season.  The service was friendly, but incredibly slow.  It took about 15 minutes to get my one glass of champagne, and I could literally see it sitting at the bar for 5 minutes.  It was a busy Saturday night, but the service was just so slow it was painful.  When my steamed crab finally arrived, it was mediocre quality and it took another 5 minutes for them to check in so that I could tell them that they didn't give me crab crackers.  Despite request, I never got a small fork to actually get the crab out.   I would not recommend it.  I'm sure there are other nice places to try.  The view was however nice and the waiting area with the fireplace was very nice.

0pvY8CHNZzY-0v1AVBO2eQ.review_text: Excellent clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl and the cioppino was delicious as well. I highly recommend either of these dishes.

i3YZY1tfzLZRJzCc8x563g.review_text: Yummy seafood! We were looking for some of that famous San Fran seafood and we def found it here! You won't be disappointed! Just dont forget to make a reservation...it was packed!

GcSbo1oX_aRroZQe4JwWzw.review_text: Our company retreat was in S.F. this year and the company dinner was held at Fog Harbor Fish House. After last years dinner (in Vegas) I didn't have high hopes.. ;-)... I was pleasantly surprised! Our table had each one of the options (Veggie Pasta for the Vegetarian, she didn't look too excited..),, but what I think since it is a seafood place is much more important... the mixed fish plate was AWESOME! Everything grilled to perfection (including the veggies!). It was a very good meal! My bf had the steak and he was a happy camper as well. The dessert was nothing to write home about, but if you are looking for a nice restaurant with good seafood and a nice view.. this is it!

QMc22rUpBPcRpeoih8Jg_A.review_text: Ordered a whole crab. Pricey at $38 but it was pretty good with the butter. The bread was delicious. From where we sat we could see alcatraz,  part of the bridge and the sea lions on the docks.

w_InKuK0A6K2uBag_g3hiQ.review_text: The food and service was outstanding!! It is on the higher scale as far as price.

le3wfpC1_P2B1jeeOv99FA.review_text: I had my family visiting from Michigan, and what better place to take them then fishermans wharf for sightseeing and lunch? Well, we stumbled across fog harbor and when I told the hostess, Denise, how many people were in our party (4) she said the wait was 10 minutes. Then I said "oh! We also have a baby but she doesn't need a highchair (baby's 6 months and was in her stroller). Denise then proceeds to tell me "oh, well it's a longer wait then...it's kind of an inconvenience to be honest for us to have highchairs and strollers in here." At that point, my father heard Denise, and said "umm..okay, we won't eat here then." Without apologizing or ANYTHING, she just didn't say anything and started talking to her coworker next to her. She was so rude and disrespectful I couldn't believe. I then asked to speak with a manager who didn't know her left from right. We ended up leaving and going to crab house on the wharf where all staff were sooooo nice and friendly and were sweet to my niece. Word of caution...don't eat here, check out crab house right next store for sure!

WhZ9ZgxxZntR7GVkUbOwBQ.review_text: With a delicious sea food menu, Fog harbor fish house puts the perfect twist on fish. Swordfish, clams, octopus and more are presented in the fish market at the entrance of the restaurant. You simply pick your fish or shellfish at the door, tell them how you'd like it prepared (the huge menu on the wall helps you decide the perfect seasonings) and wait at the table for the waiter to serve you drinks. It's always full of people, business men and women, families, tourists, and young people. There is a piece of fish for everyone

5NOHIhem2KGI-wlHi63p9Q.review_text: Had fish & chips.  It was delicious!  The blue cheese garlic bread was yummy.  Would order it especially if you like blue cheese!  We also had the apple cranberry crisp.  That was the best!!

QFJWmKBjJeswP3xFik6GeA.review_text: My first visit in San Francisco and found this restaurant on Yelp.  Since it had good reviews I figured lets check it out. Had the clams, dungeness crab, mussels, in an awesome tomato based sauce, it was delicious! Also loved our waiter David.. He was extremely knowledgeable and was very personable.. Would definitely recommend this place..

Lu8y2ayxVlAzuJEVfVcH4w.review_text: If you haven't already figured this out, I'm in love with seafood. So when I tried Fog Harbor at the Yelpin' La Vida Loca Party, the Crab Ceviche, the Ahi Tuna - I wanted to come back. I received a coupon for a free appetizer with dinner at the Yelp event, but it was the food that kept me thinking about trying it out. After having a touristy boat ride on the Bay, me and my friend went over to Pier 39 for an early dinner.  Don't be fooled by the novelty of the Pier, Fog Harbor is a nice classic seafood restaurant. Nice big booths with great views of the bay to Golden Gate Bridge.  The place is huge and would be ideal for a Holiday Party, dinner party or event. They have a nice big bar that serves up anything you want, although they have quite a few custom cocktails.  I ordered myself a Bloody Mary, I can appreciate a good bloody mary outside of normal brunching hours, especially if I'm enjoying some seafood.  Since we were going for the full tasting experience, we ordered the:   *Ahi Tuna on a fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli  ~Absolutely delicious. I tried this at the yelp event and had to order it again. *Red Chili Garlic Prawns: Red chili paste, onions, peppers and garlic ~Spicy and so good, the sauce and peppers had so much flavor, I added a couple spoonfuls to my bloody mary. Yeah, it's THAT good. *Garlic Roasted Crab: Roasted 1/2 crab with a garlic herb butter ~At $15.00, I could eat this every night. Served with hot butter, I sat there happily cracking my crab and tasting every bit of that garlicky buttery goodness. If you need a crab fix, I highly recommend this dish.  *Salmon BLT: Served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli. ~ Really great, probably one of the best salmon sandwiches I've had. You know that feeling when you take a bite of someone's sandwich and you want more. If I wasn't so entertained cracking my crab, I'd be all over this sandwich.   When they came up with the dessert platter, I didn't know if I could possibly do it...but there was the crème brulee. Just tempting me. It was just as good as expected, creamy with that sugar glazed candy crunch top.  I had my dessert with an Absolute Lemonade cocktail, very refreshing.   I really enjoyed my dinner at Fog Harbor and will definitely come back.  The service was excellent, the food was incredible, affordable for the quality and the whole overall experience was worth coming down to the pier to try out. My mouth is watering just thinking about it!!

vW5WLgkKIntl1IGck0boXA.review_text: The service was pretty disappointing. The food tasted delicious, however you could observe the economic discrimination. The tables that ordered a lot of food were given a significant amount of service to. At one point I believe the manager was walking around my table's area and asked everyone how their meal was except for my table. We did not receive bread or any refills for water while the other tables around us did. I am extremely disappointed because I was expecting to have a great experience here due to the large amount of reviews and high ratings on Yelp, however this place simply failed my expectations.

PrqhlhGVjq5FuaM9pW6Enw.review_text: We turned the kids loose on the Pier to do their own thing for a while while hubby and I duck in for a drink and an appetizer for lunch.  The place is bumping so we are thinking "it must be good".  We did not stick around long enough to find out what the food was like.  I guess I should consider us lucky for the drinks we did get even though they were just as bad as the lack of service!

ExzqN9SYMfMtpfHZfRNWxw.review_text: Place is in a good location. Customer service is great! We requested a table for 9 with a view since we have some visitors from EU and we were accommodated. Wait time is not bad. We made a reservation but we were seated after everybody in the party are present which is ok.  For the food, we order different kind of appetizers, main course and dessert. Overall it was good but the garlic butter is a bit too much butter and the spicy garlic is not what I expected. I would say overall it's not bad. The price is on the higher side. For first-timers I think it would be ok. Are we going to come back? Hmmm, maybe we'll try other seafood restaurant in the area first.

UR2VJHETDi1CaSV2gaub6g.review_text: Food was good, not great, not bad. Came for the dungeoness crab during their high season and wasn't disappointed, but also not overwhelmed.  Decor is upscale and service is attentive. The view of the ocean is a perk, but may not be as visible depending on your seat.

Y2x54OE_B6w8I-TbPFHZtQ.review_text: BEST CLAM CHOWDER EVER! Dead serious too. It's creamy, thick and  delicious. They've got kickass mahi mahi as well. Loved their citrus butter with mango salsa that they style the plate with. And their mash potatoes are creamy and delicate. So nom nom nom. Their molten lava chocolate cake is so warm and gooey. One bite and your in chocolate heaven.   Also, a major plus, my boyfriend and his family went to eat this past week and he ordered his steak medium-rare. His steak came, but it came well done. The manager came to our table because he heard us complaining and pushing my boyfriend to complain. He asked if he could order him another steak, but my boyfriend was hungry and said no no it was ok. The manager then came at towards the end of our meal and informed us that he removed his steak meal from the bill. How awsome of a guy. Anyway, this place rocks.

MDJCjh1Wctg_h72EIWbISw.review_text: As tourists to San Fran, my boyfriend and I came to Fog Harbor with two goals: a nice-ish dinner and good clam chowder. We got both. We were also lucky enough to get a table with a view. Overall it was a fine meal, with fine service, at a fine price, but I don't think it's something that will stick out in my memory. We had better food at other places that weekend -- but I do think that Fog Harbor is a nice way to cap off an afternoon/evening of exploring Fisherman's Wharf.  Edited to add: My boyfriend had the clam chowder in a soup bowl, along with a glass of red wine, and I had a Caesar salad and the calamari appetizer as my dinner.

t4o8mWvFo5Q7vwT94h1zaw.review_text: This place actually surprised me. I'm a city native who doesn't expect much from restaurant around Pier 39, but this place was solid and reasonably priced. I had a friend visiting from out of town who wanted oysters, so we came to Fog Harbor. The oysters on the half shell were good, as were the baked oysters. The pleasant surprise was the generous serving of clam chowder in a bread bowl that surpassed my expectations.  Oh, and our server was AMAZING. I feel awful for forgetting his name, but he was attentive at the right times without being intrusive.

LCVNK095eTHCVaDKySDSaQ.review_text: I tried to order lobster here and they were sold out.. Then I tried to order crab and they were sold out. To be fair, it was a busy night and in a tourist area, but I was hoping to treat my friend to some good seafood and we were both disappointed.   I will say that the environment is nice, but it isn't quiet in any way, shape, or form. It's quite noisy and sometimes I couldn't hear the waiter over the noise, but it wasn't a big deal.   Of course being in a tourist area made it relatively pricey, so I was expecting that. I don't remember the name of the dishes I ordered but there was some lobster in it, but not the whole thing. It was good, but not out of this world.   The waiter was helpful though, and did attend to us very nicely. Good manners and timely, etc. All the good stuff.   Maybe I'll come back here one day and finally get to try the crab.

T3Qiw2KLnCkSLjMqEbSfbQ.review_text: came here because of the reviews .. only thing good was crab cake... really delicious... but the pasta was bad .. sauce too oily .. and the clam chowder wasn't fresh .. tasted like it came out of a can.. my friend had a real bad stomach ache and diarrhea after eating the seafood pasta (w/ prawns .. that tasted mushy and for sure looked nothing like prawns but frozen shrimps)

LlpymMSmyuxcX6xg9AlyvA.user_location: Salt Lake City, Salt Lake City, UT
LlpymMSmyuxcX6xg9AlyvA.review_text: Pier 39 was the most touristy pier along the road and it was pretty easy to find parking. Once we got there we asked what the best thing was, she's pointed at the clam chowder. That was $10. I got the seafood penne. It was delicious. My friends like the bread bowl the chowder came in.  The only complaint is the amount of time it took after the meal--to get our check split,   We got a cool window seat. There was one tv I saw, there could have been one more but I doubt it. As you walked further inside it's pretty boosie (is that the correct spelling?) so more tvs would make it feel like a buffalo wings or Applebee's.

SfN7jh5KW2WhmNnQtUMlFQ.review_text: Great Place the Food was good. The service was good. and I check the restrooms which was clean. The place was very busy but it was quick service once we was seated.  Try the Clam Chowder Bowl in the Sourdough Bread... Very Good.

nPgBqPJBhQHAp0B_endxmg.review_text: We were in the area and wanted a good seafood meal since we were at the wharf. This place was rated high but we still did not have high expectations... However we were quickly surprised!! The atmosphere is wonderful and the food was delicious! The clam chowder is a must try too!   The portions were pretty good sized! We split a meal and then shared a appetizer and cup of chowder and had left overs!! Will come back next time in area!

SPLrEnub7BR8bVgG_wH1NA.review_text: Great place to celebrate holiday, fresh seafood and well services, their house chardonnay was worth to try btw.

GDaelIjovMulp3KmaybX3A.review_text: Great restaurant. We were recently in the Pier 39 area - had just finished a tour of Alcatraz and wanted to check out the seals and grab some food. After a quick glance at all the menus, we finally decided on Fog Harbor Fish House.   The menu is pretty pricey, but the food is pretty good. Fresh warm sourdough bread was complimentary, which was surprisingly delicious (Note: I am a sourdough snob).  We ordered the following: beet and blue cheese salad, california crab and avocado caesar salad, the soup and salad combo (caesar salad and a clam chowder bread bowl), and the crab roll. Didn't get a chance to try dessert, but the dessert tray they had looked amazing!   Great views of the Bay and the seals!

hF2EegvU9uieBrDjHZiHnQ.review_text: Brunch on Suday was a great experience. My crab omlette was light and full of flavor,  husband's poached eggs were perfect and pancakes evoked "how can they make pancakes delicious?" Service was attentive and sincere; real cloth napkins and tablecloths.:) Plus, views of active harbor, and sounds of seals doing their thing... OMG we could actually have a conversation without shouting, and it felt really clean. We are locals, so exploring new (tourist? oh my!) 'hoods has become a weekend adventure. We were drawn to the outdoor coctail area, and will now count it as a must for out of town guests' breakfast, as well as ours.  Yep, you can have an Irish Coffee for breakfast! Good place to rest feet and have a drink, too, if enjoying the waterfront area. We will try it for other meals as well. Parking across the street at the grungy Pier 39 garage. It's a quick walk over the pedestrian bridge to the restaurant.  Ask the server to validate your parking ticket.

-pJinZaemBvTUyuaL-EvEQ.review_text: I appreciate the follow up from the management as a result of my review. I'd recommend reevaluating the branding and menu to make them more special and less generic. This feels and tastes very much like every other restaurant ever, which can be good but is most often boring.

gwsqxX36OJahYxwtPDJV_Q.review_text: We dined here because the view of the bay caught my eye. Our waiter was incredible. He was cheerful, always had a smile on, and very tentative throughout our meal. We ordered the baked oysters- flavorful and cheesy, clam chowder- not the best but it was solid, and the seafood penne- tomato cream sauce with loads of seafood (mussels, clams, swordfish and salmon). All three dishes did not disappoint.

addFMW60hnUvayu7ynh_xg.review_text: On this rainy night at Pier39, I had a great Ciopino and a couple of Anchor Steam, both among the finest of San Francisco.  Funny that the waiter offer to "clean the crab" for $4, essentially to save me the mess of picking the flesh from the shell.  That was the fun part, why would I pay other people to do it for me.  The soup was intense  but the fish was a bit too dry.

8xHIhD97GeZ4G2oKoQJdWQ.review_text: This is a late review, however, I wanted to input the info. GREAT CLAM CHOWDER bowl, great ambiance, service marvelous (even though it was so busy on a Friday night!), the fresh flower arrangements are beautiful, and found the staff all to be quite pleasant.  I spent a girls weekend, visited SFwith 8 gals, was very nice there and we all had great things to say about the place!  YES, DO GO AND YES ENJOY THE EATS AND THE PRICES ARE GREAT!  THUMBS UP!!!

W-9G1OPyTlL-E7clDKIeNg.review_text: Great service, pretty descent food and a great view of the sunset over the golden gate bridge. Was going to order the crab cakes and the waiter recommended that I SHOULD NOT order them, said there may be a little to much breading and suggested another appetizer. I had the 1/2 crab fettuccine which was awesome. I would definitely eat here again and recommend it to anyone.

5ECtmLzrurE0RcNpmTwXaA.review_text: I am always concerned about places in a very tourist heavy area. For while they might have nice presentation they have nothing forcing them to make an exceptional product.   After waiting 30 minutes we were brought to a very nice dinning room area that overlooked the water. Ordering the calamari to start with a coupon that is provided by the visitors center and to eat my son got the Mac and cheese, my wife got a custom designed linguine with garlic crab dish and I ordered the crab ceviche (avocado, mango and fresh pulled crab meat).  The calamari came and I was worried about the other items we ordered. It was not awful, but tasted like any other frozen squid with breading and very little seasoning which was a little over fried. I even sampled the "aioli" which is really become just a new way for a restaurant to put mayo in a ramekin and call it something cooler. That being said it did not help much and I was not looking forward to the meal.  Then the waitress came with a basket filled with sourdough bread and it was exceptional. Did not ask for it, but the timing was perfect and just as we enjoyed our first piece the good bread... The food arrived-  My ceviche was amazing! The quality of the seafood is evident on the first bite and I felt like the combination of flavors that was more than I expected. The avocado was very flavorful and the mango was such a mild taste that all together it was a perfect mix. I cannot say anything bad about this dish except it was an appetizer and wish I ordered two.  The linguine was cooked with garlic, sun dried tomatoes, spinach and garlic crab meat. It was actually from the chicken penne pasta sub crab and linguine. This was a great way to try some fresh crab meat and the way it was pulled and placed on top of the pasta you could have some crab in every bite. The sun dried tomatoes played a great supporting role of adding color and a great finish to every few bites that were lucky enough to have some in it.  Lastly was my sons Mac and cheese. I never find it worthy of saying much about kid items, but this macaroni and cheese was gourmet and the steamed broccoli about as fresh tasting as can be.  This was a great final bite on our visit to San Fran! We will be back!!!

oZ4zwTAR2C9kGUL2aCGccQ.review_text: Fog Harbor was the choice for a holiday party with my friends from various Banks. About twenty people.  Tip: to get to Pier 39 from Caltrain, just walk to the BART track, pay $2.00 and ride it to Embarcadero. Then get off and walk to the F Street car, pay $2.00. Your other option is to cab there for $12.50 each way.  On to Fog Harbor Fish House:  Good value for large parties.  We did the prix fixe,  for starters every four people were served a platter of yummy calamari perfectly deep fried, cheese toast with fine blue cheese and a small plate of prawns sauteed in a spicy hot marinara (V. good). Next, you get a salad of a few leaves of high quality romaine lettuce with creamy blue cheese or, you can have a white clam chowder. The main entree is either salmon, new york steak, or braised chicken, comes with sauteed zucchini's and pearl onion. Mashed potato's and a dessert of lava cake or tiramisu. $38.00  I had the NY steak, cooked medium, it was tastey, if a bit skinny at 1/2 inch thick cooked.  The excellent romaine salad comes with four pieces of lettuce with a creamy blue cheese dressing; it was perfection. The mashed potatoes and sauteed zucchini were ok.    For dessert, I chose their lava cake: it was very chocolately,& moist n' sweet on the inside; it was served with a side of vanilla ice cream drizzled with more chocolate. A sprig of mint leaf added to the sensation.  My friend had the salmon and it looked phat, well over an inch, about 6 inches by 6 inches. She said it was delicious.  Their coffee was very good: black and delicious.   Decent appetizers, entrees and desserts. I just figure you are paying a very reasonable $33.00 for the food and $5.00 for an excellent water front view, fine linen and silverware. I had to ask for my coffee to get refilled. Ditto for water.  Bathrooms: clean and modern.  Customer service: a bit slow.  Ambience: very nice, trad. American.  Tip: from the BART at Embarcadero, walk upstairs and look for the train tracks and hop on the F Street Car, to Pier 39. Just $2.00  Tip: due to the deluge, we cabbed from Pier 39 to CalTrain at King/4th, it was $12.50 without tip.

I1IaGyY4OqrmcognYXHIJg.review_text: Quite possibly the best crab I have ever had.  The roasted garlic Dungeness crab is to die for.  The soup was awesome and the blue cheese bread was extremely good.  Cocktails were good.  Our late lunch was filling enough to last for dinner.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone with no hesitations.  And score - the blue cheese garlic bread was free thanks to Yelp for a check in that day!

qq1ImRPvzI0Dz4jE2a-xqg.review_text: Ate lunch here with the wife and kids.  I had the Ciopino and it was fantastic.  Very rich tomato broth and all the seafood was very tender.  Nice views out over the bay.

tMWGtt43TVK_qdMui_63cw.review_text: For the most part, any restaurant that is on or around Fisherman's Wharf in SF is pretty terrible and expensive. However, I was pleasantly surprised by Fog Harbor Fish House! My clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl was delicious and the fish and chips were probably one of the best fish and chips I have ever had! The breading was light, fluffy, and *shockingly* not greasy at all. I would return here as the prices weren't that expensive either. Two thumbs up!  I think the view during the day or early evening would be spectacular. We visited at night and had a window seat - but not much to see that late.

qPrGXgoL5RCmpQ3JjeDCvQ.review_text: Ask for Khaiman he is the best and will take good care of you! The chowder is excellent!!

Ooo-iQJ4-1UEvPfhQgmB3A.review_text: Nice place, not too fabulous, friendly stuff. There is almost no complaints about the food! Swordfish was delicious, but scallops as appetizer was nothing special and a lil overcooked. Same goes for desserts.

qU3E7ENm8VsMc_IZCpTCZA.review_text: The view is nice. So is the little waiting area out front with the fireplace. The decor is attractive as well. Um, that's really all the good things I could say. I guess the service was ok, it wasn't bad at least. And we were seated quickly. And water seems to get refilled if you ask.   As for the bad stuff. They screwed up my opentable reservation a couple times. Once just because, the other they weren't able to record the reservation because their connection was down. And I missed out on my points, dammit. The food is blah. The clam chowder, not so good. Small little cup. About on par with something out of a can. The seafood dishes are nothing special. Some highlights include overcooked prawns, cold mashed potatoes and dry fish. Plain presentation of food. As in I think once there was a tiny sprig of parsley on my plate.

8OzzJJBiTCMhLTPd8FC7Cg.review_text: GOD DAMNED DELICIOUS!!!   We had the soup (clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl..obviously) with mixed field greens, the salmon entree, and the pumpkin bread pudding. Service was fast but unobtrusive, great tasting food, and an amazing view.   This will be our new SF tradition!!

_Co-FPjZaTUeVhqpkIYTmg.review_text: My Mother was craving crab, and for $37, Fog Harbor Fish House serves a whole dungeness crab steamed just the way she likes it. The caesar salad comes with speared romaine, the way I prefer, and the dressing is delicious. Bread is complimentary and is difficult to stop eating! I conservatively ordered linguine with clams. The linguine could have been more al dente, but the serving was generous. My husband ordered fish and chips. The woman who served us was extremely polite and doting. The restaurant is very clean with a pretty interior and a picturesque view of the waterfront. This is the second meal that we've enjoyed at Fog Harbor Fish House.

owt0p6Z4iZ6ylvbMWIO-qw.review_text: Our concierge recommended Fog Harbor when discussing options to visit Alcatraz.  Unfortunately, tickets to the prison were sold out so we made a day of it at Haight-Ashbury instead.  I made a reservation at Fog Harbor earlier that day and requested to have a window seat (after all, I heard the place overlooked Pier 39, so why not take advantage of the view)?    This restaurant is definitely more of a tourist attraction than an authentic fish house, but we still thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.  Our waitress was the sweetest older woman you'd ever met, and she went out of her way to make sure everything was spot-on.  The location of our table added to the romantic, special experience.   To start, we had the crab cake, clam chowder, and a salad.  The cake's consistency was perfect--dense with crab meat, lightly seared, accompanied with a red pepper aioli.  The clam chowder was thick, rich and..well...clammy (in a good way), and my boyfriend said the sourdough bread was divine.  I was bummed to hear that they were out of baby spinach...but the portion of romaine more than compensated for this.   We chose the whole dungeness crab for our entrees.  Ladies, if you're wearing a nice outfit, I'd opt for a different dish instead of this messy treat.  The seafood cioppono looked tasty, as did some of the cuts of meat.  We were bibbed for the big event and spent a good 15 minutes hacking away at the shells prior to digging in (our plan of attack:  shell all the meat before feasting).  The waitstaff kept our area clean, even as the shards of shell flew around us.    I wish that there had been more veggies on the plate, and the potatoes were a little runny for my taste.  We spent a good two hours enjoying our meals and each others company, never once feeling rushed to leave.  It was a good, solid meal for to conclude our adventure in San Fran.  My senses are piqued and I'm eager to return to the Wharf for more fruits of the sea.

29e0pFRgMf_0vPA74VrQ0g.review_text: Not sure why this gets four stars. It earned two because of the outstanding views. But clam chowder was mediocre. The "side salad" was four pieces of Romaine. And the oysters left much to be desired. Not to mention the crappy service at the bar.

W7aNFKA1z_ziofKUaLvgWA.review_text: Everything was absolutely amazing! I took my parents here for dinner and the service was fantastic. Food was even better.

JYeiV5cQ-dlBhEcaUvZ31g.review_text: I love the food here!!! Such a great view during the day and the portions are massive. Great drinks. Had the steamed mussels, their famous clam chowder, crab louis salad (huge dish), crab roll, seafood cioppino... Everything was delicious. Sat a huge booth, plenty to share. Really great experience... a must try!

Jk3-Z6Kjb0wUUnXxOI2iNw.review_text: Really enjoyed the Ahi Tuna - rich and light and oh so tender. Get the Crab ceviche, not too much citrus and very full of flavor.  Service is friendly and knowledgeable. Classy atmosphere and a great view of the bay at sunset.

aSRomjeCrjBr1C19o7A_9w.review_text: We are locals and just went here because of good yelp reviews for father's day. Service was good and our waitress was sweet. Except she didn't tell me that there is $4 fee for them to remove the crab meat out of the shell for my ciopinno. We had to send sliders back because they were fishy tasting. They did comp up for those,  but still...gross! My dad actually spit his out. The food was mediocre tourist trap at best. But I guess what can you expect in the heart of pier 39.

Z6Uqx8VsvxhNwgUbr10Rmg.review_text: Just had a fantastic and *fresh* meal with a special friend. I have to say that Khaiman took expert care of us the entire time and also paid close attention to my food allergen issues (gluten intolerance) and recommended substitutes and alternates. What a nice touch. Overall the ambience was superb, the views gorgeous and again, the seafood superb. Lovely night, nice memories.

VaipRciC_CQGCFnpLUnYiQ.review_text: went only for the happy hour. i think everything on the happy hour menu was between $5-7.   the drinks are yummy, but not strong. i ordered the orange cremesicle and it was very sweet.  the appetizers are pretty good, but the portions are small. we ordered:   lemon calamari--- pretty standard calamari, but def. did not taste like lemons  crab cakes---good, but they only give you 2 small cakes.  spicy shrimp---very good, they hardly give you any shrimp, but the sauce makes for great dipping sauce with the house bread.

HBNsE6peWFxcb2dekzPxyg.review_text: I love this place! We were seated right away even though it was a busy Friday evening........we had a great view of the harbor and Alcatraz. The bread is to die for as is the clam chowder,crab cakes and the fresh fish! The service was good and I can't wait to go back! Hmmm maybe tomorrow for lunch?

VDnD3RKPGjIA66cAULW9iQ.review_text: The restaurant is beautiful and has a great view! The service here is excellent!   The food that we ordered from the happy hour menu was the wings and calamari. The wings were fresh and juicy. The sauce was not overwhelming and tasted like a sweet sesame sauce. =) The calamari was thick and crispy. Lots of flavor and cooked just right!   I would definitely recommend this place during happy hour. I can't review for the entrees though sorry!

zo32AHQ8UZIGJbkmJjQALA.review_text: At first I thought we were in luck.  Yeah it is in a heavily tourist area but it appears the non-touristy places are up on Russian Hill which is quite a hike from the wharf area.  The wait was fairly short given that situation and there were some nice tables and chairs for waiting where you could get a drink from the bar to enjoy while you wait.  The very poor rating was from a one-two punch.  The service was pathetic, we saw our server a few times and that was it.  I would have ordered more drinks if he came by more.  Also, I was away from the table when the food was served but my party noticed the coleslaw had hair in it and sent it back.  Sadly there was no apology but new coleslaw was bought.  Finally I had to flag down a bus boy to get ketchup since none was delivered with the fries and the server never came back. When I finally could flag down our server for the bill, I was afraid he'd never come back to take my credit card.  When I finally paid, I didn't just leave, I ran.

LPTq2-fZ9_TsG5o8lAWCGg.review_text: Hm.... the service was good, the whole lobster was juicy, but the crab was gross. The saving grace of this restaurant was the gorgeous view over the bay and the kick ass tuna/tuna appetizer. Their "supposed" award winning chowder would win awards for mediocrity!  What really annoyed me was that walking by, you can see all their sealife critters moving about in the holding tanks, yet when my crab came out, it was definitely not live when they cooked it. I think it was probably alive a couple years ago and then lost in the deep abyss of their freezers.... Add insult to injury when I brought it up with the manager, he said that the roasted crab was made with frozen crab and the regular steamed crab was made with live crab. ??!?!?!?! *pulls out hair.*  It's a decent place to go to when the meal's expensed... but other than that, there are so many other great fantastic places to eat in the city....

t_-o4zeLjbfIT9cydXTeBA.review_text: I typically don't eat along Pier 39 and Fisherman's Wharf as it gets to be too touristy and crowded. The food isn't always the best here, but there are a few exceptions. Fog Harbor is one of them. The view from the window seat is great and romantic in the evening. I ordered the shellfish platter to share and it was pretty big with lots of crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, etc. The price actually wasn't too bad given that the location has tourists galore. Would come back some time if the occasion calls for it.

4yJ0P2JWuvBRpEXPwrAxJQ.review_text: Delicious food, fresh and full of flavor! Our waiter, Oliver, was brilliant and very amiable- he also remembered us from our previous visit which made me and my group feel immediately welcomed. I highly recommend this place for a taste of good seafood and a great seaside view!

p9OUxMKlyRkOueYAeHuXig.review_text: hubs and I decided to start a holiday tradition of spending one day before christmas in the wharf area to relax and spend some qt.  when we got hungry, we checked out a few of the restaurants and for some reason decided to go here. Since it was a late afternoon meal, we were seated right away. the view from the restaurant was pretty awesome. the tables weren't cramped up and restrooms were clean.  I ordered a nojito (since I cant drink) while hubs ordered their cucumber gimlet drink.  they were both really good.  for apps we shared crab cake--crab cake was good but the salad that came with it was warm and soggy. for entree hubs ordered a filet mignon (med well) with mixed veggies while I ordered their seafood plate.  filet mignon was too rare for my husband so although he ate it, he didn't enjoy it.  the squash with his veggie mix weren't that great either.  my seafood plate on the other hand was good... not too much seasoning and the seafood weren't overcooked. for dessert, we ordered the molten chocolate cake with vanilla ice cream.  it was a bit disappointing.  the cake needed to have melted chocolate and the vanilla ice cream tasted weird...more like imitation vanilla with some alcohol. I also thought the fake dessert sample plate that they show you instead of the dessert menu was a bit tacky for a pricier restaurant.  the service was good... food was hit or miss.

4r0-Q5eu4FyGQwYwEcxC3A.review_text: This place is a bit touristy. The bread was good but our service was horrible. The friend that I went there with and I are still trying to figure stuff out with her bank because she double charged her and then charged me for my half as well. She also NEVER refilled my drinks and I always had to ask for more water from someone that seemed like the manager.  I got the fish and chips and she got the half garlic crab. It was good, but there was hardly any meat in the crab for the price. I guess it is expected for a touristy place.  Probably wouldn't go here again. THere are amazing places to eat in the city and I would just avoid this place for another down the street or a uber ride away!

H60aHCCtSMmY8j4NfDl0Ew.review_text: My husband and I had dinner at Fog Harbor Fish House our first night in San Francisco. We had made our reservations on Yelp and they were ready for us when we arrived. The service was excellent as was the food!   Tip: when you make your reservation, request a table by the window with a view of the bay. It's beautiful and very romantic. I look forward to coming back again!

fDOnFpyNj9Qd31MK1JGitA.review_text: Started with some great crab cakes. The clam chowder is off the hook and khaiman we a great waiter full of information.

lR3N44fOsKHH743pDicOig.review_text: Ok so the one star is for the time me and my husband came here for lunch one saturday afternoon.  He got the lobster tails and I got the seafood penne.  I was not that impressed with the penne but the lobster was so good I wished I had ordered that instead.  The waitress was so friendly and would check on us every time if we need anything else etc.  The view was great and we said that we would definitely be back the next time we're at pier39.  So now months later, a friend of mine who moved from NY to CA is traveling from Fresno to SF.  I suggested that we go to pier39 and meet up with a couple of our other friends.  Now here comes the "bad experience" part.    We ordered Clam chowders, Fish and Lobster.  Well, I did order the Lobster because it was so good the last time we were here.  Wrong choice.  It was the saltiest Lobster ever!  Why not just give me pure rock salt and charge me $32 at that! Im not kidding it is real salty.  To top it off, our waiter didn't even bother refilling our water.  Well, I know some of us didn't order any drinks and just water but can't you even bother ASK if we want our glasses refilled.  After all you're still getting 18%  or $35++ in tips.  3.5% health fee is $6.88.  WTH is that for when you gave me salty lobster and no water refill.  Now, I always ask the waiter to leave the little desert menu wherever I go as I have the tendency to change my mind about getting a desert afterward.  He didn't even bother.  Oh and did I tell you that I was still munching on my french fries when he took the plate right then and there.  So far, this has been my WORST experience in a restaurant ever.  I will NEVER go back and I will NEVER recommend this place to anyone ever!  At the end of the night we ended up paying well under $300 for lousy service and bad food. What's funny is at the receipt there is an option for Additional Tip even after they put in 18%.  Never again.

wHxbG6VF_10diXjFUqWfxQ.review_text: I gave it 3 stars because of the food. Dungeness crab meat sandwich is super yummy  but the  service was poor.

lZNh_3_7VZtArg-3kqDnmg.review_text: When visiting San Francisco not only did my gf and I go here once, but twice! It's not a cheap night out if that's what you're looking for, but considering the quality and service that you get it was more than worth the price. Not only that, but it is comparable to other restaurants in the Fisherman's Wharf area in price.  The food was excellent and considering it's a seafood place, I couldn't get enough of their chicken! The apple crumble dessert was awesome and tasted just like your grandma's. The service was excellent and attentive and they garnered a great tip from me both times.  You won't be disappointed by this place!

CLFknBpbWbvvfaZ00Be7uw.review_text: We had a last minute urge for some seafood and considering it was Labor Day Monday, our options were pretty limited. Our usual spots were all closed, I saw the strong rating on Yelp so i figured, what the hell--give the tourist trap a try. Turns out we both really liked the meal. We had a Caesar salad and cioppino.   Don't come here expecting mission-hipster. It is pretty touristy so the service is actually quite respectable. Forgot to mention, they do have great views!!

LPLzukJcwi6HgtgpR_MTvA.review_text: Family had a great dinner! We started with the calamari because it was free with a coupon from the Savings Fun Pack (from Visitor's Center). The calamari was very good with a lemon aioli. The complimentary warm sourdough with butter is delicious. This restaurant is kid friendly with an extensive kid's menu. Hubby had the mixed grill and loved it. I had the crab cake entree but substituted the sides to be veggies and wild rice. The banana chocolate bread pudding was amazing. A great place with excellent attentive service. Definitely will come here again.

6-0i3Mqcr-R4sLRG_EE41Q.review_text: When I arrived, there had still been people waiting for a table. Luckily for us, we made a reservation for lunch day. Our hostess seated us right next to wall-sized windows, which had a beautiful view of the San Francisco harbor. We could see Alcatraz and Fisherman's Wharf. Known for its oysters, we ordered a dozen, followed by the seafood platter. The food was quite delicious.

AgQv3bU6y_XOWo2bVaouFw.review_text: Delicious!  The salmon was the freshest I have ever tasted.  Madison was the best waitress ever!  Over the top service!

z2gPCQfW2Nv6FKyIFtiUug.review_text: We had a great lunch and our server, Madison, made the experience special.  She was attentive and gave excellent service.  The clam chowder was very good and the meal was good.  We'll be back!

IKdLCnD2eFdwDv0OmCfAVA.review_text: Nothing special about the food, which isn't a bad thing in this case.  Its good fresh seafood that isn't heavily seasoned.  I had the mix grill and it was just what I was looking for, quality, well cooked, fresh fish.  The one special thing is they had the best sourdough of my vacation!

WlhCN9MYLrFUvrH1Xl0XkQ.review_text: I loved the Halibut.  Can't beat it.  Excellent dish.  Prepared very well.  The server recommended an excellent wine.  I'll be back for sure.

om5ZiponkpRqUNa3pVPiRg.review_text: I have a feeling my local friends would cringe that I ate at this tourist destination, but tourists need good food too. I have to admit that my meal at Fog Harbor Fish House was just as tasty as some of the local hotspots i"ve tried. And the view of the pier was also quite lovely.  Our waiter was eager to please and when he thought he had mixed up my wine with a colleague's wine I thought he was going to have a slight heart attack. He apologized about 80 times and bought us some delish chocolate banana bread pudding (yuummm) for dessert.  We didn't even care about the mixup, but we're never ones to say no to free dessert.  However, before dessert comes apps and entrees. For apps we ordered the crab ceviche and shrimp cocktail. The crab ceviche itself was pretty tasty, but they were pretty skimpy with the chips that came with it. 4 total chips for our group of 5! The shrimp cocktail were a bit wimpy looking, especially for SF where I've had some incredible seafood, but they still tasted good.  My entree was incredible. I ordered off the special menu for the night. Pesto halibut that came with mozzarella cheese, figs and some other delicious goodies on the side.  This was the best fish I remember enjoying in a long time. Hopefully they'll be adding it to their main menu!  I'd definitely go back during my frequent trips to SF and may even drag some local friends with me next time!

XC8wJ5LBdDjosBGddqdRzA.review_text: We had a great meal here. We came with a party of 8 at about 5:30pm on a Thursday and were seated promptly.   The beer selection was nice with plenty of good local favorites.  Fried Calamari: I was disappointed that there were no tentacles. They were cooked properly but the breading was unimaginative. Not bad but not great.  Blue Cheese Bread: very rich and delicious.  Most of us ordered some fried seafood. I had the combo and others had the fish & chips. The fried fish is excellent: beer battered, tender and juicy. I also really enjoyed the fried shrimp. They were butterflied and cooked perfectly with a nice panko coating. The disappointing thing was that I only got one piece of fish and two shrimp and a big pile of calamari. The fries were standard.  My brother ordered the Cioppino. I got to taste it and it was very good. I've had lots of cioppino since moving to the area and I'd say this is one of the best around.  To sum up: I highly recommend this place if you're looking for a good meal on Pier 39. Skip the calamari and the fried seafood combo (because of the calamari) but try the fish & chips, shrimp & chips, or the cioppino which were all excellent.

r98x6nWRBMIMQENUjCdJqw.review_text: Went to Fog Harbor Fish House for my birthday with a group of girl friends. We loved the baked oysters, the red curry mussels, and the blue cheese garlic bread for appetizers. I had the ahi tuna for my entree- it was delicious and the portion was bigger than I expected. . The service was fantastic- everyone was friendly and gave us great recommendations of what to order. They really went out of their way to make my birthday special.  I would definitely recommend it!

hKirHL9iYVRsFlzipzfMWg.review_text: My wife and I were impressed with the prior reviews so we gave it a try. We were also pleased with prompt attentive service and a very fresh lunch. She had the crab avocado Caesar salad and I had the crab roll. Both were very good lunch sized portions. We had the ginger lemonade as well.   The total bill was $55 (after we added tip) which was a little pricey for lunch but we enjoyed the view and in a touristy area we sort of expected it.   Definitely recommended.

bunWqtzZdNai863K4LSILg.review_text: We were celebrating my wife's birthday.  The food was tasty.   My wife had the crab cakes, she liked them, but she felt more crab could of been added .  I had the pan fried sole on white beans with  spinach; enjoyed it very much.  Good choice.

GV0ZLqZ6Jmo8Z5diY5EbRA.review_text: Absolutely loved this place! Place was great with an amazing view. Excellent service and fantabulous food: fresh, fast, classy.  Highly recommend to those who love SeaFood!  Great atmosphere and very busy place

PRhuBBCN9Lnmg-9l6nuFgQ.review_text: We came back to this location after two successful dinners under a previous owner only to be disappointed. The greet and wait staff seemed somewhat chilly to our party of 3, and the food was hardly a "wow" that we had experienced before. The chowder that I was looking forward to was very thick and soon had a thick skin over the surface of the bowl that was a bit unappealing to me. The crab cakes were okay, although nice and crispy on the outside. The mashed potatoes were blah -- seemed obviously from  a box and could have used a healthy does of garlic. My husband enjoyed his fried platter, although he said it was hard to tell the difference between each seafood item's taste. My friend enjoyed her fried calamari, saying she could still taste the fish in spite of the fried exterior. While the views and the inside decor is impressive, I don't think we'll be coming back to this one. =(

IjfRUwsQ1ECzI-5Y3ARDPA.review_text: This place has a beautiful view. The food is also very good. Service was excellent. We had the free appetizer with yelp check in and it was ok. The shellfish platter for 2 at $55 was very good. Fresh seafood a must while in S.F. The dessert creme brulee was just ok.  Would come here again for the view and seafood.

JAAFOnsF7XsUU8XHygEzLQ.review_text: My boyfriend and i were on vacation in SF for his bday and i was looking for a place to take him for dinner on his special day. i came across this place and man was i happy i chosen it. first let me say i think this was the best seafood ive ever eaten. we started off with the baked oysters and they were so delicious! we almost ordered a second round. then the clam chowder came and oh man i was glad we we didn't get the second order the sourdough bread and the soup was to die for! then my main dish the salmon came and i just didn't want the night to end. the salmon was perfectly cooked and the mashed potatoes were so yummy. my mouth is watering just thinking about all the terrific food we had. the view is the best in town you see the bridge and Alcatraz. oh and our service was so great! he was hilarious and sang a beautiful happy bday solo to the bf. couldn't of wished a better experience.

PXsth8wwIh8YS9pRloLbZg.review_text: I just went here last night. The service was great. The food was delicious. The view was even better. I ordered lobster with mash potatoes and veggies. So good $39. My boyfriend ordered a crab sandwich -and fries 19$. He said it was okay. The waiter made sure we were attended to and had all our needs through out the dinner. I would recommend this place to anyone asking. Perfect for dates.

glF-xIF7W6TefGlJa0_66w.review_text: Wow, wow and wow! Top notch! Really like this place. The food and bonus views are excellent! The food quality is really there! The clam chowder is excellent; tasty served perfectly temperatured, the fish and chips delicious with just the right amount of crisp to the batter and French fries. Pan seared chicken breast with mashed potatoes is tasty and delightful. On top of the tasty food you will enjoy the views of water. Love it! You won't be disappointed with food and views!

9M99P-ZWcH5TJU7t8rIhLQ.review_text: Mixed Grill. Sword fish, salmon and shrimp. Nice combination. Tasty. Very nice harbour view.

42qDK-3uq2ZPD53iaDmktQ.review_text: Overall very pleased with my experience.  Went on a Tuesday at 5:30 PM, no wait with good seats and a nice view of the bay. Staff was very pleasant and accomodating.  Started with clam chowder which was decent but had a little sand in some spoonfuls.  Then had the mixed grill with shrimp, salmon and swordfish all prepared beautifully, especially the shrimp.  For a "tourist trap" I was very happy with the service, food quality and portions and the price.  Check it out!

EaQj-sWaliph2Uu5KBJf1Q.review_text: Checked in on yelp and got the free bleu cheese garlic bread.  Normally not a fan of blue cheese but it was definitely tasty.  Quick highlights of what we ordered:  Crab cakes Mixed (seafood) grill Clam Chowder and the fried seafood platter?  All in all, everything tasted excellent and was very fresh BUT the glaring issue with this place is the SERVICE! Understanding it was a saturday evening in tourist central (Pier 39), I kept my patience but when the table behind us that got seated after we did got their entrees first, we had to complain to the waiter.  I know it's not his fault but in the words of the ESPN NFL countdown crew, COM'N MAN!!! At the beginning of the meal, our waiter, Khaiman, recommended we write a review after I showed him my Yelp check-in that earned the free garlic bread so things looked promising too.  The big save was that this place validated up to 2 hrs parking if you parked in the garage next to pier 39.    If you're looking for a full service restaurant in touristy Fisherman's wharf, then you could definitely do worse than FHFH but I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to eat here.  I don't know the SF area that well but I'm sure there's plenty of great seafood restaurants in town.  In fact, I'll do a quick search on Yelp to prove it!

KxsmqQlZNeJyisYMH5xHNQ.review_text: When I was at Pier 39 and searching for a place to eat, I looked at all the menus and settled for this restaurant. The menu devoted to dungeness crab won me over. Also, the entrance and waiting area looked really inviting. There's a fireplace and comfy couches!  I ordered a clam chowder cup to start, a dungeness crab roll for my entree, and a blondie for dessert. The clam chowder is "award winning," and while I thought it was tasty, it seemed kind of ordinary. The crab roll was delicious! It was stuffed with crab, and it was so light and fresh. The blondie was really yummy, too! For those of you who have been to BJ's, it tasted just like a pizookie! But their ice cream has a caramel sauce over it!   The service was also really good. My waitress was really attentive and kind.   The views in this place are amazing, as well.

ztd0ck9f5dCQK322QuiZHg.review_text: Fog Harbor is putting older restaurants in the Wharf to shame. The food and service reflects the ambition the restaurant has to be the best seafood option in the Wharf. I would never send my guests anywhere else unless competing restaurants seriously upped their game; Sorry Scoma's and Alioto's, it's not 1990 anymore.  Cheers to the manager Ryan, in particular, for his gentlemanly attitude, ready smile, and great service. Good bloke.

V3abRVcuHEtomwmv7PKtWw.review_text: We stopped by last Tuesday on a recent tourist trip to Pier 39.  I was skeptical of any place here, due to the nature of the scenery, but I was impressed.  We were greeted warmly, immediately seated and what a view of Alcatraz!    I had the simple chowder in a bread bowl and it was great.  Others at the table had the fish and chips - it was fabulous.  Prices were very reasonable and the service was great, plus a beautiful view and great food = 4 stars.  I wouldn't hesitate in going back.

L1ETgnYlR_NINkzsRtxX3Q.review_text: Touristy, but solid.  Big restaurant in Fisherman's Wharf with a nice view of Alcatraz.  The seafood is fresh and well-prepared.  The service is attentive and professional. The swordfish entree that I had was excellent. It came with rice pilaf and steamed vegetables; both of which were delicious without being overly greasy.  The sourdough bread that they serve before the meal is also good.

OtbooagsCGPM00ZbDOyPgw.review_text: Some of the freshest and best crab cakes in the Pier 39 and Fishermans Wharf area. I bring everyone who visits the city here all the time!

Rd3Nx57z96jbXNau154twg.review_text: This place was pricier than expected. It is a great place for dinner/date but you don't get good bang for buck with seafood.

punt5xNJonD3Z0itZZjdHg.review_text: Decent place, food was good but service was lacking, not sure why as other tables appeared to have good service, for whatever reason the waitress didn't seemed to be concerned with our table. The crab cakes were amazing and the fried shrimp were very well cooked. For using open table they gave us a free amuse bouche which was pretty good too. The location was great with pretty good views in a well decorated restaurant. If not for the sub par service this might be on my list next time I'm back in town.

_Wqqw3rApGoF7A7z_GAnrQ.review_text: The food, service and overall atmosphere were INCREDIBLE.  Chef Adolfo is a master at his craft, knows about every single item on the menu and can read his customers' perfectly well.    What a great experience! I will come back here when I'm back in SF and will never forget the wonderful service we received at the Fog Harbour :)

Nh-l0WSVIkYL-Y3Mk14a7g.review_text: We stumbled into the Fog Harbor at Pier 39 after a wonderful day walking around San Francisco. One of our party has severe food allergies and our server, the manager and chef were so accommodating, not only making her something without her danger foods but creating her an absolutely amazing seafood entree salad. My favorite was the Salmon stuffed with Lobster. What really made the evening so very memorable was our waiter Faycal. He was funny and charming all the while maintaining his professionalism and very high quality of service. We truly felt comfortable and relaxed as we enjoyed the Sensational Food and spectacular view of the swimming sea lions.

HfsP4edajwdVVnBPZRGt6Q.review_text: The view is to die for and the atmosphere very nice. Staff is friendly.   I think the food was over priced and could have been better.  We enjoyed some yummy drinks but left a little disappointed with the bland flavors.    Nothing's to write home about unless you want to sit with a great view and a delicious drink.

jqWHYNghfGm4JL06FuaHng.review_text: I came for lunch because I was sightseeing on the Wharf. I was seated right away but I felt a little awkward. I was by myself and they stuck me in a booth instead of giving me a twoseater.   I ordered their organic agave margarita which was wow! Very tangy and boozy! I couldn't drink too much before my food arrived else I would have been stumbling out of there. They also did not give me any water until I asked for some. They brought out the fresh sourdough bread which was nice but they gave me a full basket, it was a bit of a waste. One person would never eat six pieces of bread.  I ordered the crab roll with sweet potato fries. It came out lightning fast and it was pretty good. The sweet potato fries were nothing special but the crab roll was pretty darn delicious.

xiOT2NSYHRZJrZwW-dXPtQ.review_text: Every now and then you have a dinner so memorable that just thinking about it makes you want to turn back time and enjoy it again.   This was that dinner. The service - outstanding! Thank you to Khaiman who waited on us. We never wanted for anything, and all of your recommendations were wonderfully spot on!    This was our second visit, we look forward to returning soon, and bringing along a few friends to share the joy.

Ff2ltip33PhPSj8iQuOswQ.review_text: Wow oh wow...great & I do mean Great service...we stopped in for lunch 4  adults & one over active toddler.  We were seated by the window....our waiter was top notch. My daughter ordered the steamed clams  &  they were cooked to perfection, my son-in-law had the curried steamed mussles - even more amazing than the clams- he let me taste one.  I had the clam chowder...and it was perfect!  I have had many a bowl of chowder in SF and I am a tough critic.  Hubby had a cup of clam chowder & a crab cocktail- he gave those the thumbs up too.  The bread basket was filled with hot, sour dough & I swear no matter how much we consumed the waiter managed to keep fresh, hot breat on our table.  The little one had the grilled cheese & fries...as with most little ones he ate the fries & some of the grilled cheese...it was a beautiful sandwich...toasted a little too much for a toddler...but perfect for a child, a little older.  In fact the grilled cheese looked so go, I would have been happy to have had it for lunch with my soup.  Best of all since it was my daughter's birthday they brought us the most AMAZING butterscotch soaked bread pudding with a side of ice cream....the dessert was so yummy...I am not a big bread pudding fan...but next time we are here I am ordering one JUST for me!

BfB2NjM9V2f2AsxV03bYrw.review_text: It was my birthday so when I made the reservation I asked for a window table and when we arrived at 6:30 we got the window table. Very good service, lovely view and the dungeness crab cocktail and ahi lomi lomi appetizers we had were excellent. The halibut on the special that night, however, wasn't. It was perfectly cooked, moist but rather tasteless. Halibut is a fish that can soak up sauces and be flavored as the chef determines. This was just cooked with a few tomatoes on top and some quinoa underneath neither of which added any taste. When we told the waitress that we had had better halibut she was quite nice about it and a minute or two later the matre de was at our table asking what we didn't like about the halibut. We told him, he thanked us for our feedback, adding that usually the halibut is the most praised item on the menu, and comped us a dessert of our choice. The service, the setting, the experience were all fine and would have been perfect if not for the main dish. We would go back and try a different item except there are so many other seafood restaurants we want to try first.

MZyMY-nW2ChwIs7ZhELOTQ.review_text: Stopped in for a late lunch on Saturday afternoon around 2pm with my gf. We were both pretty hungry so just opted to sit at the bar, where the service was prompt, attentive and overall very good.   We decided to split the baked oysters, a house salad w/chicken and the sliders. Overall was very pleased, especially with the oysters and the sliders. The hot and fresh sourdough bread was also nice and came out early on.   Only mild complaint was the food took a bit longer than expected considering what we ordered but to be fair the place was packed the entire time we were there.   If you can get, or are willing to wait for, a seat closer to the window you've got quite the view of the sea lions, definitely a nice touch. As much a tourist trap as I expected this to be it really wasn't and I was pleased w/my visit.

PyTg7Np9pZZsaNdRqdiYIw.review_text: Despite of a good friend's suggestion to go to Franciscan Restaurant, I went here instead and never looked back.  Came here on a Sunday during lunch hours and it was packed. We (a party of 5) had to wait for about 30 minutes but it was definitely worthwhile. I definitely loved the view that we had from our window-side table. Anyhow, I ordered their crab cake platter and it was really gratifying. To me that's usually a sign that they only use quality ingredients :)  Expect the service to be a little bit slow, though. It is just a really busy place, but nevertheless, it is an enjoyable venue to have good food and good conversation.

aWNlKh6COj4BcwaDn0c5Sg.review_text: This was the best seafood experience we had in San Francisco. The sourdough clam chowder bowl was most delicious and I would recommend that to anyone who loves clam chowder. My husband had ahi tuna for his main app and he couldn't get enough of it. He said the next time he is working in San Francisco he will order this and have it delivered to his hotel!! I had the lobster Mac and cheese for the main app and it was pretty dang good. Surprised at how much lobster was actually in the Mac and cheese. The server was very attentive even though this place was packed and they were so busy. I was happy with the food and the service.

N8wsEh3_NTUwm4kNp1pLHA.review_text: I have been coming here for over 9 years, since I was a freshman in college and just wanted some good clam chowder. Well this place had it, and even when they changed owners their clam chowder didn't.  This time I came and Brenda, our server, was awesome. She brought us plenty of crackers and plenty of bread. Super thoughtful, even though we weren't buying their expensive dishes. #soupischeap  Helpful hint: don't get their breadbowl. Get the clam chowder and eat their free sour dough bread.  #beatthesystem

1qdrLTiKcadTAg9NImDBJg.review_text: I REALLY didn't want to do this. I even gave you guys numerous chances to prove that it was an off day (they were off dayS)...  The service at the place has gone down the sh*t hole. Seriously? I brought an old friend here today after boasting about how great it was.   1. The hostesses paid more attention to the sign they were putting up than us. We weren't acknowledge for a while.  2. Our waiter ... oh wait? Did we have one? I never saw him.  3. We never got our bread and butter. 4. Took forever for the bill.  5. We were trying to pay and get the hell out and were ignored. I mean..the guy walked right by us and our waving.   Times recently before this:  *The hostess that was supposed to seat us sat a large group that came after us first.  * The hostess told us to wait and that they'd seat us. They FORGOT about us.  *Waiters were never around and when they were, did not seem to want to be there.   I'm sure there was a lot more that bugged me/ pissed me the f**k off.  The only reason I'd come back is for the chocolate lava cake, but then again I've discovered places with the same thing...probably even better.   As to not say that ALL their waiters and..well, everyone working there are horrible, Pedro is the only good waiter. He's friendly, attentive, and tries to make sure everything is good.   Maybe it's gotten busier since we've discovered it. Maybe management changed. Whatever the reason, I will probably no longer be coming back or at least not as often as I used to (not even a third as often).  Fog Harbor is now the ex-boyfriend that has treated you like a princess and then turned into a complete douche. You want to go back to him hoping he'd go back to the way he was, but you know it's a lost cause.

2BX8_CKmuhoNYFNFKgtZjg.review_text: I had the lobster and filet, the surf and turf...it was delicious.  Our waiter was great and the views are spectacular.  Next time we are in Frisco we will be back.

O2JZFeWLb67cMARsBQxa1A.review_text: My husband and I went to dinner here while staying at Fisherman's Wharf for a seminar. The front of the house staff had lost my reservation on Open Table, and suggested that is was my fault, and mustn't I have made it for an earlier time and missed my time? Therefore, we had to take a non-window table. This was not awful, as it was not a special occasion, but what if it had been? Why no accountability on their part?  I had the crabcake meal, knowing it is crab season, and they were not high on crab at all!  Service was good, fast, and my husband enjoyed his steak. The location is beautiful, and prices are in line with other wharf establishments.  I just wish that the food and attitude matched the setting. After dinner, I checked my email and indeed I was correct about my reservation time.

IxrkMwtW1emHp7cifyq40A.review_text: I LOVE seafood!!!  Came here with no reservations around 1:00pm and waited just about 10 mins.  Not bad since the place was really crowded!  Got seated and our waiter brought out some fresh sourdough bread with butter! YUM!  Let's cut to the chase.  They are famous for their clam chowder and that was a must have!  We ordered:  Soup and Salad Combo (($14.00) Caesar salad with chicken & clam chowder in a bread bowl.  Probably the best clam chowder I've ever had!  There were lots of clams in it and the soup was not watered down.  I love eating soup that you can actually chew!  Very creamy, buttery, and full of goodness!  Fish & Chips ($16.00)- Hand dipped in "Anchor Steam" beer batter with cole slaw.  The best fish and chips I've had as well! Super crunchy and full of flavors!  Definitely fills you up!  If you get this, maybe order another dish so you won't get sick of it!  Sharing is caring ;)  Mixed Grill ($23.00): Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables, and garlic mashed potatoes.  This was just an okay dish.  I tried to be healthy and order something that was in that range but this dish was just kinda blah.  The swordfish and salmon were kind of dried but the shrimp and mashed potatoes were phenomenal! Buttery!  This is a very busy restaurant so make sure that when you get your bill, check it!  Our waiter actually gave us the wrong bill so good thing I checked it!  After the bill comes out, you get some kind of gingerbread cookie!  Very delish!  Overall, this place was good!  Great view as well!  NOTE: -Make reservations -Free Cookies after your meal -Complimentary bread and butter

SfdhgaDL5ck7BI9hrH9tiA.review_text: So delicious! Everything was perfectly cooked and tender- nothing dry or rubbery. The shellfish platter is a must! We got it with Cajun spice added in, which I highly recommend.  The blond bartender was amazing,  and made sure we were taking care of all night. Any rum drinkers need to try the escape from Alcatraz.  To finish off, we had the apple crisp, which was perfect. Warm and cinnamony :)  At the end of the meal, the manager came by the table to check in on us.  All around it was great service and even better food.

_V1v1Ez_b1L6oBglnEyKEQ.review_text: Ate a late lunch here on Sunday 2/17/13 after a great tour of Alcatraz.  I loved the hot from the oven sour dough bread.    The food came out quick- I ordered the beet salad w/ grilled chicken and blue cheese dressing.  Fog Harbor has the best blue cheese I've tasted in a long time- I was bummed to hear that they don't make it but nonetheless, it was good.  The salad itself was light on beets which was a bummer and my only complaint is that it could have been a larger portion esp. when I ordered it as an entree.  My boyfriend ordered the fried combo and said it was good.  His portion was huge!  Our server Martin was attentive and although he was busy, he didn't leave us wondering where he was as he checked in often.  The restaurant is nice- unfortunately, we weren't seated w/ a view of the water but at that point it was fine- all we wanted was food.      I would recommend Fog Harbor

vfINAq_bjbZrJheUp0Dc8w.review_text: Our server Madison was adorable! She shared the history behind the restaurant which is fascinating, gave great meal suggestions, and was fast and accurate with our order. On her recommendation, we will be back for the fresh crab and AMAZING desserts!! Loved it!

4c2RYnS2mdDSMwyY9xWBaQ.review_text: It's nice to be a tourist in your own city every now and then - and when your city happens to be in the top 3 most photographed places in the world (see a study done at Cornell) and just a world class place overall, it's even better.  To be honest I have never eaten at Pier 39 nor have I even set foot here since moving to SF but we went to the Aquarium and figured we could get dinner and get parking validated.  The restaurant itself had an excellent ambiance and the food was fresh. The clam chowder in a bread bowl really was good (not hyped). Other dishes were ordered were the shrimp skewers and trout, both very fresh and tasty. The Dungeness crab fritters with risotto was definitely one to get.  Not sure when I'll be back but it was a nice dinner with excellent service, and a beautiful view.

sawcDBNg2hckUZX4YZtH2A.review_text: I had an outstanding experience at this restaurant. Weekday lunch time, not so many people, wonderful water view, boats.. Pretty good chowder and OUTstanding service by Brandon! He definitely added extra star to this review.

P_eWth28VhlYmCRVi8qaEw.review_text: I want to love this place, I really do, but the service totally blew it for me.  We made a reservation a day in advance and for a later time in the evening. Like everywhere else I ate in my San Fran trip, we read reviews and wanted to go to the best places. The interesting thing was that we had a reservation but other people got seated before us. We were right on time and the other people were walk ins. We also went to grab a drink at the bar while we waited and a tiny drink had a hefty price tag of $15. Not to mention it took the entire 15 minutes while we waited to get the drink.  We finally got to our table and sat there for 10 minutes before we got menus, water, or any kind of service or attention. Finally a gentlemen came up and greeted us and asked us what we wanted. By that time we were ready to just order anything and get out of there. We got the blue cheese bread that was available for free if you checked in on yelp. I ordered the crab cakes and my boyfriend ordered the Surf and Turf.   A couple minutes later we were greeted by our actual server, and you could tell he was a bit flustered. He apologized and definitely made up for the horrible experience that we had had up until that point. He was really relaxed and gave us great recommendations on local spots to check out and go out and have late night drinks at.   I wish this place was the 4-5 star rating experience that I see most people have, but maybe we just got "lucky" and it was an off night for the crew.

peYFIzYUcWaULuPG0nojJA.review_text: The food was mediocre. There are so many other places in the City that offer much better food for the same price if not, cheaper!  Okay, it's a tourist place but that is a sorry excuse for bad food. Okay, so the portions are large but that just means I have more crap too get through. Okay, there's a nice view of the water and the restaurant looks reasonably good but that is not what I paid for! I could sit outside and enjoy the same view for free.   I went one night and I ordered the Ciopino and was soooo looking forward to it. I was soooo disappointed. The sauce was not bad but just not very good. The ahi two ways (poke and seared) was okay. The fish (salmon and mahi mahi) was dry, the shrimp was flavorless. The tiramisu was good but I could have done without the obscene amount of whipped cream on top. The meal for two was about $100, including tip. Don't waste your money, go someplace else.

ybXYA7WyOkEHikcp5A-aUw.review_text: The fish and vegetables are cooked perfectly!  I had the mixed grill & I recommend that if you can't make up your mind what kind of fish to have.  Very friendly & professional staff.  The sourdough bread is fresh and warm.

LPS3YJZik6UURsnTTYkhXw.review_text: View was great. Clam chowder was good, oyster (raw) was fresh, crab linguini and cioppino was good. The problem were that I got a shrimp shell in my chowder and I got food poison afterward :(

Ld0HLICQ0GisBQ-P7YO0lw.review_text: For Pier 39, this is about as good as it gets. Most of the food at Pier 39 is greasy tourist crap, but this place is actually pretty good. Overall the seafood is fresh and tasty. I wouldn't go so far to say that this is the best seafood I've ever had but it's been my go to place for seafood in SF. You want to make sure to book a reservation a day or two in advance unless you're ok with having dinner at 4:00. The reason I took off a star is that although the staff is friendly they're pretty inexperienced. They're going to forget to bring you water. And bread. And that extra lemon you asked for 15 minutes ago. It's a fact. No matter which server you get. But if you're patient and persistent enough you will eventually get those things and your order. Last time we were there I told them on the reservation that it was our anniversary so they decorated the table with flowers, a candle, and they wrote happy anniversary on the paper table cloth. It was really sweet and I enjoyed that extra care.

PDMj8v2fABGrXck66ZKNFQ.review_text: Nice atmosphere. The waiter kept our drinks full and the.food.was great.

K_YEosF3GuyhlSYb6-OklQ.review_text: CLAM CHOWDER SOOOO GOOD Pros - very generous with the seafood, not too many potatoes Cons - sourdough bread too hard to eat - salad is literally 4 pieces of giant lettuce, looks like it took 3 minutes to make

nOrL1SepRBg3fd7rrwj9nw.review_text: I've been here a couple of times. You really can't beat the view! The food is pricy, but the service we got from Faycal was awesome! Better than awesome! The food is quite good too! I love taking people here from out-of-town, they seem to dig it.

Ri_MoRabNS4dR4V0g7xcYA.review_text: I had the mixed grill, it was salmon, swordfish, and shrimp. It was probably my favorite meal of the entire trip to San Francisco. Waitress was very nice. Prices were a little bit on the expensive side.

gby4gdTt11vz5jQz5OaDoA.review_text: I have GOT to stop bringing visitors to Fisherman's Wharf during lunch hours. For the money we spent here, in a not so touristy area we would have been treated like royalty.  Don't get me wrong, the food was indeed good. The calamari was fresh and not chewy. The halibut was wonderful. The shrimp were large and well battered. I had garlic mashed potatoes, but I think they left out much of the garlic. I actually had to add salt to mine! That was not good.  The dessert trays looked fantastic. But we were too full to indulge. The calamari app was very large, great for 3 people!  The servers were nice and dressed well. I like women in ties! The views are nice as well.

r9oueOmGTqRlg-ah6XnFsA.review_text: This place was great!  Great views of the craziness on the streets, the bay, and it was clear enough for us to see Alcatraz from the bar.  My friends and I were hanging out at the bar, and our bartender Brittany made it even better.  She took care of us, attentive, made great drinks, and was just really cool to talk to - kind of like we were hanging out with her too.

9S5Nbq-TJg8V_GSz1dpqzA.review_text: Very nice service people. I had to step out to grab my daughter something else to eat. And they brought me an entirely new plate!!  Talk about kind.  :-)

cZB0SRmu34stmSKNQdp2nw.review_text: We flew into SF from NJ for an overnight, on our way to Hawaii. We chose Fog Harbor House because of excellent reviews, their sustainable fish program, amazing views and their Ciopinno sounded amazing! The Ciopinno, Ahi & Calamari lived up to all the reviews! The Red Chili Paste Garlic Shrimp was the best shrimp appetizer I ever had! Other members in our party highly recommend the Clam Chowder as well. Desserts were equally as good!  Our waiter was excellent: attentive, courteous, funny and enjoyable. Fog Harbor House is clearly "The Gem of the Wharf"!

V6PeLHJ8D1C7utl4HzjBmg.review_text: After our Alcatraz tour ended, we went exploring around Fisherman's Wharf for a late dinner spot and we stumbled upon Fog Harbor.   The atmosphere = Awesome! We got a table for 2 right at the window. The view of the bay with Alcatraz in the distance was unforgettable. The whole atmosphere was perfect.  BUT...and this is what really made me love this place....the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread!!! SOOOOO GOOOOOD! I could have eaten this for my meal by itself! I got the seared ahi tuna, it didn't disappoint either! It turned out to be a very good choice!    Great spot for dinner if you are out on Pier 39.  PS: No pressure, but you HAVE to get the Blue cheese garlic bread....just sayin'

QD1GBVubTtYoYFpq4SjylQ.review_text: The food was good, the service was great, and the view was fantastic!

gOsrJWlbtVlb19ZmitNxeQ.review_text: Despite all the other positive reviews and 4 stars, our dinner did not live up to the hype. Service was slow and kids entrees came out with our appetizers (my kids are pretty normal and they are not going to sit by patiently while we eat). The crab ceviche was missing the promised lime juice and didn't have enough seasoning. The clam chowder, which is touted as the best in SF, was decidedly not. Gloppy, gritty, and devoid of any authentic flavor does not define greatness. The crab cakes were atrocious -- almost all filler and no nice crust from a proper own fry -- the purveyors should be embarrassed to offer those.
