The lobster in the lobster mac n cheese was overcooked. Hint: if you fully cook a lobster and then put it in hot mac n cheese and then put it under the broiler, it will turn horribly chewy.  The only positives were the view, nicely appointed dining room, reasonably priced kids meals, and the sourdough. That's not worth about $50 per person.

vznE4Gy9ckA0nXNfPvdETQ.review_text: My wife and I dined here on the first evening of her fist visit to San Francisco. I couldn't have made a better choice! The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and ubiquitous without being obtrusive.  For appetizers, I had the Dungeness Crab Cocktail, which was fresh, plentiful and delicious.  My wife had the Baked Oysters which garnered rave reviews.  For my entree, I had the Seafood Cioppino which was rich, spicy and full of delicious seafood. My wife opted for the Seared Jumbo Scallops, which evoked the comment "This is the best meal I've ever had, any where!"  If I return to San Francisco, the Fog Harbor Fish House will be #1 on my list of places to dine!

N0SJIKDLyo4005hgXeOT6g.review_text: I really don't like comparing restaurants BUT since I had the opportunity to eat at Fog Harbor and Crab house, which both are seafood restaurants and at pier 39, why not?  Fog Harbor takes the cake between the two in my opinion.    First off, the complimentary bread was fresh out of the oven and heated!  I swear the bread was like crack!  I just couldn't stop eating it.  Despite being on a mission to lose weight and 'low carb' it, I couldn't help myself.  The bread served deserved 5 stars on its own!  The salad was refreshing and tasty!  They use mixed greens, unlike the other competitor with their iceberg.    The clam chowder was outstanding!  It had a real good amount of clams in it.  It was very hearty and filled me up.  Mama dukes had it in a bread bowl and I ordered the regular bowl, which was fine because they serve more than enough complimentary sourdough bread.  The crab & shrimp sandwich was a little too bland for my taste though.  I think it needed a little more flavor to it.  Perhaps salt?    Our server was a sweetheart.  Kept checking up on us and he looked like Liam Hemsworth.  A total plus!  The end to our meal is even sweeter with our Biscoff cookie.  Can't get any better than that!  If I had to choose between which seafood restaurant I'd like to eat at, it would be Fog Harbor!

4ftuoeacaUQ1EyiW_xt1QA.review_text: food - mediocre view & decor - amazing. clam chowder - relatively good  would go back to take out of town guests, but probably wouldn't go there on my own.  Food: 2 stars Service: 4 Ambiance: 5 stars Overall:  3 star

66RFFjfiOgachspRdKPr1w.review_text: I was here when I came to san francisco for vacation with my bf. We love seafood. We made reservations the night before but the reservation was not booked when we got here. But since we were here when they opened at 11 there was lots of tables available. No problem. This place has a gorgeous view and the ambience is very nice. The service was okay, our server must have been having a bad day because our order came out late. We ordered the crab roll with sweet potatoes fries, dozen oysters, and the famous clam chowder. On the crab roll the bread was crispy and soft. The oysters was amazingly delicious. And the clam chowder is one of the best. The meat was not chewy in the clam chowder. It's truly perfect. Everything was fresh and delicious. I recommend here if you like seafood!

_4x70B1gvBmqqa9TzUamYA.review_text: Okay, yes, my opinion of this delightful establishment is *slightly* biased because it was a corporate dinner so I REALLY enjoyed it.  But overall, the food is fantastic, the service was SO awesome (the waiter swept away the table crumbs between courses) and to entice you to get dessert, servers bring a tray of ready-prepared desserts to your table for you to peruse (and then bring you a new one so it doesn't have everyone else's breath and germs from being carted around).  I will totally look forward to returning to this restaurant!

k2Fxqf1KoVARaVOXxlKQGQ.review_text: What is the deal people?   Of course this is a tourist spot. San Francisco is a vacation destination. So what, The restaurants in these locations can't be good?   They should be amazing considering all the people walking in off the pier from all over the world, however FOG HARBOR- doesn't cut it when it comes to food. Great location, beautiful views, great staff but OK food.    The bread is warm and delicious. The bay shrimp cocktail is very fresh and tasty.  Crab Cake platter- ugh. Cakes were mushy and lacking flavor, slaw was warm, maybe from being under the lamp too long? Fries nothing special. Left half of my entree on my plate, including a whole crab cake!!!! Not good.  My husband ordered shrimp scampi and our waiter made it happen even though its not on the menu.(excellent service).  It Needed more garlic but it was ok.   BEST PART of THE MEAL?  The mashed potatoes. Amazing!!!  The best I ever had.  The rest was just ok. Nothing great.   Our waiter, Mike was fantastic. We really liked him.

dmyZ4TDN18z1-mRRdzY_8A.review_text: Excellent experience! Our server recommended the special, which was a fresh wild salmon atop an arugula salad with cranberries and couscous. It was incredible.  The views of the bay were also fantastic, especially watching the sunset.  I highly recommend this place.

wHip-tIYauP94YcJOfSiwA.review_text: Your in SF and you want seafood and a water view right?!! You'll get all of these here..but  I'd say all in all, we were a bit underwhelmed for the price point.. Did we clean our plates? Of course!  Shared, jumbo shrimp cocktail and Ahi and Crab Cakes.. I think I expected the Ahi to blow me away and whileit was  good- it didn't blow me away.. crab cakes had lots of nice crab and the shrimp were just fine though.  Our waiter was nice enough. However, he did reach across our table from the opposite side and pick up empty glasses by the rims. I notice these things because I used to be in service and these are just simple things that clearly the mgmt doesn't watch for.  Otherwise,  their staff wouldn't be dong these things.. we had a very nice evening and enjoyed the views and the food but we'd probably try some other places next time.

Zpjrfi_qFJmTUs07kVph4Q.review_text: I had dinner here with 15 people. Only 2 could eat all their food. I still think of this restaurant for a rotten, old lobster my friend ordered that redefined how poor lobster could conceivably be as it was colorless, dried up and well...old and rotten. I tried but no...this is still the template for failure as a restutaunt for me and all of us.

B_LJAvIKcSbV3RzeyxWyVQ.review_text: Staff members were friendly and attentive, great views (they were even kind enough to make a space for us by the window), and yummy food! Would highly recommend during your trip to San Fran!

U2xsIRAZzMGuFYQgqihCSA.review_text: Service: It's appropriate. The staff is courteous and polite. But I don't find anyone going out of their way to make the experience a memorable one.  Food: Just what the menu explains, simple, and scrumptious. The seafood here is one of the BEST in SF. I have to add though, not having a desert menu, but rather displaying their selection is very naughty. I don't think I've ever walked out without ordering a desert here for that very reason.  View: If you happen to get a window seat, you'll catch yourself gazing out into the ocean... Very relaxing

X1P7OrthhSkAmlUrI5J3tQ.review_text: We walked in an hour before our actual reservation and sat right down which surprised me due to the crowd of people at Fisherman's Wharf.  The prices are expensive, but heck everything in San Fran is expensive.  Service was prompt and the food was good.  Nothing spectacular, but good.

UQJgg09mdsSzqO8kf1xoCA.review_text: The food was great, but the service was very disappointing. The salad arrived well before drinks and bread, water wasn't refilled, and the waiter was completely inattentive.

586YRBE4LOjVbibCfcrWSw.review_text: restaurant is beautiful, so is the view, and the service was great.  but the  cracked crab was really small. not worth the effort to get it out of the shell, or the money.

MqDgSw9wZFsaFFPRKh-k8A.review_text: We came here on a very cold night, no reservations and was seated right away with wonderful view,the decor was cool kinda low lights with low music playing,I had the  best Salmon BLT on the face of earth I really think (really) the only thing I had to do was take the becon off this was by far a top notch toasted sandwich on a french roll with pesto aioli and fries,my other half had the grilled shrimp brochette w/ sauteed spinach,mashed potatoes,and veggies she said everything was good except the veggies,they were very attentive to our needs,we had two shirt and tie males come to our table asking how was everything and were we o.k. with then 45 mins.while we were there,very good customer services,to tell you the truth I would have been happy just eating the complimentary bread its just that good.

yy4nxTyau9ntkDASY4mDWg.review_text: Food was good and service was ok. Nothing outstanding. Our waitress, although nice was not on top of drinks.

zhD0kT_BL9qrTY87Ki4H-g.review_text: I had some friends visiting and they wanted two things: a restaurant near the water and seafood. I ended up picking this place, I was a little worried it was going to be ultra touristy, since it's at Pier 39. I was pleasantly surprised the restaurant is really nice! And definitely not overly gimmicky or anything.             The food: I did the classic, clam chowder bread bowl, it was good! And I ordered a side of fries, which wasn't on the menu, but they were accommodating. One friend got a side of oysters and the clam chowder bread bowl, they enjoyed it. And one got the crab roll, also good. And another got the crab cakes, and had this mixed cider drink that was really good. All in all everyone enjoyed their meal!

ICPxGwIrC6sR-5ZJKYBkmQ.review_text: I ate here about two weeks ago so this review is well overdue. I explained to the waiter that I don't use yelp and my experience that night inspired me to join and write a review. I want to start off with the service.  My girlfriend and I had Khaiman which was one of the best servers I have had. Next was the food.  The food was great and it was a fair price for good quality.  We also had a view of the bay which my girlfriend loved...I give it 5 stars because I was inspired here to spread the word about this place.

ynNSKkfJ8PGw-FdukN8nBw.review_text: Excellent view,  food and service!  My son loved the steamed crab!

R9XKTIILNtaC3sv5HMaTTw.review_text: I had the Whole Dungessness Crab & My boyfriend had the Surf & Turf. Next time I'd like to get the Whole Lobster. The Crab was cooked perfectly in garlic! It came with mashed potatoes & steamed vegetables. It was perfect! I was pretty full afterwards. I had a drink called Alcatraz Escape, it was good, but a little too sweet, perhaps the margarita next time? Or maybe, just a beer..  We had the steamed clams for an appetizer. They were delicious and melted in your mouth. The leftover sauce was great for our bread!   Our server was very nice, & we didn't get bothered much! :)   We made a reservation online so we didn't have to wait, (it was 645 on a Wed, a small crowd)

3KK7L2Q6NMfJA1Ky4Ntmdg.review_text: My friend was determined to find the best tasting clam chowder in San Francisco, so while we were at Fisherman's Wharf, he found Fog Harbor Fish House on Yelp. Located at Pier 39, the restaurant is surprisingly fancy schmancy with a very weekend-at-the-Hamptons vibe; it was lunch time and every table had wine glasses. We were seated at a U-shaped booth with a nice view and the ambiance made us feel as though we could've been anywhere -- Newport Beach, Maine, 1990s SF.  I was in the mood for something sweet so my girlfriend and I asked for a dessert menu while my friend ordered the clam chowder bowl ($8) he wanted. Our server came back with a tray filled with all the various desserts they offer. Impressive and such a cool way to show what's on the menu! My friend's clam chowder was fresh, tasty, and filled with clams. The bread bowl it was served in was just as tasty as the chowder. My Blondie with vanilla ice cream was a large enough dessert for two, but I managed to finish it myself. It was that good.  Fog Harbor is a classy place I wouldn't mind visiting again for a nice lunch, snack, or dessert with family or friends.

Vq720Sf5tDq4ruG-YKwaVQ.review_text: What a nice resturant. Started off with a great bloody mary. Def one of my top 5 fav bloody marys. Then i ordered some oysters. And man they were great. So clean and a great vinegar sauce along with hot sauce put them in my top 5 fav oysters. Which i knew what kind they where (waiter did not say). Then i got the smoked salmon with a cup of clam chowder. Salmon was good but not memorable. But clam chowder was really good too. Wish i lived in SF just to be able to go here more often.

BXcHv4rl9WH3pHFN5M_oNg.review_text: Ordered the grilled tuna and it was delicious with just the right amount of sear to outside.  The sides were great with crisp vegetables and mashed potatoes were moist with right amount of creaminess.  My lady had the clam chowder which was rich and tasty. The seafood pasta was elegant and just had the right smooth sauce.  Definitely be coming back as this was our second time and won't be the last.

HSNtfiDUYQ6ZCNHxKQM_ZA.review_text: Fog Harbor was an amazing dinner! I had the swordfish and my girlfriend had the NY steak - both of which could be described as mouth watering because of the way each melted. We also had the 1/2 lb garlic crab for a starter and this was by far the best crab I have ever eaten!   Easily, The flavor and freshness of our entire meal was way beyond what I would have ever expected! Our waitress Jac was great too, making sure we loved our different 'vegie cocktails' and that our dinner was enjoyable.   Highly recommend!!

fCiuhL226aZKTZenZ5s6ew.review_text: Great food.  The king salmon was awesome and amazing jumbo shrimp cocktail.  They even gave us tape to fix a shoe.

6yhihIpGwOpGKfvkKPP5KQ.review_text: Amazing food and a beautiful atmosphere. Outstanding service; our waiter, Khaiman, was fun, helpful, fast, and just on it. He really made this place standout in my mind.   I won't lie - it's a bit expensive and probably more deserving of a $$$ rating, but it was definitely worth it. The food was absolutely delicious (get the clam chowder no matter what) and super filling, and the service is top notch.

mMtbc6HKpoeu1YoKmErlQw.review_text: Just Delightful!  I was in San Francisco for a conference and had an early dinner at the Fish House. We had an amazing view and the food was fresh and flavorful!  I strongly encourage anyone who is going to be in the area to try this restaurant, even the prices were reasonable. A 5* all around!

RlcUn2sqbsRLgMu1YMW1UA.review_text: My friends sister was visiting California for the first time so we headed down to fishermans wharf. We were starving so we basically went to the first restaurant we saw which was fog harbor. We were seated immediately and had a very friendly waitress. The view was fantastic and the fresh warm bread they brought out was perfect. But that's about where it all ends. Some of my friends had the crab cakes which they said were not as good as they thought they would be. I remember the words overly salty and very little crab. I had the Alaskan halibut which I found dry and flavorless. I was looking forward to the vanilla bean creme brûlée which wasn't bad but the harden sugary top was soft and didn't even cover the whole thing. We all left a little disappointed and needless to say will not be returning.

BwsjhAHne0tFMD3Q2A_HqQ.review_text: Review of a happy hour/snack time while on vacation:  Came in for a "snack" during our SF trip and not just any snack... clam chowder in a bread bowl.  It looked beautiful, but not even close to the best I've ever had.  The bread left a lot to be desired and the soup was just ok.  The service (sat at the bar) was good and so was the ambiance, but I would say if you're looking to show off the bay's famous clam chowder fare (like I was trying to do to my husband), head elsewhere.  We did enjoy a couple of other bar bites that were alright- I do recall a Shrimp app that we enjoyed, but it was definitely way spicier than what the average Joe could handle.  The real estate and drinks are what bumped up the rating to 3 stars, but in a city with tons of amazing eateries, this one is better left to the tourists who don't know any better (obviously none of which are Yelpers).

9lvNde59u8sLxBQx2lih2g.review_text: Had a wonderful experience here. Our waitress Meron was absolutely amazing. The food was delicious & I would definitely recommend this place to anyone visiting the area. The clam chowder is a must!

A0WOv3yex9LvvnEJPnyA6Q.review_text: Went for dinner with a fairly sizable group of friends, had no trouble with seating because we'd made a reservation ~6 hours in advance.  Everything was fine, though there was some miscommunication about what we'd ordered the staff was in general perfectly friendly.  I ordered bleu cheese garlic bread (this was really good, actually) and the ahi dish as my main. The ahi was underwhelming: quite bland, in part I'm sure because it was overcooked. To be fair, the presentation of the fish was pretty well done (heh). It was dressed with what I'm assuming was supposed to be a wasabi paste which, though already weak, was completely overpowered by the pickled ginger  scattered liberally over the fish.  If I were to come here again, I'd give their "higher end" dishes a pass, I think, and go straight for the fish 'n chips, which looked much more promising once I'd seen it.  If you're a one-plate kind of eater, this can be a $$ restaurant; if you tend to get a starter *and* a main, like I generally do, you'll quickly find yourself in the $$$ range, especially when you add a few drinks to the equation.

iWbiZ6PshZ0XqVJpF55ciw.review_text: Ordered salmon BLT, chicken sandwich, garlic cheese bread, clam chowder, chicken penne, and crimbolee for party of 4. The food was fresh and hot. The clam chowder was really good wished I ordered a bigger portion.   The salmon BLT was average the fish was too rare and bland. The penne was ok with good quality cheese. The crimbolee was bomb.   The place had great views of Alcatraz and SFO bay as it is located in Pier 39. Therefore the location and view comes for a price.   Since the dessert and chowder was awesome I would give this place 3 stars. Next time I may try the street vendors nearby as that may hurt the wallet less.

ECZPvbk-sp4V2Yj_tfQERw.review_text: Pretty good food, and great views. The Calamari is especially yummy!

A02of0tjhrqcIsgf2vv1Zw.review_text: The Clam chowder was delicious! My entree, crabsalad roll, left a lot to be desired. The portion size was good and the location is great. Next visit to the Pier, I'll try elsewhere.

bJv7NoagYMtBooXmwb2Hew.review_text: Fish & Chips - the batter was soggy.  The service was slow but it was very busy.  Had to wait 45 min for a table.

dEfQpRMik90owekQQhxLrw.review_text: Madison the waitress was awesome and this was the best salmon I've ever had. With all seriousness

bFavxEULEymYvqU-SLD0Xw.review_text: If you want to eat seafood on the wharf, this is a good choice. Very very good service and the food is pretty darn good!  Don't go to Swiss Louis down the pier. Fog Harbor may cost more, but it's worth it.

73a_0u_1zB7ThksxPI2-6Q.review_text: First timer in San Francisco and visited several restaurants in the Fisherman's Wharf area during our stay.  By far Fog Harbor was our favorite spot during our trip.

eP_l9GxcSyDfCKx68s4BgA.review_text: Had the Garlic crab for my birthday dinner... wasn't sure how good it was going to be...Loved the food and got a free birthday dessert too. Nice view and romanti.

DPBXrJey1x2SvpRIgmEhZA.review_text: This restaurant has the best view of Pier 39 and Alcatraz Island.  They also validate parking for 1 hr (at the parking structure across the street)  The restaurant had an excellent ambiance. The bowl of Clam chowder was good ($10) and the Mixed seafood grill was excellent (salmon, swordfish, shrimp with broccoli and 1/2 rice and 1/2 mashed potatoes - $26)  I'll be back next time :)

Uuz994E5Pa3R8jljncsgPA.review_text: Five star baby! No doubt.   If you know me I'm a big BIG seafood lover! My daughter and I were in search of clam chowder at the pier and we found this place on yelp so we decided to have brunch here :) so glad we came because everything we ordered was SOOOO PERFECT! Even the customer service was great! I'm sorry I do not remember her name :(   As you can see my pictures, we ordered mimosa, sour dough bread bowl clam chowder, fish n chips for my daughter and seafood cioppino for myself. Our dessert was chocolate soufflé. My daughter picked it. Good choice :)   Definitely coming back to have more clam chowder in bread bowl! Next time, we're gonna get our own. Yes, that's how yummy it is!

9GxaTFFfn4-scH4bgYAg_Q.review_text: Found this randomly walking around the wharf. Amazing! Great attentive staff! Can be dressy or casual, I went in a t-shirt. They lay the napkin in your lap for you! Great menu. Great tea selection. Ordered the mahi mahi with salsa, veggies and mash potatoes and the tuna steak. Both were excellent! Get the tuna! Great food for the price and view of the pier.

XmElOb8V73xkDQypksDloA.review_text: When you have out-of-towners visiting you there are a few touristy things you really must do.  One of those things is a visit to the wharf.  It was on such a Saturday that we discovered Fog Harbor Fish House.  Having grown up around here I have a fairly typical disdainful attitude about 'tourist trap' type places, I have to tell you, I was pleasantly surprised by my experience here.  The prices were not nearly as bad as I expected (about $30/person with drinks but without dessert) and the food was actually quite tasty.  It was here that I had my first experience with oysters, and raw ones at that! The cocktail sauce served with them had just the right amount of sinus clearing heat, the oysters themselves were very fresh and delicious.   Between the three of us we had the seared tuna salad, a pasta dish and a burger, we were well satisfied with our meal.  The wine list had several pleasant options and the view was, of course, spectacular.  It was one of those rare days when the sun was shining, the sky was clear and the water was sparkling, the perfect day to enjoy a table by the window, which we did. There was a bit of a miscue at the beginning of the meal, we hung out in the bar while waiting for our table and despite being there for about 15 minutes never did manage to get one of the bar tenders to take our drink order.  What made our experience though was our server, Jay, apparently it was his first weekend there (though not his first weekend as a waiter), he was quick, attentive without hovering, friendly and funny.  While I don't often spend time in this part of town you can bet that the next time I have visitors we'll make our way back here.

SGzfuL8WJMzm0m-ArlUV_w.review_text: Went here for dinner after a disappointing trip to the Aquarium.  This place did not disappoint.  Ordered the calamari appetizer and it was very good.  My husband had the crispy bay scallops for an appetizer and they were even better.  Both dishes were very ample servings and in retrospect would have been better to order just one and share.  I had the fresh catch of the day, king salmon while my husband had the mixed grill of salmon, swordfish and shrimp.  Both were very good.  The views of the bay were nice though if eating around sunset, bring sunglasses as the window coverings won't block the glare.  All in all a very enjoyable meal at not too outrageous of a price, considering it is located on Pier 39.

k6kmkJDuAjDFsGwui7lcgw.review_text: I really love taking visitors here and the food and service has always been excellent.  I believe the prices are reasonable for the quality and portions you receive (you are on the wharf!)  Visiting friends enjoy the view of the harbor and bridge and the excellent seafood and sourdough.  I also appreciate that they allow you to linger and enjoy your meal unlike other pier restaurants.  Our recent server, Faycal, treated us like royalty--or so it seemed.  We enjoyed the chowder, shrimp louis, stuffed salmon, and shellfish platter.

_FeMCFZ7ncPuOcMZDwxHxQ.review_text: the service was a 5 star - our server was top notch even with the craziness of veterans day weekend.  saw some poor reviews regarding service but the restaurant was packed for the entire time we were seated and our waiter was always there for us.    the food was generous, very fresh and flavorful.   the poke was some of the best i have ever tasted...even better than poke i've had in hawaii.  both the crab louie salad and shrimp salad looked and tasted fresh from the farmer.  the mussels in curry broth was delicate and bread dipping worthy.   one family member found the shrimp cocktail somewhat 'mushy'.    A+ on the view.  A++  on the fact that fog harbor fish house is a sustainable restaurant.  being a local, the only downside is that its located in pier 39.  having to work your way into the parking lots and thru  the crowds, really takes away attention from this restaurant and how good this place is.

UZ56rff2phhJ7L05Fzl3Dg.review_text: Very good service and great quality seafood. I had ordered the very famous shellfish platter and split it with my family. The food was excellent, it had a ocean of flavors. The service was excellent and the wait was kind and took a lot of time out of his job to talk with us, crack a couple of jokes, what everyone wants with a waiter. The sauces for all the dishes were exploding with flavor. My only grip with the restaurant is the kids meals were a lot less flavorful than all the other dishes, but they were still good.  Overall, this is a must go if you ever check out Pier 39. There are so many places you could check out in Pier 39 but this restaurant, when you order the right food, could be one of the best.

Hrus1rMRivbYULx6z03fsA.review_text: Excellent seafood and a great atmosphere all for a great price!

1ykk0w-LqSAcMWJXvnTpPg.review_text: Lived in Bay Area for years. This place exceeded our expectations great service,wonderfull fresh seafood .Ask for Alma she will recomend great food.

9yJLNCgH_s-7gU350rzlFQ.review_text: This place really surprised me!  My company picked Fog Harbor Fish House for our Christmas party.  But it's Pier 39 location made me wonder if it would be any good.  Boy, was I surprised.  Delicious food, carefully prepared and served.  And long open views of the Bay out the window.   I'll be back on my own to Fog Harbor Fish House soon.

_lQCtZ_aTwrPX_TiPxot4g.review_text: Tourist spot  at its finest.   I had friends from out of town who wanted to eat here for there seafood.  I  suggested going some where were real city people eat but they insisted  the hotel recommended it -- well they ended up being upset  they didn't listen to me.    The service was poor,  the  food over  priced,  some of our meals  didn't  come  on  time (thanks server for not charging  is for the food  we  never  got,  seriously  you thought  you were hooking is up!).   He didn't ask if we wanted coffee or dessert, he just gave us our bill.  Worst this is that he charged us 20% Tip (though we did not give him that much) because we had an international credit card.  What he didn't realize is that the girl who paid lives in the US and called to complain and the management were gracious and appologetic, which is nice to see

SgtdcFkrkMsEhfd9aDWNbA.review_text: Great Food!  Had the Clam Chowder and the Surf and Turf.  Excellent service and food!

OR593sPhK-32kift_bUrTg.review_text: I came here for my birthday recently, and I must say, not too shabby.  I generally stroll down Pier 39 just because I love the pier/ocean view, and I've always see this restaurant.  Truth be told, I thought it was one of those upscale, dress up like a douche type restaurants.  I was wrong.  I was coming from San Jose, and was planning on having dinner before I go back home.  I was craving for sea food.  You come to San Francisco, you gotta have some sea food if not steak.  Anyways, I was looking for seafood, and found some reviews that shows this place was pretty good.  I didn't know how reservations were, so I had made reservations via Yelp.  When I did it on Yelp, my reservation became at 9:30PM. Meh, lame.   So we came to Pier 39 walked around a bit, and said screw it.  Let's just ask them how long the wait is.  If it's longer than expected, we've already made reservations anyways.  So we walk up to the restaurant and their layout is quite cozy and warm for those who have to wait.  They have a nice little fireplace that will keep you warm because everyone knows Frisco can get quite cold.  So anyways, I ask the young woman at the podium about the wait time, and suggested I would like a window view.  I didn't expect it to be available considering it's around 6-7ish.  She took me by surprise and said, we are currently cleaning the table right now, and it's window view.  We sat down for like literally 2-3 minutes boom, here comes our waiter--let's go!  Omg, the view was amazing, I mean of course, I'm a sucker for scenery, but damn.  We sat towards the back, window view of the hills and the bridge, to the left was Alcatraz.  Perfect.   Our waiter was Shawn, absolutely amazing.  Very fast pace, generous, and helpful on the suggestions.  My brother thought differently, felt although he could have been more helpful.  So.. Maybe I was more excited on eating than service. Who knows!  OK, food:  Quite expensive if you ask me, but was it worth it? Yes and no.  Some of the items, you can go out to the fish market and get it for cheaper.  But how it was cooked, well.. Stay tuned.  1/2 Oysters:  Mini oysters was what it was really.  The sauce they had made was delicious, I don't remember what it was, but I have pictures. Haha! Foodie!  It was placed over some ice to keep it cool, which everyone should place raw fish over ice, if you don't... Ugh...  Crab Cakes:  Oh my, these were so good.  They were going for $16, only two pieces, which I felt kind of ripped off.  I cannot deny it, they were bomb!  Once in a while, yes worth the $16. Lol, I'm all for cheap eats.  Bread Bowl:  Personally, I feel although they were better than Boudins.  I had Boudins down the street where you had to get it via cafeteria style and I am not a fan. This bread bowl was much smaller though, but you could taste the clam chowder better.  Not too much breading either, just enough to distribute.  Fog Harbor Burger:  Made was Angus Chuck Patty was quite amazing.  Definitely cooked to perfection without asking.  Medium rare, but not too rare that it made you feel weirded out to eat it.  They got it down as far as burger goes.  Fog Harbor 1/2 Lobster/Crab Meat:  Ok... This was quite disappointing.  This was their current specialty on the menu, and I honestly felt like I should have just gotten a full damn lobster tail.  The crab meat was just baked crab.  Nothing special about it.  They charged me a little more than just the lobster tail.  I prefer the lobster tail so much more than to order this again.  Fish and Chips:  Fried to a golden texture, very delish.  On point  Not much I can really say, I didn't really eat it.  My boyfriend ordered it. :P Sorry guys  Overall my experience was great.  The best part was that I got to see the sunset, and oh yea, even if you're not facing the window, there are mirrors so you can reflect the image.  I sat right in front which had the perfect view.  I loved it.

reLK-ESxajUVe-h2x3QsQQ.review_text: $16 mango crab/lobster? (don't remember if it was crab or lobster) ceviche with chips appetizer   $10 Clam chowder in a fresh baked sourdough bread bowl   $26 Mixed Grill -Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp substituted with chimichuri sauce, sauteed vegetables, and substituted with potatoes.   $19 Crab Roll- Crab, celery, shallot aioli, substituted with French roll   Free sourdough bread with butter  Long wait (~1 hour.  ~40 minutes outside to be seated, ~20 minutes to be served) was well worth the food.    Waitress was nice to let me substitute my foods and also giving options.  First time having swordfish.  It was an interesting taste and texture. It tasted like some kind of cheese but my significant other said it tasted like chicken.     We got free sweet potato fries because the Crab Roll came with regular fries instead of sweet potato.  So we got a plate of our fries and we got to keep the sweet potato fries for free!

qXA36MfpB2XolHQt820eKA.review_text: We started our day hiking the Perimeter Road on Angel Island and ended it among the crowds on Fisherman's Wharf. I'd neglected to get reservations the day before, so we were stuck with a 9pm reservation I made at the last minute. With 3 hungry teenagers, a 7-year-old, and two hungry/tired parents, 9pm seemed forever away. I figured we'd try for earlier and see what we could do. Amazingly, they sat us right away--a party of 6--and we still had a great view!  Dinner was pricey, all in all, but quite frankly, it was worth it. Don't go to a restaurant in a tourist trap if you want inexpensive. The wine list was good, the food was large portions and tasty. We had the breadbowl chowder, calamari, bleu-cheese garlic bread, hamburgers, tuna, and I don't know what else. We had extra to take home. The deserts about killed us, but we couldn't resist. Our waitress was fabulous and I left extra for her. We had a great experience.

PGePak63u-a2y5qHzLcqzQ.review_text: great food, great service, great price, great views. the night before we ate at one of those stands and our steamed crab cost us $27. here it cost us a few bucks more and it came with mash potatoes, corn, and great atmosphere. the only downside is that they cleaned out the crab of all the gooey, disgusting stuff (which for 99.9% of customers is great, but isn't for my husband). he loves the junk in the crab.

0Nb_pTU9o-taKP8EBeWGwA.review_text: Great seafood restaurant! The calamari was excellent. Perfectly seasoned! Had the cod with veggies and rice....delicious! Didn't have a reservation but didn't have to wait long for a table. Beautiful view of the bay! Great end to a great day in San Fran!

p_Sm9dip5o8lWBDDrNBI3w.review_text: Out of all the restaurants on the pier this one might be the best. Great location overlooking the San Francisco harbor, and the menu makes you hungry after going over each item. The service was good, our waiter suggested a few places to see as well as other restaurants to try while staying in the city. Cioppino was excellent, hearty, rich broth and plenty of seafood to satisfy any appetite. Can't go wrong with this house.

-eLhFfFNPT5fOD3jQxknvQ.review_text: Surprised to find this hidden gem in tourist central. Lots of different fresh seafood selections instead of the usual fish and chips. Quick and attentive service! They have Robledo on the wine list!

TPBi02MkG1hJ2KulG7eKrA.review_text: Went for lunch the day after our anniversary and we were under dressed. This is really a beautiful  restaurant with a magnificent view. Ok now your asking why only 4 stars? Simply the food was great the service superb and the view as mentioned simply the best, It unfortunately is a simple victim of its own position., on the pier which makes it way to touristy for my taste. Very very nice but just too much geared for the tourist crowd. Not bad but not 5 stars.

An0B-f1WzBr8QFZKzzYs0Q.review_text: DELICIOUS!   This food here was absolutely amazing, and I wish I could eat here everyday. The employees were extremely friendly, and we had awesome waiter. We made a last minute reservation on yelp, showed up, and we were seated right on time and at a table with a view of the water!   We ordered calamari with a lemon aioli sauce- best calamari I've ever eaten and with a unique sauce. I ordered lobster tail and filet mignon. My filet mignon was a bit overdone for medium, but it was still extremely tasty and the lobster was cooked to perfection. My date ordered the live lobster and he said it was also extremely good.   I can't wait to go back here again next time I head up to the city!

8Z40XZC7Yrm3tSJtTqnAuQ.review_text: Everything about this place during my visit was fantastic! I went with a coworker while we were on a business trip and this was by far our best and most memorable meal of the week.   Here is the highlight reel: Red Snapper (special) was delicious, quite possibly the best fish dish I've had in recent memory. My coworker had the shellfish platter which he also found to be very good. We started off the meal with some of the biggest and best crab cakes I've ever had the pleasure of eating, and the service was fantastic as well. We were in and out of a very busy restaurant inside of an hour. I should also mention that the view was quite impressive and this looks like it would be a good place for a date.   The not so great: Not really the restaurant's fault, but the address really confused my GPS... both the sprint nav and google maps put me in an industrial area, which I later found out meant that I drove right by the Mythbuster's warehouse. The price is also a bit on the high side for the amount of food you get, but the quality of the food was spot on.

DxeNa6k3TEekeiF4wM-C9w.review_text: Great views of the harbor hence the name fog harbor fish house. I had the Crab sandwich which was loaded with crab meat and served in deliciously toasted bread. The oysters were also great along with the crab dip. If you like seafood this is a great place to stop in. We ate at the bar so we didn't have to wait for a table and had great service from the bartender.

6m3zubQEz3739awQb2F8CQ.review_text: The clam chowder was good. They did not take the time to de-vein the shrimp, yet they cut the backs as if the purpose was just to slice it and not remove the fecal matter. If you are in the area, go somewhere else.

_tqkd2SxrtGaOZXxxyi4Gg.review_text: We have a large party of 9 for Mother's day dinner.  1. Reservation, with open table was easy. However, I am very disappointed at their services. First off, I have requested 4 times (4x) to sit by the window and they said no problem four time.. ended up sitting by the bathroom!  2. if you don't ask, they won't give you. I have to ask for bread and water. LOL.. seriously needed to ask them to fill our water, but there were 6 cups only 2 were filled up.. and the empty one is right next to the full one!! WTF.. what kind of service was that.  3. no surprise with food, nothing really worth raving about.   I don't think i would consider there again, especially with large group. BTW, they do charge a standard 18% surcharge for large groups..

T6fk18hJADtrVTRoqBKd1Q.review_text: Being in such a touristy place, we had to wait about 45 minutes until they called us, but we went back in about 30 and were seated fairly quickly.   We went for dinner so it was packed but we had a view of the harbor during sunset and it was ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS. We could see Alcatraz Island too and the ambiance of the restaurant was really fancy (at least to my poor ass) for somewhere meant for tourists.   For our drinks we ordered the non-alcoholic Blackberry Press and Strawberry Basil Nojito and both drinks were super super sour and I will probably stick to just water next time.   The bread was really fresh, warm and fluffy and tasted great with the butter. We ordered a second helping.   My friends ordered the chicken penne (it was pretty good) and the sole (really soft and flavorful) and I split the whole dungeness crab.   I am going to say right now I am not a fan of crab due to my past experiences with suffering cracking it open and how bland and dry the innards usually were, BUT THIS WAS NOT THE CASE. It was super moist and had a strong distinct crabby flavor. There was lots of meat available, thus making the tedious process of cracking it open totally worth it. Easily the best crab I've had in my life. The potatoes that came with the dish were kind of greasy and mediocre at best.   The meal ended with a free Biscotti cookie which I thought was neat.   Definitely worth it for the crab and bread, but next time I'll skip out on the drinks and pray for a shorter wait time.

UHwEPdl6YZwEQ31xu3jfHw.review_text: It's a touristy kinda day for us today so we went to Fisherman's Wharf...  :) Great food, ambiance, and view! The food are great.  We had the special crab/risotto for appetizer; entree: fried combo (fish/calamari/shrimp), and crab roll. All the seafood are fresh and delicious! They also provide you a warm sourdough bread that is so yummy...seated by the window overlooking the boat cruise on the bay...it's nice for people watch   :) Our waiter is very professional and friendly. Will definitely come back to try other food.

8S-8O9aofPjOLBGR0UyUaQ.review_text: we had a great table by the window, we had great food, the fish and chips and chowder. and daughter had the burger.  we had the calamari to start and it was yummy!  our server was a little strange but it was a good fun lunch

-Qf4ffBkhYailgZ57ZenOA.review_text: Surprisingly good for being a restaurant in a tourist area. The restaurant was very nice and it was right on the water, so it had a good view. Our waitress wasn't the friendliest person , but the manager was wandering around helping tables out too, which was nice to see. The food was good and again the portions were huge! I will say, I don't like seafood, but went here because everyone that I was with does like seafood and the menu doesn't offer many options for non-seafood eaters; maybe two or three items. I had the cheeseburger and it was delicious. The people that I was with said they liked what they had too, which was the clam chowder and calamari.

XG5ehGoXut9WWvYHRPKRsQ.review_text: Great food, pleasant service (although the hostess was a bit snobby).  We had a 15 minute wait but that was no problem.  They had a nice fireplace with comfy couches to sit on.  We started with clam chowder.  I enjoyed it and as a native new englander, couldn't find anything to complain about.  My mom had the twin lobster tails with wild rice and veggies.  She loved everything except the veggies which were undercooked according to her.  I wanted something different so I went for the beef and shrimp chow mein.  I'm not sure why they called it chow mein because it was definitely more of a lo mein.  Still it was delicious and I'd order it again.  I'm not a fan of ginger at all, and did bite into a few tiny pieces, so perhaps I'd ask if it could be prepared without the ginger.    People with reservations get seated at the window tables first.  We sat in a booth right next to those tables, so we had as nice a view as if we were at a window table.  Some people complained that they couldn't sit at a window table even though they were seated in the booths around us and still had a great view.    I'd definitely come back again.

Nfw6KZys6dVXnB5oiuZPdg.review_text: WAAAAAAY better than Crab House!  From when we first arrived, seating, service, food and when we left, friendly and on point.  We didn't have anything other than the crab, so I can't recommend anything but this city's specialty.  Would def come back here with guests in town visiting SF!

I5YsR-ZmyB0wRDeeqGZ0hA.review_text: I spent 5 weeks in San Francisco in 3 trips this past 2013.  I ate at a lot of places and I have to say that this one was the best for customer service.  The waiter I had whose name was Michael is simply the best waiter I had during my entire time visiting eateries in the area.  The food is excellent as are the cocktails they have.  I had such a good time with a co-worker I went back and requested Michael the other 3 times I went.  I was by myself this last time and sitting at the bar having a drink waiting for him to show up.  I feel a grab at my shoulder and after almost 2 months he recognized me and welcomed me back.  On top of that the manager came by and we chatted as well as one of the other waitresses.  Traveling on business can be a real pain, but that level of customer appreciation by staff was incredible.  I have dealt with two managers there who were both great.  If you go to this place ask for Michael if your looking to impress those your with.  He really does a great job and he got some very solid tips from my co-workers and myself for his EXEMPLARY service.  Do yourself a great big favor and stop by to have a cocktail, food, and a great experience with this waiter.

UkCryqIr1K8Fo-i3FbbFmA.review_text: This is one of the pricey seafood places at Fisherman's Wharf, on Pier 39. We treat ourselves to one of these on each visit, and this time we chose Fog Harbor. We asked for and were given a window seat with a very nice view. Our waiter was friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. I had the Cioppino and it was outstanding. My kids enjoyed the garlic steamed crab, and my wife loved the seafood penne. There is a clean restroom inside the restaurant - shhh, don't tell anyone! My only complaint with the experience is the utterly bogus 3.5% health care surcharge tacked on to every bill. Being California, there's always some nonsense like this going on that people are forced to deal with. I will leave it to you to investigate the origins of this surcharge, but the bottom line is that restaurants are not, in fact required to apply this charge, and their reason for doing so amounts to a political temper tantrum at customer's expense. When I questioned the waiter about this, he gave the straight-faced party line as expected. Can't blame him, really.

4dtsi_z9Un97D0ezkLYJTQ.review_text: This place is probably the nicest restaurant at pier 39 and it's barely more pricey than the other places.  The seafood we had was cooked perfectly and everything was packed with flavor.  For a nice sit down, this was a great spot.  Crab risotto fritters were super creamy, rich and delicious.  Clam chowder was legit and the grilled seafood was perfect.  Our waiter Rudy did a great job, was very attentive, and made some great recommendations.

nCrkiw3fpRdOFog1Hkc80g.review_text: Waited literally 10 minutes just to be asked for what I wanted to drink. While another couple seated nearby got there after I did and got served immediately. When the waitress did come by I told her this and she was shocked. I left right after and went to nearby place for an amazing lunch.

BIdFgt_4owlS1VUcTuZ4fA.review_text: We love this place!  Yesterday was our second time here and we had lunch with a view.  This place is upstairs at Pier 39 and one of the first restaurants as you enter.  The prices are reasonable and the food was more than satisfying as well as plentiful.  We shared a shrimp cocktail, served in a good sized martini glass.  There were a few  European lettuce leaves on the bottom (for color but it still tasted good covered in sauce!) and a ton of bay shrimp in cocktail sauce.  That alone with bread could be a meal for me!  Dale ordered a beer and the Fog Harbor Hamburger.  It was huge (Niman Ranch 1/2 lb patty) bacon, jack cheese, carmelized onions and a tasty Chipotle Thousand Island Dressing.  I had the Fish & Chips, three big pieces of fish (I think it was Cod) moist on the inside with a beer batter cooked to perfection - nice crunch with every bite!  We both got a mess of fries with our meals and I got some coleslaw that tasted homemade.  The coleslaw had red bell pepper that gave it a nice sweetness but I thought it had a little too much mayo.  Our server, Marilyn was the best and made sure that we had whatever we needed at all times.  She remembered everything like when I asked her for mustard for my fries when we ordered.  It's servers like her with a confident and positive attitude that make dining more enjoyable.  Overall, we had a nice lunch with a great view.  Also, they have a very nice fireplace and sitting area outside.  I'm sure that area is for people waiting for a table but I wouldn't mind sitting there to have a drink - not sure if that's allowed tho!

KMmMQ8Dpx7wx15xG5caw0Q.review_text: Great view, friendly service, and delicious food.  The Fog Harbor Fish House is the best choice for crab and oysters on Pier 39 in terms of quality and price.  All the seafood we ate was very fresh and well-prepared - from raw ahi tuna and oysters to salmon and whole crab.  Our drinks were strong and tasty and the creme brule was perfect.  While pricy, we had a great time and were full for the rest of the day.

kYBe-lqgMt8X6mjSA6XWqw.review_text: Good view( we sit beside window), very good service,  good food and drink.

1IcbUBBsFrrQ0DnJ3wPlww.review_text: The clam chowder was amazing! Their popcorn shrimp was quite delicious as well. Not to mention, their swordfish was out of this world, too. The crème brûlée & bread pudding were really tasty desserts. The service itself wasn't all that great - but all in all, it was a great experience.

n2CncV0cclTnjOQow2iVgw.review_text: First time in the pier so we had to eat there. I am a sucker for great views so we decided on this place.  Based on the reviews my expectations were not really high but I was pleasantly surprised by how good the food was. My husband had half portion of crab and I had the pacific sole which was pretty good. After touring all afternoon, we both left satisfied. We wouldn't mind coming here if we were in SF again.

_zRlnzrLPnlxbJ6uwsVS3A.review_text: Our waiter was great but hostess wasn't very nice or welcoming and that's always my first impression.  The food was pretty good but some dishes lacked seasoning.  Great view of the pier.

C4UWtvXXW2KumYFxnY3zAQ.review_text: I would like to Thank the Fog Harbor  Manager for making my daughter and her Prom party a success. With the phenomenal customer service and great food we as parents couldn't have picked a better restaurant. I would also like to take some time to Thank the couple who paid the bill as a good gesture. Once again THANK YOU to the couple who sat next to my daughter and her prom party for paying the bill.

-bImAAJ8lgBbkJRykzWXEA.review_text: it was great the service was super awesome they were very attentive.

XJYFjbH-oTmu2dATTqyauQ.review_text: After walking around Pier 39 for a few hours, my husband and I were hungry for lunch. We stopped at Fog Harbor since our Aquarium of the Bay ticket allowed us to get 15% off the bill. Additionally, since it was on the second level, the view of the bay was fantastic. The inside was very nicely decorated and had plenty of seating.   We were seated right away and our waitress was quick to greet us and answer any of our questions. We had a tough time deciding what we wanted to eat, but our waitress had some good advice and offered her favorite dishes. For drinks, we both ordered the Alcatraz Escape. This drink was super tasty and my husband is still raving about how delicious it was. The drink was very tropical with orange and pineapple juices with grenadine, coconut rum, and a float of dark rum. I would definitely order it again.   For lunch, my husband ordered the whole dungeness crab with garlic. This thing was huge! It was really tasty, but honestly, it was a mess. I watched my husband crack open the entire thing and this literally consumed all of his time. By the time he was done cracking, I was almost done eating my meal of seafood cioppino. This came with crab, fish, scallops, clams and mussels in a tomato herb broth. It was delicious and hit the spot. I eyed the dessert tray, which looked delicious, but we were both stuffed from our meal.   Overall, I would recommend this place for a seafood fix. It was a little on the pricey side, but I felt it was justified with how delicious everything was, the great service, and the great view. Next time we visit Pier 39, I would definitely come back here and try the other items on the menu.

veLWPGA-1MMtcRNDYWm-BA.review_text: Came here for Xmas Day, the Oysters with Mignonette are still incredible, as is all the food - mouth watering good.  but WTF?? no Happy Hour on Xmas?  That was the biggest draw last year, and they put the sign out - but the bartenders said it was a no-go this year.  That saddened me for about 2 seconds.  (i still love their food)  Although the bartender was a bit of a bitch all around this time,  If you don't want to work on Xmas, then you should find someone else to cover your shift, and not be grumpy with the people who come it.. I'm just saying..

xhwYcN9KWJkxF3hNEoxMDg.review_text: Some may write this restaurant off as it's located in the heart of tourism town at Pier 39, but don't judge it so quickly. The food here is amazing. Upon arrival we were quickly seated at a nice table with a great view. Shortly after we received a delicious amuse-bouche as a thank you for making a reservation. It was rock shrimp with aioli -- delicious. I had the wild salmon, and it was incredible. I am a huge salmon fan, and this was the best I have ever had. It's served over a bed or arugula, fingerling potatoes and crispy onions. It's delightful. The dinner was satisfying but not heavy, so we had room for dessert. We split the tiramisu. It was delectable. The wait staff was highly attentive throughout the dinner and very friendly. I would definitely recommend this restaurant for your time in SF.

tvG5Fb4aSG4YvwYQVSiR7g.review_text: So we took a Trip to San Francisco and of course you have to go to Fisherman's Wharf and we came here.  My husband and I do not eat shellfish so after trying Crab Shack, which we did not like we came here.  They are almost next door to each other on the 2nd floor.  We walked in and it was such a nice restaurant and great service.  The place did not spell fishy like next door, and they had sourdough bread, yum.  I ordered and loved the Fish and Chips the Cod tasted like it was just caught and cooked just for me.  My husband loved the trout and we will come again when we visit San Francisco.

CBv2eqUdZYsENjHT7EDz8A.review_text: I had the clam chowder and the crab cakes. The crab cakes were disappointing and the clam chowder was good. Not amazing but decent.  The service was okay. I was put off a bit by our waitress. We were still buttering our bread when she took the butter basket away. I had taken all the butter I wanted but how did she know I was done? What if I had wanted more? She didn't know.  Anyway, it wasn't bad. it wasn't amazing. I probably won't come back if I'm in teh area though.

X1FgmdmvSOqER9IOJbxO0g.review_text: Had a very satisfactory meal here, although the price probably was more worthy of the location than the dinner itself. We started with crab cakes and I moved onto tasty bread bowl of chowder and some longish leaves of lettuce that was their caeser. The view of the foggy harbor was as advertised as well and we enjoyed it, even though we were in the back end of the restaurant. I do have to say that our waitress was very pleasant and definitely made our dinner as comfortable as it should be, certainly a place I'd return to if I had to dine in the touristy Pier 39 area again.

WU3XkIdG8qZwFW2wAFxsCw.review_text: Came into Fog Harbor after walking out of the Crab House cause we sat for 15 minutes and still no waiter in sight.  So glad we did!  The service and food were excellent!  My son loved the kids Mac n Cheese.  It was homemade and extremely cheesy.  My husband and my 12 yr old son shared the crab and couldn't finish the whole thing, it was so big.  I had the fillet minion which was tender and delicious.  I can't imagine anything not being good in this place.  The prices were good for the location and quality of food.  At $33 the fillet was cheaper than other nearby restaurants.

lucIbk6WeQ6Nq0Zr5jrSBA.review_text: We were hangout on the wharf and got hungry, so randomly we decided to try this place.  --FOOD-- 01. Steam clams (Full for $15.95 on webiste, but $16 on check) Roasted peppers, corn, chorizo butter served with garlic toast -- clams were gritty and sandy... uh, did they clean them?  02. 24oz. New York steak ($24.95 on website, $25 on check) Cooked in a whiskey peppercorn sauce, and served with garlic mashed potatoes and sauteed veggies -- subpar steak  03. Fish of the day ($19) Bundle of prawns on top a bed of mashed potatoes and spinach. -- didn't even finish them, ate like less than 10%   Hmm... they seem to round everything up to the nearest dollar. Food total is $60 with tax and health fee, total is $67.38. Yes, almost freakin' $70 for lunch.  --OVERALL-- The servers were okay. It would've been better if she noticed that I barely ate my food and not charge.  I wouldn't come here ever again, spent way too much money for no good food. Meh... it was in the tourist area. Next time, we'll do some research.

gD_1ARJw94DAlXQ9J78wRA.review_text: Wow what a chow, chow, chowder!!!! Came with a mound of fresh crab meat really good. Also had the crab cake for my meal. They were also really good. Thumbs up for the FOG!!!!

KQgNXb0hBVrdQsCpHr-WTQ.review_text: Good service Fish, crab, sourdough bread, cioppino, etc. Finished off with birthday apple crumble to die for...  How can it be wrong?

3FMK2LpNHcUyuY09_4bGFw.review_text: Fog Harbor Fish House is the cliche Pier 39 restaurant, average food quality, but rather expensive. The clam chowder was wonderful and those sitting next to me enjoyed their lobster mac and cheese. On the other hand, for me, the crab roll was mediocre.    It felt little different than as if it were out of a can, but the Texas Toast made it work a little. The prices were also fairly high, but the server was attentive despite the difficulties of working at a crowded Pier 39 restaurant.   The moral of the story is not to be some dimwit who eats at Pier 39. Pier 39 is the land of the $5 corn dog and $4 soda. It's a tourist trap of worldwide proportions, filled with every museum or giant machine that wants to grab your money in existence.   Sure, Pier 39 has great attractions like Rocket Boat, Musee Mecanique and so on. But for god's sake - save the eating for the Mission or somewhere else you can get to on the streetcar. Anywhere but in Pier 39.  Fog Harbor Fish House is best avoided. If you go out to San Francisco's many neighborhoods, you'll have better food, even regarding fish and seafood. Fisherman's Wharf also has some wonderful seafood in stands and restaurants which is a lot better than the more touristy Pier 39. And it's only about two blocks away.

7hUznGCjAomfNVnR7HEgSA.review_text: The dungeness crab was great, but my husband got the crab cakes which were small and tasted like frozen crab cakes not fresh.   The views were great, but the food was definitely overpriced.

OHtgI80fhoIxoon-LlKVrw.review_text: What a lovely restaurant! I really enjoyed the intimate/romantic atmosphere. Get a table further inside if you can; you'll have a nice view next to the water.  My family and I came here for dinner and we had a good time. We started off with complimentary sourdough bread and a calamari appetizer as well as clam chowder. A trip to SF isn't complete without some clam chowder! The bread had a wonderful crunchy texture and the clam chowder was delicious without being too heavy.  For entrees, I ordered swordfish while the rest of my family ordered ahi tuna and the seafood spaghetti. While the food was a little on the salty side, it was pretty good. I actually liked the swordfish the least out of all the entrees because it was rather dry. The tuna was surprisingly generous in portion and I liked this entree the most. The seafood spaghetti was pretty good too, and that's coming from someone who typically doesn't like seafood. I tried their rose wine soda, which was non-alcoholic. It was yummy! It just tastes like a light fizzy soda, haha. They should just call it grape soda, but I guess they just want to make it sound fancy.  All in all, I'd recommend this place if you're in the area and looking for a nice sit-down restaurant.

V_ocCdGwY85DCcpHzNjhRw.review_text: Great food and service. I don't usually like to eat at restaurants off the Wharf because they do feel a bit generic, especially in SF were you can find some of the best food in the country but we were at the Warf and got late so we gave this place a try and so happy we did. It actually reminded me of the quality of food and restaurants that use to be on the Warf before Applebees and Subways were added to make it of course appealing to tourist lol So that being said I am not a fan of seafood I know SF known for seafood and all but whatever I don't so get over it lol. But I do like Fish n Chips so I ordered that and my hubby had shoot can't remember but some kind of braised chicken meal and both were so good! I hate to say this but the food here was better than what we had at Gordon Ramsey's Steak in Vegas a few months before! I know what?! I didn't want to admit it either but I gotta be honest ;) The warm sourdough bread was so delish and the waitress was on top of refilling the bread and drinks And I l loved the ambiance and the lighting, fancy & romantic...but still could wear shorts and Tshirt because of the location so not a bad deal lol. So I will definitely be back here, probably not when I am at other locations in SF but for sure when I am at the Warf =)

SLIpcp4aPRP9XWf2SsTZiw.review_text: First place I ate at last time I was in San Francisco. Very nice place to have dinner, but I was actually disappointed in the meal. I got a simple Fish and Chips dinner, and while the fish was fresh, the batter and fry job was pretty bad. Very greasy. Couldn't decide on dessert so went with the crème brulee and the tiramisu, both of which I loved, and would go back to Fog Harbor for.

Yhi7Qqm8zSR_nxN6OXJ79A.review_text: The food was AMAZING. My family and I went on Thanksgiving, the place was packed. But the service was still great. I had the lemon dill salmon and their sunset mimosa.... both perfect.   It's a bit pricey, so I'd probably only go for special occasions. =)

btY6sVjwj8tLNR3j5J5zzA.review_text: Had a very good experience.  A group had a heavy lunch with a variety of different items.  Very good on the prep and presentation along with great service.

PJRDBGVCrgk25IGJbDqlWQ.review_text: The food and the view are great.   No free refills. My sister ordered a few lemonades and it came out costing more than her meal ($22). Dumb.

yyFhjaliPS5kDVIFkAbj8Q.review_text: I found this so disappointing. We were seated and a waiter came to talk to us and during that time the hostess moved us to another table without explanation. The new server did not come for a while. Service was terrible... Maybe because we were two women taking about space.   The food was terrible the clam chowder was thick and was like wallpaper paste. Too much flour.  The lobster tasted frozen  wet and mealy. The crab stuffing was more of  a bad crab salad with mayo.  The food came wrong. Need I go on??? They did take one entree off but the experience was so bad.

71n_oUO5aTrIexxhCqrsng.review_text: We didn't expect much from a tourist restaurant on a Friday night. Our server, Faysel, gave us a fantastic experience; the best quality Parisian style server I've experienced in America. We had a great view and the food was quite good,  but Faysel made it special. We had out of towners and a special needs friend at the table and he was patient and a perfect gentleman.

XTaxfLaLuexMe4j_ThxGOQ.review_text: From start to finish the food was simply delicious at a great price Service impeccable and portions generous  You cannot beat this place. It rivals others at comparable prices Great scenery Would definitely come again and again

6tUrIa9TcEupnRduLbvrFQ.review_text: Shellfish platter and crab cakes are SUPER DELICIOUS ... The waiter Khaiman provides us with a very good service!!! It is obvious that he likes his job and he is professional at this... I would like to come to this restaurant every time I come to San Francisco!!!

dODtK_sdIwjAocN5oQI2ew.review_text: Good food for reasonable pricing in a very tourist hotspot. Was surprised about the excellent quality served here. Surely exceeded my expectation. crab cakes were good, steak was awesome and also the tuna steak well prepared (although cooked a little too far). Will surely come back here.

hyF_RxY2mC8JYqF3sbja5Q.review_text: Excellent food and excellent customer service. Our server was incredibly helpful and punctual. I typically avoid "touristy" areas but do recommend.

0KueQxXgax9GlbZ0UNaGlg.review_text: Good but not entirely worth the price.   Shared a bottle of sparkling wine with two friends and split some seafood appetizers. The oysters were a little sad, not plump and delicious. The tuna poke was kinda standard and the Dungeonous crab cakes were good.   For this tasting, we paid $118.  Eh. I've had money better spent.

A563dpyiH4qgXjOSnd-C-A.review_text: Slightly better than your average tourist place around here. Great view and nice decor. Food was pretty good but not fantastic by any stretch. Nice selection of seafood on the menu with some good choices for landlovers as well. Prices are definitely inflated by about 20% over what they should be, but what do you expect for Pier 39 right? Didn't need a reservation for weekday lunch. Make sure to check in on Yelp for free appetizer.

XRVTCGMXroSGe0ByASFTgA.review_text: Food Poisoning!!!  The Clam Chowder tasted great and then uh oh... The girgle shmirgles began we went back to the hotel and we were became very ill all night and into this morning with Food Poisoning..  It was the only thing we ate yesterday besides Coffee and Toast so we know this was the culprit. Also, while we were there the people behind us were complaining that the fish and chips tasted old. The manager said he would pay for their glasses of wine and said unfortunately they get some bad fish now and then. We will not go back... Thank goodness for Imodium and Emitrol...

t_Q3ZBRE7s_dSgYg6Z4aOw.review_text: Well with the wait and the beautiful seating outside I guess I was expecting too much from this place. We were startled to see several waitresses and waiters with white uniform button up shirts but no undershirts beneath!! I could see the women's bras and one mans nipples clear as day!!! For a place like this I would have expected management to have that under control at least!  We were seated in the far back of the restaraunt where a party of about 15 teenage girls of 15 years old were seated with no adult supervision and were so loud throughout our whole meal that I could barely make out anything my friend was saying to me. And I really feel bad for the people who were sitting next to them as we were half way across the room! When I said something to our waiter he stated "yeah, they are pretty annoying" but never attempted to rectify the situation.   It took about 15 minutes for someone to come get our drink orders and I ordered a margarita and was able to hardly drink it because it was about 70% syrup and way too sweet. We ordered the ahi tuna poke which I really enjoyed and my friend had the crab dip which absolutely loved and devoured. When the main meals arrived my friend had the chowder and said it wasn't really all that special and was just ok. I ordered a plate of clams, mussels, shrimp, crab and corn. The dish was absolutely COVERED in Garlic....there so much garlic everywhere and I had a hard time scraping it off. The clams were ok and there wasn't too much to the mussels. The corn was ridiculous as you couldn't really bite into it but if you scraped it with your teeth you might actually get a little bit. The whole dish was hard to eat because of the ridiculous amount of garlic. It was like someone took about 6-8 whole garlic, minced it and to threw it in. With what we paid, we were severely disappointed....this restaurant needs someone competent enough to actually make this place worth the price...

0-qbolTkCyWcA8xaAOu3YQ.review_text: Had a great King Salmon dinner! Even at the pinnacle of fleet week the service was prompt and the staff was very attentive. Dinner was prepared well with great flavor and the place was packed!! We will definitely come back!

0NiUbgmLd1HbBSc122mzwg.review_text: Food was excellent.  Service was great.  Wonderful view.

UiBhRpIT1_8tI2naA0wMYw.review_text: Clam chowder was delcious! Best we had after three days of eating chowder. Mix grill was good, as was calamari.  I had crab ceviche which was flavorless.  Needed some type of sauce.  Our waiter was an elderly ESL man. Horrible service.  The other waiters kept jumping in to help and they were great. Would go again.

dUqWpw3jsPfnhML-zpJa8Q.review_text: Still on my quest to find the perfect crab cake, I will leave no wave or shore unturned :)  Being born and raised in San Francisco I can sometime forget how busy things can get at Pier 39, I still cannot gage when the down season or off peak hours will be. No matter, Fog Harbor has great view, OK service and the food is pretty good.    Just a quick stop in for my date and I to refuel after being tourists in our own city.  We ordered the garlic bread, Crab Cake Entree and Crab Cake Sandwich. Yum Yum and Yum. Not too bad of a meal or snack if you prefer. I wish we could have paid the "locals price" those three items an SF Cosmo for my date and a virgin fruit daiquiri aka smoothie for me totaled $68.00 15% tip included   I guess the price included the view and clear days in San Francisco where you can see all the way across the bay are priceless!!

WXD8bD9LVMgEFqcs5CpQ-g.review_text: We ordered clam chowder, cod and risotto fritter. The calm chowder was good. The other two dishes are mediocre. The view and service was good :)

8UUDaxYgPAbMTzGM4EQmPw.review_text: Amazing view. Incredible food. The clam chowder bread bowl was to die for! Great staff...extra kudos to Leslie, he was so nice and hospitable!

hQBfcQhtu-eAZCJVg17iVA.review_text: Had Madison as our waitress. Very polite and very attentive. If she wasn't working we would ask her to join us for lunch. Great food, great service!  Complimentary bread is baked into the price in the menu therefore being perceived as free, at least that's what I theoretically think.   Hopefully will get a chance to try the creme brulee someday ;)

a0m4D5xU_MegRf0mQDBevg.review_text: Yeah, I had two bowls of clam chowder and I ain't ashamed, hunty!  Family always man handles the fish and chips, sometimes they get hella fierce and order calamari too. What can you say? When it's good, it's GOOD!  Always seating available even though they are consistently busy.   Gorgeous view and wonderful staff, the GM is also very caring and attentive.

n4lyTe0ZUU6meaS4RjB5ug.review_text: We sat outside by the fireplace because we wanted to relax and warm up after our city tour.     The setting outside was perfect for us.  We played some Uno and had a few drinks.  We decided to try the mussels and I must admit that it was very tasty and well prepared.   We did not have dinner there only because we had reservations somewhere else.    So if you are looking for a place to relax with a fireplace and still catch some of the waterfront action then I would recommend this place.

z67oNAZR_uHG84k3Dntckg.review_text: I was on my way to a tour of Alcatraz, and my only requirement was that I find somewhere with seafood. I'm pretty sure I walked into a tourist trap, but that's OK - I'm a tourist. I probably paid more than I should have, but the food was good, the service was attentive, and I had a beautiful view of Alcatraz and the San Francisco Bay out the windows. I may be a tourist, but I'm a happy tourist!  Before I went, I was told to definitely order Dungeness crab. My dining companion ordered the whole crab, steamed, and it was delicious. As a crab aficionado, she was happy to report that the crab was good quality and cooked perfectly. I had the special of the day - a blackened fish (I'm sad to say I can't remember what kind of fish!) served on a bed of sauteed spinach and mashed potatoes. The spinach was served in an absolutely delicious sauce, I had to refrain from licking the bowl!  If you're a local, you can probably take the time to dig around in the area and find somewhere less expensive to enjoy seafood in the area. Compared to other tourist-"friendly" locations, though, this was definitely a good choice.

cpL3IAvNtxMlK-cQ6ns9Wg.review_text: If you're visiting pier 39 this is definitely the place to go. I've read all the positive reviews on yelp before deciding to go and was definitely not disappointed.   We've ordered seafood cioppino and it was a home run.  Fresh tomato sauce based broth, mussels, shrimp, scallops,and crab legs perfectly blended together. The dish was large enough for 2 people to start with but added pasta to our order and it was a perfect compliment to the seafood. Order a bottle of wine to go along with the food and you have a complete meal.   There is a little bit of a wait line when you get to restaurant. Make sure you tell the hostess that you want a table with a view on the bay. There is a different waiting time on these tables but the view makes up for it.

DjiWvNLBbrOI5qKOyYGtCA.review_text: Wow, this establishment gets my four stars for location, atmosphere, service and food! I was on a hunt for the best clam chowder and I think I found it! We also got window seating which had the perfect view of the pier from our table! :) The restaurant is super cute and fancy. Between my boyfriend and I, we shared the sourdough clam chowder bread bowl, the red curry mussels and a beer. Both dishes we're amazingggg. The clam chowder- super creamy and filling that pair perfectly well with their warm sourdough bread. Red curry mussels- I'm not a huge seafood gal, but as one bite, yum! They paired it with what seems like toasted garlic bread (they need to include more pieces!). I'll be back!

zT-5xnkEwhyCmWi2lUorrg.review_text: Sure, this is along the touristy Wharf, but when it's 9:00p on a Friday night and you haven't eaten since late morning (plus crackers and sh*t in between to tie you over), you'd be desperate to go anywhere, right?  Well, it's good to know that this place was rated pretty good, and I can't say I went to SF without eating some kind of seafood so here I was with 4 others (note: "cooked" seafood...I don't like anything raw).  My friend actually called them around 8:15ish to see if we can make a reservation, but at that time, they were booked and walk-in would be about a 30-minute wait.  By the time we got there around 9:00, the restaurant was maybe a 1/3 empty so we were able to sit down right away (thank goodness, I would've had to chew my arm off).  Although we got hot sourdough bread with butter, we ordered the blue cheese garlic bread ($8) and crispy lemon calamari ($12) on top of that and pretty much scarfed it down.  The calamari was tender with crispy batter...so good.  The blue cheese garlic bread was good too, but the blue cheese was rich so if I wasn't overly hungry, I wouldn't be able to eat 3 slices.  But I did.  For main, I ordered the Pacific Sole ($20), but by then, I was already getting stuffed...(didn't help that I had a virgin Pina Colada with the appetizers).  I still ate some of it.  The pacific sole was fresh not fishy and went well with the spinach, peppers, and tarragon cooked in a caper sauce (buerre blanc).  The others ordered coffee and dessert after that, but I had to pass.  Sooo sooo sooo (did I say "sooo"?) saaaaad to miss out on dessert!!!

UbWUr96T7yOp9w4lrKyf5Q.review_text: Great seafood restaurant in the middle of the touristy Pier 39.   We started with the bleu cheese garlic bread (free with yelp check in) and as a non-bleu cheese fan, the bread was surprisingly tasty. The bleu cheese was very mild and broiled crisp on top.   The clam chowder was thick, creamy with large chunks of clam-just the way a good chowder should be. The oysters on the half shell were fresh. The steamed crab legs were delicious although a little drier than I'd like. Drenching them in garlic butter definitely helped:)  I washed down all this garlicky seafood goodness with a Skinny Ginger Lemonade. Advertised as only 14 calories and made with Splenda, it was light and refreshing with fresh ginger shavings throughout.

vhEv9j8QbfSlL8oLwej2rQ.review_text: Spent the weekend in SF and had dinner here on an early Saturday evening.  Staff and everyone at the restaurant were extremely polite and accommodating.   Started off with the oysters and both the taste and quality were very good.  We had the linguine with clams and the lobster.  Both dishes were good and the price was within line for the quality.  Good atmosphere and generally a place for all.

KAQt87eXcWyH5NNizqoGrg.review_text: Pleasant enough to placate your cardigan wearing grandmother, but the foodie in your family will not be so satisfied.   I had a tuna salad for lunch, which only had 4 very small pieces of tuna; not nearly enough to fill me up. And the quality? Meh. The waiter also all but disappeared after he delivered the food.   On the plus side, the restuarant is clean and airy, and the huge windows surrounding the restaurant offer a truly great view of the water & Alcatraz.

nAuv2sB7bYUjx4KmBp7diQ.review_text: We visited for lunch the day after Christmas.  We ordered the clam chowder in a bread bowl and the red curry mussels.  Both were excellent and our waitress, Madison, was efficient and very friendly.  I highly recommend anyone visiting San Francisco to take time to seek this place out.  We'll go back next time we visit!

lo7AI1id6F34nAnfmi94vg.review_text: An hour wait for a party of 7.  The food isn't amazing and the wait wasn't worth it. It's pretty pricey. The seafood penne is $19 but didn't fill me up. Mussels and clams' meat are tiny. The swordfish is really good! Super fresh but such small proportion for $26 :((  The portions of the clam chowder and salad is pretty large so that was worth the $14. But everything else I ordered wasn't worth it Unfortunately..  Overall this place is nice. Our waiter, Brett, was lovely! He was tentative and funny as well. Wouldn't come back again since it's just too pricey and the food isn't amazing as I thought it would be. But really great service  --my cousin ordered the New York steak and loved it! He recommends that! :)    Total: $130.24

NEOSYsubf7SVeVm8RytxYA.review_text: Pretty good restaurant considering how centrally located it is in a tourist destination.  Brought my visiting family here to visit Pier 39 and enjoy some fresh seafood.  The dining experience is absolutely superb.  Not to mention the wonderful views with their huge windows looking out to the San Francisco water front.    My family was so happy with the food and the ambiance.

fUzFEoR39q6sAjaQd3X7TA.review_text: Visiting San Francisco with family as part of a long birthday/bachelorette week. After taking a BYOB bay cruise, we were starving and looking for a nice sit down place (not so easy to find in Fishermans wharf) but not so nice that our slightly loud, relatively inebriated (for 1:30 on a Saturday afternoon) party wouldn't ruin the experience for anyone else. Enter Fog Harbor. Were seated at the bar immediately, able to enjoy not only great views and excellent food (the oysters are to die for) but also great bartenders- they created an impromptu cocktail crafting competition and we did not leave disappointed. If you're in a group, this is a great choice as the San Francisco know it all were just as impressed as the first timers.
