2eBlOzcBvBywmhvSfZ-Kow.review_text: My wife and I enjoyed the food and service! The staff really made our  17 th anniversary very special

TZ5Xc4cQ_IBNXgZJ06xWpw.review_text: Your basic toursist trap, fried food and watered down cocktaiks. Much better places to eat in SF if you dont mind looking. Good came very quickly at the expense of being barely cooked.

w3iXYLy7b89aoDxfU96i5g.review_text: When you're hungry and just want to sit down somewhere, you'll end up at a place like this. Very touristy. You're paying for the view, the service, and a decently cleaned bathroom.   My date and I were seated at a table with the view of Alcatraz with a very friendly (and cute!) waiter. I wasn't extremely hungry, just tired and wanted a clean bathroom (which can be hard to find in the tourist zone), so Fog Harbor Fish House isn't a bad place to be at.   I ordered the soup and salad combo for $14. Definitely not worth it, considering how I get the same stuff as I would at Boudin. Salad is better than Boudin's though, slightly larger portion and with fresher ingredients. I've experienced wilting lettuce at Boudin before. The clam chowder wasn't spectacular. That's probably because no clam chowder in the Bay Area can top the best chowder I've had at Seattle's Pike Place Market. The one here was very generic. I do love my breadbowl though. Yes, that was the deal with this combo, your breadbowl is at no extra cost. If you order a regular bowl of soup and a house salad, it'll just be $14 as well.   My date had this burger with fries, nothing too amazing. I didn't like their fries just because it was too bland. My date loved it though, he doesn't like his fries too salted. So that's just personal preference.   TMI material, skip this paragraph if you need to. I wasn't sure if it's because I had coffee in the morning, or their food wasn't prepared well, I had a major stomach ache shortly after the meal. Another good reason to have a clean bathroom.   Instead of giving you a dessert menu near the end, your waiter will carry a huge tray of desserts to tease you. They are at portions to share. All looking very rich, but I'm not sure how long they've been sitting out. Nonetheless, good tactic.

munMp0AaoyO9v6nSPZJqIA.review_text: The clam chowder in a bread bowl was excellent! The calamari was also outstanding! Next time I visit San Francisco I plan to dine here again & I will definitely order calamari as a starter! Delicious!  Our waiter was great too!

PWvQMoqQDmDyItsVtTDjuQ.review_text: Great place to bring out of town guests. Unlike some of the other Fishermans wharf options, the food is delicious and worth the price. I would highly recommend the lobster mac and cheese!

qG90YZd9ezxIdlMM0ceY-w.review_text: Being a lover of seafood this place is a must. Fantastic picturesque location with great service and food. I had clam chowder for the first time ever and it was amazing.  Also had the panko crumbed scallops and was amazed by the serving size and quality.  Had the mixed grill for mains and again, it was flawless.  Wish seafood was this price in Australia!

2p35UrsLuMspndW5lZjJgQ.review_text: I just want to say, this place is really a three $ sign place as opposed to the two that yelp shows...  Aside from that, very good food, and very nice views of the harbor.. Salad=$6 very good cup of Clam Chowder=$7 very good. Chefs special (2 prawns, fresh tilapia, on top of some asian veggies)=$32 was good Crab Cake burger w/ fries= $16 very good  Table bread (which was sourdough), was very good...  Service was really good, and friendly.

Afu7arUhdJTeCT3RI6QRDw.review_text: Had a great lunch with a great view of Alcatraz and the seals of Pier 39. Our server took great care of us, providing excellent recommendations. We had the crab cakes, clam chowder and crab & risotto app. Highly recommend stopping by. It's nice to eat at a family owned restaurant with a great staff and great food.

my2QdiHb5c9i67otCSL-bA.review_text: As far as seafood goes, the place is pretty average. It would appear that one would be paying for the view which is a pretty good view. There is nothing wrong with the food it just wasn't singing a Broadway musical in my mouth. The service was just fine, again nothing bad but nothing fantastic either.

fRTQRgLERO-JoH-G3Tq2BQ.review_text: A review written by a 9 year-old: At Pier 39, I dined at Fog Harbor.  Sitting by the window, with a view of the ocean, was a great experience. The service was prompt and courteous. The food was tasty and they had an extensive kid's menu. I had the grilled salmon and it was delicious. The bread bowl clam chowder was good but I had better at Boston Chowder. Next time you go to Pier 39 I hope you can try Fog Harbor.  I recommend Fog Harbor for your family.   Note from Parent: If you get you're your reservations through Open Table then you will get a surprise treat. There is also a 15% to 20% off coupons at California Welcome Center at Pier 39 with/without your AAA card.

XGioINwLD01pnf4XbSOJtg.review_text: I have eaten here twice and both times were outstanding! I had the new York steak and to was cooked perfectly and had wonderful flavor!  My sister had the crab last time and oysters tis time both were excellent! I have also had the molten cake both times and it is sooooooo good! The Blondie is also great!  I will be back!

y4Txsn6nPrp-HpbPLBP1gg.review_text: There are quite a few place near the wharf/Pier 39 where the staff herd the customers around like cattle... but this one takes the cake. I went to fog harbor with my girlfriend because we wanted to try somewhere new and kind of nice, and she had a 20 percent off coupon that she received from working at her hotel. So we decided to give it a shot. The views seemed pretty good, but heck if I know, because we weren't asked if we wanted to sit near a window, despite the obvious fact their were many open window seats. Strike one. We asked the waiter if it was okay to drink our own wine and whether their was a corkage fee (their wine list was overpriced), and he didn't know. There was a twelve dollar corkage fee. Strike two. We told him as soon as we got our waiter that we had a coupon for 20 percent off, which he took to put on the tab, but never did. Strike 3-5. He neglected to remember our waters: twice. The food was pretty good, but certainly not better than many other nearby options. We decided to look at a desert menu, which apparently is one of those fossilized versions of the food itself there. My girlfriend had to pee, and the waiter gave me shit for having to wait with the menu until she returned. The next day, when we realized we had been overcharged the 20 percent that should have come off when he took our coupon, we called and tried to get that money refunded, and were refused very shortly. If you're looking for any kind of service normally associated with fine dining at an expensive restaurant... don't go here! I would never recommend this place to anyone.

1xonHfImAhS2yU1cKRGd2w.review_text: My company went here for dinner and they treated us like royalty.  It was perfect because the view was great, not a stuffy atmosphere and the food was a nice assortment for everyone whether you like fish or a vegetarian.  That blue cheese bread is to die for.  We will certainly be back and  loved their service.

OwkFi4nPR8u2TBDT9Lo_Jg.review_text: I ate here with my mom last Friday evening. The poke appetizer was delicious and the sole was cooked and presented nicely. The problem was that our waiter disappeared somewhere between appetizers and the main course without a word... After he took our dinner order, we never saw him again. A second person deliver our food, and a third person offered us dessert. To request our bill, I had to flag down the waitress for the table next to us to try find out who needed to ring us up. When the bill finally arrived to us, we weren't even sure who to tip so we asked to speak to the manager. He told us he "lost his waiter". He said he knew something was off but didn't like to "interfere" with his wait staff so that's why we were left just sitting there with no service. I would have felt better if he had been proactive in checking in on us. He did give us a discount off the bill for the inconvenience. Walking out, we found out that our server had gone home for the night at the end of his shift (around 7pm on a Friday night and mid-way through our dinner), but no one told us that, and we were left hanging. In fairness, I do think we were probably the one off table who had that experience that evening.

62uCy2fgZPxud4x-r3b1Dw.review_text: Loved the food. The mussels in the tomato coconut sauce are to die for! Also, the crab cakes are delicious - heavy, but very moist and tasty!

BHc7xphU4FkAIfOrrHTPDw.review_text: Their chowder in a bread bowl is pretty good.  The kids' fish and chips were excellent for their value.  Will return.

EohLvLo87M2GNbYGL-AlUA.review_text: Whenever I go to a tourist trappy kind of area, I get nervous about eating at anywhere nearby. I may be kind of a food snob but I don't think I'm wrong here. Anyway we were in the area and starving and I saw that it had surprisingly good yelp reviews so we decided to give the harbor a try. It was quite a good experience.  Let me start by saying that the waiting area is really nice. We had to wait a bit to get a table but it was an enjoyable time spent sitting on the couch by their fireplace outside. Inside there was a really great view of the bay and Alcatraz.  They have a really great selection of seafood and I had a really hard time making a decision on what I wanted. I ended up getting the swordfish. It was cooked to perfection. I also loved all the seasonings and sides that came along with it. Though I have to say that on the menu it said that it came with a chimichurri sauce (which I was amazed to see paired with a seafood dish) but what was actually on it was nothing like a chimichurri sauce. It seemed like more of a parsley oil mixture. While it is probably for the best that they did not pair a intense sauce like that with a mild flavored fish, I think they should change the name on the menu. We actually ended up getting charged for someone elses (much more expensive) bill, which was a pain. But the management was very nice about it so it all worked out in the end.  So if you end up being a tourist in SF and feeling hungry after hours of hanging out with the sea lions this is the place to go!

HWERuacNmBjeB4bszrLm6g.review_text: My boyfriend took me here for my birthday celebration!!! Service was friendly, food was great and looking forward to go again!

oc3u68ugJlAP__025Ji2fw.review_text: Sat at the bar on 1 of the nicest days San Fran had this yr.  GR8 views!  Had a perfect Sunday afternoon.    Raymond, bartender, was extremely attentive & courteous.  We concocted a new martini, which i suggested should be their signature drink!    The manager, Micheal, was professional and came over to make sure entire experience was to our liking.  Hubby luved the baked oysters.    FYI: Spoke to friends of ours who live in San Franciso, and although this is suppossidly a 'tourist' place, locals visit here on a regular basis.

Lf3-2bcjW34iJQN0Hz3Mdw.review_text: Found the food very good and there is a great view of the Golden Gate bridge if you make it before sunset.

SaLLBWOqxomnAoivv5YwqA.review_text: We came here on a Saturday evening around 5pm with little to no wait. It became very busy within an hour, but the service was good and maintained even though the waiter was keeping several tables. The best part was the food- delicious! Plus they purchase local, sustainable seafood right in the SF bay. Very close (5 minutes walking) from Alcatraz cruises so if you are looking for a good place to eat- this one won't disappoint.

xawOlgtuCxZ3lBhlvkolzA.review_text: Fog Harbor Fish House was great! It had great views, great service, and great food. We started with the ahi appetizer. I wasn't a big fan but my husband loved it. He cleaned the plate. I had the trout with garlic mashed potatoes. The trout was awesome! My husband had the fish platter. He loved it all! I would go back!

GvvCiaQfD1pb8NU4c20C4g.review_text: Fair customer service, view was nice, food was also fair. Better to come on a sunny day.

AdH2YiYrGQxm112lfWS_PQ.review_text: I was here in San Francisco on vacation with my daughter and we stopped by here because we had heard it was amazing...and my friends didn't do it justice!!! We had a fantastic table with a view of the Golden Gate bridge and a waiter (Ryan) who treated us with a lot of care and attention.  We had a dozen oysters which were on the table shortly after our drinks and delicious bread. I had the Ahi Tuni starter that was very fresh and had spectacular flavor, would be a recommendation for those looking for some good flavor. My daughter had the seafood pasta which was huge and when she was done he offered a to go box. Even though we had a coupon for 20% off, he made sure we were taken care of. When we asked him about movie theaters in the area he was enthusiastic and offered info on three different locations. While the food here is amazing, make sure you ask for Ryan to make the experience even better! We will be coming back the next time we visit the West Coast.

UZMTP7OxovgtrxOVWrPUlg.review_text: The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly! The Good:We were seated right away and the view was great. The Bad:We didn't even see our server for 10 minutes.What kept us entertained while waiting was dodging chairs being moved above us to add to the table next to us. No waters, no bread. Finally the server shows up.  Got our waters and ordered appetizers. Waters showed up and nope can't order main yet so our server can get a couple of people out of there first...Ok then..alright, he's back so we ordered our main courses just in case we don't see our server for another long while.  Kids get clam chowder bread bowls(they miss these since we did live in Monterey) and burgers & fries.  Hubby gets the linguine with crab added on top as recommended by our server.  I get the shellfish combo also recommended by our server. Appetizers showed up-poke & sliders were really good. Baked oysters-nothing special. Glass of Sauv. Blanc. maybe thins will get better? Finally had to ask for some bread & butter (SF sourdough should make up for something). Another family of 3 gets seated next to us.   At this point, I'm envious of the table of 8 in front of us whose server is checking on them constantly. Appetizers gone, kids & I start to draw w/ the crayons they gave...waiting...waiting...  and now The Ugly: family next to us got their food before us?  I watch another server take our food (had to be because that table were already ordering desert) to the table in front of us then walks away..Our server returns and asks,"You guys ordered the bread bowls right?" I say "yes, but she went to the wrong table-the one in front".  The poor girl apologizes to our server.  Not her fault she was given wrong directions.  Hubbies linguine arrives-no crab added so server asks the girl to have the crab added.  My shellfish plate arrives-I try a clam & mussle, oh great-it's cold.  Server takes it back saying well the bottom is warm..ok..girl server comes back with another bread bowl?  uh, not us.  Our server puts the bread bowl in front of me to start with until my plate is fixed.  Taste the chowder--oh my how much I miss my Monterey Old Fisherman's Grotto. The 14 year old eats it instead. BTW, the kids were starving after a long drive and golden gate bridge adventure.  Hubbies linguine comes back with crab on top all right.  They threw a pile of COLD crab on top of hot pasta?  Yuck.  Hubby is starving so he decided to just mix it all together to warm the crab. Shellfish mix shows back up-and now it's hot since according to our server he watched just come off the grill. I look down at what was my original plate just reheated so now the food is over done. Clams, crab and mussles are dried up. The shrimp were overcooked so they were tough-I gave these to the hubby.  The best part of this $35 plate-the corn on the cob. Considering the price ($196) is about the same as our family usuals-Sardine Factory, the Whaling Station, Old Fisherman's Grotto, Saporo, etc., we were all very disappointed.

L5Jg5f_cFs6SWllVsFZ1FA.review_text: Great view, friendly staff, and the food was good, but it wasn't really anything special. I'm not sure if it was worth the price.

g1UVkG0JstuRb56aUiOb0Q.review_text: Went here with a group of 8 friends for our last night in San Fran. Our apps were awesome! We had the baked oysters and red chile shrimp. The clam chowder was good, but not the best ever. Everyone really enjoyed their entrees; I had the crab cakes, and they were awesome! Sevice was ok.

iMVcB2et68xXkpLZ9eQlzg.review_text: Appetizer: The clam chowder was just average.  It arrived in a plain white bowl garnished with some parsley that did not seem very fresh.  On the menu it said that the chowder was award winning but my guest and I did not feel that it was great.  The soup was not hot enough when it came out so I felt that it was slightly older.  My guest commented that he had a couple pieces of clam where that was sand.  I however did not come across any sand.  The second appetizer was the crab cakes.  I felt that the crab cakes were well made and had a good flavor.  I felt that the crab was fresh which is very important, especially for a restaurant located on the pier.  With that said, I'm not sure about the salad that accompanies the crab cake.  The salad had a good dressing that was somewhat tart and a little spicy.  It was very good but overpowered the natural flavors of the crab.  By itself, the crab cake is good but I would suggest pairing it with a salad that has a lighter dressing that can enhance the flavors of the crab more rather than over power it.  Our final appetizer was the Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail and it was actually our favorite.  The shrimp was fresh and large.  It was served in a martini glass filled with cocktail sauce and the cocktail sauce was perfect!  It had just the right blend of horseradish in it and it was delicious.  I would definitely order this dish again.  Entrees: My husband ordered the whole lobster and it was served with two sides - mashed potatoes and corn on the cob.  He said the corn on the cob was very good.  The mash potatoes were good also but compared to the corn, it wasn't as memorable.  The lobster was fresh and "sweet".  It was a little on the smaller side but adequate since we had a few appetizers.   I got the shrimp scampi.  The shrimp was in an oval dish filled with oil, garlic, and parsley with tons of shrimp.  The rest of the plate was filled with wild rice and fresh vegetables.  Instead of the mash potatoes and I requested wild rice.    I was extremely pleased with the wild rice because I felt that it went very well with the shrimp.  The vegetables were abundant and I was only able to eat about one third of it.  Now onto the shrimp - it was delicious and nicely flavored.  The shrimp was cooked just right and was very crisp.  I was happy with the portioning, often times restaurants will skimp on the shrimp but I felt that Fog Harbor was more than generous with their portioning.  Service: A bit on the slow side

JsD6EVMJNi157zTu5Gilqw.review_text: I was looking for a restaurant that served good quality fish dishes. I was also looking for the fish dishes to be not deep fried. I found it. This place was amazing. When my family go out for our Christmas meal we all have to get something different, then we all try everyone's plate. Everything was so good. I will be back. Only mistake on my part, making the reservation this close to Christmas. It was packed. But the waitress handled it. I will be returning. Merry Christmas to all!

VQXPpIh00fwRSGHA6rDLwQ.review_text: WONDERFUL!  the service was quick and efficient, the food DELICIOUS!  we arrived at 5pm and asked for  window seating and were accomodated immediately. This place is very friendly and welcoming, if you do have to wait theres a nice patio with fireplace to enjoy a drink while you wait for seating.  I Highly reccomend Fog Harbor Fish House at pier 39,  and order the Red Chili Shrimp appetizer, nothing short of spicy and delicious, My Salmon was cooked to perfection. the entire experience from the moment we arrived to leaving was excellent...

OYdscnxmU2KaQZi8Vyha6g.review_text: We were seated promptly expecting to enjoy a excellent lunch amidst the beautiful scenery; however the scenery is the only thing that could be described seeing as how we were never served. We sat for ten minutes without ever being approached or even garnering a glance from the waitstaff. After being ignored for 15 minutes without so much as a glass of water, we left. Making customers feel invisible is unacceptable and we took our business elsewhere.

3LTSxSWQ7lk29WaFRCgkwg.review_text: I made a reservation, and upon arrival I had to wait for about 15 minutes while a table cleared. Other than that, my service and food was top notch.  The view of the bay was excellent. Service was prompt and attentive, and I never lacked without.  The food... holy moley. Maybe I don't know what good is, but the selections I had were fantastic. First, the sourdough bread? It exploded with happiness in my mouth. I ate two baskets over the course of the meal. My starter course was a cup of their clam chowder. Even better (I'm drooling thinking about it now). It made me wish I'd ordered the chowder in a bread bowl. For the main course I had the lemon sole with steamed veggies and mashed potatoes. I stuffed as much of it into me as I could, while savoring every bite. I passed on dessert as I couldn't eat another bite.  The prices for the food were reasonable, the beer (though in a very tall glass) was a bit overpriced. Next time I'm at the wharf, I'll be back.

dmIi-DqwydCEtEYNI-WK8w.review_text: I stumbled upon this restaurant after searching high and low to find a place that serves a whole lobster. Came here on Friday night to celebrate a special person birthday whom requested lobster for his birthday meal so I was determined to find a place that served a whole lobster. This place definitely did not this disappoint as the birthday celebrant was able to order surf and turf. He was certainly a happy camper which made me happy because I wanted everything to be perfect.   The service was exceptional as our server was constantly checking up on us and even went as far as to make our dessert special by adding a candle so the birthday celebrant could blow out a candle and make a wish. It  was simple yet just perfect because the birthday celebrant prefer to have a low key celebration. ( I was taken by the gesture of our server and wished I gotten his name so I could give him the shout out that he deserved.)  Lastly, everything was amazing that night and thank you for following my request of having a nice view of the water. We had a blast!!!

XKRg11Ua9arIDZnWBqEjnA.review_text: Had the Calamari with lemon aioli to start-good stuff we were hungry. A REALLY skimpy bowl of clam chowder-maybe I should've gotten the bread bowl, but I like my soup and bread separate, so I ate all the bread...  My friend had a couple glasses of wine, a fish portion, the garlic mashed potatoes with some great looking mixed veggies. (They said they were disappointed with their meal, it was really bland) A cup of coffee and the bill came to over 80 bucks.

TbhyP24zYZqZ2VJZgu1wrg.review_text: This place is just okay. People raving about the food are slightly deluded - it's good but it's also very touristy, you know the drill.  The interior is enormous, it takes several hundred yards to get from the entrance to your table if you know what I mean.   We came here for crab. I had a crab ceviche appetizer which was super delicious, made with fresh crab, mango and avocado. My entree was pretty bad. I ordered a rare seared tuna steak with asian vegetables. The tuna was coated with sickeningly sweet sauce that ruined the fish. Vegetables were way too sweet as well. Disappointing.   Our server was absolutely delightful though, really helpful and didn't mind separating the bill three ways.

hs03c7s--Np_L3-OOAiSAg.review_text: Overall a wonderful evening thanks to the staff specifically our waiter Khaiman, the beautiful view of the sunset over the bay, and  perfectly enjoyable food especially the seafood salad with dungenese crab.

gkJJAzDD_lInmgq-7imxWg.review_text: This place is not too bad if you're not looking for something mind blowing. Don't get me wrong, I believe the food here is great and the quality is phenomenon. But the food just doesn't make you crave to remember. The place has a nice view, it's located on the pier, and the decor is very lovely.   I had the oysters and I believe they were from fanny bay if I could remember. Only 1 selection. The condiments given could have been better. They are a seafood restaurant so I expected to have a larger oyster selection. The ceviche with crab was very delicious, but I felt the chips that were given to compliment it were just thrown on there. It felt a little stale to me. The ceviche could have been a bit more sour as well. I split the cioppino with a friend and because I'm a girl it was an okay amount. I didn't leave feeling full. The seafood in the cioppino tasted a bit dry and the mussels I had did not taste so fresh. I've had better cioppino with much more seafood in it before. We had the Alcatraz escape and the drinks were well made. It tasted great and it wasn't too weak. Instead of giving mints they gave a biscoff cookie, which I thought was weird. Overall, its's an okay place. Not great but definitely not something you must try. I tried to like the place, but I can't still. 3 stars because it's not a bad place.  My friend had the lobster stuffed crab. He enjoyed it. Still he agreed that it's not a memorable place.   The server was nice though. He helped us quite a bit.

JXc1HVswXh_OkHL7COn47A.review_text: Went there around 4pm on a Friday since we had tickets for a nearby attraction at 6pm. The place wasn't that busy and we were seated right away. We had a very nice server for a few minutes until he came over to tell us he was leaving and Clementi (sp?) took over for him. (At least, that's what my husband saw on her name tag. She never introduced herself). She took our orders and left. A few minutes after that, a runner brought us an appetizer that wasn't ours. We told him and he left. A few minutes later, a different runner and another wrong appetizer. We told him it wasn't ours and and he also left. Clementi sees this from across the room and comes running over and wants to know what is going on. Not as in, "Oh, is there a problem that I can solve for you?". She wanted to know why we were talking to the other employees. She seemed very accusatory, like she thought we were complaining or something.   So we finally get our correct appetizer and then our main courses. THE FOOD WAS EXCELLENT. The only  thing that really ruined our experience was our server's attitude and lack of attentiveness. At the very end, she comes over with the check and says "I have some treats for  you" and literally throws a tiny cookie onto the table in the general direction of each of us, like we were dogs. It was just so ridiculous. The restaurant seemed like it could be very nice and I think, with the right service, it would have been a great experience. I am giving 3 stars because the food was very good, the service we received was definitely only worth 1 star.

4lXMpwp-Ynmvhbhe9Ivghw.review_text: We went as part of a fairly good-sized group (8) and they were able to seat us at a table right away in the bar area without a reservation at 5:45 on a Saturday evening.  I was shocked considering how busy the wharf area was Independence Day weekend.  Had the clam chowder (very good), calamari (very good) and crab cocktail (OK).  The place did proceed to get very packed very quickly so it would seem we got lucky with the seating.  Luck or not, I'm giving this place extra points just for the fact that they could accommodate us.

esG5ZnOJHkWSZCZxJAnH0Q.review_text: After the Alcatraz tour we were starving! So, we decided to stay in the area and try out a local restaurant. Fog Harbor seemed to be a yelp favorite so we decided to take the short 3-5 minute walk from Pier 33 and try it! The crackling fireplace at the entrance was warm and inviting and the floor to ceiling views of the marina were gorgeous. The fried calamari was the BEST we've ever had... that's saying a lot since we ALWAYS order calamari when dining out. My sister loved the fish & chips and said it was 10x better than Gladstone's in Malibu. So why the four stars? They dropped the ball on the clam chowder :- ( I'm not much of a fan for an overwhelmingly clammy aftertaste nor do I jump for joy for undercooked potatoes. We topped the evening off with the chocolate cake a la mode and it was a perfect complement to the most perfect sunset view. I totally recommend this restaurant if you're willing to pass  on the chowder.

5uJoGE-nyUca4cCX8x0SEA.review_text: We made reservations here after our Alcatraz night tour and we were starving!! We started off with the Lemon Calamari - YUM!!! Best calamari ever! The other people in our party had the clam chowder and crab cakes.  They absolutely loved the crab cakes, but were not blown away by the chowder.  The sourdough they give you is delish - it was gone in minutes.  The fish and chips looked amazing! HUGE portion of fish and it was thick and really good according to my sister in law.  My husband and I both had the crab roll with sweet potato fries.  The fries were amazing, but I wish the roll had chunks of crab, instead of the flaked kind.  It was just a little mushy, but good flavor.  If I had to do it over, I'd probably get fish and chips.  The table next to us had a little of everything - and we were drooling watching it come out.  They had the lobster, which looked divine and oysters looked good too.  We saw someone else with the whole crab and it was HUGE! But, it was late and we were too hungry to be hassled with tearing apart a crab to eat.  Service was great and the view was really nice.  We will be back if we return to San Fran!

zjNGX9N7ESn4M6lI0lkcWA.review_text: This place was amazing....ordered the blackened ribeye, clam chowder was the best I ever had....topped it off with fresh crab and it was great....service was satisfactory and the view great. I would definitely return

dTebdFFINDc-lX7EjN869w.review_text: This restaurant was one of the few highlights in an otherwise disappointing birthday weekend.  The waiter we had was top-notch; he was fast and attentive, without hovering.  He overheard that we had theater tickets and were on limited time and rushed our order. Our food was ready and delicious.  The shrimp scampi was cooked just right, and the only compliant I would have is that the garlic mash potatoes weren't garlicky enough (but I love my garlic--so it just might have been me...lol.)  We had a table in the back that over looked the pier and the bay.  It was a beautiful day and the windows were opened.  It is great dressy-casual place that was really enjoyable!

nPPa7QukONS5eDLBWGOPXA.review_text: Great tourist spot for the seafood lover if you're strolling around Pier 39. Delicious Dungeness crab cocktail and Cioppino. We had a lovely view of Alcatraz.

LzL6hVHBlDk_rqyxJPpK9w.review_text: This place is a must try. Amazing food, nice people and the view is gorge. Absolute must try is a swordfish. Im such a not-about-fish person but the one  i tried here was beyond delicious. Pacific sole is also very very good. If you're confused which fish restaurant to choose, go here!

UBoM1GKbZxOT1H9MG-ET-Q.review_text: I spend my birthday dinner here. It was the most amazing dinner I ever had so far. Everything we order was delicious. The clam chowder is just off the charts, their blackened ribeye steak was so soft and flavorful, their seafood pasta is really fresh and very satisfying, the wine was delicious. Food was just amazing. Customer service is also superb. Our server did make sure we are comfortable and everything was alright. Even though they are very busy, he checks on us from time to time. He provided a really amazing customer service. He is polite and very patient and very welcoming. The ambiance of this place makes you feel belong. This is definitely one of the best restaurants in San Francisco. So I highly recommend this restaurant. If you happen to be in the pier39, make sure you passed by this place and I am so sure that it will satisfy your clam chowder craving and seafood craving as well.

AtNMwewC4drPH3Lgki9JBQ.review_text: Really good! Had the crab fritters, clam chowder, poke, and blue cheese bread. We are from the area and felt like being tourists. I think if we have people come visit and want to go to the wharf we will take them here.

-5wxM0tEPGhKuK-nv3Wc_w.review_text: Bernie the waiter was extremely personable  and very friendly which made my lunch at the Fisherman's Wharf location that much more enjoyable.  The clam chowder was outstanding and so was the crab Caesar salad.  I would recommend them for lunch!

Of-ycF_3l1HwqCZ63SFxxQ.review_text: Beautiful view of Alcatraz from our table. Ask for it.

HCn_c4OhIREcNNBi-5MD2w.review_text: If you're looking for a nice sit down seafood restaurant at Pier 39, the Fog Harbor Fish House is a great restaurant! We came here in the afternoon and enjoyed sitting by the fireplace outside and listening to the waterfall while we waited for our table. The restaurant has beautiful bay windows with panoramic views of the wharf. It's worth asking for a table next to the window where you can actually see the seals below!   Being in SF I really wanted fresh baked bread so I was delighted when a bread basket of warm, freshly baked sourdough bread arrived. To kick things off, we enjoyed the Crispy Lemon Calamari ($12), which was delicious! The calamari was seasoned with lemon zest and delicious on it's own even without the lemon aioli. For lunch, one of us enjoyed the award winning Clam Chowder in a Bread Bowl ($9) and the other had the Soup and Salad Combo ($14) with a Caesar side salad. The soup was served in a fresh baked sourdough bread bowl. We enjoyed the complimentary Biscoff cookie that arrived at the end of the meal.  Visit Fog Harbor Fish House, you won't be disappointed!

s-eRjtghj9hoQtw3hPL_SQ.review_text: My wife and I had lunch at Fog Harbor on New Year's Day.  She had the crab cakes which as usual were good.  I ordered the fried seafood platter...what a disaster.  The fish and shrimp were so over cooked they were chewy and flavorless.  The calamari was disgusting.  It was heavily processed and not fresh as I would expect and had a strong 'fishy' flavor.  I obviously didn't eat the calamari and the waiter didn't ask why.  Service was horrible...we were ignored the entire time we were there until the check came.  Paid $3.25 for an iced tea and never got a refill.

o5kJhu3vCkz2-A5_RUhVfA.review_text: Terrible service! Do not trust you when you say that you need the table for 4 people when you are 2, and just wait for the rest if the company! Shirt policy !

1E-qee5VF4vRkZTeeFYurw.review_text: Our Valentine's Day plans fell through so we had to come up with a place that wasn't completely booked, that should have been warning since we had no wait getting in here.  The atmosphere is nice, good view and the staff is adequately helpful.  However, it is a restaurant so the food is also important especially at these prices.  We started with the calamari which was probably what I would expect at Long John Silvers if they added it to the menu.  I had a fish dish which was bland and very dry with zero flavor.  My GF had the special which was crab - also terrible and quality expected somewhere like a state fair or maybe a school cafeteria.  Fog Harbor basically is for tourists only and absolutely not worth going for any reason.

MpJfcgUY6gz7TY1yK5u7Qw.review_text: There was one thing I was determined to do while in San Francisco, and that was to find a good seafood place in Fisherman's Wharf where we could enjoy fresh fish and a nice view of the harbor. So I went to Yelp, because I did not want to chance ending up somewhere not so good on my SF Fisherman's Wharf seafood adventure!  I was looking for a nicer dinner place, not just a clam chowder hut, so Fog Harbor caught my eye and with good reviews, we decided to give it a try. I am *so* happy we did .... best meal on our entire vacation!  We had problems figuring out where to enter the place! lol. I saw the Fog Harbor sign on the wall, but finally after walking around some, we realized we had to walk up the stairs and enter from above! :) It is a very touristy area, but we didn't have to wait to get seated. It's a good-sized restaurant, also with options for eating at the bar, so the capacity for customers is quite good.   They escorted us to a nice table where we could oversee the ocean, Alcatraz and the Pier 39 traffic below while we ate. Loved it.  We started off with some clam chowder.  While waiting for soup, we were served nice fresh sourdough bread, it was so delicious! Nice and smooth and not "too sour", it was perfect.  The clam chowder was wonderful.  Full of clams!! (As a clam chowder should be, but you'd be surprised at how often you can count the clams in a chowder on one hand ....).  We mopped up every single drop with the remains of our sourdough bread, that bowl was clean and ready for service again by the time we were done with it.  For dinner, I had selected the swordfish. It was served atop ratatouille and fingerling potatoes and was accompanied by pesto sauce and chimichurri. The flavors were amazing, I loved the combination of all these vegetables and sauces along with the swordfish, it really brought the fish "to life". I love swordfish, but it can be a little bland if served with the wrong sides.   This vegetable/ratatouille blend along with the sauces really did the fish justice, I loved every bite!  My husband decided on the crab cake dinner.  Now, I'm very picky when it comes to crab cakes.  I'm picky on seafood overall actually, but especially food involving crab.  If it is fishy tasting at all, I won't have it, so most crab cakes never pass "the test" ;-)   I'm very happy to say, the Fog Harbor crab cakes DID pass the "Laila" test with flying colors!! They were so smooth and delicious, I even reached over for a couple of extra bites and luckily my husband is good at sharing ;-)   At the end of the night, when our bill came, we actually did feel we got our moneys worth ... between the food, the service and the beautiful view, it was totally worth it and it was exactly the San Francisco Fisherman's Wharf seafood experience that I had dreamed about!! :-)

cujMgdKEfauUEIg_hnCcew.review_text: I went here with low expectations given it is right in Pier 39.  But wow, what an awesome meal.  By far the best whole Dungeness crab I have ever had.  I had the garlic preparation and can't wait t have it again.

CaD-x1Lh2fe-xSmkGqAb6A.review_text: We really love this place.  Have had dinner here many times and now lunch.  Excellent value and the food is always good.  Very attentive service and Greg and the staff check with their customers at every meal to ensure that you are happy!  The fish and chips and slaw were great yesterday.

FvwVU2r93kTzLM5dlm2YYw.review_text: to be honest I expected better seemed kinda like a tourist trap that thrives on the view/location food was, sadly, about as good as Red Lobster, but more expensive after we had ordered our food, about 5 min later it came out, which is sort of disturbing considering you just ordered $20+ seafood, almost like it was pre-made under a warming lamp, and it half tasted that way wasn't awful, but definitely not worth the price good view though

NZVrbEJ99qZyxuFutxUFMA.review_text: What a great spot! They took in our large group with no problem. Service was excellent! A little on the slow side, but again, there were alot of us and it was a busy night, so no fault of theirs. The servers worked hard and were very pleasant.  Food is so delicious, great atmosphere and lovely view. A great spot to visit if you are in town and looking for a nice meal.

kmonc2VcO4Q2ubSE4_JmlA.review_text: Nice meal, classy service, great view!  Only negative to entire meal, don't bother with the calamari. Breaded, breaded again, breaded again then fried, not so good!

IVbHAvQCMfgyG4Kqqg9TLg.review_text: I brought my family from Australia for an afternoon snack here while touring the fisherman's wharf. Seriously I did not expect this restaurant be so great both in quality of food as well as service.   1. There is a very nice area for waiting, with nice couch and chairs. 2. The hostess is very friendly and attentive (given that we are actually Asian looking Asian). 3. The Clam Chawder with bread bowl is delicious and of high quality, the waitress actually told us it is pretty big portion, so we decided to share, which worked out great. 4. The deserts, especially the Tiramisu is phenomenal, even in my opinion ( I almost never order desert and liked desert voluntarily) 4.5 The price is very reasonable -- not outrageously high because of being part of the touristic area. 5. The view is great if you could get the window seat (we did not, but we can still see because of the large windows the restaurant has).  All in all, I will come back here to try more food, and I recommend you as well even if you are not a tourist :)

4cGYSDQcWaC8ZArnAjlt4A.review_text: Don't let the location fool you, it's quality food. I have to say that I was bit worried about the food not being great with the restaurant located in such a touristy area. My whole family was VERY happy with everything about this restaurant.  After our tiring tour of Alcatraz, we were hungry and ready for diner. While our reservation wasn't for another 1/2 hour, they were happy to seat us when we arrived.  The ambiance, food, and service was superb. I'd be happy to bring any of my friends, including the pickiest foodies I know, to this restaurant and know they'd be happy.

TSamC_J_XBRMwjqSl6ckNw.review_text: We love fog harbor and dirk he makes us feel like we are at a 5 star restaurant and the food is wonderful.

1HwFUhq-7hhao7io_F6zZQ.review_text: Food was average, not worth what we paid. Our waitress was really good and took care of our needs just wish I could say said the food was great! My lobster Mac and cheese was okay, the noodles were too over cooked and my husbands seafood cioppino didn't have enough seafood in it.

uRPrG5Y74o9-YuMLU60i6Q.review_text: Food was delicious, pricey but not too much! Definitely going back soon. The atmosphere was great considering how busy it is at Pier 39, the waiters/waitresses were very nice and we had a great view! Planning my next visit for my husband's birthday.

qiA5QI85-A2WB5lKRlyCIQ.review_text: Vacationing in San Francisco and we hit pier 39 on our first day. We were starving and read all the excellent reviews so we settled in here. We're San Diego natives so we're no strangers to fresh, delicious seafood. This place was neither. We ordered clam chowder, fried shrimp & a shrimp & crab sandwich. Clam chowder was mediocre at best. Fried shrimp was good. Sandwich was alright. The spoon that came with my soup was wet with a brown colored substance. I smelled it and it was unmistakably coffee. Not sure I even want to think about how that happened. Nothing, besides the dirty spoon, stood out to us. I kinda felt like this restaurant thinks it can just serve anything simply because it's on pier 39. Not impressed. The fact that my spoon had coffee on it did this place in. I just can't get past that.

hT_6LivVyUu_oSrvTCRhgw.review_text: Was there yesterday, had reservations through Open Table, we got a table with a view.  Food was fresh and flavorful.  I had the salmon with spinach.  Great kids menu, very family friendly. Would love to go back soon.

qIJNQ5dyC6g6iIPIUGyVxA.review_text: We were starving and after looking around settled on this place.  I give this place points for ambience and style. The views are great. The place looks great. Makes you feel nice.  The food not so good. My opinion of course. I got to sample their clam chowder and i have definitely had better. I also ordered the swordfish which I was satisfied with but not wholly impressed. I think its probably due to my lack of understanding upscale food. I enjoy flavorful dishes and this was not it unfortunately. On the upside it was like steak as far as texture.  Go here for romance. not so much for flavorful food. That you should go down the street to the street vendors.

-bobL18AC3QdzPTkaCFe2w.review_text: We had the best lunch. The crab salad was full of flavor and no skimping on the crab. Lol.  The chicken sandwich was awesome. Not a bad price either!

D_ryvDT7qycNkhM_kgFlSw.review_text: I tried their clam chowder. It was thick but not flavorful enough. However I like their big chunk of clam. However it was not the best clam chowder I ever had. Make sure you try their sourdough bread though.

6Y8wWRHkG0hs0EcO6YDiVw.review_text: If your feeling a little fancy and have a little extra money to spare... Treat yourself to a wonderful lunch or dinner here! The restaurant is beautiful and the view looking out to the ocean is amazing! The food was fabulous and our waiter was very pleasant.

DsmZGssuJciBZR-SAPSyzQ.review_text: Just got back from a vacation to San Francisco and we could not have been happier with the food and service here. We went here after a hop on hop off tour and really wanted a nice sit down meal. We had the jumbo shrimp cocktail, mussels cooked the way they make the clams (per my cousins request), clam chowder, and crab cakes. Everything was fresh, reasonably priced (even the drinks), and service was excellent. We made several recommendations when people asked us where to eat at Pier 39. I will definitely be going back.

wzrlw1odTzLz0kTCZ6jtnA.review_text: I found Fog Harbor on trusty Yelp and was very excited to go! I made a reservation for 7:30 on a Wednesday and had to change it to 8 which was no problem. The restaurant was decently full too. And a giant party of about 50 people came in right after us.   My boyfriend and I were seated at a very nice table, I had a glass of house Chardonnay and he had an Arnold Palmer. It was so difficult to choose what to order and two waiters overheard us trying to decide and at separate times chimed in with recommendations, which was nice.   I ended up ordering the Shrimp Scampi, delicious, with mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables. My boyfriend ordered the whole lobster which was also delicious. It came with an ear of corn that was grilled and he opted to get the mashed potatoes with it.   For desert I ordered the creme brulee. The melted sugar on top was a little burnt in areas but it was still satifying. My boyfriend ordered a pumpkin spice cake thing, it was good but we can't remember the name!  We had a very pleasant experience at Fog Harbor and I look forward to returning!

J56rIb3SXeHdPAt0dWuE-A.review_text: Came here for dinner after graduation with no reservations so I was pleased that we were able to be seated within 15 minutes. It's true, the views are beautiful and the food is even better. We started off with the mouthwatering clam chowder. It was honestly amazing and then I had the mixed grill which was also great, along with a wonderful glass of sparking Pinot Noir. The service was great and I had an overall wonderful experience!

Gqt6W2mZfcZ2WE6G69wM7Q.review_text: Food was great and service was excellent... Although our waiter seemed a bit quick and didn't hear us a couple times because it got a little hectic, in the end we had a great night and great service.

y_qBQ4oWQI1dJnCUBI8sig.review_text: Excellent food and relaxing, yet fun atmosphere with beautiful view at Pier 39. Greeted by friendly bartender while waiting for our table! Unfortunately our waiter wasn't so friendly... He acted like we were doing him a favor, a bit snooty. We didn't let it ruin our evening and would definitely return!

y3_O4sMF2v6vuTZM_FfqGw.review_text: Very good seafood.  Clam chowder was excellent.  A little pricey, however.  I would have given it a higher rating except the waiter was VERY pushy in trying to offer us extra things.   I felt like he was trying to "up-sell" us the entire time.  It was very annoying.

oOKmH21_BAghPtXCGC7HDQ.review_text: creme brulee!  great food  great service   great location  *ask for Micheal :)

tTHzLMuhjatBE8CZ-L5ZUg.review_text: I was very pleased with my visit! I was not used to the great customer service that I got because most places that I've been to since moving to San Jose, service sucks lol   I had the Fried Shrimp w/ fries and THE BEST CLAM CHOWDER EVER!   I definitely recommend this place for clam chowder and their whole menu actually looked pretty good!

2caNOaOLWoCL-nLzap-D0Q.review_text: After a trip to the Golden Gate Bridge and then an unexpected rdse to San Rafael transit station to retrieve my GoPro I left on the bus (dummy me) we decided to eat an early dinner. We ventured upon the Fog Harbor Fish House. From the moment we walked in and were seated at a window table with a beautiful view of Alcatraz, I knew we were in for a delightful time. Our server, Niessa, was so friendly and prompt with everything we ordered. From our drinks to appetizers and our main course, it was excellent! We highly recommend the Fog Harbor AND if you can get Neissa as your server, it will be extra special!

uO21Oi5nmXCeEQJOm28lQA.review_text: Probably one of the best seafood dinners I've ever had, plus an amazing view. We got the crab cake appetizer and seafood platter for two. AMAZING. My only complaint is that Yelp gave this place a $$ when it really should be $$$.

mWc9qiV9EAFPuJAi1AGYOg.review_text: Food was okay...service was horrible.  At a tourist place I understand that service isn't going to be spectacular, but when the waiter is gone for long periods of time and you have to go to the bar to pay the bill because he's vanished, that's a bad thing.  Plus, he tried to tack on an extra $8 to the bill and insinuated that my GF's parents didn't understand how tipping worked.   Because of his rudeness and slowness, I left a very small tip and wrote "SLOW SERVICE" next to the small tip just so he knew that his bad tip wasn't because of the foreigners that he was obviously prejudiced against didn't know how to tip.

aGjisfSYiO-83h_ZHkDptA.review_text: I love fresh salmon at Fog Harbor! Amazing taste and fresh ;) also they have the best clam chowder in the city. Love this place!

gPlJ1ukVVi0Ahex2SzjZug.review_text: Clam chowder - delicious! Ahi tune Poke - not so much. I literally had 2 bites and couldn't force myself to eat it. The waiter was super nice, when he asked me how I like it I was honest and said I didn't care for it. He saw that I barely even touched it and didn't end up charging me for it - that is some good customer service skills! I would go back to try other food on the menu.

dZLPQUDQQ5AjhPHx6nWP-A.review_text: Seafood is excellent, staff is very nice and polite. A bit too expensive, visit "Welcome California Center" to get a discount card.

xon12FQ3dQY_xM6NK_2fig.review_text: The setting is nice since it's in Pier 39 but I couldn't help but feel that it was simply another typical SF Seafood restaurant. Not going to lie, the clam chowder was pretty bomb and the warm sourdough bread was super yummy but they were disorganized with our table and seating even after we had made reservations.   If you're in the area it's a good place to try but I wouldn't go out of my way to try to eat here.

HPJY5cQ7Za6Hi07eB3gvZA.review_text: I have never been to this location but the samples I've had at a travel convention on Alcatraz was delicious.  I believe it was Ahi Tuna Tartar with a hint of cavier.  Needless to say, I went back for seconds.  At the event, they handed out little pocket size menus - very good idea.  Of course they do chowders, salads, sandwiches, pastas, rib eye etc.  Located at Pier 39.  Has live lobster and crab tank, it says.  Someplace I'll check out eventually.

6ztcNrsWEOeixrjOzZsg4g.review_text: Our waiter, Jason, made my mom's birthday a stellar experience!! He is awesome, the food was great. Happy Birthday written on the table when we arrived. Wine and cocktails, bread fresh from the oven, at the table right away, my brother is vegetarian and he gave him great off menu options, kids were picky he made them happy, Cioppino was amazing, lobster tail YUM, clam chowder, crab cakes all delicious, birthday dessert with a candle... great view of the bay and sea lions. Seriously, this was an amazing night. Thank you Fog Harbor team and especially Jason!

JBTkuuLDg-BMAiRAjNwaYg.review_text: I ordered the seared ahi and it was outstanding. I have eaten a lot of ahi..even in Tokyo and this was the best. I had  requested a table by a window with a view and that's exactly what they gave us. Great service, food and atmosphere's doesn't get any better.  Dave

NpmaZccw7SCCn6KI1nT9aA.review_text: We were at the wharf for the afternoon and decided to grab a late lunch here based on the yelp reviews. I had the Ahi Poke appetizer and the Grilled Shrimp Brochette. Both of them were very good! The service was okay but not overly impressive. The ambiance and views of the water were great, although the windows needed a good cleaning (the amount of bird poop on them was gross). The 4 stars is strictly for the quality of the food.

CqJVkZYzNiPgOVaOB1bMdw.review_text: Complete tourist restaurant. My friends were in from out of town and of course they wanted to eat in Fisherman's Wharf. My fish and chips were probably the most bland I've ever had. The service was pretty bad and our server was very rude. I waited tables for a long time and splitting checks sucks I admit but you don't have to be rude about it.   Only reason I would consider giving it a star is because the bartender seems to be the only one who showed up to work.. great mojitos!  Skip it!

yBkMMjXlQCEl7hiIGhQYgw.review_text: I've been here before with my brother a couple years ago and was excited to visit again. I enjoyed the ambiance, friendly staff and excellent food. As some of the other reviews I've read, I agree that it does feel a little crowded, but I appreciate that the food makes up for anything I could say.   Our view was fantastic, right near the window. I ordered the Cajun shrimp and ham pasta: excellent! Highly recommend. Overall, a very pleasant evening and dinning experience!

Hw5riZfnB-B7G79vBTOssA.review_text: Came here for dinner on a recent trip to San Fran. What a gorgous view of the ocean! We were seated right next to the window with a great view of the water and Alcatraz.  We ordered to appetizers to start with, the scallops and the squid. Both were breaded but it was the lemon aioli that was the star!   I ordered the cup of clam chowder and half a garlic dungenous crab (as it was in season!). The clam chowder was probably one of the best I have ever had, and I grew up along the coast so I have alot of clam chowders in my life! The crab was also very good. A bit smaller than I was picturing but with the clam chowder, I was full!  Out of all the restaurants along that pier, this one seemed the least touristy and Im glad we stopped in!

5BHovY0BbAJVvb1SSSax_w.review_text: Fantastic food and view!!  Loved the crab mango avocado cerviche, delicious salmon and the fish and chips!  Generous portion of fresh baked bread and beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz. Our server Niessa was super-fantastic!  The place is to the left just as you enter Pier 31 so great location.

3xRujHoCjgfC8Y8qDo9Juw.review_text: We were visiting San Francisco for our anniversary and wanted to dine on amazing sea food.  We did that at Fog Harbor.  We shared a whole crab and clam chowder.  Not only was the food amazing but the staff was equally as amazing!!!!!  Thank you to our waitress, Shawna, for giving us ideas of other spots to go and making our anniversary dinner special!!!

l0KvprRA3hCe3rYpJierQw.review_text: Half of our party were not seafood lovers but everyone was happy! Steak and chicken were amazing. Sea food was also great according to those who had it. Kids loved their portions. Got a great table with a view of the bay! Ambiance was great, casual but not too casual and fancy but not pretentious. We walked in off the street and were seated in less than 5 minutes. Would

EscG72AIyZjhztifzXUN2Q.review_text: How is this place rated so  highly?   1. Service, not good. Hostess was super snotty because I made the reservation online for the wrong day. I could understand her being upset except that there were tables everywhere. Our  server "Clementine" sucked. Forgot my soup, took forever to get me butter for my crab, took forever to bring us dessert. She was scattered and sloppy and sloooow. I wouldn't have tipped her more than 10% but my friend was paying. Left the check before we were done, tacky.   2. The chowder, umm wth? Voted the best in SF? Not even close. If you look at the reviews everyone who rates it highly is a tourist.   3. The food, the crab was good but my friend's halibut was way over cooked and the pumpkin dessert sucked.  I would never be back especially for the prices.

wf924SjCjgJQzh0vzTxMNA.review_text: Not a bad seafood restaurant - although way overpriced, the view off of Pier 39 makes up for it. The service is attentive, and the food was pretty decent. I tried the Ahi Tuna Poke, which was fresh but under seasoned. I also tried bites of the calamari and several pasta dishes, which were all very good. It's a good place to go as a tourist.

d-LgUpezH27EGLA7-hAaYw.review_text: The only reason I'm giving this three stars is for the food. Our service was great at the very beginning of the dinner but as the evening went on.... it went on and on and on. After finally getting our food, it was another while to get the drink refilled, and another while to get plates cleared, and then a really long while to get the bill. We had great sea food but if you go, make sure and block off the evening.

d5IXMuFIZHBpTe20jmYJmQ.review_text: Awesome Moscow mule served just right in a copper mug.  We did not eat here because it was more touristy then what we were looking for hat night.  Seemed very busy so I assume the food is good.  They had a nice looking menu.

IucvvxdQXXhjQ4z6Or6Nrw.review_text: Wow, the fresh sourdough bread is the bomb here.  They apparently make it fresh every 20 minutes.   I am not a fan of eating in this area given the large crowds of tourists. Fog Harbor however is a little oasis in the middle of all the madness. Everything we ordered was pretty good. The views of the water are pretty spectacular too. Definitely a better option than Hard Rock and other tourist traps nearby.   Tip - you can get 20% if you purchase $20 worth in the gift shop downstairs.

sBJbjgvRSgASUf_jng9DFQ.review_text: My favorite restaurant on pier 39! Located on the second level of pier 39, Fog Harbor Fish House offers great food, decent prices as well as good service. I've eaten here about 5-6 times and I've been impressed each time. The food here is very good. I highly recommend the filet mignon with mashed potatoes and spinach. It is my favorite item on the menu and since I am such a potato lover, they replace my spinach for an extra side of mashed potatoes. I've also had the salmon, steamed clams (an appetizer) calamari, popcorn shrimp and clam chowder, all of which are delicious. The food is fairly priced.   The service is good, the waiters/waitresses are very friendly and attentive. They also seem very knowledgable about the menu and will give recommendations and suggestions. I remember going there one time with my friends, our waiter was so sweet he hooked us up with free dessert and put it on the check as a "free birthday dessert" -- awesome!   Definitely recommend this restaurant! One of my favorites -- I am even planning on going tomorrow night!!   One last side note: while waiting for a table you can sit outside on the couches by the fireplace and order drinks from the bar while you wait.

IvOjSn_Pj9aLwXtio4u-1g.review_text: This place is wonderful. Great views, prompt service, and delicious food. Husband had some kind of seafood platter/sampler that had crab, shrimp, mussels, clams, etc etc...it was all REALLY good and cooked perfectly.  Everything was really fresh and seasoned well.  I had the crab linguine, and it was probably the best seafood pasta I've ever eaten.  The creamy sauce was light but rich, and the crab was perfect.  The only disappointment at this place was the dated wine list....apparently they were out of the wine we ordered, and had been out of it for almost 6 months! Definitely not a huge deal, but just a heads up!

dyVupcaxLUrQnrqmYVktGQ.review_text: 4 stars for the food! If you're in the area you need to try their clam chowder that comes in the freshly baked bread bowl. It's the best you're going to get in SF. The dungeness crab is very good too.  I will say that their service (particularly the hostess staff) need to get over themselves. They are very stuck up. Ignore them. I promise the food is worth it.

dV4RJbS5AARppHnAFAHUTA.review_text: My waiter's name is Khaiman and he was very good. The food was very well prepared and he had nice suggestions. Next time I'll try the crab ceviche. The environment is good and the view is fantastic.  BTW: I got a free garlic bread with blue cheese only by checking in here at Yelp!

mrJhMCpyMhtHWTT7C9a3gg.review_text: Went here for dinner on a whim... Ordered the garlic butter crab... AMAZING!! The view and the ambiance really set the tone for my mini getaway with my love. The clam crowder was to die for!! Khaiman was a great waiter attentive and helpful.

ODsM6-_BvHt6-cqNylJn7g.review_text: I'm really going to have a hard time with this review as I actually really did enjoy the food, but it was easily the worst service I've had in a decent amount of time.   Not sure if they were having a hard time adjusting for the Labor Day tourists, but when you have to ask for ketchup three times from three different servers, you know things aren't going well.   I had the crab roll which was great. Gf had the ahi tuna which was also great. Mom had the mixed grill which wasn't too bad. It's a typical seafood place located within the tourist utopia that is Fisherman's Wharf.   We had a nice gentleman who was taking care of us while our server was on break, and he was fantastic. Once he left things really took a hit. Our server was nice, but we barely saw her. We had oyster shells on our table for nearly 30 minutes. 30 minutes. They normally take those away within minutes.   It's a nice location, with pretty good food, but they really need to step up the service.

6qDzLUSMjjI0WHGgF5KJxQ.review_text: Okay food. Over priced meals due to the location. Took some friends from out of town and they were very disappointed due to the very slow service. I would not recommend and won't be back. Staff was not as eager as I would hope from such a pricey spot.

ClKlBmJcV5haeh42rBy_og.review_text: Boyfriend was in town from Chicago, so I made him be a tourist with me.  Went to Pier 39 to check out the sea lions, and then stopped in here for some clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl.  Did not disappoint.  Thought they might judge us for just stopping in for some wine and to share some soup, but the server was nothing but nice.

GyepZybb28J5unnKjV3a_g.review_text: Nice location and great food. The service was also good. Good choice of wine and great desert. The desert menu is rather limited, but they have really good stuff. We recommend a table next to the window enjoying the sunset ;) Good price/quality ratio

4_o8AzCFalr09BpOaFTqvA.review_text: This restaurant was "A-OK."  There was really nothing special about the restaurant.  It was a nice atmosphere, the bread was good.  My husband loved the clam chowder bowl and the wine was nice.  However, the food was okay.  The vegetables were far too greasy and oily for my preference.

t9I2QZ5Cwkvq_plNIOVCrA.review_text: Nice view/very nice and classy ambiance  Great selections  Friendly and professional staff  Very tasty (Serves daily caught fish less than 3 miles away)   SOURDOUGH BREAD = TO DIE FOR

z_jyjDtboP9uqw8p582hAA.review_text: ...not sure if it was the happy hour food or what, but this place was just ok.  Nothing to brag on that I recall.  We did have the calamari and it was decent, but i've had better.  I've even had better from an asian restaurant.  We also had some shrimp that was like out of the oven or something.  I wasn't impressed.  Next time I think we will eat off the dinner menu.

-K_YNEARt02MULbbBWvCag.review_text: We thought we had  a very good experience at the Franciscan...well, we topped it at the fog harbor. The crab clam chowder is EXcELLENT! And to top it off: great view of the harbor, great service and a very first: view on the sea lions of the San Francisco Bay! I thought it was going to be touristy: it was, but the quality was there too!

YYU7ge_UTRRz3OsuxI3owQ.review_text: We got a great table, not by the window but it still had a great view of the bay.  The server that we got was excellent.  She was very attentive to our needs and making sure that everything was good.  The food was very good and reasonably priced for the area.  I definitely recommend this place.

RASYB8uzgZlIWHzSGrsq2A.review_text: Great food. Better atmosphere . I was dining with the Webdoc. Peter had the Dungeness crab and I blackened swordfish. Portions were good, quality even better. Nice view from the window. Shawn our waiter was on top of it and tended to every detail. Get a window table and enjoy!

yH7Sg5zMDpOYTGoS-I63XA.review_text: Amazing location, average American menu, decent service and decent prices ($15-25 / person) for the area.  The clam chowder was a bit gritty, which was very unfortunate, but everything else was prepared perfectly and tasted delicious.  I think this is one of the better places to take the family or go on a date, if you're on Pier 39 and want to steer clear of the usual chain restaurants.

xxneUsUNNYdbr2Ukh_yQlw.review_text: So, we went to Alcatraz on Saturday and wanted to have lunch in the city. We decided to walk down to Pier 39 and spotted Fog Harbor (formerly Chic's) The front waiting area had a lovely fireplace with waterfalls on either side. It was very inviting, so we went in.  The place is all white tablecloths and beautiful views. It was semi-crowded and smelled really good.  Our waitress Claudia was extemely friendly and helpful. She brought our drinks right away and sourdough bread just out of the oven. Yum! We all ordered crab dishes. When in San Francisco you have to get the seafood, yes?  I had the Bloody Mary (spicy), it was decent. The bf had the Angel Island Iced-Tea, he said was very refreshing. Some of us ordered the crab melt. The crab was delicious and the fries were hot and crispy. The bf ordered the crab louie...it was huge! He ate the crab and said it was good. My niece ordered the fried combo (shrimp, calamari and deep-fried fish)...another big portion. I didn't try any but everyone else did so it must have been good.  All in all a pleasant dining experience. Great service. Good food. Great view. The best company. A little pricey, but hey, it's the city. It was worth it.  If you are in the area of Pier 39, give Fog Harbor a try.  P.S. Alcatraz was a lot of fun. Should have gone there years ago.

TO5UgRsX9tLWdDp6f27w7A.review_text: Love Love Love !!!  Excellent: sourdough bread, blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder!  Highly recommend!!

-K1oPGyqUyOwE2Q7humQ4A.review_text: Really good food and great ambiance. Shared the calamari app and seared tuna entree.. both tasty!  Also, the warm sourdough bread they bring is fantastic!  Would recommend to someone in the area looking for a quick/tasty bite!

IfHplx86fRtsyQiyELmo8Q.review_text: Dinner was FANTASTIC!    I live in SF, but my bff was visiting, so we wanted to go somewhere fancy.  We split: the crab risotto fritters as an appetizer, the swordfish as an entree, and the apple crumble for dessert.  Literally all of it was delicious, particularly the fritters.  That and the swordfish was as light and fantastically cooked as I have ever seen it.  Our waitress Brenda was also lovely about splitting our portions.  She even had the kitchen put our entree on two separate plates.  We came in ~5:30 on a Saturday and didn't need to wait for a table of two and everything came out of the kitchen very promptly.

uaQW0HU1MV2jJ7rdl9vYqQ.review_text: 3.5 stars...I just came from a company sponsored event at Fog Harbor Fish House.    The teasers served were incredible!  Lamb, to die for, crab cakes yes I'll have another and the peanut chicken skewers amazing!  I also feasted on the Cesar salad, and prime rib. Everything was really good but I had to give 3.5 stars because I didn't have the dining experience which can be different from a catered event.  Nonetheless everything I had was incredible! They just remodeled and the space is beautiful.  This restaurant is worth a visit just for the views alone.

G5HELqHfNfC02ToA8NVQHg.review_text: The location is nice but the food is way overpriced and not very good. We had 2 cocktails, 2 sodas, order of oysters, filet, lobster tail and swordfish. The bill was $200.00 (not including tip). The oysters were the only decent item on the list. The lobster was chewy and lacked flavor, the steak was bland and the swordfish was drowned in sauce. All of the veggies/potatoes that came with the meals were overcooked. The service was good but not great. I wouldn't go back again.

cli9Bd60dp9TYnJ5kDz47A.review_text: The service, at Fog Harbor, was absolutely horrific.  However, I've never experienced such amazing damage control.  A resident of North Beach, I would never recommend one to eat near or around Fisherman's Wharf, the biggest tourist trap in the world.  However, this experience proved that there is simply an exception to every rule, as my friends and I truly enjoyed our dinner.  The sourdough bread loaf was absolutely amazing, and complimented the broth of our dinners.  The dungeness crab was to die for, and I will forever be a fan!  While I once lived in Santa Barbara, we made sure to purchase many rock crab during the season, which we all felt could not be matched.  Fog Harbor proved me wrong, and I would be happy to bring future guests and friends to this venue.

qE6ESN3gF_ax_4ZtaR-giw.review_text: Fog Harbor Fish House- you were great. I wanted to celebrate my actual birthday dinner by the water to get a nice view of the sunset but unfortunately mother nature wasn't on board with my plans. Either way the hostess was friendly and sat us by a window. The restaurant does cater to the tourist who are wandering around Pier 39. It has a romantic-feel to it--too bad I was with my best friend!   Our  waiter was super friendly and attentive throughout the entire night. We checked in and got free garlic bread to start off with. We ordered our glasses of wine and I already knew what i wanted since I Yelped their menu. I had the mixed grill which comes with salmon, swordfish, and shrimp-mashed potatoes and broccoli. The salmon wasn't great-it was a bit overcooked but the rest of the dish was super filling. The waiter came over and told us to text a number regarding the service and we would get  a free dessert--uh no problem! It was delicious and left me incapable of moving. They really take pride in their service which left me feeling happy!

zgD5m_3BspN9HdJhu0aYDg.review_text: I'm an SF resident and try to stay clear of Fisherman's Wharf, but I was taken here on a business lunch. It surprised me because it was so good. I thought it wouldn't be that great since it is such a touristy restaurant. But the food tasted fresh & was delicious.

9gDhzWjsloW5AZck_uSwQg.review_text: Tourist trap. Nothing special if you live in SF. Dollar sign should actually be 3 $$$ for this restaurant. Service was great.

cRACPOyTRYkbjvv5PMQuKQ.review_text: My gf and I were in SF for the Daniel Tosh tour and asked our friend for dinner suggestions.  First on her list was Fog Harbor, so we decided to give it a try.   I saw a long wait list and wasn't too thrilled about that.  To our surprise it was just a 15 minute wait on a Saturday evening. We were seated and perused the menu to see what I would like to feast upon for dinner.  Our server Khaiman took our drink and appetizer orders.   When he came back I asked him what was the popular item on the menu.  He immediately said the shellfish platter is a popular item as well as their mixed grill and a couple other items.  I ordered the shellfish platter and my gf the mixed grilled.  Khaiman recommended she get it Cajun flavored for the fish and he was right, but more on that later.  We were given some fresh sourdough bread with our appetizers and it was amazing. We had the Dungeness crab, mango and avocado ceviche and while good, it wasn't amazing or to die for.   We also decided to each get a cup of their clam chowder.  This is a definite must have and something I would get again. Nice flavor with a good amount of clams.  It's not overloaded with fillers like potatoes that other restaurants utilize. Now for the main course.  The Shellfish platter came with 1/2 a Dungeness crab, mussels, clams, shrimp, and corn.  All of those was drenched in a garlic and herb oil that put this dish over the top.  I love garlic so it was like this dish was made for me.  Everything was fresh and cooked just right.  Price was fair considering what was included.   The mixed grill my gf had was amazing.  The Cajun flavoring wasn't spicy or over powering. It complimented the salmon, swordfish, and shrimp well.  Something I'd recommend to order if you prefer fish over shellfish.  We opted out of dessert cause we were quite stuffed and couldn't possibly eat another bite.   When Khaiman brought out our bill he included some biscoff cookies to enjoy at the show.   I should mention I ordered a Moscow Mule to sip on during dinner.  I'm picky since I make my own mules often and they did it right.  Perfect balance of ginger beer and vodka which made it a refreshing beverage. Of course it was served in a copper mug which every mule should be.  We have a wonderful experience at Fog Harbor and will be back once we visit Frisco again.  If you have a chance stop by and you won't be disappointed.  Oh and if you can get Khaiman as your server. He won't steer you wrong and will make sure your glass is always full.

VFKmKsk2rCueQb1mc245NQ.review_text: The service is great, the people were super nice and friendly. I like how they give customers a sample of wine without asking or anything, which I guess is a form of marketing. The clam chowder s really good, creamy and chunky, although there isn't really anything about it that makes it particularly any better than other places. Their baked oysters look really good, on a bed of sea salt, but it tasted slightly weird. I didn't enjoy it as much as I had anticipated. For the entree, I had the cioppino, and I have to say, it was really, very good. I like my foods more on the acidic side, so the tang of the tomatoes were perfect for me. There is a lot of crab meat, the serving size is fairly large, and the celery in it was dynamite. The fish in the cioppino was alright, some pieces better than others, so the consistency wasn't always there. The crostini that comes with the cioppino was kind of small, but was rubbed with great herbs and spices. All in all, a good experience, especially with the spaciousness and the view.

EeNxafbMAJg7m4mIe1h95A.review_text: We were in the San Francisco area and decided to try out the Fog House. We ordered two bowls of clam chowder, the crab cakes, and the poke. We requested that the clam chowder came out first and I tried with all my might to stop eating it to leave room for the other stuff, but it was too yummy. Although it wasn't quite as rich as chowder usually is. The crab cakes were also good. The poke had a unique mango flavor and paired well with the filling chowder. Overall the food was really good. We will definitely be going back if we find ourselves in the area. I would say that the one thing everyone going here has to order is that clam chowder.

Srex-j9ahjTn-R4WPMhbgg.review_text: Anchor Steam Beer Batter Fish and Chips is ON!

MmjjoK9jSx1weZBAyDzV3A.review_text: Overpriced and service was below par. I was on business and stopped in for a nice meal but apparently they don't think a single person is worth any attention. I was seated right next to the door so whenever people were leaving or entering (which was every few minutes) a cold gust of wind would hit me. The waitress, Brenda, also did not seem I was good enough for attention so she barely provided service. I received my salad first, which the romaine hearts were brown at the tips so I had to cut them off. Then the wine that came several minutes later had visible lint around the whole goblet. The water with lemon I asked for never came. The main dish was okay, but the fish was dry around the edges. Not the food I expected right on the water. After asking 2 more times for water and already halfway through my meal, a manager stopped by and asked how my meal was. I told him that I was still waiting for the water I asked for 3 times. He quickly brought out water and I was grateful. After another few minutes, I finally see Brenda with a glass of water (no lemon) and she scowled as she saw that there was a glass already on my table. She took my water to someone else and I heard her ask very loudly if anyone else would like water....really? With an empty water glass in front of me, Brenda drops off my check - which I had not yet asked for. I really wanted to leave no tip because I felt so unwanted by Brenda but my guilt took over and I left her a around 17%. When I got up to leave, Brenda stood there and said nothing to me (not even a "have a good night"!) As I was pushing the door, I looked back to see Brenda opening the check book in front of my table to see what tip I left her. At that moment I really wish I would have left her nothing and should have asked for a discount based on horrible attitude and treatment from Brenda. Truly despicable. I am never going to return. I think I'll stick inland or go back to Neptune's.

BDlZK7jcR0NZF9PjB2Yxcg.review_text: Food and service was ok. I feel that you are paying more for the location.  Wasn't a terrible experience, but it wasn't a great experience. I'm on the fence about this place.  My friends said they enjoyed it though..so maybe it was just me.

6-eHXK3LNXyqHoLwqpzxVQ.review_text: The wife and I went to see the America's Cup and, while the decor, the service and view were sensational, the food was mediocre at best. I had the calamrai and while the amount was huge, it was warm at best and heavily breaded and not having much taste. My wife had the sole which was also lacking in taste..  Not sure we will be back

HGTdyEDygTqANThO64WDWQ.review_text: Came here after walking the area and the menu and view looked good from afront. It is a white table cloth type of place with large windows and a view from almost every table. The bar scene was vibrant but we were at a table. There was no wait as compared to other places with a wait. Perhaps because they are located upstairs, people don't know about it.  I had the bread chowder bowl and a crab cocktail.
