The crab cocktail was small for the price. They give you really good sourdough bread while you wait. The service was friendly. All in all, a good experience.

CNlud2-t1JN2ADjiMliV5Q.review_text: This place was awesome! The clam chowder in the bread bowl was delicious and we topped it off with some hot chocolate cake, perfect ending to a perfect meal. Our server was Meron and she was really nice and had great suggestions. I'd definitely recommend coming here, even if only for the views of Alcatraz or the bridge!

FCT2AcooXjMtoHTsEUTDrA.review_text: Horrible place and awful service. My wife and I and another couple had a bottle of wine at the bar while we waited for our table and the bartender was very rude and unpleasant. Then we were seated and given menus and not 5 minutes later the manager came over and said they would not serve us any more drinks. At no point were we rude or obnoxious. I guess the bartender was having a bad day and needed to take it out on someone. Overall the service and atmosphere was severely lacking.

VXRhvAIuj5kdIJ_eJX6Q_g.review_text: Food was great. Started off with blue cheese baked garlic bread on sourdough and bowl if clam chowder. For the main course, we ordered the porterhouse steak special and subbed it with the whiskey peppercorn sauce....amazing and steak was tender and juicy! Also got the fried combo....calamari, fried shrimp with a medley of bomb aiolis! Khaiman, our server was awesome.

wlZDmZvRFXSSSuMlKzLXng.review_text: Very upscale restaurant!  More so than I was expecting.  We tried the Dungeness Crab Cocktail for an appetizer - very fresh!  The clam chowder soup was outstanding.  So creamy and delicious.  I had the special lobster roll for my main dish and it was great.  Good pieces of lobster.  Stuffed when we left!  Service was only ok, but food was great!  312/365

hQWqpqGP55800W73iPp-DQ.review_text: We went here after going on the Alcatraz Cruise. The service was excellent! Khaiman, our server, provided us with delicious recommendations and some welcomed advise about the surrounding area. We definitely suggest trying the clam chowder. If you've had the clam chowder from Pike Market it is just as good. Great service, great food!!!

hJWQ_8bDOKtojl9E3X9I0Q.review_text: Everything was fantastic. Service was great. Food was way better than expected. Clam chowder bread bowl was some of the best I've had. Make sure you order extra jalapeno aoili for added flavor for the already good fish and chips.

P9oukNXsAUzsn1YDq1n0Aw.review_text: Well this was a pleasant surprise. After pounding the pavement all day as a tourist we just wanted a decent meal before heading home. I figured any restaurant on Pier 39 would be, more or less, a tourist trap and didn't expect much from Fog Harbor Fish House.  We had no reservation so they quoted a 45 minute wait. It was actually really nice lounging by their awesome outdoor fireplace and sipping drinks from the bar. But after an hour, we still weren't seated and I got cranky. When we finally got seated they plunked us down at what is clearly the worst table in the place: poor view, low to the ground, and uncomfortable seating. When the waitress asked how we were doing, I couldn't help venting a little bit, and she handled it politely and professionally.  Now's where the good stuff starts. A few minutes later a guy comes to our table and says "please follow me". Apparently the waitress told the manager of our displeasure and he took matters into his own hands by moving us to a totally rad table with a killer view. We shot the shit with guy for a while since he once lived in Santa Cruz and suddenly we were in a much better mood!  The food was all fantastic. I think they make their own sourdough here as it was hot and fresh. I ordered the garlic roasted dungeoness crab which was huge and delicious. I think the kitchen will clean it for you for an extra charge, but I donned the bib and did all the work myself which was actually an entertainment of its own.  For my 7 year old daughter, they were happy to do a simple mahi over rice instead of fish and chips which was just perfect.  In retrospect, walking into a nice restaurant on a warm Saturday night in SF without a reservation was a dumb move on my part. They should probably be trying to overestimate the seating times rather than underestimate them, but people make mistakes.  The main takeaway for me is that 1) the staff here clearly gives a shit about their patrons 2) they communicate well enough to do something about it when someone's not happy and 3) the seafood here is awesome.

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: 3.5 stars  We went to Pier 39 for the live music - specifically for Tainted Love.  Got there early and thought some oysters would be nice.  Fog Harbor is one of the nicer place on the Pier.  The front open space is spacious, modern and the fireplace is a nice touch.  We had no idea the restaurant is huge - there are a lot of tables in the back.  We grabbed the first booth seat in the front and settled in.  Our waiter, Khaiman? was very friendly and great at selling.  What we had:  Anchor Steam - $6.23 glass of Prosecco - $8.5 1/2 dozen oyster (2x) - $13 - from Prince Edwards Island.  These were very good, plump, sweet, creamy and fresh.  I can probably eat a couple dozens easily. curry mussels - $12 - pretty good, nice curry flavor with plenty garlic clam chowder - ordered a bowl mainly because of the Yelp reviews but what a disappointment.  It was chalky and not very flavorful.  Since we didn't eat it, they took it off our bill.  The dessert tray looked very tempting - the bread pudding with Ghiradelli chocolate chips looked quite good.

aPXKEuJLx6FQREFXEtGUWw.review_text: Sometimes it's a blast to head down to Pier 39 or Fisherman's Wharf and hang out with the throngs of tourists. Fog Harbor is a classy restaurant with gorgeous views in the middle of tourist central. I mean seriously, you can't get a better view than this! It also helped that after a gloomy summer, even by San Francisco standards, we had an epic weekend of beautiful weather!  To start we ordered the Red Chili Garlic Prawns and the Ahi Tuna 2 ways. The prawns were succulent and tasty and this dish definitely took me to the outer edges of my spice tolerance. The Ahi Tuna appetizer was sesame "poke" style with fried wonton and Cajun seared with cayenne aioli. The tuna on the crispy wonton with the creamy sauce was a cool and creamy antidote for my taste buds which were still recovering from the red chili garlic prawns.  For my entree I ordered the Salmon BLT served on a toasted french roll with a pesto aioli. I almost never finish an entire entree, but I couldn't put this thing down! Bacon truly is the miracle meat that goes great with just about anything. The sandwich came with fries and it was an extremely generous portion, I didn't come close to finishing all of them.  My dinner companion ordered the Garlic Roasted Crab, it's a roasted half crab cooked in a garlic herb butter. I didn't try this dish as I'm not much of a crab eater, but it was a sight to behold. It looks like a lot of work, but she is a gigantic crab fan and actually loves the whole process of cracking the thing open and pulling out every last tasty morsel.  Usually at this point, I'm stuffed and dessert is out of the question, but we were in a mood to take it to the limit so we ordered the crème brûlée. It was creamy, crackly and a perfect way to end the meal with a cup of coffee.  No complaints out of me when it comes to this place. It was such a beautiful day, the view was spectacular and the service outstanding. It's my pleasure to give credit where credit is due, these people work hard and I would seriously consider eating here the next time I hang with the tourists.

JeEhTF0opUP1z7J9R0PC9g.review_text: Great food!  After a long day of tourist attractions we referred to yelp and thought we would give this place a chance based on the reviews.  Great ambiance and waterfront!  Reasonably priced for waterfront restaurant.  We got the Blue Cheese Garlic Bread.  Tasted awesome!  Also ordered the crab cake entree and ahi tuna entree.  Very good!  Would recommend.

ttQaIO8SD70rLwnixdudYw.review_text: Cioppino was good, can't compare it to other places since this is my first time to have it.

P2tH2NIkseonvLhFG32M9w.review_text: I would only give it one star. But, due to the Ahi Tuna 2 ways I'd give it the extra stars. The service was really way below par and slow. The bath room was totally out of paper tower.   p.s. I don't see how the clam chowder is award winning. I couldn't find one piece of clam in their chowder. The view is GREAT but over all......... over price!

GcUCFPT68HWi6LyEx1hWdA.review_text: I am a local, born and raised in SF, and this was the first time I have gone here. It was definitely worth fending off all the tourists and crappy parking to go here. The oysters were phenomenal and the crab ceviche was very fresh. I had the seafood cioppino which was very good and my boyfriend had the king salmon which he said was great as well. The drinks are overpriced but the food more than made up for it. The service was great as well. We had a very attentive waitress who checked on us multiple times. I will definitely be back again!

NRZYuHMukj-pWsdLWayt4Q.review_text: This is a lovely restaurant, the food was great with very decent sized servings. The service was wonderful, Neissa was looking after us and she was cheerful, friendly and did a great job!

i6RoTLHeg75swW_BCJSxGg.review_text: Amazing experience here on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Waited about 15 minutes and had a couple drinks at the bar. Once we were seated we were greeted by a sweet girl who had told us it was actually her first week. We ordered a bottle of wine and the shellfish for two! The shellfish for two was more than enough for both of us. If you love delicious flavorful shrimp and buttery garlic flavored crab legs this is the dish for you. I loved the atmosphere, the food, the wine and the service was top notch! I'm so glad I came here instead of The Crab House.

r5wlm6QmLHZ4-pTomF1iwg.review_text: With all the restaurant choices on Pier 39, it's hard to choose which one to go to. I've tried most of them over the years but have only gone to 2 of them more than once. This one and Bubba Gumps. Completely different experiences but both have really good food.  When I'm looking for a quieter, more intimate meal, I'll definitely choose Fog Harbor over the other cloth-napkin restaurants on the pier.

eab8pI_gcctp3U3_NgYamg.review_text: We like trying different restaurants during our yearly visits to San Francisco and decided to give Fog Harbor Fish House a try. We arrived after the lunch crowd but before the dinner crowd so the restaurant wasn't very busy. We were seated right away at the back with a nice view of Coit Tower to the left and the bay to the right.   We were given fresh sourdough bread and butter. What I ordered was simple, fried shrimp with fries and coleslaw and hubby had Seafood Penne with fresh fish, clams and mussels in a tomato cream sauce. The food was fresh and hot, good but nothing special. The shrimp was medium in size and fried to a nice golden crisp but unremarkable in taste as was the fries and coleslaw. Per my husband although the seafood was fresh the seafood penne was bland. The service was average, our waiter was more interested in the 3 girls that was seated at the table next to us and totally abandoned our table.  Even when he was at the other table we couldn't get his attention and he pretty much ignored us, we had to flag down another waiter to get our check because our waiter disappeared.   The food was fresh and the views were really nice, definitely worth a 2nd visit but would order something totally different.

1kNsEAhGU8d8xugMuXJGFA.review_text: 3.5/5, +.5 for service  Well, Fog Harbor was my first dinner stop in my 11-day trip down the west coast. Our theme was seafood for our San Francisco stops, since I personally have never been to the Pacific coast and really wanted to test out what's so great about their seafood.  We reserved via OpenTable and had to wait about 15-20 minutes for a window seat, but we did get a seat eventually and were promptly served.  Our dinner included the "award winning" clam chowder, dungeness crab cakes, garlic roasted crab, wild salmon, lobster tail, and the lobster mac and cheese. Well, the first thing we realized was we ordered way too much. I understood America and their big portions, but the portions were not just big, they were huge. The garlic roasted crab had to have been at least 5 pounds, and I was actually completely shocked my mom managed to finish the whole crab (although she didn't even touch the corn cob and potatoes). The lobster tail also tasted very good, and that we were actually able to complete. The award winning clam chowder definitely lived up to its name: Creamy (but not too creamy) soup with plentiful clam chunks and easy on the potatoes. The wild salmon was also good, however once again it was so large on portions we couldn't finish it. The lobster mac and cheese was baked and was probably the disappointment of the meal as it really didn't taste anything special, especially when comparing the other orders.  Service started brilliantly, and quite frankly I don't really blame the waitress that much for the slightly worse service we got as we were finishing our meal, since the restaurant closed at 10 and we were still eating at 10:45 (I did say the portions were huge!!!). We finally left around 11 and were the last customers departing the restaurant, having finally experienced seafood in the west coast...miles better than the east coast.

8ciQzrRSDqCeS9EIYdpkvA.review_text: I had trout, lobster, grape fruit juice, and dessert with latte. Very tasty.  Great ocean view. Because of the location, this place is popular.  We were able get seats because 5 p.m. for dinner.  Only thing is that I wish the plate was bigger as a big eater.

cl2r-UJA7wrgEgr0fgP25A.review_text: Food and service are good. Location is great, very convenient.

CQZunptTnj_mxKeQc0W-Iw.review_text: I took my family from Los Angeles, whom never been to the city. We went after a Giants game and we were ready for dinner. What a AWESOME and BEAUTIFUL place. The scenery and food was perfect. We got to watch the sun go down on the bay. You must go and take your wife or significant other. Perfect place for a perfect day. This day will stay with me.

AKHX3VbnKrdE_nIOCd5ptA.review_text: This used to be my favorite restaurant on Pier 39 because of the view, food, and service. A trifecta!  However, my recent visit this weekend left me slightly disappointed due to the service. First, we were seated at a table too small for our party though we made reservations weeks in advance. The sun was glaring on our table and made us uncomfortable, so we ended up changing tables. However, once we changed tables, we ended up with a waitress that was extremely grumpy. Maybe she picked up an extra couple shifts? She was tired and lifeless and was not keen on interacting more with us than possible. There were plenty of servers and waiters around on a Sunday evening when only 30-40% of the restaurant was filled, yet our service was so slow. Our waters were too often completely empty. It was also a birthday as stated during our reservation, but we had to remind the waitress a couple times to get a candle... When the desserts came out, low and behold, candleless... and then the waitress brought out another dessert with a candle 20 minutes later. She then, charged us for the extra dessert and we had to ask her to take it off. Sloppy... and off...   The food was quite good and well-priced, as usual and the view was nice, though slightly too sunny during sunset (they didnt lower their shades over the offending windows). Enjoyed the mixed grill, clam chowder, crab ceviche, and seafood cioppinos. Don't know what's wrong, but service is getting sloppy.

zejTWFNKTAEk4G8a6GAw8Q.review_text: I would have licked the plate if I weren't in public! I ate at Fog Harbor Fish House last night, for the first time, and it was absolutely amazing! A super chill blonde lady, who was very personable, waited on us and was VERY attentive. My party of four was seated immediately. Waiters and waitresses all smiled, and said hello as they walked by - even commented on our food and if we were enjoying it! Everything was flavorful... but goodness.... the Lobster Mac & Cheese deserves a ribbon of excellence, or something! I happily give this place 5 stars... and you should to!

pWLv2TEEIceumZ_wcaUvuA.review_text: You're paying for the view but the food's pretty good. Clam chowder is as good as anywhere else on the wharf. The crab very good.

Rt-XJ5yInDRiFsgQ0Uam-A.review_text: Loved this restaurant!  It's right at Pier 39 - so the location can't be beat.  We got the crab, and it was totally amazing!  The garlic butter is to die for.  You gotta go for it!  Also ordered the fish - it was only so-so.  My big piece of advice is don't do fish - just get double the crab!

uZ05YHFvI47U_q6jZewnog.review_text: Don't bother waiting for a table. Just sit at the bar and enjoy the most outstanding service around.  Yes, the food is über-fresh, and fabulously tasty - we had the California Crab & Avocado Caesar Salad (enormous and delicious) and the swordfish (flawlessly grilled, with melt-in-your-mouth ratatouille veggies). And yes, the view is great. But what really made this place stand out in a town full of tourist traps was the service. Archer, Nelson, and Jason behind the bar were exceptional - personable, attentive, fun, they went out of their way to deliver everything we asked for and much more, which made for a truly unforgettable meal. Extra special thanks to Archer for the warm and crusty sourdough heels, and to Nelson for the ridiculously good ginger lemonade and for the soon-to-be-famous wickedly yummy Half Nelson ;-) Thank you for making us feel special tonight. We will most certainly be back.

8MeFSgQBe3HiWXVXJ4qqXQ.review_text: After appalling service at Bubba Gumps we were in search for a more upscale lunch spot.  We we got right in and were given our choice of tables with water views.  The waiter was very attentive and helpful with menu items.  We appreciated his recommendation to try a dish with crab as they may not have it for long and it's from local waters.  The crab cocktail did not disappoint.  The clam chowder really is as good as they tout.  And the fish and chips came out warm and tasty.  Overall, great service, clean restaurant and very good food.  We will definitely be back next time we are on the Pier.

4s9VYDlkstf7EhLxJv7FBA.review_text: Stopped by on a busy Sunday evening and was told the wait was 45 minutes. My daughter and I definitely wanted to try Fog Harbor so we hung out and sat in the super comfy chairs near the fireplace out front. 25 minutes later my name was called and we were seated at a lovely table in front of the windows. Our waitress was sweet but the service wasn't particularly fast. To be honest, that was ok with us, we wanted to take our time and enjoy our last dinner in the city. Fog Harbor was full of tourists but didn't feel touristy.  Our food was AMAZING. She had shrimp cocktail for dinner and was happy with the six very large shrimp plus the warm boudin bread and butter. I had the half garlic roasted Dungeness crab with fingerling potatoes and corn on the cob. My mouth is watering just thinking about it and dinner was two hours ago!  I highly recommend Fog Harbor Fish House!

u_5944V9AIr1xv8xwqdKyg.review_text: I'm giving a 5 star because I can't think of anything that I didn't like. Maybe just the wait? but good places always have to wait.   I ordered the fish & chips, the fish is really good, big chucks of meat, very light batter great fresh taste. Fried calamari was very good as well, very fresh and chewy. Clam chowder has lots of clams.   Been to a few places at pier 39 and this time was my best experience. Nice view, nice staffs, would go back.

StNAnvyhVISULAFmO_Ke1Q.review_text: We have come here the last two years for my mother-in-law's birthday.  We take the ferry boat in, and always manage to avoid the lunch time rush.  We always get a table right next to the window with a beautiful view.  The service is really good and the servers are very attentive.  For such a fancy looking place, they are extremely family friendly, and I am comfortable bring my 4 and 2 year old there for lunch.  We will be there same time next year!

NVianVl7QtCL8JNsU9eU7Q.review_text: Stopped here for a beer and the view.  This was a first day in SFO so we decided to come down to the warf.  I had the clam chowder and it was delicious and the bread was yummy.   Ordered shrimp cocktail and it was okay. My partner ordered the crab meat cocktail which totally rocked!

R6xTdFBQt0kcKb8vix9d3Q.review_text: I Loved eating at this place. The food is delicious from its appetizers down to the best part of the meal, dessert. The atmosphere is elegant yet casual and relaxed, the views are wonderful, and the service was fantastic. Jason, our server, made sure that we were well taken care of. He really went to the extra mile for us and they all work as a team. Brian, who was the manager on duty, ensured that we were satisfied with our meal.  The Food: My boyfriend and I both had the New York Steak and it was perfectly cooked to our liking, the peppercorn sauce on top was not too overwhelming or salty. For dessert we had the raspberry cheesecake and the apple crumble a la mode. Very delicious! I loved every bite.  Overall, this is a really great date place, no pressure to act snooty and snobby, very relaxed with great service and food! I would recommend this to anyone looking to just have a night away from the kids or looking to impress that special someone.  Cheers!

K-3AlC2oipTkxuQCvKV-5w.review_text: AMAZING! First of all, great location right on the pier, beautiful views. I ordered a cup of clam chowder which was hot and delicious, served with fresh sourdough bread. For my entree I ordered the crab and avocado salad - sooo good! Can't beat that fresh crab. Our waiter was super friendly and attentive. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting the SF area looking for some good seafood with great views.

s3jn-f-F_XQ_Hhc1MX33yw.review_text: I was impressed, I had the crab roll it was pretty good i would recommend it. one person in our group had the cioppino and really liked it.

QzcZmCVwkfqoxTUakrOWCQ.review_text: Very friendly staff at the bar, delicious food. I highly recommended. I wanted to try the lobster Mac and cheese because I saw it on a yelp post but they weren't offering at the current time. They were nice enough to accommodate my request and make it for me. It was awesome! The clam chowder in a bread was delicious too. Very nice food. My review is for dinner time.

Pfb9bmYRZyGtrydsfr1UvQ.review_text: What a beautiful place this is! At the entrance there is a fireplace and sitting area which is so cozy when it gets chilly at night! Came here on the evening of fourth of July and although they said the wait would be an hour it was only 30 minutes! Ordered the clams appetizer, and clam chowder in a bread bowl both oh sooooooo good! Ordered a moscow mule which comes in a beautiful bronze challas! Had the apple cobbler with ice cream on top which was also delicious. Best part was the view, over looking fisherman's wharf and the water! Definitely come here worth the wait!

IGiRyV2t6p1HT3_Rk-JWpg.review_text: Absolutely my favorite restaurant at pier39. Any item i've ordered wether it be crabcakes,steak or lobstser..heck, even the bread they bring out nice &warm & fluffy w/butter. Highly recommend this spot, its worth your buck.

iBcJm4Pch5Q6dIisAn9HJQ.review_text: Clam chowder was fantastic and jumbo shrimp cocktail was very fresh but sorely disappointed at our server Amy. She just handed us the 2 menus, didn't inform us of the specials. We had to hear it from the other table's server. She also didn't check back with us while eating. It took her a long time to process our payment. Great views and food , bad service .

jhEc1YShRsXStqMk7KV9wg.review_text: Pier 39 is usually for the tourists and a area where most locals avoid at all costs. It's not exactly a reflection of San Francisco and is filled with over priced,  bland food. It can be easy to get lost and settle for something that burns through your wallet and leaves you reaching for the tabasco.   Well, if you do find your self stuck in this area, and hungry, Fog Harbor is a great spot to fill your craving. The food isn't cheap, but you're going to shell out the same amount of money at most spots in the area.   PRO TIP: If you happen to park in the Pier 39 parking lot... get validated here and spend money on the chowder and calamari instead of parking!

lP-CJ4okAuLhQX8-QOUTVw.review_text: Came here for an anniversary dinner, and was thoroughly impressed.   Our waitress was personable and had great customer service. We ordered the seafood penne and linguine with clams. Both were perfect, and not over-saturated with flavors as many pasta dishes come. The salmon in the seafood penne was freshly caught that morning and you could tell, it melted in my mouth and I'm drooling thinking about it.   We watched the sunset over the marina and it was absolutely gorgeous.  I can understand how other reviewers feel about the crowds because of tourists, but it's because this restaurant has it all. Even with the many customers, the staff was not overwhelmed - it didn't disturb us.   Anyway, if you are a tourist looking at reviews to pick an excellent seafood restaurant with a great view, I highly recommend Fog Harbor!

V7Ff74uPh7EviNVB3JRuBA.review_text: Food was great and the service from Shawna exceptional. She help recommend tasty food and also fun areas of the city. Would recommend asking for her when you go.

CTR-ZWVHbqmcJEwx_rOXKA.review_text: We found the Fog Harbor Fish House on Yelp.... and we're happy we did.  We had an excellent evening starting with super drinks and ending with one of their yummy desserts.  Service was excellent.  Dinner was fantastic... seafood of course... with a large selection.  Recommend it highly.    We hadn't been in San Francisco in many years.  Dinner at Fog Harbor was a highlight of a super two night stay.  We'll be back.

IJGQALx4pMF_kk5c3x8hqQ.review_text: We went here on a Sunday afternoon of New Years weekend and we were pleased to see that the wait wasn't too bad. We got seated pretty quickly and our waiter took our orders fast.  They give you complimentary bread & butter and the bread was so warm and yummy! We ordered a calamari appetizer and one order of fish & chips. That doesn't seem like a lot of food but my husband and I were stuffed! The serving sizes are big enough that 2 people can share.  It is kind of pricey but the quality of the seafood & the view of harbor is totally worth it. The service was pretty good as well.  Would definitely recommend this restaurant but would suggest coming for lunch so you can take advantage of the beautiful view from your table!

DJteQWADGOAk-cvAHtZ4BQ.review_text: I've been here three times and the only conclusion I've come to is that Fog Harbor is ridiculously over rated.  If I were rating this place on the great atmosphere, the excellent waiter service, the location and the breath-taking view, I would give it 5 stars.  The food, however, is sub par and I can't in good conscience give a place with unskilled chefs anything higher than 2 stars.  Sorry.

u6CFVuCP2NPCeShh-qa8Ug.review_text: We were a group of seniors and very much in a hurry for a quick meal so as to catch the ferry to Alameda and had the best server and service in many times, on Friday the 13th too.. What a great day this made for one that had started out so badly..

iH-UGq7G1UqvsSFfSO2E3w.review_text: I chose this restaurant based on yelp and not only was the food and view amazing but our waitress Madison really made the experience great. I highly recommend!

39bkrrnFA5T5Evl6M_ASzA.review_text: The food was amazing, I had the crab linguine alfredo.   I also had the Syrah and the wine was equally as good.   It sits right on the water in Fisherman Wharf so there were great waterviews.   Overall, I really enjoyed the food, service, and atmosphere of Fog Harbor and will definitely go back the next time I am in the San Francisco area.

5gwA9AmeLTeNmzOZmqVH2Q.review_text: Celebrated my 50th last Saturday night with 11 family members and the dinners were fabulous, the desserts were incredible and the service was wonderful!  They even sang to me and it was priceless!  I think we will have to celebrate here every year.

czrjqJBZ_pp2ZBzPdHOgbg.review_text: Found ourselves on Pier 39 looking for something small to eat (already had a bread bowl with clam chowder while walking around).  Saw the yelp offer of a free appetizer for this place so figured what the heck.  Turned out fantastic.  Had a beautiful seat with a view, a fee appetizer and our Liquini with clam sauce was amazing.

smSZx0GnTUx_gEU0tCmkbQ.review_text: it's overpriced, but what do you expect at pier 39? small portions but it's good.

qphl-0CNgmkXhzxehajoxw.review_text: Wonderful atmosphere overlooking the bay. Our server was excellent and our food was delicious. I liked that they offered "skinny" drink options. It was our anniversary and our server bought us dessert, which was a delicious apple crisp with vanilla ice cream. I would definitely go back!

gmM7maEZA7FrV9XbGsThrQ.review_text: Here for some seafood chowdown and wasn't disappointed. Drinks weak so make sure to ask for strong stuff or you'll be disappointed.    CLAM CHOWDER was too watery and lack filling.  I think a Boudin can would taste better. oh now really did I just say that?!  JUMBO COCKTAIL $13 for 4 shrimps. 1/2 OYSTERS in a nicely presented plate in center of table. Fresh!!! $13.00 1 WHOLE Garlic CRAB $39.  Great great with butter sauce on side. Well, it was with lobster but oh well, let's dip away.  COCKTAILS: Lemon Drop (strong), Long Beach (whole crab strong!), Blackberry Martini (juice was this??! disappointed), and Alcatraz (oh ok..) if you like rum.  Total for 3 adults $180with tax about $190+($60 + a person). Would that be $$$$?  Would be back here if I were not so allergic to seafood and had to just watch as my favorite other two people chow down while I feed the little babes.  Agh, the life.  Friendly upbeat service in a nicely decorated place with great view and really a great place for family (Stroller parking outside is safe).   It's on 2nd floor so find elevator by NFL store across the way. Check receipt for coupon deals. Don't toss..i know u might be buzzed...but really, check first.

3RIUIlmcId_8ddv4hTd47A.review_text: Great calamari with a cold beer was a great choice just wish they were better in their service

-EnH4FdkRG_iVhncdIYx-Q.review_text: Some friends were in from out of town last weekend and they were totally excited to go Fisherman's Wharf.  We chose Fog Harbor based on the slightly lower prices and great looking space. We asked for a table with a view and they happily gave us one by the windows.   Camille was our waitress and she was awesome. Five star service. She listened to all the various dietary restrictions - no gluten and no milk - and made several trips into the kitchen just to inquire about ingredients for us. Turns out there is a lot with milk in it. Though the menu has little "G"s next to all the gluten free options! She made sure we enjoyed all the food brought to us!  The food was alright. Our guests loved the heck out of everything they got, so really, what more can accomodating hosts ask?

KG5WwnONu4JTkAG2q3BM1A.review_text: I think the management in this restaurant is awful.  I will never go there again.  I was on a Tour Bus with 50 senior citizens, some with handicaps and walkers.  They paid in advance for the bus, the theater and the restaurant.  They had a reservation and when we got there the tables were still empty.  The bus,because of heavy traffic, was late by about 10 minutes and the management refused to honor a reservation for this party that was made months ago.  The people did not have time for lunch and this restaurant did not even try to compensate these people when they refused to honor the reservation after many of these old people walked up the stairs and were tired.  At least they should have asked some of the elderly people if they wanted water or a piece of bread etc before they sent them away with no food and no recommendation of a place where 50 people could go at 5:20 pm.  They were told via phone that the bus was late due to traffic and when got to the restaurant and the tables were still empty and we sat down to be served.    We were told we had to leave and they would not serve us.  This is totally unacceptable behavior for any restaurant management to take and commit to serve a part y of 50 and then refuse because they come in 10 or 15 minutes late. .  Do not go to this restaurant.  There are 100's of excellent restaurants in San Francisco.  Leave this off your list.

bozrqlaG3x1CfJ5vOI2AhQ.review_text: We were visiting pier 39 and quickly yelped for a good seafood place. The girlfriend wanted to try the crab shack, but I liked the vibe of this one. I'm glad we went here: the view was incredible, and the food was generally fantastic!   We went with  the "famous" clam chowder (in a bowl) - good but I don't see what the fuss is about  The seafood cioppino - this knocked the ball out the park, the fresh tomato sauce based broth, mussels, shrimp, scallops were all made just perfectly. You can't go wrong with this one.   Lemon fried calamari - Tip, if you have a city pass or one of those flyers at the sf visitor center, be sure to exchange for a welcoming booklet at pier 39, you get the calamari free with two entrees.  This was better than we expected, with the calamari fried to just the right amount of crispness and the lemon sauce providing a bit of zest.   A dozen oysters - the girlfriend was aching for oysters, I was lucky enough to sample a few and they were just fantastic.   If you're visiting pier 39, this place is a must.

gOBkinOIsBUSNP8byXKsrw.review_text: We tried this place on Sunday, a new spot for us.  The atmosphere was really nice, the view was amazing and so was the Crab.  We try a lot of crab places, I love crab.  This one is probably the best.  I had the red chili garlic crab and it was delicious.  Now, I said it is probably one of the best "Crab" places because the rest of the meal was just "OK".  My husband had fish and chips, they really had no flavor.    So if you are looking for "CRAB" this is the place to come.

x9GAyWgGv8V2rSVHh8SDAQ.review_text: Great experience for the three people in our party. Excellent clam chowder. The rest of the meal was top drawer. Friendly and helpful waiter. Reasonable prices for great food. I would recommend Fog Harbor Fish House to anyone.

FBomNdw1vD6XkoXeEDRaiQ.review_text: Solid overall dining experience.  Highlight of the meal was the clam chowder!  Great views, attentive staff.  A little pricey at times, but, hey, what do you expect in the touristy areas of SF!  Would definitely stop by again!

RJKcI5Qq5NtIdZbmHTwXzg.review_text: I came here with my boyfriend on our first trip to SF. My boyfriend is a big fan of seafood so we decided to try this place. The ambiance here is nice, classy yet casual. Makes it more comfortable without it being too dim. We ordered a dozen oysters, crab rolls, lobster mac n cheese, and the alcatraz drink. EVERYTHING WAS GREAT!  Although I did not eat the oyster, my boyfriend said it was really good - very fresh. The crab rolls were good, but nothing super special. However, the lobster mac n cheese was super BOMB! I've never tasted anything like it - it was beyond delicious! The lobster chunks were huge and the pasta was cooked to perfection. I am not a big fan of alcohol and hate the taste of alcohol, but the Alcatraz was delicious! It was fruity and slushy like, but the hint of alcohol was very little. 100% going back to this place again!

odi0eeAykdz6DCSM0d1U-Q.review_text: My wife and I wanted a comfy place to sit after a long day of sight seeing.  This hit the spot. We had a table at a window so we overlooked the bay. Great view. We had some very tasty crab cakes and clam chowder. I only rated 3 stars, however, because the prices were high and the service was very poor.  $18 for two 4-in diameter cakes was rediculous and our server only came to our table 3 times (to take our order, to offer desert  and to refill our drinks while handing over our bill. 4 visits if you count bringing back the cc.)

X5VL_N2qt1NDxYpcB_EmBg.review_text: Growing hungry for something a little bit more substantial though, we paid a visit to Fog Harbor Fish House, a family-owned seafood restaurant well known at the Pier for great crab and great views.  Great views, check! Located right at the pier's edge and where a lot of the Blue and Gold Fleet cruises dock.  Crab? Check! A whole menu entirely dedicated to the local Dungeness crab. Fresh and a multitude of preparations, making it very hard for us to choose a single dish.  Joe and I were in the noshing mood, planning to go to Fisherman's Wharf for dinner (post to come!). We shared the 1/2 lb crab, stir fried with onions, peppers, in a spicy red chili garlic sauce. NOM! Turned out a lot better than I thought it would be. The shell was super soft, making it pretty easy to crack even without the crab cracker, and the garlic sauce was nice and spicy! The highlight of the dish: the fresh crab meat waiting inside the shell. Sweet and juicy. Should have ordered a second crab dish in my opinion!  Our other dish: an ahi tuna poke. After having amazing poke in LA, we've been looking around for a good poke. A trip to Hawaii next perhaps? Anyways, the dish was beautifully presented with crispy wonton chips with white and black sesame seeds, a wasabi aioli, an unidentified hot sauce, seaweed, and the ahi tuna marinated in a sesame soy sauce with avocados and mango. Yum! The mango made the dish it's own and added to the refreshing taste. Still not up to our standard from Venice Beach, but satisfying enough.  Great eats, but you definitely pay the price for the location and the view. If you want straight up fresh seafood, served simple, look forward to my Fisherman's Wharf post coming this week!

kG5dqjJz6rS124qJdrBoYQ.review_text: So a few weeks back, me and Matthew went to San Francisco for the day with my grandparents. While walking the pier, we stopped by this place. Matthew and myself were a little hesitant because we don't eat seafood.   Luckily, they offered more than seafood. So we started out with drinks. I had the Moscow mule and my grandma had the Lombard lemonade. The guys had some straight scotch I believe. The bread was really good too.   Matthew and I got the chicken penne which was delicious. The service was great and the view was even better! Would totally recommend this place! A bit pricey, but worth it.

sXtYdtCP3Ew1gHfxJxk51w.review_text: The food - 3 stars Service - 4 stars View & Ambience - 4 stars Average 3.5 stars  After spending the morning around Fisherman's Wharf, we were looking for a place to share a late lunch.  We stumbled upon this place in Pier 39 and saw they served Fish & Chips on their HH menu.  They were having a HH bar special, but you had to sit at the bar for it.  The hostess sat us at the windows overlooking the Pier and at first I was resenting it because we couldn't get the HH specials, but I'm sure glad she did.  The sun was just setting and we had the most gorgeous view minus the smell and bird poop outside.    We got the fish & chips and calamari to split and when we told our waitress, she was so nice to ask the kitchen to put the order onto 2 plates.  She was extremely pleasant and helpful checking in on us, and even getting us 2 different choice of dipping sauce for the calamari when we didn't like the mayo aioli.    The food itself wasn't memorable and they serve large portions that we couldn't finish. I could taste the freshness in both the fish & calamari that was lightly battered.  I prefer a little more batter on my fish & chips, but the service & view was amazing.  The bill came out to a little more than $30 for our shared late lunch.

lNDSfSmpgnezOIhoL4sAJA.review_text: Ok so my first trip to San Fransisco and I can say out of all the landmarks and places you can visit the Fog House Harbor Fish house is a must on any to-do-list super romantic with great views of alcatraz and the bay and the golden gate bridge. It was my Gf bday and after spending the day at union square shopping around and taking in the city we stopped by this place for a quick drink and ended up spending like the whole afternoon there ... lol We were greeted by Shana and Mike at the bar and if u get a chance to eat anywhere ... I recommend you sit at the bar .. they were so cordial and down to earth, so "san fransisco" and so very helpful with drink selections... their seasonal drinks were recommended by Shanna and let me tell u she was spot on ! The ________ mule is my fav drink its served in a gold cup super good i ordered one and after my 4th one i lost track lol and my gf ordered the pumpkin pie martini she loved it and couldnt resist havinga few aswell#pumpkinmartini=food/drinkpornmeetsfoodieorg­asam #andyesitsthatdamngood! .... So we ordered a few menu items all very good and of course we had five star service from the minute we walked in but the clam chowder was the best clam chowder not only for me n my gf who are foodies ,but when u walk in this place you'll see the awards they have on the walls for best clam chowder on fishermans wharf... personally I tried others on the wharf even boudins and the freshest (as in daily hand selected ocean fresh clams n garden selected veggies) tastiest heartiest clam chowder belongs to fog harbor fish house.... this place  is a SanFransisco ICON and Shanna made our trip memorable  To recap the clam chowder is the best ever...we got 1 togo and we'll definetly be back .. also ask for Shanna and Mike at the bar they are the best bartenders ever #seriously.. and the reason why me and my family will be customers for years to come   Ps....@shanna....  lakers beat the Warriors :p

46g1PTpxcRkT9KFsrXLFhg.review_text: We had a very good experience here.  Every dish and drink that came to the table was enjoyed. We had a table by the window.  This restaurant, to me, is a great place for a special occasion celebration.  Large open space, white table cloths. GOOD FOOD!  If I'm remembering correctly, the CLAM CHOWDER was spot on. The SEAFOOD FRIED COMBO was nicely done.  We had an assortment of dishes on our table, including the Lobster Mac n Cheese, the Ahi Poke and none of them disappointed us.  The Garlic Crab was good, but The Crab House next door has them beat when it comes to this dish.  I love it when Yelpers drop hints like this in their reviews, so here is a good tip for you.  Go to The Crab House literally next door and get the Garlic Crab.  Best I've had.  I like this place a lot.  It's between a 4 and a 5 for me. This is exactly what you would expect from a classy version of a fish house.

M7gGHFf369yjYFBGv9bgsg.review_text: We decided to go here for my daughter's sweet 16 birthday party.  We had been here before and have always really enjoyed it.  The food was wonderful.  I had the salmon with the lemon dill sauce.  It was so fresh and tasty.  Plus the service was outstanding. Overall we had a great time.

aJiPpb2V85K_pdmPMQ3WhQ.review_text: Came here Sunday morning at 11:15 ish with reservations, to be greeted with quick customer service! With my party of 6, we were delighted to get a table with just a breathtaking view. Absolutely gorgeous. With a quick change of waiters, because why not, a new friendly lady (I should get on top of remembering my servers names...) helped up decently well. We all ordered the clam chowder in a bread bowl, a half garlic crab, and some drinks.  The chowder was delicious but pretty much the same thing as everywhere else in the Pier 39 area. I ordered a ginger lemonade, while expensive (like everything at Pier 39), was refreshing! They also had alcohol-free wines which my friend enjoyed. The garlic crab was decent, but I've had better in the area from small restaurants. The check-in for the free blue cheese garlic bread was a nice touch!   Food is high quality, overall good customer service, and an AMAZING view of San Francisco! Excited for the next time around!

cLXPbjPmyAKGv05cYqYPBQ.review_text: We were looking for a seafood restaurant with great views of the Bay and we found it!  The clam chowder + bread bowls are to die for and our waitress (an older woman who has been at Fod Harbor for many years) was enthusiastic in her delivery and helpful with our questions about the area.  My husband didn't think the beer battered fish & chips were the best he's had though...the batter overwhelmed the actual fish and in result, was very filling.  We loved the "feel" of the dining area and bar...the waiting spot with couches & fireplace warmed us up on a chilly September evening.

kFFYPeO87IGpYuSR4NKP5A.review_text: After reading on Yelp how great their clam chowder is, I was really looking forward to trying a cup. Unfortunately, the cup was completely forgotten and I was left with two pieces of (delicious, fortunately) undipped sourdough bread. I ended up having the crab melt, which was pretty good. This place is worth going for the view and the bread, as far as I know, but that's about it. I'd stop by again for some clam chowder, but I'm feeling it's a little risky now.

ngQLmk_aiYuJhTqsZEhrEg.review_text: Kind of a tourist-trap, but prices and food are more than OK for what it is.  We had the Ahi tuna (very good), and the Fish and Chips (I'd give them 3.5 stars.) The service was nice, with good sights of the pier.

-5hG5GO2tq1gMCL5G2mNyQ.review_text: I have had the opportunity to eat at many, many San Francisco restaurants. In terms of ambiance and quality of food, Fog Harbor ranks at the top of my list.  It's location on the Pier makes for a wonderful backdrop for lunch or dinner. The servers are friendly and have a great understanding of the menu options. Most recently I enjoyed the crab cakes and the Surg & Turf. Delicious!   Sometimes the restaurant gets a little loud, but that's only because so many people are enjoying themselves. I look forward to coming back again soon!

uTsG5j9CTemtQOJfz3F-bA.review_text: We were visiting San Francisco from San Diego just for the weekend for my birthday! We were exploring the pier and found this place via Yelp.  ATMOSPHERE: Nice view of the water. Casual. Crowded on a Saturday at 2pm so we knew it must be good.  A lot of large groups come to this place.  FOOD: We ordered -  1. Complimentary bread  2. Blue cheese bread - yummy. This paired well with the soup broth of the cioppino 3. Swordfish w/ capers, grilled veggies - very, very good! Healthy too. Definitely would order this again.  4. Cioppino - huge portion!  Definitely enough for 2 even without the pasta which is $2 extra. I opted for the crab to be cracked for me for an extra $4. Good but probably would not order again.   5. Tiramisu - delicious! Creamy layers. Definitely recommend. Big enough to share between 2 people and maybe even 3.  6. Moscow mule - served in a copper cup! Very good but not the best one I've had which was in San Diego and I don't think they use bitters.  SERVICE: Excellent! The waitress, Ika who was from Kazakhstan, even sang happy birthday to me all by herself, haha.  TIPS: Check-in on FourSquare, Yelp for a free blue cheese bread appetizer! Also check into the pier for a free coupon book at the visitors center which has a coupon in the book for Fog Harbor for a free blue cheese bread OR calamari appetizer.  If it's your birthday, just say so and they treat you to a complimentary desert! Score! Also reservations can be made on OpenTable.  PRICE: I would say moderate to pricey. Paying full price for a full lunch including appetizer, drink, main dish, dessert expect at least $50 per person.  CONCLUSION: Good food, very big portions, nice view, great service. Solid restaurant! There are so many good restaurants in SF and although this is not a "must do" restaurant, it's a good choice.

xecFwpl2RqLynuPH23xQsQ.review_text: We decided to eat here on the recommendation of the boat captain who had taken us out to watch the America's Cup boat race.  We are not a big fan of the crowds and restaurants on Pier 39, but he indicated this was the best of the bunch.  Since our boat had left from Pier 39, we opted for convenience.  We came about 2 pm and were told it would be a 40 minute wait.  It would have been nice to have a device to take on the pier that would have vibrated when our table was ready, but the waiting area was pleasant.  The table had a nice view of the harbor, and we were attended to in a timely manner.  There was a good variety of choices on the menu, but my brother in law was very disappointed with the non existant vegan selections.  He opted for the Salmon BLT sandwich with no bacon or fish.  The waiter was one of those who doesn't write down your order but trys to memorizes everything, which made me very nervous.  Sure enough, even after asking me twice, I received a chicken dish instead of the sandwich, and my brother in law had fish in his sandwich.  The manger came by and was very apologetic, offering to comp his sandwich, I told him I would eat mine for the lower price of the sandwich.  The food was delicious, but not once did our waiter come back to apologize or check on us, and sure enough when he brought our bill, they charged us for the comp items.  By this time my brother in law was worn down, and despite my objections just paid the entire bill so we could leave.  I guess I came out ahead since he paid for my meal, but overall it was not a pleasant experience.

37MokMVg7Z-DJjvkK-qmkA.review_text: Had a great dinner here in November.  I had the mixed grill and my husband had a red clam based pasta dinner.  Both were delicious.  The place is beautiful and we had a really nice table.  The service was fantastic.  I would definately go back there and I highly recommend it.

H0A2kJ089dOTNgdwZ9GMRQ.review_text: Probably as touristy an area on Fisherman's Wharf as you could find.... But food is good---better than all the others(cept for Hog Island). Good crab rolls, fresh oysters, ok house white & great SF homemade sour dough. Clam chowder excellent. If stuck in area I'd return over all the other spots around it.

rHgT6lBbZ2PaHt0UWfTMtw.review_text: We came on a Monday evening and ordered 1. Clam chowder in a bread bowl - 9 2. Fish and chips - 16 3. Seafood Penne - 18 a couple drinks for 43 with a 20% coupon from the coupon book from the Welcome Center  - You're on the 2nd floor so you get to see a wonderful view of the Pier. We came during sunset, so we got to see a gorgeous view of the sun near the horizon.  - Nice service. Quick with refills and condiments.  - Clam chowder was rich and creamy. generous portions of clam. My favorite part is eating the bread bowl when the bread absorbed most of the clam chowder soup! Nom! They Claim being the best. I can attest that it's good!   - Fish and chips pretty average. No better than ordering from a fast food fish and chip joint - Seafood penne had a lackluster taste. Don't recommend.  - Overall, very pleasant meal with a wonderful view of the Pier at a discounted price!

g9YHOduTOL-hxcB-eTPjkA.review_text: Hands down the best calamari I've had, not over-breaded and cooked just enough and not chewy. The blue cheese garlic bread was very rich and flavorful. Fish and chips for the main course - also perfect! Our waitress was super nice and the manager was very friendly and took time to tell us about how they only use sustainable fish suppliers. So, they don't overfish the areas and wipe out populations. They have closely inspected all their suppliers and it shows in the quality of the food. Great experience!

FmY7lphPGQHxkwcUKIx-MA.review_text: Best Clam Chowder! Faycal was a great waiter with a wonderful sense of humor. The outside fireplace makes you hope you have a bit of a wait, while enjoying a few cocktails.

SPHLXU4zHQbDevHy_xcRhg.review_text: Clam chowder is awesome. Cocktail shrimp is so-so. Whole dungeness crab is ruined by cooking in that way.

ySAPe_VJPyB_2RiS4t65bg.review_text: A little over priced for the food since there is so much good food in the same area, just as fresh but this place is quiet, clean and the service was good.

e4wvIoyiqFg3ZqfaGQtI5g.review_text: A couple of weeks ago my boyfriend and I came here for dinner on his last night in San Francisco. The atmosphere was great and the food was delicious. Meron was our server and she made us feel right at home. She was able to give great drink recommendations and also went the extra mile to ask for meal substitutions. She has an awesome personality and was a big part of the reason we had such an awesome last dinner.  We ordered clams, calamari, and the fish and chips entree with garlic fries. Everything was perfect. We went on a weekday so although the location is a major tourist area, it wasn't too busy since we weren't having dinner during the weekend. If this is your first time to San Francisco this is a great place to explore and eat great food!

YoC8_a-CvBGa4wcu0KRmXw.review_text: Went last night for dessert and drinks and couldn't have been happier.  It was very quiet, but the warm lava cake was wonderful and their service was absolutely impeccable.  I expected a much different experience going to a bigger restaurant in a tourist-haven, but was quite solidly impressed.  Will be back, without a doubt.  Reasonably priced drinks and food, and of course pretty views of the pier/bay.

WD0pchQWVY5tBbPqRq4zjQ.review_text: This restaurant absolutely NEVER disappoints!!!!! It's in one of the most touristy places in SF, yet it's top shelf!! We went here tonight after a hellious week on public transportation. My boyfriend picked me up from work and we headed to the Fog Harbor. Pier 39 was teeming with tourists but we only had a 10 minute wait. Our waitress was perfect, the meals (we both had ahi tuna) were tremendous and fresh, and we got our favorite window seat looking out over to Alcatraz. Just the perfect evening!!!!! Love love love this place and please: eat the sourdough bread. It's to die for!!  Kudos to a fantastic restaurant! We will be back!!!!!

7Hc_iM_xCVJjMfACR8Rcsw.review_text: I know it's a seafood restaurant but I ordered the New York steak and it was very good. My husband ate the crab cakes and clam chowder and said they were better than what he had in Boston. The views of the bay were beautiful too.

4taqjBbjEtFN-hfqAGGJZA.review_text: Hostess was very unfriendly. She had orange hair wearing a brown leather jacket. Wish she could be a bit more inviting to an establishment such as this.

4iqFn4TTzGXj7q_LdlCD8Q.review_text: Looks like some good food. Khaiman (our waiter) was great! Good views and a nice atmosphere. definitely recommend it!

smva3NZMyK1ORf8epvQx0g.review_text: We went here on a Friday for lunch.  After walking around the pier and looking for somewhere to eat...  We happened to stop at Fog Harbor.  Manager came out and spoke with us as we were looking over the menu.  What we were seeing looked okay, but the manager's sense of humor and friendly personality is what sold us.  We were immediately brought to our table.   It was nice to look at all the people on the Pier and to see the different boats pull in.  Our server greeted us, he was hard to understand, but seemed friendly.  Unfortunately as time went on we saw less of him and his friendliness seemed to go away as well. He told us about the Fresh Market Fish of the Day...sounded great...salmon stuffed with crab, etc, etc.. for $20.  After looking at our menus, two of us decided on the salmon with stuffed crab..I was craving crab and for the price it seemed decent.  After taking our orders...we waited, waited, waited, and waited...and waited some more.  During the time I saw two businessmen come in, order, eat, and pay their bill.  I saw 3 ladies come in, order, and eat.  And two old ladies come in, order and eat...all while we were still waiting.  After about 40 minutes our food was brought.  BTW, during this time we were waiting for drink refills..hardly ever checked on, etc.  The food arrived...all looked great and was very excited to eat!  We start to eat... hmm...the "salmon" tastes okay, kind of bland...  I said to my dad..I don't think this is salmon.  So, we ask the waiter again what he said the special of the day was.  He AGAIN said salmon stuffed with crab...we then POLITELY and RESPECTFULLY said that we didn't think it was salmon and that it tasted good, but it's not the special.  The waiter then said he would go and double-check.  Come to find out...he was wrong!!!  That was YESTERDAY'S SPECIAL!!  He said that he could get the salmon for us though...no apology or anything.  Too bad we weren't checked on until 20 minutes into our meal though.  By that time half the meal was gone, and we didn't want to chance waiting another 40 minutes for our food.  We were very polite about the whole "mistake", which you would have thought the waiter would have been even extra nice.  No such thing.  He never refilled our drinks.  Once it came time to get a box and check...that tooks another 20 minutes!  When he brought the check, he stepped on my dad's foot and didn't say a thing.  Overall...the food was good, but the ONE waiter needs to be switched out.  The other waiter that had to start picking up his slack was great.  Wish we could have had the OTHER waiter.  Got the bill, thought we would maybe be compensated for at least one of the "salmon" bills since I barely even ate half, but all was full price.  Would I go here again?  NO.  Didn't expect a lunch to take 2 hours!  BTW, the waiter's name was something like Lubo.

mGlFIRcRGmGOZEBTygRRSw.review_text: My husband, in-laws, and I visited Fog Harbor Fish House a few weeks ago, after finding it here on Yelp.  It was really great!  I had the Crab Cake Entree and the crab cakes were really flavorful, full of crab and not too much filler.  My husband had the Fried Combo, which includes fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries, and cole slaw.  It was like fried seafood heaven!  I tried some of his calamari and it was perfectly cooked, not chewy at all, and lightly breaded.  Yum.  My father-in-law had the Seafood Cioppino (crab, fresh fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels in tomato broth, with or without pasta).  They even offer to crack the crab for you, for a few bucks extra, which gets you more crab meat.  It looked fantastic!  And lastly, my mother-in-law got the Fish & Chips, which had an incredible beer batter.  Also, I must highlight that the coleslaw was fantastic:  crunchy cabbage and not overly creamy.  The views of the bay are also beautiful and we enjoyed snapping shots of Alcatraz from our table. It also has a classy, relaxed atmosphere that was even nicer than I imagined from the reviews and price range designation.  I would have liked options for sides (fries came with everything, but I like variety).  Basically, this is a great place to go if you want delicious seafood and great service, with gorgeous views.

BHMi1_iNHLwuTDxXohVupQ.review_text: Best views. Sourdough bread was excellent and the clam chowder was awesome. Cole slaw weaker than Amy Winehouse in a methlab. Fish and chips are a 3 out of a 5. The wife had the crab cakes and said it was mostly bread (as a native Virginia, we like predominately crab meat).  The staff is awesome and the service is fast!

-ELEWjRTdcu4a-nK0e-gNQ.review_text: this place has the best Desserts.... I would go any day just for that.

jvlcoGVo4arj5dtbnsC0Jg.review_text: Seared Ahi tuna was spectacular! The clam chowder was very good. Great sourdough and an excellent wine recommendation. Service was perfect.

vyZvnSBVQV_3R-pemNn1RQ.review_text: The fish house was very delicious. With relatively heap prices, the restaurant looked very fancy and elegant. I got the linguini and clams which compared to bistro boudin had much more variety. There were bigger clams and sun dried tomatoes in it, along with a piece of bread on top with red pepper flakes and regular pepper. It also had parmesan cheese already mixed in instead of on top, and it was very delicious however the parmesan on top tasted much better. Along with the clams in the shells, there were also smaller clams not in the shells spread around, and these clams were not crunchy, which I like. This place is great and highly recommended. Quick tip: the restaurant looks tiny from the outside but is gigantic on the inside, and it looks under staff compared to the size, so get there early or else you will definitely have to wait a very long time for the food, but it will not be a long wait at all for a table. ALSO KEEP IN MIND: THEY CHARGE AN ADDITIONAL SERVICE CHARGE OF 3.5% ON EVERY CHECK FOR A HEALTH ORGANIZATION, SO DON'T BE ALARMED WHEN IT COMES UP ON THE CHECK. U CAN READ MORE ABOUT IT AT THE BOTTOM OF THE MENU.

zoYysMVgd65eYowTrfZQRQ.review_text: Award winning clam chowder was perfect in a sour dough bread bowl. Fresh bread and butter as an appetizer was excellent. Friendly waiters, fast service, and just a great atmosphere! If your around Pier 39 this is a good place for amazing sea food.

gkjkDvLv4fsMP8b6-Z1d1g.review_text: We are SF locals but decided to venture out and be tourists and get dinner at the Pier. This place had great reviews and we were craving seafood.  Came at about 7pm and were told it was an hour wait for 2. We hung out around the pier and came back after 45 minutes and they were ready for us. Got a beautiful table by the window with a great view.  Mila was our fabulous waitress with a great personality, and told us there is a 15% discount for all locals! Yay!  Right away, got the amazing warm and fresh sourdough. Love.  Started with the crab ceviche with pineapple and avocado. The crab was perfect but pineapple made it too sweet. I give it 3 stars.   Then the amazing, hearty bowl of clam chowder. I have had great chowder and this one is definitely on the top of my list.  For entrees we got the surf and turf and the seafood platter. Surf and turf is delicious with a perfectly made 10 oz steak and delicious crab stuffed lobster.  The seafood platter is generous with lots of clams and mussels and shrimp. The half crab was perfect. Corn is buttery and excellent.  Paired everything with Moscow Mules - must get!   No room for dessert but you do get biscoff cookies with your check.  Great food, would deinitely come back.

bQTeiPhTjEtZqglZC-adjQ.review_text: The view was great. The crab cakes were outstanding. My wife got the clam chowder, it was average at best.  I got the special for the night which was crab stuffed lobster and I didn't walk away to impressed. Wine was great.  Service was average to good So my dinner was average but I paid top dollar.

9vrHfd-WthPj9982vNJW1Q.review_text: Great spot at Pier 39. My kids love seafood and begged to go here for lunch. Didn't see the kids menu so we expected to be ripped off. However, it wasn't bad at all. Kids menu came with the usual crayons and good seafood selection. Son loved his grilled salmon. I had crab cakes which were pretty good. They obviously had panko in them but no lumps of crab which was disappointing. This is why they lost a star.  I should take off two but everything else was good even the service.

XwhSe9jkoLdM9rVWBcNuMQ.review_text: Amazing.  For a tourist, like myself, the view was very nice and all. Water. Alcatraz. Golden gate bridge. Good stuff. But I'm not the type of person who will make excuses for mediocre food, based on what I have to look at while i eat. I could go outside and look at whatever I want for free. Fortunately, the food here stands on its own. I ordered the swordfish. It was undoubtedly the best swordfish I've ever eaten in my life. It came on a bed of fingerling potatoes, grilled onions, peppers and capers. The pesto aioli was perfect, and the fish seriously melts in your mouth. The sourdough bread is pretty awesome, too. However, looking around at the plates of my fellow diners, I can see why some people would be disappointed. My husband got the crab melt, which I tasted. It was alright, nothing amazing.  All I know is, I got that swordfish and it was the bomb diggity.

mT6M9KsElw1anibSP0vW_g.review_text: Swordfish was very good. It looks like chicken, has the texture of steak, and the mixed taste of chicken and a mild fish flavor. Some tasty herbs on it too.  Wonderful view of the bay. Lots of unique menu items. A bit pricey, but understandable given the location and quality.  Had to wait probably 40 minutes for them to call me because it was so busy. So I just went and enjoyed the cool souvenir shop downstairs.

TO5G32j_BZ7zRI3CEPyQ6w.review_text: Pretty solid dinner tonight- came with two other couples. Shared the blue cheese garlic bread to start, which was solid. Entrees for dinner were the ahi (which my friends shared and loved apart from too many sesame seeds), a Caesar salad and clam chowder in a bread bowl (another thumbs up), and the Fog Harbor burger (good except the carmelized onions were more pickled than anything else and taken off after one bite.)  The prices were reasonable, the food was fresh, and the restaurant was nice, airy, and classy while not feeling ultra touristy. Will be back to visit again for sure!

vtRc2ApxN_qYuPDWXAMvtQ.review_text: Even though this is a fish house, I had a cheeseburger.  I'm way picky, so I was disappointed that they couldn't leave the produce in the back. Why? I'm not going to eat it, seems like a waste.  I'm so picky, in fact, that I wont eat what the pickle was sitting on, which was several fries. More to waste. The burger was decent, I can't complain about that.  We got a table with a great view out the window, that was pretty nice.  Oh, the orange juice was basically water with a yellowish color. Very disappointing!

H9tS1F2AE6EmUICXwerV-Q.review_text: My husband and I went to SF for our honeymoon.  When we arrived in town and to our hotel, we were starving.  We walked down to Pier 39 and went in to this place.  It had a nice view and was not too crowded.  Our goal was to try as much different eatery spots as we could, so we wanted to share most of our meals.  We chose the red chili garlic prawns appetizer and the seafood cioppinio.  They were both good and filled us up.  The reason I gave it 3 stars because I was dreaming of something with a San Francisco twist...

lvSf6Q0XG0JuXkC7W9zC-w.review_text: Beautiful location, very nice server. She was very attentive and gave great customer service. The price was what was expected for eating on the pier. I had the crab it was okay, but beautiful. I wold come here again.

eSvRGvm7ms7mwPgW1Yip3Q.review_text: Excellent food, great service, beautiful restaurant. I had the best Seafood Penne pasta with fish, clams and mussels in to die for tomato cream sauce. Definitely will be back.

PAtfHgtoiOlWoE96WSDjfQ.review_text: my boyfriend and i went here tonight. it was our one year. parking garage was very close by, and the first 2 hours is free. the front of the restaurant is very pretty. the decor inside the restaurant is even nicer. we were seated by the window which had a great view of the harbor.   my boyfriend ordered: stella beer (they accidentally gave him a large, which he enjoyed) salmon BLT which came with fries - he loved this so much. he wants me to write he he loved loved it. he wouldnt stop talking about it on the way home  i ordered: cup of clam chowder ($5) - delicious. very clammy. it does not have potatoes in it or i didn't find any. im not complaining because there were plenty of clams. sea bass with garlic mashed ($20) - the sea bass was a little on the dry side. i have had sea bass in different places were it was so much more buttery and flaky. this sea bass had the texture of tilapia. the potatoes were good, wish i had more. it was also served with brocoli and red bell.   our total bill was only 50 bucks plus tip. not bad at all!!  overall, a delicious place to eat, not as pricey as we thought. plus it had a great view and its in the city

68uga8HvM89ptZJFkPTn8Q.review_text: Normally I do not venture down to Pier 39 since I live here but Codmother was closed (A MUST EAT AT) and I had a visitor in town from AZ so I thought, "what the heck."   First and foremost: If you are a local - SKIP AT ALL COSTS.   Pluses:  1. The wait was minimal on a Thursday night in the summer, which was nice.  2. The restaurant seems clean, upscale and has amazing views if you are willing to wait for them.   3. The drinks were amazing. Mixed very well, creatively concocted and delicious.   The minuses: 1.  VERY LOUD AND NOISY. There are way too many tables squeezed in the space available. Normally I wouldn't knock a place for this, but given everything else that was bad, I thought I'd list.  2. The service. It is very apparent that each server has too many tables to handle. Service is extremely slow. We were told 4 times our oysters and crab cakes were on the way however the actual time to receive was approx. 30 minutes. If they sent actually on the way, just don't say it. Again, I wouldn't necessarily knock a place for this however the oysters are raw (easy to plate) and the crab cakes were obviously pre-made and just dropped into a fryer. Also, it would have been nice to get or even be offered bread, when everyone seem to have it. Lastly, when we tried to joke or have any conversation with put waitress at all, she immediately became defensive and didn't get the banter.   3. The food. Crab stuff lobster ... Should include ... Lobster. Additionally the dish should not be sitting on top of boxed (at least that's what they tasted like) mashed potatoes. Or in my opinion not for $36 bucks. The swordfish had a very odd square shape, tasted at one point frozen and was dry.   If you're visiting, hungry and need a place to eat on the pier, choose someplace else. Not at all worth the price.

TYbsgPiTIECsOW2sVrrrwQ.review_text: Ate here with the wife and kids...fantastic.  Wait looked long but we grabbed a high table by the bar with no wait time and no reservation. Ceviche and calamari apps were top notch.  I'm a crab cake nut and loved the Dungeness crab cake dinner.  Even the kids meals and desserts were top quality.  Was worried it would be a tourist only type place but the food really lived up to its hype.

Gq9ByyLeim7NazCwRcJgQA.review_text: I had a lovely lunch there couple of days ago. It is quite a dining room with spacious corridors and large tables. You dont feel cooped up at all. However the food is mediocre for those dollars. My pasta was barely cooked and the sauce was a bland. Although I liked the service even the server guy had no clue about the menu.

Ew3tHMLznk4bj-ErNX09AQ.review_text: Ahi Tuna plate is amazingly delicious for $23!

2cz3Bb2Nq2ytwrSdyuC2Ww.review_text: Our server Khaiman is awesome! So much fun and super helpful!! Love it! All the bartenders are great. Super beautiful spot. Right on the water. Great atmosphere. And family friendly! Food is amazing!

Se23p2kgy48dz2Vkah_KIw.review_text: I came here for my six month anniversary with my boyfriend. He told me to choose a nice place for a seafood dinner with a view of the water. I did some research and the best I could find was the Fog Harbor Fish House.   I loved this place! The staff was very very friendly and the view of the Golden Gate Bridge was amazing! You don't have to dress up super fancy but I recommend a little more than casual dress would be nice in this place. The menu choices are broad and prices aren't going to break the bank. The drinks are great too.  We started out with an order of calamari and they don't skip out on the squid that's for sure! I couldn't stop eating it. I ordered 2 lobster tails that came with fries. My boyfriend got the sampler plate with clams, crab, and another seafood I can't remember. They were both very satisfying and delicious! We were checked on frequently by a very attentive and smiling waiter and had an overall wonderful experience.  We ordered Tiramisu at the end and oh man...I shouldn't have indulged but they bring a tray of desserts over to you so you can choose what you want. Nothing worse than seeing it in front of you! The tiramisu was sooo good. Moist, creamy, and had a perfect espresso flavor to go with our espressos.   The fact that it's right on Pier 39 is great too so you can walk off your dinner around the pier and watch the magicians and performers right by the water.

eBu4BJMnzx0wPCVezsSjNA.review_text: If you don't make time to stop here for clam chowder in a sour dough bread bowl you are crazy and missing out on one of the best meals in San Francisco.  Jon was our waiter and was very nice.  We were able to view the sea lions from out the window along with the boats coming and going.  The Fog Harbour Fish House is a must.

sGYrxVCEJGGBArWI1LUgxQ.review_text: My parent's hotel, The Argonaut, recommended them and I'd previously read on SFGate this restaurant is notable.  I have to tell you - and it might be a surprise to you as well since it's at PIER 39 - it is.  From the food to the service and certainly the views, Fog Harbor Fish House is about as perfect as you'll get for a San Francisco seafood restaurant.  Specializing in sustainable seafood and with a luxe, Malibu-style gorgeous outdoor space by the entry complete with roaring fireplace, Fog Harbor Fish House is a perfect choice for out-of-town friends and family you're hosting to a romantic date.   It's such a surprise to find a "view" restaurant not resting on its laurels or looking a little dated and frumpy (you know who you are).  From the overflowing amount of crab in the San Francisco favorite Crab Louie salad, to the crispy and fresh calamari appetizer to truly, one of the best bowls of steamed clams you may ever have, it was a perfect lunch at Fisherman's Wharf.  Sleek, modern yet comfortable, the ambiance strikes the perfect chord as does its food.  It's just a bit pricey (you will, after all, pay for the pluperfect view) however the quality and postcard perfect location equate to Fog Harbor Fish House being well-priced.  I would go there again in a heartbeat, all on my "local own"   -without out-of-town family and friends.  If you're thinking, "Wow, that's pretty high praise"... it is.  And Fog Harbor Fish House surely deserves it.

6IpZCod9jWw7qwBrKFxdtg.review_text: If you want a view of the bay, this place is probably as good as any. The menu has the seafood fare that you'd expect, priced on the high side. The food is safe though not special. The staff is competent and aim to please. You can't go wrong.

RbVB7X6G7MsOTY7Jkd0wiQ.review_text: Upon arriving we were seated fairly quickly.. And were immediately greeted by our waiter David.. The restaraunt had amazing ambiance And the food was off the page delicious...!  We were completely satisfied . The muscle fries were hashtag pow!! David is absolutely and asset to this business..

c9X_eqz6Rr_st-6-6qql3Q.review_text: Myself and my girl and another couple ate her Saturday night, the place rocks.   I had the crusted Ahi Tuna and garlic mashed and t was the best i've ever had.   My girl had the Seafood Capinnio and that was also great, the other couple both had the Clam Chowder bread bowl, being from Boston Im very picky on chowda, but that chowda was some of the best i have had.   Our Dinner was $ 104, but there where a few drinks also added in there....will be back for sure...

hoXkft1ZRl5mXCh04Pv75A.review_text: Fresh Bay Crab Ceviche and fried shrimp plate were simply D-LISH! The entire staff was super friendly and my wife and I were seated next to the window overlooking the bay. The waiter was very prompt and the food was absolutely amazing! We WILL be back. The decor and ambiance was superb. Kudos to the entire team at Fog Harbor.

Yfra3fRnskqW3jIJLvEQ3Q.review_text: Food was great! Fancy place to go on a nice date. Service was a bit slow, but nothing to be worried about. Great Clam Chowder!

Dwu59YY2uedK3barvDMg7A.review_text: if you want to get seated right away, do Go elsewhere. The hostesses were rude and ignored us when we were standing in front of them. It took them a while to notice that we were standing there waiting to get seated. It did not look like they were happy to be at work. It was my first time here and first impressions are important. So so Glad our waiter took really good care of us. Drinks and food was mediocre. Do get their pumpkin spice bread pudding with vanilla ice cream! It was so yummy. Four stars for our waiter, he was awesome!

w8dy-ibFrNXBfA-TdQDCIQ.review_text: First, I need to give a shout-out to Faycal and Oscar. Their service was five star quality. Be sure to ask for them the next time you're dining at Fog Harbor.  Ours was a big party - two full tables - and we were seated in the back of the restaurant, which had lovely views, but no air circulation. As the sun went down, the room became entirely too stuffy for comfort. I had to get up to walk outside several times just to clear my head. The bar and main restaurant areas were a good 10-15 degrees cooler. That said, it was really nice outside; the wharf is a beautiful place to have dinner.  The fried calamari is an excellent way to start a meal at Fog Harbor. Crispy and expertly cooked, they were absolutely delicious.  If you like sourdough bread, then you'll love the stuff here. People at our tables also raved about the clam chowder, the tuna and the garlic-roasted crab.   The red chili prawns are flavorful, and pack a decent zing, but the steamed clams lacked flavor. Stick with the more highly spiced dishes and you'll be fine.  Desserts were A-OK as well. Nothing too fancy. Our table had just about every dish offered, and I tried most of them. My favorites were the blondie, the apple crisp, and the cheesecake.

IMoGoqC5TKTPMTMTvlnctQ.review_text: This place never lets me down. They have the best clam chowder and im sure everything else is good too. Ive only come here a couple of times but their food has always been killer. Today i ordered the Cioppino and the Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail. I thought i was gonna get those big ass shrimps in my cocktail. But although they were good they looked average sized. But the Ciopoino made up for it. It was so good. I've tried other Ciopinos and none of them compared. I've never liked crab or clams but this made me want more of them. Also the fish they put in was cooked to perfection and so was the shrimp. This is a must have if you come here and if you don't like Ciopino you haven't tried their Ciopino.

mHcC4VIWHsa3JMQqekcIzA.review_text: Had an excellent dinner here with my boyfriend on our trip to the west coast.  The clam chower was sooo delicious.  We also enjoyed the shrimp scampi and the crab pasta.  The icebuef wedge was also yummy.  We really enjoyed sitting by the window and looking out on the bay and the city.  It was a great treat!

f6UgQ4hByardViAlor6Rsw.review_text: Really nice restaurant on Pier 39 with great views of the harbor. Their "Award Winning Clam Chowder" is just that! Simply Amazing!!!! We also ordered the calamari, which was okay, my fiancé really liked it, but I would rate it a 6.5. I live in the Central Valley and I take weekend trips to San Francisco every so often and this place I will definitely return too ;)
