wL73AeqiZ9qABmDVP8xkUQ.review_text: We came here for a late dinner after a SF bay cruise and were able to be seated earlier than our reservation. It was super easy to find and the atmosphere was great. Their outside waiting area is really nice with a fireplace and couches and the ambiance inside is great, including the view of the bay and lighthouse. We didn't order appetizers, but I had the ahi, which was AMAZING, and my date had the crab cake dinner which he liked as well. I would definitely order the ahi if you go. Over all, I would definitely go back because the restaurant was nice, wait staff was friendly, and food was delicious! :)

Txu5nzNNce_txZv9TY1Frw.review_text: My hubby and I went out to dinner on a date night to this place! I loved the crab it was so good! we ordered the cajun style. over all we had a great experience.

uDZ2AclY1bnVtxbjbM7jfA.review_text: Such great food and service! Always a treat to come here. Not to mention the hot blonde bartender and the sexy muscled GM!

25QcyhHIE1Iizie3Znk9Iw.review_text: Dude.  This place is legit.  I have a foodie family and we were on vacation when we tried out Fog Harbor.  Being a foodie family, we tried many excellent restaurants, but Fog Harbor was FAR AND AWAY the best meal of our vacation.  So so good.  We started with the grilled artichoke appetizer with the crab dip and it was... amazing.  Then our meals came out.  My dad ordered the Mixed Grill dish.  He said that everything on it was excellent but the salmon blew him away.  My mom had the fish and chips and it was a solid, well-done version of fish and chips.  My brother ordered the garlic crab which was outstanding... as was everything else on his plate (like the corn and potatoes).  I ordered one of the specials - a pesto halibut that was phenomenal.  Great flavors.  It was such a wonderful meal that we were nervous to get dessert, fearing that we might end on a clunker.  Our waitress assured us, though, that the desserts where worth trying and so we ordered the chocolate banana bread pudding.  The waitress was so right... that dessert was... INCREDIBLE.  It was so good, we were trying to figure out if we could go back there and get another one as an afternoon snack before we leave town.    Oh, and the atmosphere is lovely, the view is pretty nice depending on where you sit, and the service was fantastic.  Seriously.  If you're on Pier 39... go here.  It is a divine blessing.

1CtHuzZDw13yZfl_CpJCrg.review_text: Went to this place with a friend during a visit to San Fran. After seeing a lot of local fare on tv a few weeks prior and with my boyfriend not being much of a fish person thus meaning I get to eat it so infrequently, I figured I'd seek out one of the better restaurants on pier 39 to have a delicious fish dinner.  We sat by the window and had a gorgeous view of Alcatraz and the harbor, and most of the restaurant has this view even if you're not sitting at the window, so this is an excellent spot if you're a tourist and want the whole experience while you dine.  I had the swordfish with chimichurri sauce. I'm seeing some photos here of that dish served with mixed greens in addition to the wild rice, but my vegetable was broccoli mixed with pearl onions and that was it. I love broccoli, but for such a delicious fish it seemed really lackluster in comparison, and the pearl onions didn't really do much to help. I would have much preferred asparagus, or at least for the broccoli to be anything other than steamed. I dipped it in the garlic sauce from my friends meal, big improvement, sad it wasn't better.   The swordfish steak, however, was perfectly tender and seasoned. I haven't had swordfish in years and after having read that their menu is sustainably caught I had to try it. It didn't disappoint!  We also got a sampling of their seasonal dungeness crab menu by trying the mango and avocado dungeness crab cocktail. The portion could feed one person as a meal it was so huge, and between the two of us we were concerned we wouldn't have enough room for our meals (but not in a bad way, we were loving every minute of it!). This appetizer was packed with crab and really showcased the ingredient in a deliciously fresh way.  My friend ordered the seafood platter which had clams, mussels and crab legs and claws in a garlic butter sauce. I'm not much of a shellfish person, but thanks to Fog Harbor, I now know it was simply because I hadn't had them done well, and these were so delicious I'm seriously wondering where garlic mussels have been all my life. If I were to return I would order this item in a heartbeat, and if you're a garlic lover, you'll absolutely love this!  I look forward to returning and trying more from their menu, but given that their seasonal dungeness crab menu is for a limited time, I'd say definitely try something from that list if you go in the next few weeks, it all looks good!

T1Hm29LPbtLg8kyASJiOTw.review_text: Excellent!!! Beautiful view. Impeccable service. Delicious five star food. Caitlyn, our server was friendly and courteous. The food came out quickly. Presentation was perfect. I ordered the shrimp plate and it was fresh and tasty. The fries and coleslaw were great. My husband ordered soup and sliders and loved the plates. We came to San Francisco on a cruise and having excellent fresh food was just what we needed! Thank you! We will be coming back here!!

i6w1V5iPWdYKVPnZLOeLkA.review_text: At first I had my doubts.  I mean this restaurant is smack dab in the middle of tourist trap heaven!  But once we were greeted and seated, it felt miles from the madness.  Our window side table was fabulous with a clear shot of Alcatraz right before the fog rolled in.  Our waitress was not only friendly and attentive, but also gorgeous. Our party of 9 + 2 kids was a handful, but she took care of all of us and was prompt and attentive.  I had the filet and a ginger beer cocktail (skinny style) and both were great.  For dessert I ordered the apple crumble and it did not disappoint.  My colleagues all enjoyed their meals -- ranging from kids meals to linguini and clams -- and the ambiance of the place.  It was classic, with soothing music and a nice busy vibe without being overwhelming.  This place is a classic and if you want a nice view and some good food & service, book a table here right away!

z-oO1tVXUwLt8G1NDZwWDQ.review_text: This is my favorite seafood restaurant on Pier 39. It's a little high scale, but very delicious, fresh fish.  I've had the seared ahi tuna, and have been in heaven. The fish is super fresh and the service is great. It does get a bit crowded (due to being located on Pier 39).   Also, I love the location -- it's high up right above the pier and the view is beautiful, especially at sunset. Great restaurant!

Syt_iQqW_c9T2_lrvsddqQ.review_text: The 3 stars are kind of for the view. The food is nothing remarkable, but you could do worse around Pier 39. I've had lunch a few times at Fog Harbor...today I had a Caesar Salad which was pretty good, and Fried Calamari which was good enough but arrived cold.   I was interested in Salmon but they only serve farm raised. Prices aren't cheap, and I think for an expensive seafood lunch you're better off at McCormick and Kuleto's in Ghirardelli Square, which I'm no big fan of but their food is a notch above and the view is beautiful there too....

ypszj7RqjV3JohA5EfuXWA.review_text: 20% discount with AAA membership  I had a late lunch on a Sunday afternoon. The service was good. The garlic mash potatoes were yummy.

yW5ajGtDmMAujfld63J-eQ.review_text: Alright, you can call me a tourist!  I've taken numerous visitors to the wharf for clam chowder, sourdough bread, and a ton of salt water taffy.  We usually just stroll around and end up in whatever restaurant is available since they all mostly serve the same things.  This has been my favorite one BY FAR.  There was a bit of a wait in the beginning, about 30 minutes but it was completely worth it.   The inside was right by the water, great atmosphere and comfortable.  The food came seriously so fast I didn't even get a chance to blink.  They must have the kitchen in some kind of military boot camp order if the drinks came out before the drink!  All the food was delicious and I will definitely be back here.  I feel like such a tourist giving a place like this 5 stars but I can't help it!  The food, the night, the company, the atmosphere this evening was just perfect =)

d4eYokLq5v_0solWv6Ocog.review_text: This is my fault. Really, it is.   We picked a spot right on Pier 39 full of tourists on a Sunday afternoon. Guh. Why did I do that?   All right, the oysters were delicious and fresh. I'll give them that! No horseradish though. The crab sandwich was okay - the bread that it was served in was very good, but the crab itself was a little bland and just too cold. Needed a little sauce or something to flavor it better.   Anyway, our server was just flat, lusterless and almost angry at times. The place was overly busy, but she could have at least tried to appear happy.   I shan't be back.  EDIT: I'm editing this to a 3 star. The food was 3-4 stars but the service was 2-3 stars. The manager seems extremely conscientious and has contacted me with questions on how they can improve - I appreciate this chance for personal feedback!

sy16cRWw8TOhj3M6tyTirg.review_text: Live in So. Cal but my sister lives in the bay area and we have been to this restaurant twice now.  I have nothing bad to say about it except that if you go there and it is in no way crowded they should let you sit by the window if you request it.  I requested a window and was told the tables were reserved (which I later observed was a lie).  Other than that the food was to die for both times and the service (save for the hostess) was excellent.  Will definitely eat there again when I get back up to the city.

9_dHJM9z0Pn_4W8v6u4fSg.review_text: This is just for the bar because we didn't eat there at all.  In fact, we didn't even drink inside the restaurant so I can't justify giving 5 stars but I did spend around 2.5 hours a whole lotta dough getting drinks at the bar and drinking outside in front of the fireplace listening to the live Christmas music they were playing in the streets below.  The atmosphere was really nice, air was fresh and it was warm enough.  The bartender was really nice but it did take a long time for him to ring us up but that's because he was making the drinks for everybody in the house and NO ONE was helping him.  In fact I was mad for him because the other guys should have at least helped us while he made the drinks for the other patrons, but that's not my place.    I think it'll be a nice area if you just want to grab a few drinks and relax, the couches outside are comfy and the people there were totally cool with us chilling there drinking. 2 blue moons and 2 shots equaled to 24.00, not bad especially in a place that has a lot of tourists.

nsK_Kf_s28rEF_Oyi5mIgA.review_text: Had the shrimp Louie salad and it was huge!  Couldn't even finish it, which means a lot because I have a crazy appetite.  Kinda wish I would of ordered the clam chowder so I could compare it to the fish hopper but oh well there's always next time.  I also tried the crab, shrimp sandwich.  It was eh, alright.  Kinda dry, lacked some flavor.  If you get it I would order a side of tarter sauce.  The bread they give you to start with is amaze.  Sour dough bread makes me happy!  Staff was also very accommodating.  See you soon fog house :)

_UB1WXP6gZ1wU_Gall-y2w.review_text: They have the freshest, best seafood of any place. It is on par with Scomas. The clan chowder is delicious.

RZKArMj_vXzcg5ehdkTlsg.review_text: Eh. We ate here since we had already paid $25 to park for an Alcatraz cruise. The food was ok, but kind of over priced. I wouldn't come back or go out of my way to eat here. It's a large place with lots of people and makes for a noisy environment. Lots of obnoxious kids who lacked parental guidance.

_OCVA417JevjE1ifcftgIA.review_text: I usually don't ever come to the Piers because it's super touristy and crowded. The food here is pretty good. I got the Trout and calamari appetizers. My friends got the lobster mac and cheese, salmon, cippino and fried platter. Everything was pretty good and the portions are pretty big. I would definitely come here again. We parked at 80 francisco parking garage it's $10 for the full day until 9 pm.

CrDBJKwmGuAwN9upipfsiA.review_text: The best clam chowder in a bread bowl I have ever and will ever have! Phenomenal!! Chase it down with a Anchor Steam and you're good to go! My GF and I absolutely loved this place. From the ambience to the outstanding service. If it's the famous Clam Chowder in a Sourdough Bowl you're looking for ....Fog Harbor is the place to go.

r20fgMU5gW0R24eONq8IxQ.review_text: Stopped by on my visit to California. Had reservations for the evening but stopped in for lunch and was quickly accommodated.  Food was delicious, had the clam chowder, a must, baked oysters and the seafood penne and had the penne substituted for linguine. All were excellent. Would definitely recommend. Beautiful views of the bay and Alcatraz.

E9T0Irm2d52T2yh1r0DwEA.review_text: Started with the calamari. Needed some seasoning but definitely not overcooked. We ordered three entrees and they were: ahi tuna, crab roll and the garlic roasted dungeness crab.  The portions were pretty decent and the ahi tuna with mashed potatoes was incredibly fresh and unbelievable.  The crab roll was really good and came with fries and the garlic roasted dungeness crab came with corn on the cob and was good. It was the first time I tried a roasted dungeness crab.  I definitely prefer steamed but it was worth the try. Plenty of garlic and was definitely happy with the choices we made. Will definitely visit again the next time we're in town.

W6ox4O7lYbRWPYtFTKjNRw.review_text: Had the "WOW" factor!  Amazing food!!!  Prices were reasonable.  You get what you pay for.  Will definitely be back again to try everything else =D

pzeMuYKBmiEuLzHVxZgvvg.review_text: I went here for my birthday dinner and the service and food were great!  My friend and I had the Cioppino and it was pretty awesome.  I would definitely come here again!

zBMPGHJYyBK6rJfb_ycXXA.review_text: Environment: 2nd floor of Pier 39. Pretty big restaurant and most of the seats are by the windows so you can see the water!  Food: I've been here twice and the food is honestly nothing special. I would stick to a bowl of chowder and a salad here.  Price: Under 25$ a person unless you're ordering drinks too. 2.5 dollar signs!  Occasion: We came here for a friends birthday dinner. They seated us at a round table (were were a group of 7) right by the window. And they wrote "happy birthday" on our table for us. A little tacky but we appreciated the effort!  Overall: I think this place is good for parties bigger than 4. The food can definitely use some work but the chowder is good!

QRr4WYhQcdqHhXfREEfEgQ.review_text: So yummy! I love coming to this place, I've been here a couple of times, but this last time, the food and service were exceptional. The host was super nice (I forget his name, but he was a young Latino). The waitress (I think her name was Monica) was very friendly and checked up on us frequently, but not too much.  And let me tell you about the food- I'm getting hungry as I write this.... I had the calamari (very tasty, not the usual rubbery yucky stuff); the cioppino (also very tasty, but I couldn't finish all of it); and the tiramisu (man, that's the stuff right there...). I've never really had managers come up to my table and ask me how I'm doing, I was really impressed that they did that. For such a large restaurant, they're on top of it.  Plus, the view of the bay isn't too shabby :) Check it out- it's NOT a tourist trap, I pinky swear.

L9AJkS7jMhf8cYo3AE6rjQ.review_text: I sat at the bar and the service was great!  Nice cold beer and to start off we had calamari...very good.  I had the tuna and it was perfect.  served with veggies and mash potatoes.    I will be back!

4WdpCYeDguXbNv3Ku1HHBA.review_text: Delicious!!!  Nikko hands down best costumer service.. Had a wonderful dinner food is great..

Sp8Gnvy1vtdj7Y1egXS9cQ.review_text: My husband & I enjoyed this place. The service was great. The food was awesome. This would be a great place to bring friends, your family, in-laws, its so comfortable u could dine alone!

8XrM2C6Gp4-Nztsum9jPcw.review_text: We made reservations here to start off our day in the city to show my friend from SoCal around.  The place is right in the middle of all the touristy destinations. We waited around 10 minutes for them to set up our table, but we just looked at the menu and decided what we wanted to order during that time. The place is very nicely decorated and we were seated next to the windows. We got a very good view of the ocean and the activities outside! To top it off, our waiter was also very pleasant and gave us some recommendations of what we should order too.   What we ordered: - Blue Cheese Garlic Bread: so good! It's a must-order starter. Definitely could of gotten full from this alone.  - Fried Combo: Consisted of fried fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries and cole slaw. We could not finish this. It was huge.  - Seafood Cioppino: We added the pasta with the crab, fish, shrimp, scallops, clams and mussels in the stew. This was amazing and definitely my favorite. I loved the crab and scallops; both were very fresh. We tried to finish this, but we couldn't either.   The portions here are huge. Everything was worth the price. The three of us could not finish our meals. My SoCal friend really liked this place. We really wanted to order dessert, but we were stuffed.   All of us definitely full and were happy to walk off our meal afterwards by the bay. I would recommend coming here if you're showing of San Francisco to someone! I would want to try the clam chowder, more seafood, and desserts next time!

6lVdZlDnBEc0fuUzZ6OkNg.review_text: Great food. Prices are a bit higher that the Yelp summary makes you think, so bring some extra money. Clam chowder is amazing as is the sourdough brad bowls!

md_v4AHsmu_KP6Bc4REWhA.review_text: Madison was awesome as our waitress. She was not pushy and we stayed longer and spent more! He is a keeper!

sA4ZTzEFNZSh668S2sldaQ.review_text: Serviceable seafood for tourist from Toledo.  Large Middle American portions too.  A classy alternative for those who've outgrown the Hard Rock.

b44pSPvJZ8y-PZ6cNYJytA.review_text: Great location. Seafood was fresh. Amazing service with a phenomenal view!

e-uR0uACjDx9lFE2rBEDrA.review_text: I've been here a couple of times and both times I've been satisfied. The food is good, although I haven't had anything amazing.   This last visit I started with clam chowder and the red chili garlic shrimp. The clam chowder is really good. The sauce for the shrimp is tasty with a nice kick. I had a half order of the roasted garlic crab. That was good too, but not as good as I expected. Also had a couple of Moscow mules from the bar that were good.  Service is pretty good however out waitress seemed a little flustered. She was pleasant but probably just overwhelmed since it was s busy night.  Overall my experience both times were good. It's in a great location (Pier 39) if you want to walk off your food after, grab dessert or just check out the view.

vY9L93W2q32d-YMvW2rLpw.review_text: For Fisherman's Wharf this place is good.  I had the clam chowder, which was good, not great.  But then I had the Ahi Tuna - this was fantastic and cheap.  For $23 it was a huge piece with veggies and mashed potatoes.  Tasted great!  Get the free blue cheese garlic bread from the yelp ad too ;)

DNmeLov3wXNxlxjN5feBoQ.review_text: After a long day in the city, we decided to go to Pier 39 for dinner.  Despite all the restaurants available to us, we decided on Fog House based on the decor outside (a nice fireplace with a seating area and ample room inside).  I ordered the spicy shrimp appetizer and it was pretty tasty, but VERY spicy if you like that kind of thing.  For my entree, I ordered the garlic roasted whole crab.  Although it was very flavorful and good, it was missing a claw (my favorite part and the best meat in my opinion).  So I told the waiter who was very apologetic and said he would take care of it.  About 5 minutes later, a whole plate of seafood arrived at my table and the waiter proceeded to apologize and the chef made a special dish for us to make up for the gaffe.    I'm a firm believer that it's not what the restaurant does wrong, but it's what they do to correct the problem and they get an A++++ from me for that.  4-stars based on the good, but not outstanding food.

W-KwcVc40lNDgMPL5n-B0A.review_text: I been here a few times.  Service is always great!  Drinks are really good.  I really like their fried combo platter (fish, shrimp, calamari, fries, served with tartar sauce and a red sauce and cole slaw)).  My wife had the special of the day. Salmon stuffed with crab meat. She really likes this place.  It has a great view of Alcatraz since it's on the top floor.  I would go back with no hesitation.

Q4ksGMVKcTzNi5CDpoAE4Q.review_text: Every table here has a view of the SF bay. Our waiter Bernie was personable, professional and constantly checked on us. Kudos Bernie! Next time we come back, we will ask for you.  The food was absolutely delicious. Every dish in our party was excellent. The assortment of appetizers we had: calamari, clam chowder and crab cakes were outstanding. Must save room for their desserts which were of course worth burning off the next day.

DJDS4P_0nrEk7Dt4iyfqnw.review_text: Excellent New England clam chowder and fish and chips!  The portion sizes were big too.  Service was excellent also.  Will definitely be back again when visiting.

QxMx12ZCth8g4jtQCur-NA.review_text: There are tourist traps and then there are city gems that are conveniently placed for tourists to relish in. This is one of the later.  A great atmosphere with a great smattering of universal and signature sf seafood dishes.  Plus, they have paper on their tables which puts them on my list of fav sf restaurants quite automatically.

4XAPdDK3h0Uc0kYLdJCR1A.review_text: Service is definitely off par starting from the time we waited for our table, to getting our food.  The server dropped our french fries on the table and said she was going to replace it, but she never came back. Asked for more water and it took about ten minutes before I got anything.   Asked for a bottle of ketchup and a guy brings it out only to give it to another table.   If you want to put up with this kind of crap, this place is for you.  If there was a negative star I'd give it to them.

aYEqNwqF-YsB9g7lmrAJvQ.review_text: I came here for my birthday a couple months back, and as I went around the table, I got both positive and negative feedback. I heard that the pasta was horrible, but they could've been exaggerating. However, everyone else that ordered food besides from the pasta said that it was pretty good. I enjoyed my lobster tails very much =) The prices aren't cheap, but for a nice restaurant at Pier 39 with a killer view, what do you expect? Overall, I'm not dying to go back, but definitely wouldn't mind if I do.

_4b1jlm5DZ7LyIQ6_pLIdg.review_text: We love this place.  We came from Southern California for a little vacation and found Fog Harbor after touring Alcatraz.  We looked at the other restaurants and decided to eat here.  Amazing!  We started with the Ahi Poke, I fell in love!  The taste and the mango sauce was mouth watering.  My husband had the steak and he loved it.  I had the Clam Chowder and it is the best I have ever had.  Especially in the Sourdough bowl.  Our server Khaiman was wonderful, excellent with tour information and service.  I recommend it for anyone going to San Francisco and I will go again!!

zZxaFnid9SdKy1ToRSHuAQ.review_text: We stopped in on a whim, we liked that they fished 100% sustainably! And the view of the harbor, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz was great! Wow well we were pleasently surprised! The food was absolutely amazing! We had the crab and risotto fritters and then swordfish and the lobster tail as entrees. Finishing with the apple crumble and tiramisu as desert, the apple crumble was the better of the two though but were great! But really it was our waiter Charlie that made us love it even more. His service was great and he was able to really make recommendations and seemed very knowledgeable about the food and the wines! And the manager on duty was also a pleasure to talk to and was on the floor much of the night so she was easy to grab and talk to! We'll definitely be back and would definitely recommend!

KmPhSm1ckHpigirrUJ5LZQ.review_text: Great food and what view.  After a great day at #nada2015 the #webdocpeter and Ron "madmax" needed a big meal.  Started with the clam chowder and finishing with the crab.    Angie is going to be so jeolous. The desert was great

_w_Vj5p4-vECHKXDIiY-UA.review_text: First time coming to the pier since moving to the Bay Area so we just picked a place. The chef was awesome enough to make us a delicious crab dip bread bowl even though they don't offer it. Our food and service was great! We were in a hurry to catch the ferry and the waiter made sure everything came out fast. Definitely will be coming again.

cwt1eDIvIYADP5v6UbTy1A.review_text: Aight, I'll keep it short and simple.   The waiter was nice, check.   BOMB AHI TUNA STEAK. EAT IT.  That's actually all I can remember. I'll update my review in a weekend or two.

ymohZAk94wGZMjPYe-EjdQ.review_text: Came here to meet up with a couple friends, because the boyfriend really wanted seafood. Naturally, we ordered a spread of different seafood dishes including crab ceviche, clam chowder, a seafood platter and the cioppino.   Clam chowder was decent, nothing special and definitely can find better in San Francisco. The seafood platter was also standard, and came with a ton of different shellfish, enough for all of us. I was most excited for and most disappointed by the cioppino; it was literally boiled array of seafood swimming in tomato sauce and immensely lacked depth of flavor.   On the other hand, the restaurant had a great view and good service, but definitely more of a touristy place. Don't know why I expected anything more from Fisherman's Wharf.

KjLNlhXAS7QKlLCY5QpcAw.review_text: I have to say, they have a very nice view of the harbor! And yummy clam chowder!!  But the excitement kinda ended there. We ordered the seafood penne and the crab cake but both were OK. The seafood penne didn't have much flavor, though it had a lot of seafood so that was nice. You couldn't really taste much of the crab in the crab cake because the herbs kinda overpowered it.

qxeIhWOJfg9k8O7GRqb41Q.review_text: Yes, the rumors are true, their clam chowder soup is good.Get it while it's hot!  First of all, I totally love the view. The restaurant is right next to the bay on the second floor Pier, so anywhere you sit, you can dine and enjoy the ocean/harbor view. I like to daydream while I eat, so this place was a dream come true.  Service was superb, they seated us prompted and gave us a quick meal as we mentioned we were on a time constraint. I order oyster anywhere I go, and theirs were fresh, no surprises though since this is the bay area. Really wished I had time to try the Dungeoness crab, but we were rushing around. But no worries, I will be back for you, San Francisco!

bJcH5UNzLCXk-pxHnwAi9g.review_text: AWFUL service. I am not sure if we just hit them at a weird time but literally the table next to us got in after us and left before us. We sat around most of the time just waiting waiting for our food which was soup and salad only. One of the girls in our party ordered a clam chowder bread bowl and we were all half way down with our meal before she got hers. I think they must have completely forgot about our soup because after we said something to the waiter it came right out - except for our one friend. The bread it came with was good, I would not call the clam chowder "award winning" too creamy but did have some good flavor. The drinks we had were good but all in all this place is an over priced tourist trap.

1cIQLxwC9sCS5buvKREj0g.review_text: OH. MY. GOD.  Best calamari I have EVER had in my San Francisco experience to date!!    My friend and I were quoted 15 minutes on our wait, and were seated within about 5.  The decor and lighting is just stunning, it really sets a nice mood for a romantic date and feels really swank.  Lots of patrons in business suits, dressy attire, and couples lounging around, not a lot of younger people dining here (as in, under 16).    We were seated, checked on promptly, the wait staff was friendly, polite, and knowledgeable.  The food was absolutely TO DIE FOR.  Pairing the Calamari appetizer with a Savignon Blanc was just the perfect dining choice, while my friend ordered the Garlic Bread, which was by far, also the best I ever tasted in my life.  I am putting this restaurant away in my mental filing cabinet for "place to go on a really hot swanky date"... om nom nom... I had to shield my eyes from the rest of the menu because everything sounded amaaaaaaazing!

ml201bMwSAWs3y3w8Yl2Hw.review_text: The owners could have lazily rested on their location laurels and served boring, expensive tourist fare. Instead, they take the high road serving fresh sea food provided by friendly, professional staff. It's the exceptional restaurant indeed  that is right in the heart of one of the biggest tourist traps on the west coast that provides really good food. Our server "Bong" (not a typo) was courteous and prompt and got our order right. On the downside: my salmon was a bit dry, the atmosphere is unimaginative and the place is packed to the rafters. If you're stuck at Pier 39 for whatever reason, this is the place to go.

C53glIBDgyrkvuPVZ0xocg.review_text: Great atmosphere and a real nice place. Got the sea scallops, so good, and nice n' spicy. Not a big selection of beers, but a great selection of wine.

WQ8XspqfeK9eZ1_sVFojeQ.review_text: One of those places that doesn't have to try very hard, with a Pier 39 location offering splendid views of San Francisco Bay, Fisherman's Wharf and Sausalito. And, because putting its best foot forward isn't necessary, it doesn't.   Yes, the sourdough bread was excellent. And the fish part of fish and chips earned rave reviews. But the chips were mediocre, and lunch went downhill from there. The calamari was fishy. The Crab Louie, which generally includes avocado in California, didn't here - it was added for an extra charge. And a warm spinach salad "with bacon" had only microscopic hints, as if it was lightly sprinkled from a shaker.      If you want a nice San Francisco meal at a tourist destination, consider the Ferry Building instead.

yGHP5LUQe73kOvYQZF6Dqg.review_text: Beautiful place to eat at with a view. Going straight to the point- two orders of clam Chowder in a sourdough bread bowl, 2 Laguanitas IPA, and calamari. Calamari with tarter sauce was good. However I think they used squid instead of calamari. Sauce was on point. The clam chowder was creamy and delicious. I got a bite of clam in every spoonful. The complimentary bread was great but I wish it were more hot. Total bill was $56 before tip.

IFyGlsXVPtGRojVHkomWuw.review_text: Lovely server Madison charmed her way into our hearts just about instantly!  Charm, grace, wit, humor and maturity beyond her years created a stellar experience for us last Saturday night at this most dreamy of ocean view restaurants!  The view of the boats and sparkling lights on the water was mesmerizing.  A window seat on the water front, a full moon night, a first date!  What more could a girl ask for?  Granted, I am not let out of my cage that often, but this was a truly magical dining experience.   As my date and I basically took out a rental on the table we occupied for the greater part of the evening, I would say that our server went above & beyond the call of duty in catering to all our whims and needs.  Oh yes, and the food was delicious!  We loved the clam chowder, I ordered the Mixed Grill plate, and darned if I remember what my date ordered, but I know he cleaned his plate!  Five stars for sure!

NPfyoniUdBxoSecM7jMNOw.review_text: Great food. Not as touristy as I would have thought for the location at fisherman's wharf.  The clam chowder was very good.  I don't recommend getting it in the bread bowl though because the bread soaks up the soup.  Definitely get dungeness crab!  Messy but delicious.

PTLfianlaIhaMjoqiOPwiw.review_text: One of the best restaurant experiences my husband and I have ever had! It's a lovely, elegant place while still having a relaxing, casual feel.  We made reservations, and secured a nice table overlooking the bay. I enjoyed the bleu cheese garlic bread, which is free with yput Yelp check-in! Too bad my husband couldn't eat any, because of a gluten allergy.  I ordered a couple oysters, which were amazing and made me wish I ordered more! I ordered Garlic Herb Dungeness Crab, which was amazing!  This place is great about handling food allergies. My husband has gluten and mushroom allergies, and ordered the chicken, with which he was thoroughly impressed.   Definitely go here for a lovely atmosphere, delightful food, and a classy experience!

ReGxijkS5xZ-JrcmO_DMjQ.review_text: My boyfriend and I went here (after reading some reviews on Yelp!) for a nice lunch on the waterfront on our recent trip through San Francisco. I was looking for some high quality, fresh seafood and this place prides themselves on their sustainable seafood selection!  First they seated us at a table away from the windows and when asked, quickly and politely got us a nice booth instead with a view of the water and sights.   Service was nothing short of great: a prompt, courteous waiter who didn't hover but brought us our drinks and complimentary fresh-baked sourdough bread with butter and tended to our needs unobtrusively.  Food was delicious; I ordered the Grill Combo which featured perfect portions of shrimp, swordfish and salmon in a delicious citrus butter sauce with a side of veggies and choice of wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes. My boyfriend ordered the Fried Combo, which came with a very generous portion of house-battered and fried calamari, shrimp, and cod, with French fries on the side and dipping sauces. My one disappointment: the side of veggies was not to my liking, a green that looked like stringy broccoli cooked with some cocktail onions. I expected some mixed veggies at least!   All in all a great meal and experience! No wonder they get such great reviews! MUCH better than a generic Joe's Crab Shack experience any day!!!

Aai51NrR1F5qHaMHZ5inDg.review_text: My family took me here for Father's Day and I had a great experience.    Delicious food, great view, awesome servers.  It was Father's Day and really busy but we had made reservations and was promptly seated at a table nest to the window.  Ordered the Tuna Poke and fried scallops.  They were delicious.  My sons asked me to get a second order of the Poke.  I ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna and it was done perfectly.  My son ordered the Salmon BLT and cleaned his plate.

CL0he8wexb23zI7PDe8FUw.review_text: This placed seemed like it would be better but I should have expected mediocre at best. The service was so quick it was dizzying at moments. I do realize that since it's on pier 39 they are probably slammed often, but Geezus it was quick. I didn't get that relaxed restaurant atmosphere. We ordered calamari with a lemon aioli which was pretty good and it was good serving size however you get the tiniest ramekin of aioli to go with such a large portion. Me and the hubs ordered clam chowder in a bread bowl (cuz we were being tourist-y)  he ordered his with a side Caesar salad. The salad came out as three whole romaine lettuce leaves with a splatter of dressing. It was so bad he didn't eat more than a bite. The clam chowder was full of clams and nice and thick, but it had HUGE pieces of celery in it and the bread bowl was half full at best so I was a bit disappointed. Overall not a restaurant I would enjoy again.

Eq4z0BzNPB_BvE1UP74ALw.review_text: Pass. This is a hard review to write after just one visit, but as it is located at Pier 39/fisherman's wharf, most folks will have a very similar experience. Lots of tourist crass, as expected in the general area, we chose this restaurant because it had the best yelp rating. As walk-ups on a slowish Tuesday night we were seated way in the back far from the scenic window view. Ok, fair enough. We liked but didn't love the lobster Mac and cheese. We liked the creamy clam chowder. The broth for the steamed clams was dull, and the panko encrusted scallops served with jalapeño aioli were a deep fried mess. The cocktails, @$13 per were tasty and along with the fresh sourdough bread were the highlights of the meal. Not likely to recommend this place to foodie tourist.

WeV73N2zV8CxbKTCfw6nwA.review_text: The best clam chowder ever and it was reasonably priced ($10 per bread bowl). The blue cheese salad was just alright. The view was very nice. Amazing staff!

BiyIK2TDfOAKnpzq02a2KA.review_text: My wife and I went here for our 5th Anniversary. I made the reservation via Open Table and put in a special request to get a booth by the window. Without me following up they granted our request which was even more impressive since it was a busy night. The service was upbeat and prompt and the speed in which we got our food was even prompter. My wife got the Alaskan Halibut and I got the mixed grill. Both were great! Atmosphere and views were amazing! Instead of a dessert menu they bring out a desert tray for you to pick from. Desserts on the menu tray are fake but that's not a big deal. The only complaint I have was a hidden charge on the bull for $3.50. Not exactly sure what t was for. But altogether our experience was wonderful and I will definitely be recommending this place to friends!

onXW3feeMlULCH5z-ebyEA.review_text: My experience at Fog Harbor was average. The service was subpar and disappointing. Our server Robert payed no attention to detail, was not attentive and showed no interest in serving the needs of his patrons. Robert had no personality and acted like he'd rather be at home. We had to ask for EVERYTHING :-( refills, bread...etc.   The food was good. I ordered a salmon club salad and a salmon/shrimp dish (can't remember the name of it). The taste was pretty good.   Beautiful establishment. If the service was better, my experience would have been great. It irritates the HELL out of me when servers are terrible. Ugggghhhh!!!!!! I'm so disappointed

MxnNT3MSGco7hQN6-pCNow.review_text: I really like this place! My fam and I wanted to the stereotypical SF experience and get Clam Chowder in a bowl.  We decided on For Harbor Fish House because it was close to the parking lot- Pier 39 garage and just looked nice!  Of course pretty much every place there has Clam Chowder in a bowl.   For Harbor Fish House is on the second floor so its away from the craziness of downstairs.  Their lobby area has a fireplace where people were sipping cocktails which was cool.  We were seated right away at a half round table and got to see an amazing view of the Bay waters, Alcatraz, and Golden Gate Bridge.   This place def had a classier feel and may be a really nice romantic place for a date.   We ordered: -calamari - clam chowder in a bowl  I thought they were all really good.  Our waitress was super friendly and our food came out quick.  I mean they were simple orders but still.  The clam chowder had a lot of clams in it and the pepper sprinkled on top was good.  The bread was also very soft and it made me want to eat the whole bowl! haha carbs galore tho.   I would totally come back but I'd be down to try other places at Pier 39 too.

SlT_9eBctIcWvKrJpwlSHg.review_text: Absolutely LOVE this place. As soon as we approached the restaurant we were met by a most delightful young man - Anthony. He shared some of the highligts of the place and the food and got us in the door and to our beautiful table - right on the water overlooking pier 39! The service and food were OUTSTANDING - this has become one of our haunts whenever we head to the city! I highly recomend this place ... if you care about great service, great food, yummy wines and unique locations, you will love Fog Harbor Fish House

A_fuSdZiigwtoUJfKvwIYQ.review_text: As I approached this place the hostess was standing in the open lobby inviting people in. It was a nice touch and probably nets them a fair bit of business.   I liked the  atmosphere with staff in crisp white shirts and aprons and a simple, classy decor. They had a nice little happy hour menu with appetizers and drinks, but I was in need of a full lunch. So they sat me at a table with a very nice view (which wasn't difficult - except for a few seats at the bar, every table in the house seems to have a good view).   The waitstaff was very pleasant and efficient, especially Monica, who was friendly and attentive. I'm not normally a big fan of clam chowder but I'd heard good things about Fog Harbor's, so I gave it a try. It was very nice - buttery, creamy, and with just the right amount of potatoes and clams. San Fran sourdough was simple but good, especially with the soup. I could've eaten the chowder, bread, and beer for lunch and been perfectly content. But I was keen to try the seafood, so I got the mixed fried seafood plate. It seemed like the best match for the Anchor Steam I was already drinking. The fish, shrimp, and calamari were good (but not great or special). And my one complaint about this place is proportions. One would think a combo plate of three items would have the items in roughly equal proportion, not one piece of fish, two fried shrimp, and a giant mound of calamari, so that was a bit disappointing.   Two managers stopped by during my meal to ask if everything was good, and while I toyed with registering my minor complaint, I decided I'd prefer to enjoy my meal rather than raise such a minor quibble. All in all, a decent meal. The food here was probably only three stars, but the service was a bit above.

GQlWomRTmT_W2fPqUo3GLQ.review_text: Amazing! I do not know where to begin!   Calamari might have been the best i have ever had. Helpful waitress, when she was available, but i was pleased with the speed of the food coming out that i didnt mind.   Crab Alfredo and the Surf and Turf were amazing. I will be coming back to try their clam chowder and crab!

9ue2qQ2yEOdYB1OM-VgF1Q.review_text: WOW this place is AMAZING! You HAVE to get the baked oysters! We also loved the blue cheese garlic bread (I know, sounds strange but is fantastic) dipped in the red curry steamed mussels broth.  The waitstaff is knowledgeable, friendly, and accommodating. They didn't seem to be bothered that we showed up with four people more than our reservation! They told us to come by again right at sunset; apparently the view is incredible.   I got half a garlic crab which was super fresh, delicious, and economical. Also, in order to not single me out, they put bibs on our whole table - we had a blast taking pictures!  Go here, bring friends!

CLL2yqudvHj6FrmEXGQyYA.review_text: Had a fantastic meal tonight....great oysters, shellfish platter was immense and creme brulee was delicious.  Couldn't recommend highly enough! Also service was no.1. A must visit in San Francisco if you're looking for great seafood.

R3219ePRI6SWZ01PSBGwGg.review_text: Decided to brave Pier 39 on a Sunday evening since we were craving whole crab... Because it's such a touristy area I really wasn't expecting such an amazing experience. Excellent service and the freshest seafood you could ask for... a dozen oysters, crab stuffed lobster and a whole roasted garlic crab. We also shared chowder and a salad... Outstanding... will definitely back again before crab season is over! :)

CtaFCHFvt75m-bXdNXoUEw.review_text: I came here for my two year anniversary with my boyfriend and it was the best evening ever. The food was flavorful and exquisite, the service was fabulous, and the atmosphere was romantic and elegant. I ordered the linguini with clams & my boyfriend got the wild salmon. The food literally melts in your mouth. The drinks were good as well; the cocktails were just the right balance between alcohol and sweetness. The wine selection was fabulous as well. For dessert we got the chocolate cake and since it was our anniversary it was on the house! The chocolate tasted like heaven. Our server was very nice and knowledgable. Overall this was a great experience and we will definitely come again. And the view from our table was beautiful.

wi7DAzM1CHM3zJQVWeyuEg.review_text: We did a walk in on a Wednesday night and were seated promptly. We requested a window seat, which is the way to go. The view is outstanding. It is conveniently located on Pier 39. It's the place to be after a long, chilly boat tour around the Golden Gate and Alcatraz.  The food and drink didn't disappoint either. I was shivering from cold after our boat tour. The Hot Apple Cider with Ginger Liqueur and Cinnamon Whiskey was the perfect drink to warm me up. The Crab Ceviche was also good. I had the Lobster stuffed with Crab. All excellent.   Our server was the reason this place does not get 5 stars. I agree the place was busy but when you charge $$$, one of those stars is for service. He made me feel like I was at an Applebee's; one of those eat - pay - leave places. In fact I have received better, more attentive service at Applebees.

xCfg2FearSaxWrnQu5LbvQ.review_text: Fog Harbor Fish House offers a nice break from the touristy feel of Fisherman's Wharf. My fiance and I went here for a late dinner after a sunset cruise on the bay. If you can, try to request a seat near the windows - the view is unbeatable! We both got fish, her the tuna and myself the swordfish. The swordfish was a little overcooked and tough, but the tuna was some of the best I've had. I suppose it just depends on what you order. The service was good, walking the fine line of giving you privacy while not letting you sit too long with an empty plate. Overall, this is definitely a step up from the normal fare on Pier 39, however your dollar will go further at a place off of the Wharf. I'd stop by again if I was in the area but won't be making a special trip for it anytime soon.

ff07A6wxdjY4VPVZSqk2xA.review_text: Dec 29, 2012 9PM. Wife & I were served by Amelia. Food was: Garlic Roasted 1/2 Crab, Mixed Grill of Salmon Swordfish and Shrimp.. Wife had Salmon.  Place was packed. Service was spot-on. Server Amelia was on us immediately. We ordered the 1/2 crab appetizer. It was on our table in 4 minutes and hot.  Dinner was the same. FAST, complete and hot.  Salmon was not overdone and dry. Drinks? Same. I liked the place so much, I had to tell the manager what a good ship he oversees. Manager Nusan was dressed professionally, and polite to us.   Wife used to work there when it was Chick's Place back in the day. She loved seeing  the place again.   To qualify my opinion, I am ususally very picky on my kudos for eateries. This place deserved a 5.

MhEsnJRunEhTYSKpWQc0tg.review_text: (3.5 stars) Based on my experience and the comments of my friends. We were about 20 mins early for our reservation, but were seated right away. Table was set & ready. Got service right away. Enjoyed the appetizers: shrimp, bleu cheese toast & my friends had 2 orders of raw oysters. They really enjoyed those. The entree portions were ample. I finished my crab cake sandwich and fries. Others finished their tuna and shrimp scampi. Others took home what was left of the fried combo plate. Although they said they did not like the fish.  The cocktails looked nice but not special. Supposedly had 2 types of rum in my drink but could hardly taste it. My friend ordered a pomegrante "daquiri" which the menu read $4 because it was a 'virgin'. She was charged $9 for an actual cocktail. It was corrected. They were nice enough to split the checks three ways for the 8 of us.  I got a free dessert for my birthday. Warm chocolate cake, vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. Which we shared because we were too full for individual desserts. The decor is clean and the windows are huge & give a nice view of the piers.  Got parking validated. Not sure if I would ever go back since I hardly ever go to Pier 39. But overall not a bad experience.

pFwZJmc2ueIZpMFvFnKsfw.review_text: We had a pleasant meal in here with a great view of Alcatraz and Pier 39.   The food was presented beautifully but non of us found our meals particularly note worthy.  Family friendly and certainly okay for a pleasant lunch.

ZYLx8FpH3JKjrnaPJIXU8Q.review_text: This restaurant looks good on the surface. Sustainable fish (hooray! A priority for me), amazing view of Alcatraz, nice decor, and a tasty sounding menu. However, many of the items we ordered were mildly disappointing.  Our starters, chili lime shrimp salad and (on special) crab ceviche with mango and avocado, were bizarrely similar just with different protein. The ceviche was served on lettuce, drizzled with the same salad dressing which was mildly mustardy and didn't go with the dish. Also, while the amount of crab was decent, it actually seems skimpy on the mango, avocado, and lime. Definitely missing a ceviche sort of flavor, but it was a tasty pile of shredded crab meat. Both starters also had the same house made tortilla chips, just in different shapes.  My husband liked his crab roll sandwich, and the sweet potato fries that came with it were good. If I had realized my salmon sandwich came with fries, I would have upgraded to sweet potato. Blackened salmon was a nice option. Half my sandwich was leftover and still good the next day, cold.  Our drinks were just okay. We didn't stay for dessert. If you go, insist on a seat with a view.

kKTcYPz47sCDH1_ylnE4ZQ.review_text: I visited San Francisco (for the second time ever) last weekend and we decided to eat at Pier 39, since I remembered that it had great seafood restaurants.  I realized that I'd actually eaten at Fog Harbor Fish House during my first visit to SF exactly 7 years ago!  I was not disappointed at all by my second visit.   It was a beautiful and clear (not foggy at all!) day in San Francisco and the tourists were all abuzz in the pier area.  Though Fog Harbor Fish House is a huge tourist attraction, it's definitely not a tourist trap.  I really enjoyed the service (very nice!) and also the selection of foods.  I was stuck between choosing the seafood platter or the seared ahi tuna.  In the end, I went with the seared ahi tuna, and it came with this amazing wild rice and seasonal vegetables!  The tuna was a very decent portion and it came crusted with sesame seeds and a ginger glaze.  So delicious!    To top it off, I got a bowl of clam chowder (their chowder is amazing here!) and a pina colada on the side.   We had such an excellent view of the bay - the Golden Gate bridge was in view, as was Alcatraz island.    What a lovely visit to SF!  I will certainly be back again to eat at Fog Harbor Fish House when I'm in SF in the future!

G1g0_fFONwgApQEGp1F_eA.review_text: Superb food at a reasonable price.  Go after 6 and you get 2 hrs of free parking at the Pier 39 garage.

Vq9DCJCxhGW06cyBJqxTyw.review_text: I was rather unimpressed with this restaurant.  The service was sub-par and the food uninteresting.

521_QKerZNYI0ylftfbj4g.review_text: As a Bay Area resident, I try to avoid eating where tourists normally flock to. But since we were in the area playing "tourists", I booked us a reservation for 2.   The restaurant is situated in the heart of Pier 39. The inside is classy without being too intimidating. You can come in here dressed up for a date night or casually stroll in wearing jeans and tennis shoes. They have sone awesome window seats overlooking the bay and the Alcatraz view.   They start you off with fresh-out-the-oven sourdough bread. I usually shy away from white bread, but I just can't say no to crunchy on the outside, soft and warm inside--fantastic sourdough bread. We also ordered the calamari and clam chowder for appetizers. The calamari is great! The batter is very light, crisp and tasty. It's served with lemon aioli sauce. The clam chowder was also very yummy. It was the right creamy texture with good flavor and the perfect amount of saltiness. For our main entrées, I got the Seared Tuna with a side of mashed potatoes and my bf ordered the whole garlic crab with fingerling potatoes. Blame the appetizers because I didn't get to finish my entrée. However, the tuna was delicious. Perfect seared exterior with the pink inside. It wasn't overly seasoned, and still featured the natural flavor of the tuna. My bf devoured THE WHOLE CRAB. That means it's good right?  I will definitely brave the touristy crowd and the expensive parking to eat some great seafood from here.

MP1fSFSGz6Ftw65Zd3goJg.review_text: First off, I just want to say that I originally had 1st intentions of going to another restaurant to celebrate a 6 year anniversary. Unfortunately, that place was already booked (place is called Navio located in Half Moon Bay; attempted to book reservation two weeks ago; no luck). Anyway, I must say that I'm so grateful to have found Fog Harbor Fish House.  This restaurant was going to be my backup plan B; however, should never be considered a plan B. This restaurant is the real deal.   I booked a reservation at 9:15pm (used open-table) and right below reservation time I stated under special requests...this is my first time for the restaurant and personally wanted to see if any staff representative can label "Happy anniversary" on the table nearby a window for viewing and personally requested to buy a cake and have the plate labeled in icing "Happy Anniversary Day". Little did I know that they would actually do this; well turns out they granted all requests. My server was Pedro; hands out provided the best experience for my girlfriend and I. Thank you Pedro for a job well done.     My girlfriend and I sat down at exactly 9:15pm as stated, anniversary in coloring on the table and a great view of the bay. Atmosphere like can be a little noisy, but that didn't bother me at all. Service is excellent and the food is superb. It's the real deal. My girlfriend got the lobster plate stuffed with crab for 35 dollars; it's worth every penny!!!! I got the halibut for 32 dollars; best tasty fish ever!!!!! They both are seasonal.  My girlfriend was speechless when she saw the "Happy Anniversary" in coloring on the side of the table. Toward the end, Pedro closed it by bringing a tiramisu cake, candle on top and with "happy anniversary day" labeled in icing for my girlfriend chanting Happy Anniversary Day. She was blown away!!!!!!!!!!  Even better, while I expected to pay for the cake (as listed on my special request through open table), I realized that the cake which was 8.50 was reimbursed as a manager compensation. I can't believe this tremendous service, outstanding food, gorgeous view of the bay and last but not least experience exceeded beyond my own expectations. Plan to come here more often. Drive is worth it. Pier 39 parking is free for two hours (make sure you ask waiter to stamp the back of card for you).   Thank you Pedro and Fog Harbor Fish House!!!!!!!

hWt6PvDkgUNmyy8i8gVoeA.review_text: Love their clam chowder!  Great location with beautiful view!!

fUVlvzKOO-SpvZj3mnuqOg.review_text: I was there for my friend's anniversary and my mother in law's b-day. Both time it was great service, plenty of food, and free blue cheese bread due to check in.  I will be back whenever I have visitors. :)

Ml2i2mGdUyrRswXZZlbKNw.review_text: Fog Harbor Fish House is located at Pier 39 on the second level. We came here for Dine About Town 2014 and made reservations about a week in advance to secure a spot for dinner. We had parked in the Pier 39 garage where Fog Harbor would validate 2 hours of parking when after 6pm. We came here on a Saturday night and boy, the whole restaurant was packed! There were even people waiting for seats. When you first enter Fog Harbor, you'll notice that they have a really cozy fireplace area for those who are waiting. We were seated in one of the booths near the window with a nice view of the bay. I wish we came a bit earlier when the sun was setting though.  Food- Red Curry Steamed Mussels: The PEI mussels were steamed in garlic, onions, peppers, and a coconut curry broth. The coconut curry broth was not too flavorful. I could barely taste the curry flavor. However, these mussels were REALLY fresh. YUM. Definitely, the freshest mussels I have had compared to all the other restaurants I've been to.  Seafood Cioppino: The cioppino comes with crab, salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels stewed in a tomato herb broth with pasta. What I thought was really cute was that Fog Harbor provides you bibs so you won't get food on yourself! A plus for me since I can be a pretty messy eater when it comes to seafood. The tomato herb broth was really flavorful. I ended up taking the complimentary bread and dipped it into the broth. So delicious. My cioppino came with 3 pieces of crab, a good amount of salmon, shrimp, clams, scallops, and mussels. All the seafood were really fresh and in good quality. There's no fishy taste to them. My seafood cioppino also comes with pasta too. Originally, they had forgotten to include it into the dish, but the manager on duty quickly apologized and provided me a bowl of the pasta. Regardless, the seafood cioppino has really BIG portions. They are not skimpy with their seafood.   Molten Chocolate Cake: The cake was served with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. The cake was REALLY sweet. The ice cream definitely complemented well with the chocolate cake. Unfortunately, the cake didn't have any melted chocolate in it when I cut it open in half. :(   Our dinner lasted for almost 2 hours! That was pretty surprising but in a good way. :) At the end of the meal, they also provide you Biscoff cookies. Per our waiter, he stated that they are quite delicious when dipped in coffee or milk. The overall service was excellent. The waiter and the manager on duty really made sure that everything was going smoothly and checked up on us. I think this was a successful Dine About Town! :)

v6EGTaTjZDYn2kcgV-5MEw.review_text: We had a gorgeous experience at our second visit to the fog harbour. The server was a Hawaiian fellow who was very eager to provide some tourist tips and to have some friendly banter. The clam chowder was sublime, creamy, textural, and seasoned well. A true highlight as the menu suggests. We had the. Ran cakes and crab stuffed lobster for main which both rounded out a great meal. The lobster was cooked perfectly with the welcomed addition of crab to give two distinct flavours. The crab cakes were seasoned well, had a nice crunch to the shell and were a good size for the money. The location is a dream for an Aussie like Myself with Alcatraz and golden gate in the background, providing a postcard like backdrop. In summary a strong performing meal with superb service has given me a second great experience from this restaurant. Food 8/10 9/10 decor 7/10

kLgcJLg7D3dRp9H73958UQ.review_text: As of now, I see that the overall rating is at a 3.5 stars, and I think that is what I would give it.  I'm deciding to give it a 4 stars though, because I think if I had to go .5 star higher or lower, I would go higher because the overall experience was pretty good.  The warm, fresh sourdough bread was fantastic.  It really made me wish I got the clam chowder to go with it though.  As a starter, my hubby and I got the calamari.  I have to say, the only reason why I would give it a 3.5 stars is because of the calamari.  I'm no cooking expert, but I've heard when things are not fried at the right temperature, they absorb a lot more oil.  The calamari was SUPER UBER oily.  I didn't even feel like I could taste the calamari, just the breading and oil.   It was on a bed of lettuce and there was tons of oil on the lettuce.   It was pretty ick.  Did I mention it was oily???  My hubby ordered the lobster tail, which was pretty good.  He let me try some of his plate.  The vegetables were cooked perfectly, not mushy or anything.  The mashed potatoes were....regular.  They were too mushy and the taste wasn't that spectacular.  I wasn't THAT hungry so I got the tuna tartare.   That was pretty damn good, so I would highly recommend that.  The ripe (but not mushy) mango and avocado were so good with it.  I do miss that and hope to go back for that and then probably get the soup to go with the yummy bread.  The other thing is that I didn't get to sit where there was a view since it was too crowded, but it was one of those times where it seemed everyone else had a nice view except me.  Oh wells, overall, it was a nice lunch.  I'm not going to blame them for being too busy to seat me with a nice view, but I'm sure that would have added to the experience.  I MIGHT have given a strong 4 stars. ;)  So, I guess after writing this review, I realized I don't like mushy things that aren't supposed to be too mushy...  UPDATE...  The manager contacted me and apologized to me that I did not have a great experience and for the fact I did not get a window seat.  Well, it totally wasn't their fault I didn't get a window seat, so I definitely don't blame them for that at all. I just knew it would have added to the experience.  Anyways, the reason why I felt so compelled to give an update is because I admire the fact that the manager contacted me and was not defensive at all.  And he also said he would let the whole team there know about my experience.  SO, I will take my family there and try it another time and see what my experience is.  I might take one for the Yelp team and even order the calamari again to see if it's super uber oily or fried to perfection and let everyone know.    I'm sure with that kind of attitude, the restaurant will continue to improve.  So, we'll see what my next visit is like!  In the meantime, I think they deserve 5 stars though.

ndiZlnpglRpvjbZ2Vp4JMw.review_text: Great food and service by Shawn.  We had the crab and the prawn cocktails. Good flavor and plenty to satisfy the palate.  The blackened sole was delicious. And, of course we had to save room for dessert... Crete brûlée and their blonde. Creme brûlée is always good. Their blonde was so good. Great chocolate flavor and ice cream and whip creme for balance.   Fog Harbor knows how to do it right. Always good.

QngNoyM4MFJMYfQ8mWwKdg.review_text: The sourdough bread bowl for the clam chowder was amazing, but for salad and clam chowder it comes in at a whopping $15pp, but can be expected for being directly on the pier. The check with dessert  came to around $50 for 2 before tip with only tea and soda ordered for drinks.   The views are great with a window over looking the harbor where you can see the sea lions resting on pier 39.   The service was varied. the food came out fast and multiple servers would come to refill drinks, but no one checked on us during any point when refilling glasses and we had to ask to see the dessert tray.

gS1idmervZf-CAlzVd1w_w.review_text: Superb service. Delicious food. Beautiful view. It could not get any better.

0ZqF6yC2AZYVzZWgMGgHdg.review_text: When in San Fran, I always get cioppino and this place did not disappoint!  Cioppino was full of awesome mussels, clams, fish and shrimp.  We had the calimari as an appetizer and not only was it amazing, but they brought out way more than we could possible eat- so bring your appetite!  Michael took great care of us... Will definitely be back.

KfP92xZflnzwsPsX6WuI0A.review_text: The sevice was fabulous and the clam chowder was the best in the entire state of CA.I love this place. I will recomende for all those who enjoy great taste helty food and service,sheer

g6rxDUaZEQwf_CSWTx-Kpg.review_text: My family and I were on peir 39 and were amazed by how touristy it was- all the places seemed to attract tourists with cameras and I heart San Fran sweatshirts. We wanted to find a place with good food- especially fish without feeling like total tourists. Although the seating hostess asked us where we were from (showing they get tons of tourists) she was super nice and got us a great table with stunning view. The waiter was accommodating and kind as well as professional- he spent a bit too long eying my sisters ID when she ordered wine (she is 23).  The bread was hot and fresh and a great way to start. We also got a smoked salmon appetizer which was incredible.  My dad order the fish & chips and really enjoyed them. My mom got a platter of different fish and shrimp with rice pilaf made w/ wild rice and broccoli. It was all excellent and the fish was so fresh tasting. My sister got the special- a very tasty white fish that is from the coast of Vietnam. It was prepared in a wonderful sauce on top of creamy mashed potatoes and wonderful spinach. My pan-seered chicken also had a great sauce and mashed potatoes/spinach. It was wonderful. The waiter somehow convinced me to get dessert even though I was stuffed. All the desserts looked to die for. I got the caramel toffee cake- it was wonderful. I would highly recommend going here if you are visiting San Francisco and want a less touristy place. It is pricy but I would say it is all worth it.

E9qtLQ6PxjiIbswRJCMqAg.review_text: DO NOT waste your time, or palette at this place.  We were at Fisherman's Wharf anyway, so figured the seafood would be fresh and delicious.  First of all, the service was terrible.  The waiter was downright rude and unfriendly.  The food was fresh enough, but wouldn't have made me think I was sitting alongside the ocean!  I was not impressed with the flavorless dish I ordered, nor was my husband with his choice.  I would absolutely not go back here.

G3PSxRYtkRWqjshciOyTog.review_text: Ate here with family Saturday night. Party of 11.  Service was pretty slow, it took nearly 3 hours for the one course meal then desert. Luckily that gave us time to catch-up, but we were pretty hungry there.  Food was OK. Nothing came out "bad" enough to return to the kitchen, but it was truly mediocre.

Ob2dvnx7dPGwAjZx9l0-zg.review_text: It was tasty, a bit on the $$ side, but hey it is in a tourist trap in San Francisco, pier39.  I had swordfish which was very good. The Ahi that my daughter had was a bit overcooked, it was supposed to be seared, but I think they left on in the pan too long.

MAdyEzyOImq-RgpdMa3pEg.review_text: I am going to say 4-5 stars, beautiful view, very clean, great food and great service. I plan to return.

myhNx3B0vNE7i29XDDvaug.review_text: No need for a reservation on Sun afternoon. View is spectacular and so is the ambiance. Initially got a diluted Lombard cocktail and our waiter performed excellent customer serv and got me a Lipstick Lemondrop (yum!!) to replace. Ordered the calamari ... it was a meal in itself. Perfectly breaded and the slices were a good sizeThe clam chowder was so scrumptious ... not too watery and not too thick.

7RYOY7Yo3X3GmM3eOW_HZg.review_text: kid friendly white table cloth restaurant with incredible views Amazing customer service from the hostess to our server Ashlie to the manager who came by to check on our meal felt great eating at a place that values sustainable seafood and right across from the aquarium by the bay!  Fried shrimp and fried fish were ok calamari was delicate but too bland Salmon over beets and brussel sprouts hearty dish excellent  Apple crisp very good - esp light caramel sauce over high quality vanilla ice cream  by far was the customer service that was impressive my salmon was supposed to have sauce on the side- cook made it with sauce on top but Ashlie caught it before it even got to us and made them redo it That process made our wait time a lot longer for food. manager came by and offered a discount for us! Ashlie meanwhile made sure we had plenty of warm fresh bread - even before we finished the first loaf. thank you - what a great place in the midst of a big tourist trap with incredible service

l7wxZPKiYV5XU6c5_E87KA.review_text: Made resv for 6pm on a tues. Arrived around 530pm so we could sit at the bar first and have a couple happy hour drinks. There was a heat wave in sf, and this place was insanely sweaty hot. As I sat at the bar sucking down a cold drink, I looked around at the people sitting at the window seats, where I was going to be sitting soon, to see them all using their napkins to wipe the sweat off their forehead. Nightmare status. NO AC!  This was a dinner for my birthday, and I was hoping to not have to rush through it just to get outside for some fresh air.  Bartender was super nice, don't remember his name, but when we told him we were gonna go get seated so we wanted to pay for the tab, he offered to make us another round of drinks and bring to our table at the happy hour price (which was about $5 cheaper). Awesome.  Told the hostess I would rather die than sit at one of those window seats where the other customers were stewing in their own sweat. So she sat us in this room off to the side of the main dining room, right next to a window that just wasn't in the sun and the window was propped open a bit. Perfect spot!!!!! So thank you so much for being accommodating!  Now for the food! Started with the calamari, lightly battered/fried rings, a nice lemon aoli type dip (very light).  Chili shrimp - woah. SOO good! Spicy! But flavorful!! Used the fresh sourdough bread they give you complimentary to dip in this spicy broth  1/2 garlic crab - good garlic flavor! Tender meat, have to crack it yourself   Dungeonous crab cocktail - decent portion of shredded tender crab meat served over ice with cocktail sauce on the side.  Think that was enough? No.  Dinner was a whole Maine lobster with a side of mashed potatoes and a grilled corn on the cob. The lobsters tail was over cooked and chewy, but the claws were tender. Kinda sad about the lobster tail, but I guess that happens when you get a whole lobster?   Dessert was complimentary cause it was my birthday, I was just brought out a dessert the waiter, Rudy picked. It was some sort of warm chocolate rich almost lava melty cake with vanilla ice cream and house made whip cream. Really decadent.   Good service, lovely ambiance, and fresh seafood. Fun birthday dinner ;) Thanks Fog Harbor!

Y-AMlQrne8iLCwaz7p6B_g.review_text: My wife and I enjoyed ourselves with nice wine and entrees of crab louie and linguini with clams.  We sat at the bar right insider the front door which was still comfortable.  The service was attentive and the food was delicious

D3Ab4e-qL_tq3bvwlm1Ygg.review_text: This place is just okay. We were wondering why this place got such high marks... ah, yes, because it is a tourist trap. We are San Francisco natives and used to very good food. Two stars... calamari not crispy, crab piled on top of iceberg lettuce in a bland crab Louis. Fish and chips were greasy. Beautiful surroundings and decent service, but we won't go back. It is a tourist spot with unreliably high marks.

lpC7nYyt1LHulO-86dIATw.review_text: I had a good old friend coming to town and he wanted to have seafood. Since he's new to the city I decided to venture into Pier 39 for its convenience, but wondering whether we would end up in a "tourist trap". That was not the case.  Food was good and so was the service. We got a nice table by the window with beautiful view over Golden Gate and Alcatraz.  We both had Lobster + Crab as main dish and it was super fresh. The warm sourdough bread was also very good. Many of the dishes are not cheap ($25-$35) but you can still find some stuff at around $12-$20.  Overall great experience and wouldn't mind going back!

9_opUR0cFDRYNHEoPOuvyw.review_text: I was here for a short trip and wanted to experience an amazing meal. I wasn't disappointed!!!  I came right after Dungeness crab season started, and had that.  My server was the bartender, Jason.  He did an amazing job of offering suggestions to try (both on the menu as well as things to see while in town).  Will definitely be back!!!

-fPnMS8IvaPwCTZy7dlP3w.review_text: Check in to "Pier 39" on Yelp to receive a "fun pack" at the California Welcome Center located a few shops behind Fog Harbor Fish House. You will receive a coupon book which contains a coupon for 20% off your meal!  Boyfriend and I came on a Monday in October around 1pm. It appeared busy and there was a 10-15 minute wait to be seated, but the gentleman seating us stated that it was "slow" today!   Luckily, we were seated in an empty connecting room facing the water! I liked this area better because your body is facing the water, as opposed to having to turn your body to face the water in the main dining   We were served HOT, fresh sourdough before receiving our main dishes.   I ordered the king salmon dish which was "market price" - apparently market price in October was $32! That's how much a salmon dish at a popular Disneyland restaurant is! It was REALLY good, though! I substituted the potatoes with wild rice.   You receive a Biscoff cookie with your check, and at the bottom of the check is a coupon for the Biscoff Coffee Corner located on the first floor on Pier 39. I think it was 30% off?  Not only was the food good, but the ambiance was quiet (while we were there, at least!) and romantic. I had a hot date, eating deeeeelicious salmon and looking out at the water, tourists, sea lions, Golden Gate Bridge, and Alcatraz.. how could I go wrong?!

Xzfw4sKEJoqKOsqeD9MLRQ.review_text: My mom and I stopped in San Francisco on our way down the coast, and we had not made any plans, just stopped at Fisherman's Wharf and saw this place and decided to eat here. I cannot believe how awesome this place is. The staff was AMAZING and the food was unbelievably good.  We were sat down right away, because we didn't need a table by the window which I guess takes a little while. The view was still very pretty from our table inside the restaurant. I ordered clam chowder and my mom ordered fish and chips. The food took a little while, but they WERE pretty busy, so we didn't mind. And when the food came it was incredible, so no complaints at all. And then they came over and apologized for the little wait, and offered us free dessert!  I think I've just become so accustomed to horrible service in restaurants, but I was stunned and mightily impressed. And the desserts, like the entrees, were utterly delicious. Fish and chips were great, the clam chowder is the second best I've ever had (first best is Splash in San Luis Obispo), my mom's creme brulee was fantastic and the chocolate cake and ice cream I got..... no words. Just tears of joy.  Thank you to Shawna, our waitress, and Krystle, the hostess, for being ridiculously awesome at what you do. You earned yourselves some fans for life.

0LwN37IQHOPTSpVTmG1eKQ.review_text: Amazing view, great food, friendly server - what more can I ask for? I know that this place isn't the cheapest, but Fog Harbor Fish House is in the center of tourist mecca. I know there are lots of similar restaurant options nearby, but they either lack in food or interior or attentive servers. I tried to nitpick and find things I don't like about this place, but honestly I couldn't (again, apart from having to deal with major tourist crowds, which is no fault of the restaurant) Just be sure to check out tourist brochures and/or yelp check-in for modest discounts or freebies. In fact, most Wharf/Pier39 restaurants have some form of promotion. They also validate parking so make sure to take advantage of that.  My party had clam chowder, cioppino, crabs, shellfish platter along with some white wine and dessert.  Clam chowder wasn't the best I've had around bay area, but they were above average. Seafood was fresh and prepared right.  This probably isn't the best place for family with small children, but for more adult-oriented crowd or date nights, I would highly recommend.

QqLZs_jBN_HCSnkki48lSQ.review_text: Fresh-tasting seafood, great service, and a wonderful (and rather romantic) view of the pier at sunset =) In particular, the clam chowder was amazing, along with the crab louie and seared ahi tuna dish. The baked crab spinach was pretty good too, though not as good as the other dishes we had. I will definitely be back here in the near future!

AXCDbZohyTIY4qeYcrtPNw.review_text: One of the waiters here name Khaiman was really friendly. He gave us really good suggestions. The food was amazing for reasonable pricing and this place has very good service.

x45JwSKMJAb3oU-l6zAGZQ.review_text: Great views, great service and awesome food.  We literally came off the street and were looking for a great happy hour place to grab a few drinks and appetizers and we hit a jack pot.  First of all, staff is courteous, very neat appearance and nice, shout out to the waiters!  We were promptly seated, and our drinks came fairly quick. That's always a plus when you're a thirsty traveler. We went ahead and grabbed 3-4 appetizers to share and we couldn't have been happier with our choices. Our favorites? the raw AND baked oysters(oyster quality- smooth and creamy). A close second to the fried calamari, it was light and crispy not over fried and breaded.  Overall had a great time, we were never forgotten by our waiter which so happens so often in more touristy areas of SF.  Thanks again guys.

-z-QZCKdTjupHT0ZDjGVZQ.review_text: The clam chowder bread bowl was the best we had during our entire visit to San Fran. The chowder had the right amount of potatoes in it (not too many), and the bread was so yummy and warm after the chowder was gone. I had the mussels appetizer as well, and it was great. This is a must eat place while visiting Pier 39. We went fairly early (530 PM), and there was no wait. By the time we left (7ish), the place was packed. It was a Saturday night, so my advice is go early during the weekend!  The decor in the restaurant was very nice...pleasing to the eye. It was probably one of the best decorated places that we visited while in San Fran.

FcjioveW2WDKx8QwTXg9KA.review_text: GREAT seafood!  Anyone who knows me know that this east coast transplant is a seafood snob.  I don't want to be, but when you're raised on the best it's hard to eat crappy seafood ever.  I came here with friends from LA who was looking for good seafood at a fairly affordable price.  Bonus points for the lovely views.  We had a table right by the window overlooking the water and it was beautiful :)  Our service was great, the food was fresh and tasty.  All of us really enjoyed our meals and the ambiance.  I will certainly return!

u6j0S_vTNxSZ2wWI_KLvEA.review_text: They serve an awesome Ahi Tuna with wild rice, and their clam chowder bowls give Boudin a run for their money. The cioppino is tasty, and of course anything fried like the  fish and chips, and  calamari appetizer are good as well.

55jKBDDr47Ec0bDa8Q3EiQ.review_text: My girlfriend and I came here expecting the better end of seafood because of the location and reviews for this restaurant. We were sorely mistaken! If I had a choice I would have avoided this place and gone somewhere with more of a specialty in seafood. What happened here?
