What we had: Seafood platter for 2 (no butter), Iced Tea  The Good: Nice views (if you are lucky) Nice waitress Excellent claim chowder (award winning) Iced tea was clean and refreshing Clean cutlery and dishes The crab was the only redeeming quality of the platter   The Bad: Significant wait times 40 minutes - hour Rude, unorganized, woman who took down wait times (not just to me)  The terrible: Seafood platter for 2 was ~50 dollars The platter was not even close to what we were expecting: We believe it was cove mussels that were used, minuscule amount of meat inside, some were even empty (no QC check) We maybe got 10 mussels in our meal, 10 pieces of shrimp, a few clams, and 2 full sets of crab legs Corn was stale and not fresh, this was evident by the fact the core was dried out  Avoid the platter at all costs - it is not worth it. I could have easily finished it by myself with room to spare. The quality was poor and prices were very high. Check came out to almost 100 dollars after tip for 2 people. Stick with the lobster or other dishes that were more highly reviewed.

BXczRAQUhhNW-JN-7j0a8w.review_text: So we went to this place when we were visiting SFO last week.  My husband was in a mood for a "broiled seafood" type of dish and since they had something similar we decided to go here.  We ordered the calamari for appetizers-not good and I would not recommend it at all.  It was "soaked" in oil and we started feeling sick after the first bite.  We asked the waiter if we could order something else and got the "Red Chilli Prawn" instead.  It was an appetizer with a lot of gravy-it was tasty though.  For entrees, I ordered the mixed grill which has grilled salmon, mahi mahi and prawns.  The salmon was tough and overcooked and there was too much salt on the mahi mahi.  I ordered the crème brulee for desert which was descent.  Overall, I was very disappointed with this place.

xYhE81kALW3IJNEkDTaEng.review_text: Fancy and upscale decor. Amazing views of the bay. Friendly and attentive staff. The best crab dishes. I can't say enough good things about Fog Harbor.  Service: Our server, Meron, was extremely friendly and attentive. She made sure we had everything we needed and came over several times to see how we were doing. She even helped us open the towelette packet and put on our bibs. The manager, I believe, noticed we needed something and immediately helped us and thanked us for being patient. My scarf fell off my chair to the floor and a different server noticed and picked it up for me. The entire staff was top-notch. Excellent service all around. Very impressed (and I'm not usually that impressed by service).  Decor: Dark and intimate. Very fancy and upscale atmosphere, but the attire ranges from casual to fancy. Although it is fancy, nothing about this place screams snobbish (being tourist friendly helps). Even the bathrooms are clean and nice. Definitely request to get a seat by the window. The view of the bay is incredible. Where else can you go fine dining and look out the window and see the boats glistening in the water up close? I felt like I was on the Titanic.  Food: I loved how the Darigold butter was slightly warm and melted, which makes applying it on the sourdough bread much easier. The garlic roasted dungeness crab was superb and was my absolute favorite dish here. It comes with roasted fingerling potatoes, corn on the cob, and garlic oil sauce. Absolutely delicious. After having the perfect dungeness crab as the first dish, it set the bar so high that no other crab dish could really compare. The crab clam chowder was good and rich, and also another favorite. The swordfish and crab linguini alfredo were good, but personally not as impressive. The chocolate lava cake was to die for. It wasn't runny in the middle like other lava cakes, but the instant you put it in your mouth and your tongue touches it, it melts into liquid chocolate. What kind of witchery is this? Seriously. It was like MAGIC. It looked like a regular chocolate cake but it melts into chocolate in your mouth! I still can't get over how amazing and mind-blowing it was. It was very rich like a brownie and the vanilla ice cream pairing was the perfect complement to it. The whipped cream was also sweet and flavorful, and definitely not from a store-bought spray can. I was so fascinated by the lava cake that I immediately googled recipes so I can attempt to make my own cake-that-turns-into-chocolate-the-second-it-­enters-your-mouth.  I am dreaming (& drooling) of the day when I can come back and have another taste of the heavenly dungeness crab and lava cake.

u1msYADEadxvF3Odeg6tRw.review_text: I grew up in San Francisco and typically steer clear of anything touristy.  Fog Harbor is one of the few exceptions!  If I find myself on Pier 39 with friends or family I go to one of two fabulous restaurants.  If I want something a little fun and casual, then Wipeout Bar and Grill fits the bill.  When I want to dazzle and impress, Fog Harbor is the place.    My husband and I had lunch at Fog Harbor last week as we had a friend from Germany in town visiting.  We wanted something nice, and Fog Harbor was the first thing that popped into my mind.  We walked in without a reservation (next time I would make one, just to be safe because they were pretty busy) and were greeted by a friendly host and also by the bartender who was also busy with guests at the bar.  Within minutes, our sever came over to say hello and offered us drinks.    We decided to order several appetizers because we love everything on the menu and thought that would be the easiest way to share a variety of things with our friend.    The ceviche- to die for The poki - fresh, delicious and beautifully presented The clams in a choizo broth - Cooked perfectly and I soaked up every ounce of broth with the hot, delicious Boudin sourdough. The prawns - yum! (if no one was looking, I may have licked the plate...) All the desserts are made in house and are fabulous.   Seriously, everything is fresh and delicious at Fog Harbor.  Between the friendly service, the consistently scrumptious food, and the stunning view, Fog Harbor is not only a great place to take friends from out of town, but also a great excuse for San Franciscans to play tourist for the day!

BsACgBvYC4U3lzp4nd-4tw.review_text: Went here for New Year's Eve dinner.  Food was great, but the service was excellent.  Very attentive, patient wait staff, with attention to detail and able to make great conversation (not just do the minimum job).  A bit pricey for some, but well worth it!

9yuOMbrURP4we2CIZVuGdA.review_text: Very pleasant experience, waiter was everything I love in a waiter, straight talker, reliable recommender of food and seemed genuinely interested in our opinion of his recommendations, wine and other venues and attractions, friendly but not overly chatty or personal.    The food was great, I loved the chowder in the bread bowl, I know it's gimmicky but that's some good sourdough and chowder!  The crab cakes were delicious, as gigantic as they were, they were light yet flavorful, good portion size!    The table/view was awesome, a sea lion had jumped up on the dock right below us so we got a front row seat of him/her preening and swimming and jumping on and off the dock, and then a sea gull came down and grabbed some guys head and hair and then flew off, so pretty good entertainment!    As a resident of SF (as opposed to a tourist), I thought Fog Harbor was better than a lot of less "touristy" places that I've been to on recommendations from bay area folks, the prices seemed perfectly inline with the quality and service and it was calmer and more sedate than some of the other restaurants at Pier 39.  I would definitely come back here!

VoC3uOuZ_5-naxtvRrXKjQ.review_text: Great seafood, the lobster mac n cheese was delicious.  Moderately priced food.  Try the Blue cheese bread, it's free if you check in on YELP.  Great view of the bay as well.

GsCNN9Oa1SapI2L349FX6Q.review_text: This is my favorite Pier 39 restaurant. It's in a beautiful location (right at the front of the Wharf on the upper level) and the interior design is classy with a fireplace!   The food is truly as good as they say it is. The chow-dare is creamy with big clams. There isn't the fishy after taste you can get from old clams in chow-dare. Freshness here!  I also tried the blue cheese bread (free with first time check-in btw). I normally hate blue cheese to. the. max. but I actually really enjoyed this. It did not have the nasty blue cheese taste at all. And they weren't skimpy on the cheese either.  Highly recommend if you're ok with slightly higher prices. I think the prices are reasonable for the quality. And you're on the Wharf so those prices aren't really higher than any other sit-down restaurant.

X8zhFrA_aAbpxRxSv9REgg.review_text: Went to have lunch after my son and I toured the aquarium by the bay. We where in rain gear and the hostess just blew us off and seated all the "better" dressed folks.  Before I was about to say something someone else came and took us to our table. Got seated and ordered drinks and our meal at the same time. Juice for my son and and local brew for me, fried calamari and linguine and clams. Bread came with water, then a few mins. later the calamari. After the linguine arrived I'm like "where's my son's pineapple juice and my anchor steam"?  They said the bar didn't get the ticket. The waiter looked like he lacked focus. The saving grace was the Calamari and the view.  But I know there's plenty better out in the pier area.  So the next time I'll be going else where.

NwdJgZaorL2r9X6NhaVMBA.review_text: Had dinner here on a Saturday night.  Used Open Table via Yelp to make reservations, which I highly recommend because it was pretty busy. Normally my husband and I wouldn't head over to Pier 39 for dinner because it's so touristy, but we had a friend in town and she wanted seafood.  Thanks to Yelp, I'm very glad we ended up here.  The view was outstanding. We got a nice table by the window looking out at the water. The menu had such a large variety of items to choose from. We had crab cakes and clam chowder as an appetizer. The crab cakes were full of crab meat and not to much filler and the clam chowder was nice and thick, but not to thick.  I had the shellfish platter, my friend had the scallops, and my husband got the pacific sole. The food was all outstanding.  I was definitely having a hard time finishing my meal.   The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was for the service.  It was pretty good for the most part, but after our food was brought out there wasn't much following up.  My husband wanted a second beer and my girlfriend wanted some more wine which took some time to get.  Again it was really busy, so we were patient.  We'd definitely go back again.

DAA51tqTdTooEojignjMhw.review_text: We visited frm LA & made reservations for V-day & I couldn't be any happier w my choice. We had an awesome time. Attentive waiter, food came descently quick for a busy night, the food was delicious. I had the Fried shrimp & fries, my bf had the garlic crab. It is a bit pricy, but it's good sea food & totally well worth it. We had a magical & beautiful night. I also received a gorgeous red rose  courtesy of the restaurant.   If you're thinking about it...just go. I def recommend it. Plus the views are stunning. Try to go arouind sunset time. Enjoy. :)

i_jq10I66vCPE3ShSaBl-g.review_text: Tasty food, good sized portions, great service, amazing sourdough bread.

qbQzH6jARRbBajV0VKLDEQ.review_text: Let's just say that walking all the way from the Powell Bart Station to here... was worth the sore feet.  My friend and I had our mind set on clam chowder in a bread bowl on the pier. When we saw the menu had "Award Winning Clam Chowder in a Sourdough Bread Bowl", we immediately asked for a table.   The boyfriend and I split a Cioppino (delicious), my friend got a swordfish steak, and my boyfriend's friend got calamari. Everything was delicious but I think the clam chowder took the cake. It had big chunks of clam and the soup was the perfect consistency. I notice that a lot of other places put in too many potatoes in their chowder, but Fog Harbor doesn't overpower the chowder with too much. Bread bowl was amazing. My boyfriend is on a no simple carbs diet - but even he could not resist a freshly baked sourdough bread bowl. Crispy, just a little tart, and warm. Hrmm.   Prices are reasonable. Food was delicious. Service was awesome. Would definitely come here again.

-9v9WWod_h44Rc12usPDtQ.review_text: Came here 2 days in a row...ordered a Sourdough clam chowder bowl with crab meat...freaking delicious. And on both days I ordered Fish and chips. Best fish and chips I have ever tasted IMO.

fwAmFWelfLgJbzUcN7txqg.review_text: Food was good, service was a little stuffy though. We got the clam chowder which was pretty good, but a couple bites were a little gritty though. Then had the fish and chips, really yummy. Finished with the creme brulee which was the best I've EVER had. All in all it was good, and I would go back, not sure if I would order the chowder again though.

_oe1TkhJuKoFNKWUwE3vFQ.review_text: I am not a sourdough fan so I am not really impressed by it. This restaurant is all about seafood, i ordered Pacific Sole, it's a bit salty and I don't like the way they cooked it, it's more like indian flavor. One of my friends ordered Dungeness Crab and looks good though. The service is very good, we've been there till 10:30pm and nobody seems impatient with us. I would say it's a good restaurant for treating friends just visiting SF since the location is great.

VbCX_dF3xTArvwLua46tUg.review_text: Great experience from the front door in including the service, the view, and the food.  We got to share the cioppino and there was more than enough food. The sourdough bread is perfect with this dish. Pumpkin bread pudding and excellent coffee made for a wonderful end to this meal.

nutpQPyrsK-mJ-y2LOIeUg.review_text: I really wanted to like Fog Harbor, from the beautifully warm and comfortable entry way to beautiful views and what looked like a great menu.  There are so many great seafood restaurants in this area that competition and expectations are high.    The crab cakes were great.  But from there the experience went downhill quickly.    Part of my food was undercooked while I had to spit out a piece of swordfish because I couldn't chew it and my husband indicated that his dinner was nothing special.  As our meal progressed, I noticed our neighbors sitting for long periods of time waiting for...well, waiting for service.  And soon, we too joined the ranks of the ignored.  Water glasses went unfilled and it took 25 minutes for them to notice that our plates needed to be cleared.    Now, I enjoy lingering over my dinner, particularly when we have a view of the bay and the food is worth enjoying, but for the money that was spent, the lack of service and food quality was inexcusable.    It might have been an off night--we're all allowed those--but as we're close enough to the city to visit often and do, this restaurant will not be receiving any more of our business when we're down that way.

z4iln5ZW8NAVUG_WSaeFow.review_text: Got the fish and chips with a cup of clam chowder. Both if which were pretty good , can't say they were the best I've ever had but worth going back to again. I think my server forgot to put the rest of my order in because the table cleaning guy came by to clean my table and clear it. 20 minutes later  and still no fish and chips. I mentioned to him I was still waiting for the rest of my order. It then arrived 5 minutes later.

Ruc1aArEXQDSJPbYwrjJzw.review_text: Excellent food (had crab) in very pleasant surroundings on a mild Friday evening in January. Not as touristy as it seems from the outside. Good choice of food and drink. The waiter wasn't that great, hence the 4 stars rather than 5 but no actual complaints about the service.

B6eR6Lcxoo1OPsAicSUNGw.review_text: Had the clam chowder bread bowl, they were not shy with the clams! View was great and the pricing was reasonable.

9bxdPvAhP6cuipD5s2UnCg.review_text: I had friends in town from Arizona and after a day of playing tour guide and having fun at Pier 39, we ended up having dinner here.  There were 5 of us and we were seated right away at a table by the window. Our waitress was a bit surly and seemed like she would rather be helping any other table but ours (could be due to having 2 teenagers with us).   I ordered clam chowder to start and after a taste of sand and grit, sent it back. The daughter had seared ahi and loved it, I had a combination platter that had salmon, mahi-mahi and shrimp. It came with mashed potatoes and green beans. The fish was cooked perfectly, but the cook seasoned everything with cayenne pepper. Since another in our party had the same dish (hers with garlic fries), and the fish on her plate was without this seasoning I asked the waitress if mine was a mistake (I am not the too spicy fan), the manager came over right away and claimed my dish was made with the pepper by mistake.   I really appreciated the kindess of the manager (who also comped our desserts), the really good cosmo I had and the company I was with. I would probably not tell people who live in the area to run to this restaurant for a meal, but I would tell people who are visiting to eat here BEFORE going to any other restaurant at Pier 39.

zQfszAWNRDjoo2RA_AD34Q.review_text: Good place when you are hanging around this area. It's a nice spring day. Not too hot, not too cold. We enjoyed the the food. The price ok for SF higher end dining. Khaiman was our waiter. He is a nice guy and took care of us. The Oyster was excellent giving me some mojo for a few days. Try the Calamari too. I ordered the Laguenita IPA beer that worked out well. The Clan Chauder was good in that bread bowel as well. Try the place if you can spend money on food. It's a good dining experience.

-vYw9TCVCufy8-hRZRdAMw.review_text: Absolutely delicious!  I had blue cheese garlic bread from the check-in, some calamari, fried scallops, and the clam chowder for my appetizers.  For the main course I had the garlic whole crab...it ROCKS.  If you happen to eat here be sure to get your parking ticket validated for a parking garage nearby - we didn't notice the garage until AFTER we finished our meal and explored the area.

Lt3yloGFP1vuxyrNdYYG0A.review_text: Clean and nice environment, but I was totally disappointed to the food there. Price is not $$ but $$$$. I am an oyster lover, but the oysters here are too small and shrank, not worth that expensive at all! Anyway, service was good.

shl3Lubt6GLCkzwWuD4W-g.review_text: We've been eating at Pier 39 on our anniversary for 35 years.  Our last experience at Fog Harbor featured the best seafood and the worst service we've had in all of those years.  The food was simply outstanding.  When we were seated (after a 15 minute wait despite our reservation) there was a window open at our table (the table was immediately adjacent to the window).  Anyone who has been to Pier 39 knows how strong and cold the wind can be there.  The wind was so strong that it immediately blew both of our menus off the table!  It was so cold that we were flapping our arms for fear of numbness.  The waiter's response when I explained that we needed to shut the window: "I'll check with my manager."  The cretin who she referred to as a manager came to our table and told us that he needed airflow in the restaurant and could not close the window.  We asked for an "indoors" seating and were given another table.  Sure enough, 10 minutes after we sat down at the new table we looked over and found that all of the windows had been closed.  So much for "needing airflow".  At our new table, the waiter took our drink orders and then forgot about us (she literally never returned).  After 15 minutes, I flagged down another waiter and asked what happened.  Ten more minutes of waiting produced a 3rd waiter with our drinks and an explanation that our first waiter was a "floater" who was used only to substitute for other wait staff when they were eating their own meals.  I have to stop this review now - there were more service problems, but just recounting them is making my blood pressure too high.  Despite the great food, I would never recommend this place and would never go back --there are so many other good restaurants at Pier 39 that know something about service.

yfG8hiLv0mA0ltTNXERuYQ.review_text: Came here for a Mai Thai while waiting for the Alcatraz Cruise, we had been once before and remembeedr how good they were and how friendly the bartenders are. We hadn't planned on trying the food, but upon sitting at the bar we looked over the specials menu and saw Poke that sounded so good it was irresistible. It didn't disappoint, we had a nice chat with the bartender, had a nice snack and cocktail, and wasn't too pricey.

AKe0YPPVeUT2DL6zcQ7ffw.review_text: I seriously could have just sat and looked out the window all evening and been happy with just a cocktail or a glass of wine at this place. After a day of sitting on the beach and taking in the last day in San Francisco, we headed here. I made reservations before the trip because this place looked and sounded like a winner.   We were seated upstairs right next to a huge window that overlooked the harbor and had sweeping views of the Golden Gate Bridge. We left the window slightly cracked so the breeze blew in. We had the sunset and the views and on top of that some amazingly fresh seafood.   The waitress was even so sweet to give me an extra glass of wine on the house since the wine I first requested had run a bit low and she couldn't get a full glass out of it. Try getting that just anywhere! The meal was wonderful, the view was wonderful and the service was outstanding.   This was one of those places that living in Texas, I really could appreciate because we don't get those same views. Nice views from certain places, but completely different. I didn't even mind hearing the seals outside. Again, one of those things that you don't get to experience in Texas ;)  Like I said, the ambiance was completely worth the money spent, but add an amazing meal and drinks to it and it's a stellar evening. I believe the bill was close to 100.00, including a starter, two dinners, dessert, coffee and drinks.   Hope I'll be seeing you again one day Fog Harbor and please....don't change a thing!

9Ez0VRTa3LBxuduAgdqVIw.review_text: Very nice place on the bay with great drink menu and food with an awsome chowder bowl

-DTpelkNudFUIxWqXpl_3Q.review_text: Great atmosphere, great food, great service. Khaiman was our server, he went the extra mile to make sure we had a perfect experience. Try the clam chowder and the banana bread pudding for sure.

64konRX-4_8NwJctk70qwg.review_text: Came here with my family on Christmas Eve. Got seated pretty quickly, even without a reservation. The food was very good, I had the Shellfish Platter with 1/2 crab, mussels, clams, and shrimp. Very good portion, but pretty pricey. The other portions (not specifically sure what the rest of the fam got) were quite small though. Not worth the money they said. The service was...ok. I wasn't able to get a refill on my ice tea because my waiter didn't come around to check enough. Waters stayed empty for most of the night. Waiter seemed very flustered and looking to get our table closed out and on with our nights.   No matter, Pier 39 is a nice place to search for desserts and coffee too!

q5aG7pkJdHjb5O9YjgupSA.review_text: Four of us shared the crab ceviche, clam chowder in a bowl, seafood platter for 2, and the cioppino. Total was something like $130 before tip... (pricy!)  Nothing was particularly remarkable. My favorite dish was the seafood platter - the shrimp, clams, mussels and crab were seasoned simply (garlic salt pepper butter) to really let the platter be about the taste of the seafood. Yum! But nothing I want to pay for at a restaurant. The cioppino was _really_ disappointing, tasted like a can of tomato puree dumped on a bunch of seafood.   I won't be coming again.

XcWmZ6BTXyiEGL6lofBAbA.review_text: Great food, great view, don't make the mistake of getting the bread bowl though. You can just get the large chowder and keep ordering free bread. Use the 2 dollars to buy half a coffee in a hip coffeeshop somewhere nearby.

S5x3bBh7tXL70N2gLZn1ZQ.review_text: Average tourist pier restaurant.  Attentive service, ok food.  Wouldn't return, but then again, I wouldn't return to the pier either. There is not a lot of difference that I can see between this pier and Chicago's Navy Pier, either in shops or food.

Ivz7nImANzYXz08eDT29Og.review_text: great food and great view. I love it here!

g4ZNWPlwLjplq12Gh_YdNA.review_text: Went here with my friends on v-day and the service was phenomenal the food was fresh and great and the manager came to the table and brought us each flowers. Also I asked for a window table when we got here and they were more than happy to accommodate us and the view was beautiful. I cannot recommend this place more well priced great service and excellent location

pQD0yqJFcOkFDCMkPbXARA.review_text: I finally found the Best clam chowder in San Fran for me!! If you don't mind the tourist everywhere then this is your place for good seafood. Service was excellent. I ordered a cup of their clam chowder. Man this was phenomenal. No overpowering thyme taste as I mentioned in my review for Capurro's. Clam chowder done right here. Make sure to have reservation as this place is right on the pier where crowds of people are looking for places to eat so they get packed quickly. I had their Fried Combo platter. I love love loved the flakey white fish perfectly battered. The shrimp however that came in my platter was just "ok" really nothing special about it. The Calamari rings were also good. Did enjoy the coleslaw to cut through the richness of my dish. Wash it all down with their house merlot was a perfect dinner minus the mediocre shrimps.

jiec6iT7szmL6Uruw41cnw.review_text: Horrible. Saturday night waiting more than an hour. This place is a Tourist spot. Low quality food, high price

66yzYNSzh2cP3Vb4SRehPQ.review_text: Bay scallops and calm chowder.. all you need to know.    Only bad thing is getting a table you want. I have yet been able to get a window seat despite open tables. If you want one I guess you have to make a reservation.  The food is worth putting up with the snooty attitude on seating. Waiters are friendly and helpful.

dGCAdyhRpUmWqlgzANwufw.review_text: grilled salmon was very fresh and prepared just right . delicious seafood experience ..

aLSJxufr-JwJbLdVF6zg5w.review_text: My husband and I dined here twice in the week we visited San Francisco. The food was incredible! The crab cakes were delicious, the calamari was good, the sourdough bread was wonderful. Oysters on the half shell were fabulous as well. They were accommodating to our friend with dietary limitations too. Our server offered suggestions on the menu for her.

isbLGb9cfE1St-S_VZFK6Q.review_text: My family and I love eating at Fog Harbor when we are visiting SF. This review is for our recent visit on Father's Day and our excellent waiter Khaiman! With our numerous visits to Fog Harbor this man really stood out! He is a 5 star waiter and we hope to be served by him again.  As for the hostess, Velvet: My 1 year old was sleeping as we arrived for our 4:30 reservations (as she also informed us that we didn't have, but later was told by another hostess that we did) told us that I had to leave my stroller outside in the front as they have a "no stroller" policy. I was upset because he had just gone down for a nap and didn't want to wake him. So my husband parked the stroller and woke up my son so we could go sit down in the restaurant. About 15 minutes into sitting at our seat, what do you know??? A mom strolling on by with her stroller to her seat-- AND Velvet walking around with her clip board checking out the restaurant not saying a word that this other mom had her stroller in the restaurant (not to mention the baby in the stroller was not even sleeping).

Xec7NHmRwL9KFZMcEHtoLA.review_text: Great food with a great view. My Alaskan halibut was cooked to perfection. My husband's fried fish was equally well-cooked. All of this with a view of the boats and the famous sea lions. The cocktails were inventive and quite delicious - cucumber basil gimlet amid Moscow mule (vodka and ginger beer concoction).

82P1dqLERWO0mJ-dCfJVZA.review_text: This restaurant is pretty classy and is situated right on the pier so you can see out into the bay.  My friends and I were lucky and got seated right next to the huge windows with a great view of the water. The inside is dimly lit and would be great for a romantic, fancy dinner. I loved the ambience and the fact that it's on the water and as my friend said, I suppose you're paying for the view as well as the food, which is why it's pricier.  Apparently their clam chowder is very good, and I almost ordered it but instead, I went with the curry mussels, my favorite seafood. The mussels were really soft and soaked in the delicious curry sauce. I was relieved that the curry wasn't spicy at all, although it had a nice small kick to it and was slightly sweet and creamy. I really liked the sauce and I also dipped the complementary bread they serve into the sauce. The amount of mussels they served in the bowl was worth the price, especially for a fancy place.  Service was okay, nothing bad but nothing stood out either. I would like to come here again sometime though, for both the food and view!

4m39dORxVHGspqkKBYVkfw.review_text: We had the best food. 2 separate appetizers and entrees just because we wanted to try all of them. Both appetizers were full of flavor and my stake was cooked to perfection. The garlic mash were the absolute best I've ever had. Nothing felt heavy and the vegetables were also perfectly cooked, flavorable and  crisp, not soggy at all. I recommend this restaurant to everyone. Our server was also wonderful. She was stuck with a big party that were seated right after us but she always made sure that we were taken care of. Then she went the extra mile to help me find a family member.

bIa6M-h-QUdmFFJt0e3F3Q.review_text: What can i say wrong about this place. The ambiance was romantic and welcoming. It sits on the water at pier 39, which at night is stunning. The sourdough AND the crab cakes were A-MAZ-ING!!! I highly recommend this place to everyone!!!

h7MR2u4wNPB5NndrZK9ARA.review_text: Great service, great food, great time!  Greg and Zarah went out of their way to make sure that we were well taken care of.  Thank you!!

KrCKueBH5qKmJduet7468A.review_text: I use to live in the Bay Area so I have never done any of the tourist things. I had my niece with me so I decided to give one of these places a try. We were cold and decided to step into the Fog Harbor to warm up with a bowl of clam chowder. I thought the service was excellent. The chowder was good. Creamy and had small pieces of clam. The sourdough bread bowl was fresh. I really enjoyed the view. Prices were high but well worth it due to the service, view, and ambiance.

muf4EbkvtT1ohRJZJ-r7-g.review_text: we must've came on an off night--for some reason, every ten minutes or so the power would shut off and come back on again about five or ten minutes later. i came with four other people, they received their meals fairly fast but i was still waiting for mine, finally my fiance told the manager about that.  by the time everyone was finished with their meals i got mine. thankfully, the manager came up to our table and took off 50 dollars from our bill. other than that, it was an ok restaurant, im guessing it was just a bad night.

8Qp8XrdvMY0cfGyG3NE9iQ.review_text: Ask for a table by the window. :) The drinks were refreshing & good sized. The clam chowder in the bread bowl was delicious & a good size portion. The fish & chips were nice & crispy & tasty! We were too full for dessert, but the table next to us ordered almost one of everything & they all looked great!

FVLaz-4v1g11hKCtD-N6lQ.review_text: The food was better than expected for a place right on Pier 39.  The view is awesome. The garlic bread with blue cheese was so good.  I make it at home like that now. I'm not a fish person but everyone else at the table who ordered any seafood loved it. I did like the calamari appetizer too!  The steak and lobster was really good.  I liked the stead more...  I would come back again and try the clam chowder.

2-gMqp9WnP-0bQbdLaL6nA.review_text: Khaiman rocks!!!!!  Food was wonderful.  Service was awesome.  Khaiman really went above and beyond to make our experience memorable.  Gave us great suggestions about the city.  Highly recommend.

U1GiQ4GDGZXRqE3Oxe0P_w.review_text: Excellent bar - Barrel Aged Manhattan with oysters to start.  In crab season you can't beat their garlic roasted whole Dungeness crab!  Great service, even if just for one guy at the bar.  Comfortable place to relax, and AWESOME harbor views.

XzpUvx48UpaCbCkb7Ntr5Q.review_text: Being a local, I try and stay away from Pier 39, but with parents and in-laws in town, we decided to stop here for dinner based on a recommendation from a friend. I am glad we did! We were able to get a table for 6 by the window and we had a spectacular view. The service was prompt and friendly. Everyone in my party seemed pleased by the food. My FIL ordered a whole [steamed] lobster and I got to try a bite and it was delicious! I ordered the shrimp skewers which were good, but nothing special. I probably wouldn't order them again, just because I would want to try something else next time. My MIL ordered fish cooked a special way and they were able to accommodate her requests. The filet mignon was also delicious according to my wife. All in all, this is a great restaurant. It's pricey, but we all thought it was well worth it and everyone was happy, which is a miracle considering we were entertaining the very picky in-laws! Oh, and the sourdough bread is amazing. It comes out warm and you smother it in butter.....to die for! I'll be back next time the relatives come to town. It's a nice place without feeling too touristy.

jy_RGAeAvNeCv5BxZsUWFA.review_text: ****Updated**** After receiving a polite message from the Manager who seems earnest in his desire to make sure his guests are comfortable and not rushed I'm bumping this review up to three stars. *******************************  I've lived in San Francisco for over 20 years and I've finally tried chowder in a bread bowl.  I was meeting my Sister, her husband, and his mother at Pier 39 for dinner. I'd already decided that if the place they chose had chowder bread bowls I'd finally try one.  The soup was expensive for such a small portion. It was good but it was garnished with cilantro, which completely over powered the taste, every other spoonful had a chunk of cilantro in it so I only enjoyed half of the already small portion.  The service was fairly rushed and not very friendly. I get that this is a touristy place and you are playing a numbers game but not everyone likes to feel like cattle, for these prices I expect better.  I think I had a salad as well but I'm drawing a blank, not a good sign.

w7rb4WRsCH7xieeYEdvfcg.review_text: This place is pretty good.   First off, free bleu cheese bread with Yelp check-in. (Win) Why is this not a more popular thing?? Totally delish.   The whole garlic roasted crab with corn on the cob and garlic potatoes was incredible. The server tied on my bib and there I was, a respectable adult, viciously ripping open the exoskeleton of an enormous crustacean, devouring it with my fingers, making an enormous mess, drinking wine and expecting to still be taken seriously.    Note: Whatever you do, don't order the shrimp. Unless of course you'd like to pay $22 for eight small, slightly overdone shrimp on two skewers over a bed of raw baby spinach that tastes as if it has been drenched in dirty fish juice, with a few cubes of tasteless butternut squash.

uHL8tygYmcPn9D4laymtFQ.review_text: Happy hour :)  I came here with my boyfriend, (we are kinda broke grad students). So happy hour is our nice time out. We had a great time. They were playing the football game so my bf was happy. We got Angel Island Iced Teas .... it was a very unique long island: cute, girly, sweet, fruity thang... my by never gets fruit drinks but he got this one! I will add a pic..   As for food we got the calamari, our fav appetizer. Ill add a pic of this too. We really enjoyed this a lot.   Good times! -jf

CcekFVBRIPPKue16475frg.review_text: I was definitely impressed. Better than your typical tourist spot.  This restaurant is fit for foodies.  The restaurant staff keeps the establishment very clean and maintenance is efficient.  The clam chowder is very good especially w a garnish of fresh Dungeness crab. The crab avocado Caesar salad is a wonderful seafood treat.

j1obgwUy5MLvbMTvElyUig.review_text: Great Place! My boyfriend and I were visiting San Francisco and had just finished the Alcatraz evening tour and couldn't wait to get dinner at a local seafood house.  This was definately a great place to dine!  The entrance is gorgeous with the backlighting to the water feature in the entrance by the fireplace and nice seating added a welcoming touch to our dinner. We had 2 free drink vouchers from our hotel (Radisson Fisherman's Warf) to use which was a nice surprise.  Along with drinks we got a chicken caesar salad and the fried shrimp plate with veggies and wild rice pilaf.  Fantastic!  We arrived at 930pm and were immediately seated, received our food and were out the door within 1 hour.  Very nice Fog Harbor!

ytpGEstuMuxpQF_nu67_VA.review_text: Shawna suggested the Moscow Mule and it was very refreshing. She is a great bartender I highly recommended you stop in and say Hi to Shawna  shrimp cocktail was nice as well

D9IMOsV39BvoDNb08N9myQ.review_text: We had some pretty amazing food here. The crab was fresh and delicious, specifically the Cajun one. (or was it creole? I know its not the same. ) I also had the fried combination, since I was really craving some fried shrimp. Unfortunately it only comes with two, a slab of fish, and a boatload of calamari. It would've been perfect, but we had already ordered calamari as an app.  The non seafood options are also pretty good, and with the care and quality taken to prepare those well shows this place can deliver 5 star food when it needs to.

wPQaXi9nUWygnllFdeUfoQ.review_text: The service made the meal.  Our server was exceptional and went so far as to bring back 2 clams from the kitchen when she noticed that there were a couple of closed ones in my dish.  View of the harbor was picture perfect and made for a very romantic lunch for two.  Definitely make reservations in advance if you are looking to get a good seat; only too easy to do online.  Food was very good as well.  Seafood was fresh and flavorful as one would expect.  My wife had the Dungeness Crab and was thrilled.  I had the Cioppino and was very happy with the selection.  Couple of snivels; comes served with a piece of sourgough on top that is over-oiled and gets soggy in the sauce right away.  I would discourage this presentation technique.  Better to just serve fresh bread on the side.  Also, the sauce itself was a bit on the plain side; non-remarkable flavors beyond a thin tomato sauce.  Otherwise, a wonderful place and would recommend to friends.

b974DuLfzoKvS4PKZgPZ9Q.review_text: Your typical touristy restaurant. Nothing amazing about it, not terrible either by any means.  First of all, I will mention that this location is superb and the views are amazing. This added some enjoyment to the experience. Unfortunately, the experience was rather meh.  The biggest downfall to our visit was the fact that our server was very timid and didn't explain anything that well. It felt instead of being a knowledgeable server, he was rather just fetching our meal/drinks back and forth.  I ordered the lobster tail which was pretty tasty, but the vegetables that accompanied the dish were under-seasoned and boring.  If you can, steer clear and spend your money elsewhere.

EpZNoPkJVBgAYHb8j9feWw.review_text: FOR the damn clam chowder and view!!!!!!!!!!!   This place used to be named Chic's. Goodness tho the soup didn't change. Actually the menu is much the same with a few updates.  Fresh n quiet n located at the beginning of the pier.    Many similar options when coming to Pier 39, this place is a solid, safe bet.

XNIAsEmbEWh8snJendr1Sw.review_text: great food.. great service great prices. make a visit you wont be disappointed.

zBGRIMCTD4MCQSxHnVp1Jw.review_text: I love coming here and I love the view. Blue cheese garlic bread is yummy. Fish and chips I'm not crazy about the batter. Crab is delicious and generous portions. I just had the pumpkin martini and love it!

3Wwf7byw8fq_ew_MA1xzzA.review_text: Average and Over Priced.  We asked "do you have a lunch menu?"  Answer was 'yes' and we were seated.  View was OK....basically looking out at the harbor, and other piers.  Not much to write home about.  Turns out that the lunch menu is really just the dinner menu, not much to choose from for less than $15/$20.....not much at all.  So, DON'T GO HERE FOR LUNCH.  Food was OK at best.  Clam Chowder in Sour Dough Bread Bowls.....well, the bowls were mostly bread, very little chowder.  Calimari was good, small, and overpriced.  The slider appetizer (3 burgers) was SMALL.....and just OK.    None of us would return here.  Admittedly, there are not that many quality choices on Fisherman's Wharf, but the prices here are too high and there are not many lunch selections.    Maybe it's OK for dinner, but they should have said 'we are really more of a dinner restaurant'.    Recommendation.....try somewhere else.

DpiMuxg2g4urzClzjykUHg.review_text: It's everything I love about wharf restaurants: Classy dining room Sweeping vistas of the bay Crisp white clothes on the waiters  Delicious seafood, over 14/entree for lunch Giddy energy of other diners Attentive waiter who makes you feel welcome

_gS--SujA3LD3UK1F5ODLw.review_text: We got a window table which had a very nice view.  Our server was very nice and offered good recommendations.  We started with the half garlic-roasted dungeness crab and clam chowder.  The crab was delicious.  The chowder was a little on the thick side, but it was still very tasty with lots of clams and minimal potatoes.  For the main course, we got the seafood penne pasta and the cioppini with pasta.  Both were very very delicious.  This was actually a lot of food, and we couldn't finish it all.  If you save your ticket stub from the nearby Aquarium, you get 15% off.

ga3Xol_m2SC_6dGa9DiGfg.review_text: This place is phenomenal! I brought my boyfriend here for lunch for his 20th birthday and I guess we were not prepared for how pricey it was going to be since we just happened to stroll by and decide to eat there since we were hungry and looking for a nice sit down restaurant. We were seated by our sever John who was probably one of the best severs we've ever had! He was professional, sweet and helped us pick out something for appetizers since we both couldn't decide. I ordered the garlic roasted Dungeness crab (it was crab season) and I don't quite remember what my boyfriend had to eat but it seemed like a fried seafood platter of some sort. The garlic crab was SOOO good and it was big enough to satisfy me even with how hungry I was. Unlike other restaurants the garlic flavor could actually be identified while eating the crab meat and not just laying around on the shell. My boyfriend loved his entire plate and finished every bite. For drinks since neither of us are 21 yet, we had the iced tea and the ginger lemonade. OMG I wish I could have that ginger lemonade right now, it was quite strong but combined with the mint and lemon it was a perfect drink paired with the strong garlicy crab. For appetizers my boyfriend ordered the fried calamari since I had never tried it before. It was pretty good even though I know for some people it's an acquired taste but I liked it as soon as I got over the texture :p All in all we had a terrific upscale experience even during lunch hours and customer service here was outstanding so we will definitely be returning. I feel a little guilty for not leaving a bigger tip than I did and after we left we both felt so bad because we have never been served that greatly and John definitely deserved it!!

G1aAbnM1QAaKsoKWvCRRsg.review_text: Our family of 6 (4 adults, 2 kids) recently ate here and it's a-ok.  The fish and chips were pretty good, the clam chowder was ok (had some sand in it though...ugh!), the swordfish was decent, the crab cakes (2, small patties) were fine and the sourdough bread was also fine. The kids menu was adequate and the desserts looked good but we finished our meal around...11pm and were starting to fall asleep, so we had to skiddadle.  This place is a fair, reliable Fisherman's Wharf option with a psuedo-New England atmosphere.  I'd go back again...someday.

fvV_EA7EHCpyh-x3OR-3eQ.review_text: The atmosphere, staff, service, and food were all excellent. It was quite crowded, but service was very good and i hardly had to wait for my meal!! i would recommend this Fish house to anyone!!

_Oz_-_BrfcxqR3Uvwd4-BA.review_text: Wow! I did NOT expect to find such good food at the Pier. Fog Harbor is a sure bet for excellent food and service with the killer view and convenience you're looking for.   Clam Chowder breadbowl was as luxurious and decadent as you want it to be. It is perfection on a cold (or even cool, for this FL gal) day. Tuna Poke was uninspired and lacked texture Chilled half crab was so fresh and delicious. Cracked - easy to eat All of the cocktails we tried were creative, well-balanced, and strong.  Total bill approximately $100 including tax and tip (two people).   *Although I didn't order them, my friend's crab cakes looked way too bread-y for the price*  Bonus points to our Ken doll look-alike server, who proactively separated our checks by couple.   Fog Harbor would've earned 5 stars if not for the lackluster Tuna and high drink prices. Still, not to be missed if you're in the area.

36rZ0mdMtea2690mOxKMgw.review_text: We came here from the reviews and feedback. Great atmosphere, great service. Our waitress was very helpful regarding the menu. Manager stopped by to see how dinner was and chatted. Don't see that very often! Will come again! The food was delish!

McjXP-XOWMkwfbdVtWglOg.review_text: Actually, a little higher than 4 stars ... =)  We had a very friendly & attentive waiter which is always great ... no matter where you dine.  I ordered the scallops and it was de-li-ci-ous!!!  Too bad there were only 3 JUMBO scallops, I would have loved at least 1 more ... but that's just greedy me especially when something tastes so great! I asked for a little extra of their Balsalmic Vinegrette Glaze for the scallop on the side.  Very tasty.  My husband ordered the Cioppino and took the server's advice of paying a little extra for additional shelled crab meat.  For just a few extra dollars, the extra crab meat was the way to go ... instead of adding pasta for a couple dollars.  My husband absolutely loved his dish and went on to say that it was probably one of the best Cioppinos he's ever had.  His main props for the dish was because he felt they used quality seafood and not a lot of "filler, cheaper" seafood like calamari.

SqEVyB5dFAki-GEgihWo1w.review_text: This restaurant offers beautiful views of the sunset and of the bay. The food is good. All restaurants in the area have great food, usually fresh. Service is sometimes tough because of the frequentation but i've never been too many issues there.

X0_MP4NVsW6FDxmoKAMYHA.review_text: MMMmmmm! I loved my dinner. I ordered the mixed grill which consist of Mahi-mahi, salmon, and shrimp. All perfectly cooked! I ate every bit.   Great view, and good wine. The clam chowder was not good...I got a mouthful of sand. Also, expected to pay more for five people, that was a pleasant surprise!!

OJ6Fl4Be5YeIUgAqvRIRLg.review_text: Outstanding views.  Friendly but slow service:  we were seated right away but it took 10-15 minutes for a waiter to show up and take our drink order and another 10-15 minutes to actually receive our drink order (very fresh cold Lagunitas IPA, Yummy!).  This slow theme repeated itself throughout the meal.  No biggie, we weren't in a hurry but it seemed like the waiter was spread too thin and the lag times were noticeable....not really a good thing. Sourdough Bread:  A+ Steamed Mussels:  A- Clam Chowder:  A Crab Roll:  B+/A- Tuna Poke Salad:  B+/A- Lagunitas IPA:  A All in all a nice meal.  Were it not for the slow service and low cozy factor of Pier 39, we would be back.

dg4q1yi_soxfDrp7KzHF5Q.review_text: First time, I really wanted to try this place because it has  4 stars of 1000 reviews. Plus the other place I wanted to try was packed. I mean it is a Saturday and today is the giants vs. LA dodgers game.  This place is upscale, fine dining type of place. I like that they offer places like these in an attraction base environment. Cause sometimes you want to enjoy a nice dinner with a fantastic view. Like this place I'm at right now.   Our server is nice, but when we asked for water she said it's coming, and made it seem like someone else was bringing it but she brought it to us instead. Sometimes she'd walk by just to walk by and see that my water is almost empty and doesn't fill it up, you're just walking back and forth, what are you doing?   Anyway, what we ordered: clam chowder bread bowl, seafood ciopponi with pasta, and steamed clams.  What it tasted like: everything looked amazing. The clam chowder was the best thing we ordered, it was hot and very good. The seafood ciopponi was ok, there was some type of flavor I probably won't remember. The noodles were hard. The seafood in the ciopponi were good, I like the variety. There was salmon, fish, mussel, clams, shrimp and crab legs. The steamed clams, I've had before somewhere else taste better with garlic broth. This chorizo with tomatoes, I didn't really care for.  Would I come back? Maybe I'll try somewhere else first before I give this one another shot.

Ii1PkdRpONUNwKC3lmhl1A.review_text: We were here on Christmas Day... one of the few places open for Lunch on Christmas.  It was FANTASTIC!!!  Nice staff, amazing views of the bay, bridge and Alcatraz. We had: Clam Chowder, Popcorn Shrimp and Fish & Chips.  All of it was delicious and fresh.  The fish was so delicate and the batter was light, perfection! Would LOVE to go back for dinner!

TbTrPBQ6lA6onzFQ5kBp7g.review_text: My fiancé and I ate dinner there Sunday night 8/18 based on Yelp reviews and we clearly did not heed fair warnings. In a nutshell this restaurant is what it was designed to do, and that is; be a tourist destination.  My fiance had the seared Ahi and while the temp was perfect her seared vegetables were not even close to seared.  Her rice was bathing in butter.  My swordfish was dry and the seared vegetables underneath were backstroking in butter.  Clearly a common theme with the cooks this evening. We being industry folks made the quick assessments that Fog Harbor (perhaps this weekend) was probably the victim of being completely overwhelmed.  The place is so large that I cannot see how quality can be achieved.  Our waiter was so far behind we felt bad for him.  Clearly other guests were less than patient. At any rate, we take responsibility for wanting to eat on the water, after a long three days of dining in San Francisco's awesome boutique family owned restaurants, we subjected ourselves to this absurd price gouging when in comparison we had two fabulous meals for the same price prior nights earlier.  All in all, the menu is predictable, and the plating/preparations are to be expected in what is essentially a tourist plain Jane steak and seafood house. I am very upset with myself for giving this a shot, mostly because the price was not even anywhere close to worth it.  We would have rather eaten from a creative food truck.

Irj8yRM4gOXN0OsyHywtTQ.review_text: I went here with a lady friend. Of the restaurants at Pier 39, I'd say this is probably one of the best. The atmosphere is very nice. A great place for a date. Because we made an online reservation, we were treated to a complementary amuse bouche which was very good. For an appetizer, we had the crab cakes, which were amazing. The main course was a little disappointing. To be fair, perhaps ordering a crab melt and fries at a restaurant of this sort was my own fault, but my thinking was that they must be able to have an interesting and fancy take on this relatively lower class meal. I was wrong. It was just a regular greasy crab melt that I could have got anywhere on Fisherman's Wharf. It still tasted fine, but I was disappointed. My companion's meal was a much more classical fish dish, and looked quite scrumptious. Taken all together, I'd say our evening here warrants the 4 stars I've given them.

JwsanJ9GmI4xo9desz66fA.review_text: We had the greatest service and the food was phenomenal. NOT! I wanted to treat my little girl to her favorite meal of fish and chips at her favorite place in the City, Pier 39. Since my daughter was famished, I stopped by the first restaurant that served a kids portion of fish and chips. It was Fog Harbor Fish House. What a big mistake that was. Our waitress, who acted like she had some sort of hearing impairment, seemed like she was on 'something'. I had to repeat my order four times. Yes four times. But whatever. Maybe she was having a bad day. We ordered the kids fish and chips, curry mussels, and the cheeseburger. After waiting for about ten minutes, my daughter started to complain for that she was hungry, and was there any bread for her to nibble on before her fish and chips?  Looking around for our waitress, she was no where to be found. Finally the double doors to the kitchen opened and out came our deaf waitress carrying our mussels. She sets  it down and I start digging in. I offered my daughter some. She refused, she just wanted bread. The mussels were fresh, but didn't taste curry enough (probably the freshest thing that we ordered) and  the curry sauce just sat at he bottom of the dish. It was like the mussels were steamed separately and the curry sauce was just an afterthought.  I looked up to ask for the bread, but the deaf waitress disappeared again. She not only forgot our bread but also a bowl to put my shells. I told my daughter to simply drink her cranberry juice that she ordered. She was quiet. I asked her what's wrong. She just looked at the juice. I grabbed the juice and sipped throughout he straw and to my horror that juice was SPOILED!  Half-way through eating, the double doors flung wide open and out comes our deaf waitress. I practically shouted for a bread basket. And as quickly as she came through the doors she quickly disappeared through them again. But too fast for me to request a bowl for my shells and to fill my water cup. Sigh. She comes out 5 minutes later with warm sourdough bread and butter. My little girl was finally in food heaven. After 10 minutes, my daughter's long-awaited fish and chips and my cheeseburger finally came. I finally asked for a bowl for my shells. Our waitress noticed that the cup was still full of cranberry juice. I politely told her that it was a bit rotten. She stated she'll take the juice out of my bill. My burger looked awesome. But at the first bite I noticed the burger was a bit tough and the bacon old and leathery, liked it was MICROWAVED :( NOT GOOD. The fries were okay, nothing spectacular. I was thirsty and asked my daughter for a little of her water, since i drank all mine and the deaf waitress was now where to be found. Then I looked at my daughter's fish and chips. I asked her why she was just picking at it. She didn't say anything. I asked her if she wanted a to go box for it. She said, "No box, please". She NEVER says this. I took a fork full of fish, that $hiT was COLD AND HARD! OMG. I quickly looked around for our deaf and invisible waitress, but she was no where to be found. I finally saw her robustness and asked for the check and two boxes (hey, I wasn't going to waste food. My dog hadn't eaten and could use the cold fish and hard burger). The check came and as I was about to sign it, the manager came up to me and inquired about our meal. I made a face and rolled my eyes.  He said that wasn't a good sign and to tell him what happened. So I proceeded to tell him about the fish and chips and cranberry juice. I was about to tell him about our lack of service, but he grabbed my check and went to fix my bill. He took out my daughter's meal and gave me an extra 20% off.  He even offered to fix my daughter another meal. Nice gesture, but it was too late. This place already gave me indigestion. Any minute longer there would have given me food poising.  *KUDOS*:  clean bathrooms my adjusted bill sourdough bread mussels (but see below)  *ATROCIOUSNESS*:  service fish and chips cheeseburger with the leathery bacon the lack of 'curriness' in the mussels

MZuvl0oUK3QSv7faGx9i5w.review_text: Fog Harbor is a touristy place, but tourists wouldn't come here if the food wasn't good.  We stopped in for a late afternoon lunch and cocktails. The cocktail menu is a bit pricey at over $10 a drink, but consistent with other bars we've visited at Fisherman's Warf. We both had Moscow Mules; they were crisp and refreshing, garnished with lime and ginger.  More importantly, you will be delighted in the freshness and high quality of their foods, especially their seafood. Both my fiancée and I had their blue cheese wedge salad after seeing one delivered to another person at the bar. The salad looked mouth watering when we saw it, then we proved it was delicious when we ordered our own. It is loaded with creamy blue cheese, crumbles of blue cheese and bacon.  I had the Seared Alaskan Halibut and it was perfect: flaky, over a bed of quinoa, leafy greens, dried berries and a delicious sauce to bring all the flavors together. My fiancée did an appetizer combo for dinner including a crab cocktail and clam chowder, she said both items were fresh and delicious.  For those with gluten sensitivity, their menu is clearly marked with all the items that are "prepared without gluten." They have a significant selection of gluten free dishes and one gluten free desert. Our server, albeit quirky, was very conscientious about my needs and took ownership of communicating my needs to the kitchen.  We'd also like to thank them for listing the dungeoness crab cocktail on their receipts as "dung crab cocktail." My fiancée and I can verify that the crab cocktail didn't taste like dung, it tasted like crab. However, we we appreciated the laugh.  Overall, a great meal and a wonderful view of the bay. It may be a touristy due to its location on Pier 39. Nevertheless, you'll get a great meal in a nice atmosphere!

PgkSWpPWUTL7ro9gRHEtdA.review_text: Awesome place right on Pier 39 to have the best seafood the Bay area has to offer!  Got a surf n turf that came with a perfect medium filet accompanied by a fresh Lobster Tail. Service was flawless and I was very impressed by the consistency of it given that tourists like me come and go all day long.  I was pretty hungover from the W all night so I didn't get to try the cocktails, but I did overlook the bartender going HAM on the mojitios, so try one of those out for me!  Overall, a must stop when walking the SF embarcadero .. Try it after the GoldenGate Blue Line cruise for the best experience!!

WoBY39POG80D99hoyF-sDw.review_text: I got the clam chowder bowl and crab cakes, which were both fresh and perfectly filling. Delish. My friend got the crab, mango, & avocado ceviche which was also super tasty.  If you check in, they give you blue cheese breadsticks. Unfortunately, they came to the table last and although they were pretty good, they were a touch too oily and at that point we were already too full to eat them.  Overall: nice ambiance, good service, decent price. Was happy with the experience, but wouldn't make it a priority to come back again.

s9XwlpL_b9kIbwxLNnnngA.review_text: We went here with my Grandma, husband and 4 month old baby. The hostesses were pleasant and very accommodating. You can order wine by the glass or glass and a half (which I have never heard of before but really liked the idea). I would give this place 5 stars, but I ordered prawns and it seemed like they were more like jumbo shrimp. Still delicious. If I lived in San Francisco I would come back.

-sa6ii6BFnDHnPo0-Ompcw.review_text: This was my second time eating at Fog Harbor. I wanted to return for their amazing fish and chips! The batter is so thin and light and the fish is white, moist, and soft (not mushy) The tartar sauce is soo good! Great food and service. Their view on the water is amazing!

nAtKG20kfQclgPFr7HpELQ.review_text: Great place for seafood with an outstanding view but the service was slow.

dkdpo2oZm_QLBf0drCqE9w.review_text: Simply the best crab cakes and clam chowder my wife and I have ever had.

aURXctTpENUmTuCQSs_0yw.review_text: Good service from Michael and free blue cheese bread from Yelp a good offer too. Wine list and menu all good with large portions, food fairly pricey but ok as you're in a tourist area. Recommend getting on early. We are before 5pm.

lEDPV3-25q49SeG5N2UL1g.review_text: Sorry gotta give this place 2 stars service was so so waiter didnt clear the table till we were leaving.i ordered the crab with a spicy tomatoe pepper concoction how are you sopposed  to eat the crab with a ton of sauce poured over it?my wife had the alfrado and crab it was bland at best not enough parm in the sauce.for this price it wasnt worth it great views but 1 star food go to bubba gumps much better quality.

TXzUwgCFs-dGcP5-uOBtqw.review_text: Nice place. Swordfish was great. I would come back. They have a really nice bar, but a pretty limited drink menu, weird.

FkL2bIqiO5TWN1ya0QHH5A.review_text: We had a fantastic view from our table! The waiter was super nice and he suggested some good plates to chose from. i had the Mix Grill i would recommend getting it with the rice instead of the smash potatoes. The food was out in no time, quick service. I also liked how in the waiting room they have a fire place it made you feel at home. i will definitely be coming back!

QCSD_v13NrlYCMH5_l2LcA.review_text: The waiters and waitresses were so nice and kind very fast and helpful on questions. The atmosphere of the whole restaurant was nice, low lighting slightly quiet but got really loud at some points mainly because of kids but that's normal.  The main reason for 3 stars, the food was great but I got major food poisoning from the crab cakes with the aioli sauce, very sure it was the sauce that did it, probably the worst food poisoning I've ever had or I would've rated this higher, if I had not gotten food poisoning at all it wouldve definitely been a 4-5 star rating.

ORGpSK4fXHBWDl44MFDBgg.review_text: Really good service here with attentive service staff! The view was great as you can literally see the ships, seas and all the tourists below the restaurant.   Came here for restaurant week but ordered a bowl of clam chowder on the side. Was surprised by the small portion of the clam chowder but the taste more than make up for the small size! Wish I could order another bowl!   Had the crab ceviche and crab cakes. ceviche is better than crab cakes as the plate came with fries and made me feel like it was an unhealthy meal!  So come here if u like to eat with pretty scenery and be served by nice people!

f0bbZOzD9iWEojm__o15MA.review_text: Me and my wife had a dinner here for our honeymoon. The service was excellent! Very informative and fun as well. The food was excellent. We were told to get clam chowder and it was the best I have ever had and then we got the steamed platter. That was a great choice it was awesome. I would tell anyone to go here if you make it to Pier 39..

5dugjIhFhOnxhmLQQ_pNKA.review_text: This place has a great view of the bay! It's directly on Pier 39 so beware of lots of crowds. My boyfriend and I went here for lunch and really enjoyed our meals. I had the salmon and I wanted to finish it all! It was delicious! Even the vegetables were great! lol. Our waiter was very friendly and gave us some options for sightseeing around the city.

HJBDaJuqP_QHZeTDQI4lUA.review_text: Fog Harbor serves sustainable seafood, and has an american style menu. You can get everything from crab dishes, to sandwiches. They have a good happy hour. The atmosphere is casual and family friendly. Good views of the bay, and Golden Gate bridge.

Ij7OcAO5FpoNKxS1RzNoWw.review_text: We stopped in here for a couple of drinks before the rehearsal dinner. Its a huge place but its awesome - kind of touristy but it is what it is. We had some great drinks - I had some girly pink lemonade drink but it was awesome and strong. The food smelled and looked great so I would definitely go back to try some of it.

cikMH120Xypm7-GjgvnRsg.review_text: This place was the ONLY good thing about Pier 39 on our visit recently. I have lived in the Bay Area for 30+ years...... and I don't usually got to Pier 39. But a friend wanted to go, and I agreed. This place was a saving grace of our day trip.  The food was excellent, and our waiter, Derik was super. The sour dough bread was the best, and it's baked every 15 min!  I had the crab cakes, and they were Yummmmy.  Everything was fresh, and served hot. We did not feel pushed to finish our meal, so they could seat someone else.  GREAT PLACE.   If I go back, I will NOT use the parking garage (big rip -off) and will go straight to FOG HARBOR.

d23OLx3YK3wsJRsPzDvGTQ.review_text: I can only speak from the one experience I had there, but it was great. The windows overlook Pier 39 and you can see Alcatraz Island as well. The waiting area outside was cute, and the waiters were friendly. I ordered crab cakes, and they were wonderful. My husband got seafood pasta and he loved his. I'm not an expert on seafood, but I enjoyed it and that's all I can really say!

ap6LAP_g7IuKXlfVlKYXVg.review_text: Stopped here for lunch before going on Adventure Catamaran Tour at Pier 39 (an awesome tour by the way). Decided to eat at the bar to save time. The bartender, Tony, made our visit extra special. Despite being very busy, he took care of our food order and got us in and out in less than 30 minutes. The fish and chips were awesome, and they have a good kids menu. I agree, its nice to see a not quite so touristy place with good food, in the middle of this tourist trap of a Pier. We will definitely come back when we can spend more time!

Wrudx0OajqgrKpizjAwbcQ.review_text: Wonderful place,nice veiw , amazing food and most of all our servant KHAIMAN such a great person :) was fun being here :) would definitely come again

F3AYZfDJ0Oc1T9QhOhAURQ.review_text: Went here for Happy Hour.  Got the Lombard Lemonade. The bartender made it very well. Tasted yummy. I can barely taste the alcohol, but it somewhat creeps up on you (in a good way).   The calamari was good. Nice, crispy, and filling. The smoked salmon crostini was very flavorful.   The view from the window looks out into the water, very beautiful.  The outside area of the restaurant is very cozy with a fire place.

8LitC9OoezsHsHm_It0QzQ.review_text: Had a great time at Fog harbor house on Saturday night. Our server Brenda was amazing she went out of her way to give us tips on places to watch the football gamer he next day and her recommendations were spot on. Food was sooooo good. Had the whole crab with a bowl of clam chowder plus the view is great. Would recommend to friends/family.

izVTBQfKSVn0ZCwqpu8K8w.review_text: While the food was good and visually very appealing, we found the actual amount of crab/ lobster you receive very lacking. You definitely had to work for your food with the crab. And the crab stuffed lobster was mostly potatoes and spinach.   The appetizer of mussels was amazing however the crab and shrimp ceviche was mostly avocado.   The sword fish was great.. My 10 year old son cleaned his plate!

EL6AdCstHrEdtZrH2K89NA.review_text: Although it's nestled into the tourist trap of Pier 39, this place was surprisingly enjoyable. The food was great, the view was really pretty. Slightly noisy due to hard surfaces and high ceilings, but the good service and yummy chowder make up for it.

VUBO_0vSuatlHwaxV7azdw.review_text: I came here per the suggestion of my roommate who works as a hostess there because she always would recap to me all the delicious food she ate that day with eyes wide and everything, so I finally got the chance to  try it.  First off, let me just say the ambiance of the place is very...ritzy. The restaurant itself is beautiful--definitely a place to wine and dine someone special with a beautiful view of the bay (*hint hint* guys!). The servers are friendly and attentive, and they made sure my water glass was never left empty.  I had the crab cakes and ahi tuna to start off with, and the crab cakes were by far some of the best I've had in San Francisco. They were moist, creamy, and had a great balance of breading and crab. The ahi tuna was okay--I didn't really care for the seared tuna; it was a little dry but the sesame poke with the wonton chips was delicious to snack on.   I had the Mixed Grill with the salmon, mahi-mahi, and prawns, and I was worried that the fish would come out dry, but surprisingly, the fish was quite juicy and flavorful. I didn't care too much for the prawns though.  Finally, I had the lava cake for dessert, and this is where the 5 star acclaim comes from. The chocolate lava cake was the BEST cake I have ever had. Drizzeled with a heap of warm gooey fudge and served with vanilla ice cream, each bite was a taste of what heaven should taste like. They could have served me dirt for the main course and this cake for dessert and I probably would have still been happy.   All in all, this restaurant was a pleasant dining experience. The prices are a bit steep but a seafood restaurant at the wharf with a view overlooking the bay will cost you a shiny penny.

GN83yGu-5Isw5iVJ5cFj9w.review_text: Made an afternoon pit stop for drinks...while the bartenders are friendly...their drink mixing skills are somewhat off the mark.  We'd ordered a cosmo and gimlet and the drinks came out looking bright Christmas colors (red and green).  At our request, the bartender was nice enough to make us something else - we opted for on the rocks with splash of juice.

U0lZpxyfRsFnDJ-LBKvCjQ.review_text: Our family was in town for 24 hours so trying to narrow down were to eat a GREAT seafood dinner in San Fran was hard. We totally picked the RIGHT PLACE! We ordered the garlic crab, fish in chips, crab roll, calamari (OUTSTANDING), and clam chowder. We absolutely LOVED everything!!!!!

n5B5bF6wBEimP73uB24Z7Q.review_text: The food was decent, but I don't think I would come back.  I had the Crab Melt, which was a bit bland, but the fries were the better part of this entree.  The clam chowder was seasoned just right; the good thing was that it did have good-sized chunks of clam.  The tiramisu was perfect.  This meal cost about $32.00 before tip.  You can catch some great views if you sit at a window.

_9iZTjwRl9rBWRfcyX928Q.review_text: Everything was great except for not knowing who our server was. It took so long for a server to finally walk up to our table and acknowledge we were there. We seriously were thinking of getting up and walking out if it took any longer. Something in our hearts made us stay, well maybe because the sound of crab on top of clam chowder was just something we did not want to pass up. So we're glad we stayed and after we made some crazy eye contact with who we assumed was our server, it got better from there.  Definitely order clam chowder, whatever the option it may be, bowl, cup, in a bread bowl, you will not go wrong.   I had the crab roll, it was a good amount of crab in a butter toasted super soft bun. My wife ordered the soup and salad and it was perfect.

BbDL2iMhszS_M6jyKzLFCw.review_text: Aside from the most delicious meals ever!!! Michael Kelly provided us the best service we've ever had bare none in a restaurant. He chattered to our every desire. Seth Maddox, restaurant manager extraordinaire, aside from wearing a shirt of my favorite color, purple, made certain we were taken care of as if we were family. In fact, he looks very similar to one of our nephews. if ever you are in San Francisco I highly suggest you visit them at Fog Harbor Fish House on Pier 39 - life doesn't get any better than dinning at the Fog Harbor Fish House! And I've eaten at the Top of the Mark and other 5 star restaurants all over the country - but the Fog Harbor was so good we eat there two nights in a row. But then, with outstanding people taking care of our evenings out such as Michael and Seth it is no wonder we can't wait to go back again and hopefully soon!

kKCxMwAffgRrA0MJFv1aUQ.review_text: We made our reservation through yelp earlier in the day. Our table was ready when we arrived and service was great. We had a lovely view from our table. The calamari was great and the spicy shrimp appetizer was also delicious. It is very spicy though so be ready! We had the tuna and scallops for our main meals and both dishes were delightful. We would definitely go back! A couple dining with us actually did go back a couple days later because they enjoyed it so much.

U2BDYntmmVanSvYExOhP-A.review_text: Excellent view.  Awesome food. And a great service.  It is a bit pricy for my budget but it was worth it.

Y6yg0sxJjZg7m2UdF9eGZA.review_text: 3.5 stars   Fog Harbor serves up a good, solid lunch with great views.  The restaurant is a good size, and the view with the boats and the like entertained my son quiet well.  I ordered the crab cake appetizer as my entree, and I thought it was delicious.  My glass of riesling was a bit on the skimpy side though.  My husband's clam chowder soup and crab roll were delicious as well.  My son's mac and cheese consisted of very-overcooked pasta (and I usually like "overcooked" pasta) with way too much butter, which completely seeped out and puddled when I opened the leftovers box the next day.  And although the sourdough bread that they served was hot and fresh with a nice crusty exterior and great flavor, I have to say that they completely squish their bread by cutting it wrong. Whoever is cutting it needs to learn 1) use a serrated knife and 2) saw back and forth.  Otherwise you are killing the good efforts of the baker to make great bread.  Overall, not bad. We'll return another day, but will probably skip the kid's mac and cheese and go for something else.

hGV3LOOZYXTCXk48ZcUwVw.review_text: We visited this place a few weeks ago for dinner and had a large party so we had to wait around 45 minutes to be seated. The food was fabulous and so you might ask why the low rating, well the service was absolutely terrible! Our waiter was abrupt, curt, and made us feel as if he simply did not have time to wait on us. He was attentive to every other table in his station except ours, and we had to resort to stopping another waiter to ask him to take over our table which he gladly did. To their credit the manager did come over to apologize and we were treated to complimentary desert so it wasn't a total loss and the food was great. I had the steak and lobster and it was cooked exactly as I requested. the second waiter we had did save the day and was very helpful and apologetic, and based upon his service we will definitely return.

Ns-Mk7Dn0XWTcmEquZ12Dg.review_text: Went there with my husband, 5 yr. old and 2 yr. old, and my father this weekend. My Dad likes to visit Pier 39 when he comes to the bay area to stay with us. (which isn't my favorite place, but we go there just for him.) He really wanted to go to a good seafood place, so I looked up reviews on yelp and found Fog Harbor. I'm always a little leery of restaurants in tourist-y places (especially since a couple other places I've been to at Pier 39 turned out to be really terrible), but Fog Harbor turned out to be a great choice.   My husband and I have high expectations for our food when we go to nice restaurants in the $20-$40 range, and we were very impressed with this place. My husband and dad both got the swordfish, which they raved about. I got the special, which was a gumbo with vegetables and rice topped with a filet of salmon and grilled shrimp. The salmon was like butter on the inside, and had a deliciously seasoned and seared outside. I also had a fresh squeezed lemonade with ginger. Not overly sweet like most lemonades, just perfect. We got the chocolate cake for desert. It was super moist and I couldn't stop eating it, even after I was already stuffed from dinner. Our waiter was friendly and helpful. My kids kept themselves entertained by drawing on the paper tablecloth with crayons provided to us. My 5 yr. old got the burger from the kid's menu and it was HUGE! enough to easily feed an adult. And it was arguably one of the best burgers I've ever had, too. We will probably go back to Fog Harbor, the next time my dad wants to go to Pier 39 ;)

LecyBjohZL6LW-pXt5PTeg.review_text: My eyes were bigger than my stomach here.   Had the (free) bleu cheese garlic bread with the starter Dungeness crab cakes and house salad with balsamic vinaigrette dressing. It all tasted fine, but pricy for the portions that you're served. Unable to stop myself, I also got the apple crisp for dessert and it was very good. My server was prompt, attentive, and friendly which made for a nice dining experience. Also had an excellent view of the water.   A nice place to eat on Pier 39, but pricier. Definitely not some place I'd come to regularly, but a good place to eat if you're already down by the wharf.

zhtMfSgqn1sCCvmBxczzdQ.review_text: The food was delicious and our waiter Derrick was fantastic. The crab roll was excellent and a nice portion. Sweet potato fries delicious. My husband is a fussy person that likes his burger well done. This was cooked to perfection and the grilled onions were tasty and sweet.

yhwtDBHillyYM6GuWrmzdw.review_text: This place is awesome! Great view, it's worth every minute that you have to wait for a seat near the window. Great service, very friendly. Great food, I had the oysters, clam chowder, and mixed grill, all superb!

BHej3YG3nmkCxDeJHOKQzA.review_text: Clam chowder and oysters are delicious. Do not get the calamari. Worst calamari ever. Server went on break and no one was really checking up on us. I ordered a cup of clam chowder and never received it.

sKd2Mn9-ws34UwZ3D54huQ.review_text: I had an amazing time at this restaurant. I couldn't give a 5 star, because our original server didn't have the best customer service. However, for some reason, a new server Morgan took over and our time here became almost perfect. She was very kind and always had a small on, and had great customer service for a high quality restaurant. She checked up on us as much as she can, and really changed our time there. I highly recommend asking for her if you want great customer service.  As for the food, the seafood was high quality and everything was absolutely delicious.
