We had the crab and avocado salad, clam chowder, and the crab ceviche to start off. All of the flavors were upto par and super fresh. I recommend trying their whole crab, their mixed grill, and their shellfish platter for a variety. You can order for 1-2 servings with the shellfish platter. All of the seafood was very fresh and seasoned well.   Overall, I will definitely be returning for their quality seafood and the customer service we received in the end. One tip: make reservations for the view because the view really makes it much more special. Thank you Morgan for a wonderful Christmas Eve dinner with my family!

KZQWqOAA7cCrA5ufuW8xnQ.review_text: I should have known not to expect too much at a tourist restaurant. I ordered the crab cake burger and it had a lot of bread crumbs and very little crab meat. They also added a lot of vegetable within the crabcake to fill up the crab burger. This was a really big let down. However, their clam chowder is amazing. It was a little thick and the flavor was perfect. I wished I ordered the sourdough bread bowl instead because the girl on the next table finished the whole thing. Also, I guess we were lucky because we had a table with an amazing view. You can see the sea lion on the piers and you can also see Alcatraz Island from where I was sitting.

gurcmVDESVQ8X20xpw4btw.review_text: Solid, very touristy spot.   Now, you're probably not reading this thinking its a "local gem", but i want to be explicit. This place is on the edge of the touristy part of SF.   That said, the food is solid - Dungeness crab season all the way! The service is good and the place feels clean and open. There is a great view of alcatraz as well. Overpriced a bit, but not terribly.   So, overall, its a great place for tourists!

85nh-P4jR2TgjQlyqArznw.review_text: I was able to book a reservation last minute thru yelp. Awesome.  Ha the margarita (organic) was really good and well done. My dish was the crab cake. Good portion if you are not a huge portion fanatic. Was very good and the crab cake was real crab. Coffee was really good as well. The bread was still warm! I like this place.

mL9GtEYtR5e3kae0B7pCsw.review_text: After just 3 years in the Bay Area I still feel like a tourist. So any opportunity to act like one is taken with gusto. My cousin came in on a cruise ship en route to Alaska or something and she wanted to see my family while she was at port.   Now - I have 2 kids, a 2 year old and a 11 month old, so I am always cautious not to go out to restaurants that are not kid friendly. Luckily, most tourist venues fit the bill - even nicer one's like Fog Harbor.    I made reservations right here with Open Table, noted that I had 2 kids and we were set-up with crayons, a coloring menu and a very attentive, patient staff.   Now onto the food - it was good, nothing too fancy. I had a delicious steak, fried calamari, my wife enjoyed an Ahi Tuna and our guests were full from Chinese Dim-Sum - but they did have some lovely shrimp cocktail.  I can't complain, the 4 stars were really for the kid-friendly atmosphere and great views from almost anywhere inside. Oh and they validated parking.   TLDR version: Good for kids, good food, validate parking, enjoy the Pier :)  p.s. there is an awesome merry-go-round at the end of the pier, it was epic. :)

o_p7twtyTsJ3NmXmL5yyRA.review_text: This is my favorite place ever. A friend and I were in the city one day and took a cab to Pier 39 for lunch, we were soooo hungry that we walked upstairs and said "Hey, this place looks nice, let's eat here" it was the best meal either one of us has ever had. I now come here for birthdays, anniversaries, and any other excuse I can find to get there. The clam chowder is amazing, but the swordfish is why I keep coming....the service is great EVERYTIME. The drinks are delicious.

zWANMGlOSLgoKm6PX6P-zg.review_text: My family and I went for lunch on a Saturday.  The service was top notch and the food was excellent.  I started with the dungeness crab cocktail.  It was shredded crab dresses with a touch of cocktail sauce and some lemon wedges.  It was fresh and chilled perfectly. The main course was fish and chips; something I haven't had in a while since it's usually so greasy.  This fish on the other hand was beer battered perfection using the locally made Anchor Steam beer.  It was crispy and the fish was tender and moist.  The view was also great, looking right out into the bay.  I would definitely return.

yoMyZL8PpA8-P-lTMHbkKg.review_text: Second time here and still not disappointed. The sourdough bread is addictive the service is great.  Clementine was my server and I really can't say anything bad about her.   She was attentive funny and made the experience even better.   I am vegetarian so I had a special dish made by the kitchen. It was good. My partner ordered fish and chips and loved it.   Clementine made sure our drinks were strong and that we were enjoying everything.  Now if only they would get rid of the silly dessert tray.

UJ_cZ3ER8fXh7dKMB6vv5Q.review_text: I've walked through Pier 39 countless times but I've never actually gone upstairs to check out the restaurants before this past week.  Fog Harbor is a great little spot with an amazing view of the Bay, the Wharf, and the City.  The food was amazing and the service was excellent.  The manager that night came over to talk to us, his name was Brian.  Our server Pedro kept the food and drinks coming.  I had the Seared Prawns Ravioli and it was excellent!  Not a single person in our party of 6 had a single complaint!  The chocolate banana nut dessert is a great choice!  I will definitely bring my family out to Fog Harbor when they come out for the Holidays this year.

egJ0KB6iuj9_2HsnOfVgLw.review_text: Took my visiting mom here for some fish & chips and it was a-ok. The view is remarkable and worth a visit for any tourists. The food is about what you'd expect in Pier 39.   All and all a decent experience if you're looking to patronize any of the Pier 39-area restaurants and stay budget-conscious.

5YUfy39pMeDI_ZNuAj2Iig.review_text: We live in the East Bay and came her for our evening in SF due to the great reviews on Yelp.  1. Lots of hot  warm fresh Boudin baked bread. Am embarrassed we had 2 basketfuls for the 2 of us. 2. They serve sustainable fresh seafood. 3. Clean environment, crisp linens. Did not look rundown. I did not expect this being this is a location on Pier 29. 4. Great View of the Bay

y0dhi-wmcPnnzP5CGjE1SA.review_text: In a touristy spot, but it's a beautiful restaurant with great views.  They validate parking, so you end up saving $8 from the parking garage right across the street.  I've had the chowder and as a New Englander, it stands up!  Love the fresh sourdough and the cioppino was great and huge!

xiBOTayhN5vkDOWmIy-cXg.review_text: Food is amazing and so was the service from Shawna! We will for sure come back to this place!

X1Jfcylqrh-B-IaphsP7IA.review_text: Lovely view, excellent service...drinks only ok, fish only ok. I saw a lot of tourists, as you might expect, and was overall not too thrilled.   Our server was obviously new. My husband enjoyed his fish and chips, but those are hard to mess up. I had some sort of cold seafood on salad dish that I'd heard was good, and it was ok...Maybe a Crab Louie? Portion sizes were very large, prices were fair.  I really enjoyed looking out across the bay!

0aQ57h7pu4FyxjWHq1EpQg.review_text: My wife and I went here for a nice dinner on our trip to SF. It's a classy establishment with nice views of the Bay. We ordered the scallops appetizer which was Amazing as was the sauce that came with it. I had the Crab Cakes which were LITERALLY the BEST I've ever had and I've had my share. My wife had the crab cocktail. The actual crab was delicious BUT order the cocktail sauce on the side. They smothered the crab in sauce which was sort of unexpected. I would absolutely go back again. I will say expect to run a decent tab if you go BUT you're at the ocean. You can't skimp on fresh seafood.

smKxbOJb9p2SrwSyOFHwvg.review_text: I went here recently with friends from out of town.  I got one of the specials a Seabass with a citrus sauce. The seabass was ok.  It was moist and well cooked but I wasn't as excited about the flavors as I had hoped to be.  The grilled asparagus and garlic mashed potatoes were excellent though. As well as the service.

UKyn5u9C-F9QkucQIUG7pw.review_text: Had a terrific dinner here tonight. Started with the bleu cheese bread and fritters. I would recommend both.   My wife had a bowl of the chowder.   It was creamy, and had wonderful flavor.  Especially liked the crab meat topping.  I had the seafood platter.  The portion was a good size, and felt it was reasonably priced. All the shellfish was cooked properly and loved the slice of bread for dipping in the garlic butter. Finished off the meal with tiramisu- which was spectacular.   Our server was Shawna.  She was absolutely terrific.  Took the time to answer all of our questions, and was very prompt with her service.  She frequently checked in with us and ensured that everything was good.  If I were to be back in this area again, I would definitely ask to be seated in her section.  Beyond the food and service, the place has a wonderful ambiance. The views overlooking the water are terrific, and found the noise level was not so loud that you could not have a conversation.  All in all,  really enjoyed the meal and service we had.

YnAT3WxbrlJqrny-lS8gog.review_text: We stopped in for a late lunch two years ago and the food was delicious.  We returned this fall and the food was still wonderful.  We had the shell fish plate for two and a bowl of clam chowder each. So much food, all wonderfully cooked.  After all that good food I wanted something light for desert.  I ordered the tiramisu  and it was just right, just a bit of sweetness for the end to go with the coffee.    I'm sorry some of the reviewers had a bad time.  Our waitress, Madison, was delightful. She took the time we needed to answer questions and made sure we had everything we needed.  We came in right before the rush, I am sure that helps.

ncDvsOBA1BobJbfvbOcTcg.review_text: Must order the Dungeness crab cioppino, so deliciously flavorful since the seafood is very fresh. The portion is very generous so there will definitely be left overs, which it taste even better the next day! It's also nice that they provide the option to de-shell the crab for you.

4hZuLbjtZU5MbkbAwEeBrg.review_text: Got a great dinner here today. We started off with the calamari, it was crispy and delicious. I had the halibut and my husband had the mahi-mahi with the mango salsa - both very delicious with a Cajun seasoning. We got the chicken tender kids dinner for the little one. Everything was yummy and the fresh baked sourdough bread was excellent. We sat by  the window and had a great view of the bay.

jhE0HCEgIxBvE3PXbxm4AQ.review_text: Who knew such a good restaurant is alive and kickin in the biggest tourist trap ever?!  I ordered the mixed fish plate and the fish was sooo good!!!    The rice wasn't cooked all the way but the bread made up for it. It was hot and yummy!!!  Save room for dessert!!!

9xXBniVmut2nVkB2CBKT4Q.review_text: I thought the clam chowder tasted like it had flour or starch or something in it. And my bf didn't think the ahi tuna was that great kinda chewy. For the price tag i would say try somewhere else

lh3Erb-PSSw6Pi4mzhQmHw.review_text: If you're near pier 39, come to this restaurant! Everything we got was fresh, not heavy, an absolutely delicious. From the freshly baked sourdough garlic bread to the lobster Mac and cheese to the mixed seafood platter, everything was delicious and they don't skimp on the portions. Come here, for what you get for the price you will not be disappointed!!

JPXsEViInojd0GBJPoCLUA.review_text: My husband and I came here for dinner to celebrate our anniversary while on vacation. We almost ended up at Scoma's but I'm so glad we didn't! Fog Harbor exceeded our expectations. Starting off with two delicious cocktails (Manhattan and dirty martini) at the bar, we were given great recommendations from the bartender. After being seated at a window table with a wonderful view of the wharf and "Happy Anniversary" adorably scribbled on it, we began to indulge.   For our entrees my husband ordered the seafood cioppino which was chock full of large shell fish and a broth that lit up our tastebuds. He's literally still craving it 2 weeks later. I on the other hand decided to be difficult and create my own dish that was not on the menu. Our waiter Richard who was phenomenal and beyond accommodating, brought me exactly what I was craving (lobster and Dungeness crab pasta in a cream sauce) A-mazing!!  After dinner we were gifted with a large and decadent dessert (a warm walnut brownie with ice cream) for our special occasion. All in all, Fog Harbor made it a very memorable night for us and we thank Richard and staff for the awesome service.

jTLcYO0sWQergwONKPcNNQ.review_text: Came here our half year of being together.   The environment was very elegant and slightly romantic. The waiters were very well dressed, well mannered and respectable.   We ordered the clam chowder in the bread bowl. It was excellent; very rich and creamy.   We also ordered the fried calamari. It wasn't anything extraordinary but it did taste good. A lot of the calamari tangled together.   Overall, each dish is about 16-25$ except for the clam chowder, which was 10 with the bread bowl.   At the end you get a 30% coupon for the coffee shop nearby.

1qGl0NAQvWNtcV6EtbmT9w.review_text: Be careful of this restaurant! I told the waitress I just want 2 waters. Then she kept asking sparkling or still water. I said I just want normal water. She finally served a bottle of water and charged me for $7. We never got our bread and butter. The waitress even argued that I should have said "tap water". Who have time for this! What kind of restaurant does that! Just cut the tip half and will never go back again.

hRD1uMCRXkpDSbr5xC3R8g.review_text: My husband and I had a good time here. Yes, it's in a super touristy location and has that grande, corporate feel to it. It didn't bother us too bad though.  We tried: -Clam Chowder -Whole Garlic Crab -Fish & Chips  The clam chowder wasn't to my taste - it was incredibly thick and lacking flavor. The garlic crab was great - sweet crab cooked perfectly. The side of corn on the cob was horribly overcooked though. The fish & chips were good, with a light crispy batter and moist fish. However, the fries that it came with were bleh.  The best part was our server. I don't know his name, but he was the BEST. He was on top of it and very friendly. I can't say he reflects the rest of the staff, as a table near us wasn't greeted for several minutes and had to notify the hostess.  All in all, we probably wouldn't return, as touristy areas aren't really our thing. However, I'd recommend this to others who plan to be in that area and are in the mood for crab.

-c9Z5MQHWIc5YsWIHE8d2g.review_text: Excellent place to enjoy Pier 39! Great food (pricy) but very worthy! Try their blue cheese bread and their clam chowder! Enjoy it!

x46DLPnNQ9bGpIx4B59u1Q.review_text: The popcorn shrimp appetizer with jalepeno dipping sauce was excellent.  I decided to have the pan seared chicken and it was great, but my wife did not particularly like the fish and chips, she said it was too greasy. Our waiter was phenomenal and quite professional.  Dessert was a real treat of course, my wife chose the creme brulee and she loved it.  While I decided to have the raspberry cheese cake, hmmm.  Overall we enjoyed our visit to Fog Harbor Fish House and would recommnend to eat there anytime you are at Pier 39.

ZNKbBH45FnFF-9aNbGmKHg.review_text: Great location on Pier 39. Had the platter for two. Was good, came with crab, mussels, clams, shrimp and corn. Tasty buttery garlic sauce. The Caesar salad was really good. Dinner comes with hot baked sour dough bread. Platter was just perfect for two. Desserts all looked delicious, had the Apple Crisp. Yum! Comes with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream.  Atmosphere was nice, had a table over looking the water. Prices are decent. So good ate here twice on one trip!!

OKKfEypDO-42cBQaddaeQQ.review_text: Even though its centered in one of the most touristy areas in sf, Fog Harbor was an awesome standout seafood restaurant. Although the exterior isn't much to look at, once you go upstairs and even to the waiting area, it's a really nice fine dining experience.   A few friends and I were really in the mood for oysters at around 11am and found fog harbor through yelp. The view from the inside is amazing as you can look out across the pier and see all the boats and tourists wandering about.   My gf and I shared a dozen oysters ($25), a clam chowder bread bowl ($10) and a Dungeness crab roll ($19). I just had to order a crab dish as they just started their crab season just the day before.    The oysters were freshly shucked (they shrunk as I added lemon juice) and very sweet, definitely did not disappoint. The clam chowder was very creamy and had lots of clams, although a bit lacking in the amount of actual chowder but its a novelty item so I didn't mind. The crab roll was overflowing with their crab mixture which had good amounts of crab that you could taste in a nicely toasted butter roll.   At the end of our meal, our server notified us that they were doing a promotion in which you rate your experience on your smartphone on their website and you get a complimentary dessert!! And they aren't the skimpy "one ice cream scoop" desserts. Actual full fledged desserts like a 5" Creme brûlée, huge slices of tiramisu, bread pudding. We got the cranberry and apple crumb cake with vanilla bean ice cream. A great way to finish off the meal.   Our meal for the two of us came to about $75 because we were also ordering a few beers. I would definitely come back here again. Service and quality of food was spot on.

IDcYXJpo3B62HS40bEXCpw.review_text: I've been here a few times since moving to the Bay Area.  The food always is very good here.  The Clam Chowder is really tasty.  Last trip, I had the mixed grill and again no disappointments in the food.  However, I have to agree there are some service issues with this place.  I've eaten at the bar a couple times and usually pretty good service considering the bartender is doing a lot of other things besides the food.  Took a guest to Fog Harbor last Saturday and we were seated in the restaurant portion.  Probably 10-15 mins. before anyone came and asked if we had been helped.  Then when our waiter took our order, he failed to ask if we wanted anything to drink besides the water that finally showed up, so he lost a sale on that.  Then after he took our order, we never saw him for another 10-15 minutes.  A long time between the chowder and the main meal.  Never brought us the famous sourdough bread he promised.  The food again - very good - recommend eating at the bar if you go.

AriCHacDrcROakQpkN_tKA.review_text: Food is delish! Super fresh and tasty! The portions are a good size so you're not left hungry. I loved it!

FZgzMFY50CME1vPvfy_qGg.review_text: Good view, very thick clam chowder but i liked it. Should try the Ahi tuna with avacado and mango for a starter! Nice in general!

mQ-bqPJU0Di-SPEdT7ahLA.review_text: Excellent food! The clam chowder soup is great.

DTJC_VEeLh8wg-JC3FSuOw.review_text: Went to this restaurant based on Yelp reviews, the menu and the proximity to our hotel. I never would have expected such poor service from a restaurant like this, especially one in a prime tourist location. A little background, we had reservations for Sunday at 4:00 PM. Here's a summary of our experience here after being seated:  -No one acknowledged us, no one as in any other waitstaff -Another server had to take our order 10 min after being seated. He tells us out waiter didn't know he had the section we were in. -Our waiter served a table that was seated after us and still don't stop by our table which was four feet directly across from their table -We didn't get water after 20 minutes and that's after asking multiple times  -Our waiter didn't acknowledge us for over 15 min, didn't say hello or apologize for the wait -We had to ask for bread -It took 50 min to get our food -We had to flag down our waiter to get boxes and the check -The general manager didn't even ask how everything was even though it was obvious we weren't happy and were looking all over the place for our waiter throughout our entire time there  I cannot stress how bad this dining experience was. How could a tourist restaurant be so poor in customer service? It should be the exact opposite in my opinion. I will not be returning here and will tell others to not go here. The food was mediocre. We ordered the blue cheese garlic bread, clam chowder bowl, crab roll, and the mixed grill. Nothing memorable besides the food was rather bland especially the mixed grill plate. Don't waste your time and money going here. The view of the water and Alcatraz isn't worth it, trust me, the ambiance isn't worth it. If anyone from this restaurant is reading this (which I highly doubt), I'd recommend on training your staff better, especially your general manager working on August 11, 2013.

7Q4xvpbjLa_s7P802HtEJg.review_text: My boyfriend and I visited for our anniversary dinner. Around 9pm on a Saturday night, we ended up waiting a little under 30 minutes for a table. Service was great; from the hostess to our server. On to the most important part and the reason why you're reading this review... The food:   - Oysters: Fresh. Fresh. Fresh. I am not the biggest fan of oysters, but I had to try them. They are the cleanest oysters I've ever tasted. I could've eaten half a dozen by myself.  - Ahi Tuna Poke: Decent size chunks with avocado and I believe it was mango as well? The Sriracha drizzled around the plate adds a kick of spice if that's what you're looking for. Down side to this plate was that there was only 3 wonton chips to share!   - Clam Chowder: You can't come to SF and not have a bowl of clam chowder. You won't regret it! So rich and creamy, you can actually tell that there are clams in there! (Also had clam chowder from Nick's Lighthouse... Fog Harbor blows them out of the water)   - Garlic Roasted Dungeness Crab: YUMMY. So glad we went with this over the steamed dungeness. It had so much more flavor to it and was way more juicy than we expected, which is a definitely plus. (Tip: Dip the corn into the garlic/butter... Also, if you prefer mashed potatoes to the fingerling potatoes, just ask your server to substitute it for you)  Overall, we had a great experience. We also ordered 2 drinks from the bar to go with our meal which brought our grand total to ~$108 (excluding tip). Will definitely be back again!

hAU72qKgpuev6md8_6SngQ.review_text: Hubby and I stumbled upon this place.  We opted for H.H and ended up sitting in the bar area.   Our bartender/server whipped up a mojito for me despite the fact that they don't offer mojitos during H.H which is understandable- I mean who wants to muddle all of that mint during a busy H.H.   Service was impeccable- everything was just on point.   Food was so delishhhhh esp the a la cart Salmon sliders, I could've ate 6 no lie!!   Crab Louis was ENORMOUS!!  We both shared it and couldn't finish it.   The view wasn't breathtaking but still nice.   What I really loved about this place the most was the non-touristy vibe it had and may I mention I spotted Barry Sloan from the ABC Show REVENGE sitting right across from us but I was too much of a chicken to say hi as he was with his family.   All in all we had a great experience and can't wait to come back!

76vIFZcC7owykCBjMfGVXg.review_text: This is your typical touristy restaurant in the Pier 39 area, which decent tasting food and a nice view, but inflated prices. Make sure you check in on Yelp to get a free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread appetizer. I came for my friend's birthday (Kellie C.!) since they have a separate room for large parties in the back of the restaurant, and were able to accommodate a group of 18 on a Thursday night. We came in around 8:15pm, and the table was ready, so we were seated right away. Although the table sat 18, we could've used a little more room. However, it worked out fine, and I got to try: -Blue Cheese Garlic Bread (Fresh Sourdough, Topped w/Garlic, Pt. Reyes Blue Cheese, Herbs, $8): Just ok. The blue cheese overpowered all the other flavors, and you couldn't taste the garlic. The bread was also too crunchy for my liking. Skip! -Oysters (Served w/Cocktail Sauce, Dozen $26, yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…): The oysters were fresh, but the cocktail sauce and mignonette were just ok. I wish they had given us some Tabasco with the oysters. Skip! -Crispy Lemon Calamari (Seasoned w/Lemon, Served w/Lemon Aioli, $12, yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…): Yuck.. the calamari rings were chewy, and the batter was soggy. This is one of the worst fried calamari dishes I've had, and they should really re-look at their recipe. Skip! -Ahi Poke (Marinated Raw Tuna, Avocado, Mango, Sesame-Soy Sauce, Wasabi Aioli, $16): Ok. The tuna tasted fresh, and I liked the wasabi aioli. However, the sesame soy sauce didn't have much flavor, and the dish overall was bland. Skip! -Crab Louis ($22, yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…): They didn't skimp on the crab, and it tasted really fresh, which was great. However, there were pieces of cartilage in the crab, and the salad itself was bland. I wouldn't order this again. -Crab Roll (Fresh Crab, Celery, Shallot Aioli, Served on a Buttered Roll w/Sweet Potato Fries, $19, yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…): Pretty good if you like mayo, and I liked that they toasted the roll nicely. The sweet potato fries were also really good. Recommended! -Fish & Chips (Hand Dipped in "Anchor Steam" Beer Batter w/Cole Slaw, $17, yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…): They give you a huge portion (2 large and 2 medium sized fish sticks, fries, cole slaw), but the fish was just ok. I didn't like the taste and consistency of the batter- it tasted bitter from the beer, and was too crunchy. The cole slaw was also just so-so since it was very bland. However, the fries were done nicely, and the tartar sauce was delicious. -Award Winning Clam Chowder (The Best in San Francisco, Bowl, $8, yelp.com/biz_photos/fog-…): This was a pretty good version of clam chowder! It was rich and creamy, and there were big pieces of clam in the chowder. Recommended! -Apple Crisp a la Mode (House-Made w/Granny Smith Apples, Walnuts, Butter Crumb, Served Warm, Topped w/Vanilla Ice Cream, $8.50): Ok. I liked the butter crumb, but the apples were a little hard. I wouldn't order this again. -Warm Chocolate Lava Cake (w/Creamy Chocolate Center, Served w/Vanilla Ice Cream, $8.50): Just ok, nothing special. I wouldn't order this again. The best dishes from here were the Crab Roll and Clam Chowder, and the fries from the fish and chips. Although I don't think I'd come back for those dishes again, I would recommend ordering them if you are dining here. The service was good up until the end- it took them a long time to bring the dessert and our check. Make sure you ask them to validate your parking ticket if you parked in the structure across the street.   Overall, there are so many better restaurants to eat at in SF, and it's not worth coming here unless you can expense your meal, or if you really want a view of the pier area.

MBvB4l4N39_emF5KmC9Gpw.review_text: I had the best sliders ever for an appetizer and had the perfect meal of a clam chowder bread bowl and chicken Cesar salad all of which was DELICIOUS! My only complaint is that the lettuce of the salad was not cut at all, pretty presentation but, left me cutting lettuce like I would cut a steak...

gBxIhdBw-NLcjV3XNUTxUw.review_text: If you are at the pier, this is the best restaurant there and it also is one of the ones that will validate parking in the nearby garage.  The clam chowder and crab is excellent, everything else like fish and chips is just average, but not bad.

OrJyDA02dlSRBhDNJ4cH_w.review_text: Fog Harbor  Went here for lunch. Get the clam chowder in the sourdough bread bowl!!! it is delicious enough for a meal by itself! the sourdough is baked fresh and they give you more sourdough bread on the side! their clam chowder is FILLED with clams! yes a rarity since sometimes its just all potatoes and other fillers.  oh and also get the cioppino!!! its work..but it is sooo worth it! they give you the bib and all. the sauce was very tomato-ey...tasted so fresh. It goes great with the sourdough bread to scrape off the bottom of the bowl! they've got a great combination of crab, mussels, clams, and assorted fish in there! this is a must try!

FLwyCK_hWIGEr01S_htdgg.review_text: Food is good for the amount you pay, but not necessary value and beyond expectation.

-8EnCioUmDygAbsYZmTeRQ.review_text: For a San Francisco dining landmark at PIER 39, I'd expected better, but the food wasn't great, the restaurant is beautiful, the views were spectacular from our booth, amazing views of San Francisco Bay and the Golden Gate Bridge! We passed by this place, thought the decor was nice enough to eat here... The crab house next door didn't look nice to us...  Had a spicy Bloody Mary ($10) at the bar while waiting for our able, it was sooo spicy, but a good one! Bartenders were very strict at carding me! They insisted to see my ID first before making me a drink! ( Hubby had my ID at the moment & he went to restroom) Responsible! That's a good thing. :)   Got a nice booth facing the waterfront views, a dozen of raw oysters ($2.5 each) to start, the oysters were fresh, but the sauce wasn't so great to go with those. The complimentary bread was delicious.   I had whole Dungeness crab ($39), 2 lb crab steamed, served with mashed potatoes and sautéed veggies: the crab was not meaty, very plain, flavorless, I had to dip all the crab meat in Tabasco to finish it.   Hubby had Linguini & Clams ($18), fresh clams, garlic, olive oil, tomatoes: he didn't like it too much, flavorless  Had one more Bloody Mary and a Stella on draft, didn't like the food. We have had wayyyy much better seafood in LA, disappointed, the service was good, the views made up a little bit, but still not impressed. :( Let's try some other places next time.....

W7Kz2IfXL6aVsFXnFWSwrg.review_text: We wanted to have some lovely seafood while we were in San Francisco, and we chose the Fog Harbor Fish House from the many options on Fisherman's Wharf. Overall, very high marks. First, the view is lovely, and the restaurant itself is very nice and well-appointed. A nice place for a relaxed lunch, date night or a special occasion. Second, the food: -I ordered the ginger coconut cocktail, which was generally very good and tasty, but I felt had a bit too much coconut. It was kind of offputting in mouthfeel but did have a delightful ginger/lemon/spritzer type of flavor. I was torn between loving it and hating it and in the end only drank about half. -The chowder. Oh my god, get some.Some of the best chowder you will ever have. Thick, creamy, silky, delicious. Think cup, but go bowl. You're welcome. -Poke. I do love tuna, so poke is a tough thing to ignore on a menu that isn't in Hawaii. This particular poke is mixed with fresh avocado and mango, with a small amount of seaweed like you'd find in a seaweed salad. Light, gingery, soy-ey (??) and really yum. -Salmon. I got the salmon entree, which was just delicious. Cooked perfectly, with a med-rare center and beautiful grill marks on the outside, set over a creamy sauce with spinach and potatoes. A beautiful piece of fish and a huge portion! -Tuna -- perfectly cooked again with a nice big rare center. Served over a great hash-like mix that included these delightful bits of bok choy. SUPER yum.  In all the food was really excellent. We didn't have time for dessert. Our server was good, helpful and composed. Not cheap -- we had two apps, two entrees and two drinks and the tab topped $100 for LUNCH. Still.... We would definitely come back!

N7qi5oXzZQixmWc984AaMA.review_text: Great Food!  I could eat their bread & clam chowder Everyday!  Great Service and the cocktails are awesome! The bartenders are friendly and always have a suggestion on new cocktails or wine to compliment our meal.

qTUJzyNeORGlT_I7zUwqEQ.review_text: My family and I went here for dinner and had a great time.  The view overlooking the bay is gorgeous and all of the drinks were wonderful. Their Lombardi Lemonade is so addictive. We started off with the blue cheese garlic bread and steamed clams.  We found that the clams were a little bit bigger here than anywhere else we had been to so that was a plus. I ordered the half shellfish platter, when it got to our table I completely devoured it.  A generous serving of crab, mussels, shrimp, and steamed clams hit the spot. The atmosphere is very nice and the waitstaff are friendly. Definitely worth a try!

B-PKqWdTolVFksd0Lgk1JQ.review_text: I had the best birthday dinner with my husband a couple weeks ago at Fog Harbor. We were on a trip to celebrate our anniversary, my birthday, and our "babymoon" as I am 7 months pregnant. We chose the restaurant randomly as we were walking through Fisherman's Wharf and I am so glad we did! Our server Shawna was absolutely amazing. She was happy and funny and very knowledgeable about the food and wine menu. She took such good care of us and made sure I had a fabulous birthday! Our table was right by the window overlooking the wharf. We had the calamari, halibut, crab louis salad, and a complimentary Ghirardelli chocolate cake that was to die for! We will definitely return to Fog Harbor for dinner the next time we are in San Francisco. Thanks for a great experience!!

HzX0WGVJVqzT0E8Givft7A.review_text: Came here on Valentines Day with my hunny. The service was great, our waiter was very helpful & the wine she recommended was pretty good.   For our appetizer we had crispy lemon calamari which was the best calamari I've had. We also tried the clam chowder and the reviewers were right. The best clam chowder I have ever had.  Entrée: I got the special that was not on the menu. It was a half lobster stuff with crab & shrimp with garlic mashed potatoes. It was delicious. My hunny got Mixed Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp, citrus buerre blanc, sauteed vegetables, wild rice or garlic mashed potatoes. He said it lacked flavor but our waiter brought 2 sauces over & he really liked it. Overall it was delicious & service was awesome.  Will definitely be coming back.

O0v8v7JYW2NlKBiBbcoD6A.review_text: The service was impeccable, the view was stunning, and the food was delicious! We had a wonderful Pinot Noir (Carmel Road), yummy ahi, and an amazing chocolaty dessert! The manager was super-sweet and our waiter was very professional and attentive, even though we were a lil' toasted and belligerent! I will definitely be coming back!

W7tKBCQ1XugMEDjB8ZBXqg.review_text: Much better location and atmosphere than the other seafood places on Fisherman's Wharf (i.e. Alioto's and Fisherman's Grotto). This place is much more updated and SO much more crowded! But seriously, the atmosphere is what sets this place apart. The menus at all these places are comparable. I had the fried shrimp and was happy with it. The fresh sourdough is reaaalllllly good!  (Bill for my shrimp meal, my bf's fish and chips, a salad, two beers, and a sprite came to $68. Pricey, but that's a lot of stuff)

91b3eFKZ628pHxELnzYnRA.review_text: Clams in the chowder (one or two in every spoonful) were meaty and not chewy. The blue cheese garlic bread was nice. Heavy, but great. I thought the tanginess of both the cheese and sourdough would be too much but they were a nice combo. Since we had bread for an app, I just got the soup in a bowl. We also shared 1/2 a crab, which was my least fave item. Crab is so much work and this crab wasn't sweet or moist enough.  Lastly, the oysters were great! Cold, fresh, and big!

QK3Qvnwc_RI_tughKL3oZA.review_text: Been here a couple times and I love the ambiance--it's got great views. The food is pretty good too. The crab melt was a little soggy (prob too much mayo), but the scallop dish was amazing!

RZZ_ZHuAHvCg41-UG_icRg.review_text: Delicious! I had the tuna poke, which is a must try. Perfectly marinated and seasoned, it's a great dish all around. The tuna was fresh and full of flavor, and the wasabi mayo was a perfect garnish. For the entree I had the lobster ravioli special with tarragon, butternut squash, and sun dried tomato. It was creamy, but not too heavy, and the tarragon balanced the dish really well. My lunch-mate had the clam chowder and ciopinno. Both were great. Get the crab out of the shell for extra convenience--it's worth the money!

NRI9jDnTnSToLTxIW1KmVA.review_text: This was by far the best restaurant my boyfriend and I went to while in San Francisco.  We were skeptical that all of the restaurants down in Fisherman's Wharf  (especially Pier 39) would be a tourist trap, and then Fog Harbor Fish House by far exceeded our expectations.  The meal was amazing from beginning to end.  First, the view from every table is spectacular.  We were fortunate enough to catch an Americas Cup race while sipping on a cocktail.  Then our VERY attentive server Rudy gave us detailed recommendations about all of the specials.  Everything on their menu is appealing.  We ended up with the crab salad and fish and chip combo plate.  All of the seafood was EXTREMELY fresh and by far the best calamari I have EVER had.  Although we had a couple of hiccups with the order, the staff went over and above to make sure that we received the best experience.  Not only did the server Rudy say to us several times "We strive for perfection at Fog Harbor" but the manager came over to us and personally apologized for any problems with the meal.  For such a small mistake the team at Fog Harbor made sure that they fixed it right away and that we walked away pleased with our meal.  And boy did we!!!   I will recommend this restaurant to anyone I know visiting San Francisco and until next time I will dream about those calamari!!!  Eat at Fog Harbor....I promise you won't be disappointed!!!

5tA6XMewAx5PWZHGSgwWbA.review_text: Ratings for this restaurant range all over the place, some 5's all the way down to 1's. Mine is a 4.  I went there with my group of 45 seniors for lunch and that is a tough crowd, believe me.  Despite the size of our group, everyone was served promply with their exact choices, and by an large everyone was most happy with the meal, the ambience, and the service.  I had the shrimp skewers and my wife the salmon, both tasty. Yes, it is a little pricey but this is SF.  You can go cheaper in your own hometown, but just to be in the sunshine on Pier 39 adds to the overall experience.  I would go there again on my own.

xvPbF8-A_pwjNeBZV5sAzQ.review_text: This is a combined rating of 3.5 stars - location is 4.5 stars, service was 4.5 stars, food was 4 stars, and atmosphere was 2.5 stars. The crab cakes are particularly delicious, as was the Mahi Mahi. Great variety of good tasting, well-presented, dishes.   Major issue was that the tables are really crowded, and the place is extremely, painfully and incessantly LOUD! Although the food was excellent and the prices were reasonable (for San Francisco), I doubt I would want to return.

pGTP56e_LdLl2HN3iuGofQ.review_text: The best Cioppino ever! Also, great view of the bay.

OQHGlNKQdcp4noK5NrvyMg.review_text: Excellent food, great service. Bit pricey and crowded, but all in all a great experience

Ai3NbwFPjtLVEBVcOdnurg.review_text: Seared Ahi Tuna. It was the first time I ever had it and I have fallen in love. It was just so tasty. Encrusted with sesame seeds, it was just good. I can't even describe it. What is the texture suppose to be? It's just good!!!  Mint Mojitos. SO much mint, therefore I like. covered up the taste of the alcohol more.  Service was great! Warm bread as well.  Chocolate Bread Pudding was a little too dense/hard for my liking. I like my bread pudding on the softer side.   Tiramisu was actually really good. I thought it was very coffee-ey which is good cause I usually complain about it being too light, but this was on the stronger side so I really enjoyed it.   All the desserts were $7 so they weren't too bad for a nice restaurant. The portions were HUGE too.

so9GrvH-XELGdMt0qwhgng.review_text: Had such a good experience here. The food was great. Bar was awesome. Staff were excellent! Great job everyone. Can't wait to go back.

VEp_VFuXdwv3zWJw1RLacw.review_text: Looking at all the reviews, I think I had way too much expectations for this place. Went for a dinner (2 people) fairly late to not catch the tourist but service was so average and so slow for a late night. The free Yelp check in bread and blue cheese is very basic so take it but please stop raving about it. Then we tried the baked oysters which were really good, and I know my oysters. Following other reviews we tried the lobster mac n cheese which was way to average for the upscale dish that this represents. We also try the cioppino but not good.   My overall take is that if you want seafood in a decent place on the Wharf then this place is overrated.

adKonsQWY64vJYglPotH5Q.review_text: I don't normally enjoy touristy restaurants because of the crowd, but going to Fog Harbor is definitely a cuisine experience I would recommend to any local or tourist. The view is gorgeous, the service is beyond excellent, and the food is heavenly. Shout out to our waiter Jonathan!  I ordered a cup of clam chowder ($6) because I didn't want that to be my main entree, and it's cool that they offer options to have clam chowder in a cup, regular bowl, or bread bowl. Personally I think this is the best clam chowder I have ever tasted in SF, and I have had a LOT of clam chowder in SF.   I also ordered the linguine with clams ($18) which has garlic, olive oil, and tomatoes. This might actually become a regular item for me, if I didn't want to try everything else on the menu at some point. It's fresh, creamy, and very filling.   Even their bread comes straight from the oven, hot on our table. Their selection of cocktails is worth taking a look at as well. I'm just in love with every aspect of Fog Harbor. Make sure to call and reserve a table ahead of time to avoid a long wait!

exTHuOFaWck-gHqEeMahpA.review_text: Absolutely loved the clam chowder and my garlic roasted dungeoness crab. It was so good. Our wait was long but it was Christmas Day and they had these really comfortable shairs and sofas set up like a family room that made the wait actually pleasant. We had such a good time.

I_jqi8s4MySkNAnXWEU1ug.review_text: For good seating with a view, MAKE A RESERVATION ahead of time!   Food: the mediocre-est, whatevs.  Clams appeteaser: so-so, nothing special.  Service: was great, prompt, even though they were quite busy.  They had me at the warm sourdough bread basket, which doesn't say much for the restaurant at all.   Oh! And if you're annoyed by tourists, do go elsewhere.

-0u3FtuSiJGzLicKlw-zsg.review_text: Went in to just have a glass of wine and I asked for a Chardonnay that was on more of oak side and I was recommended the "Annabella" which I had never heard of! Being a San Francisco Native I felt I was being taken advantage of by them short pouring my wine and charging $9.50!!  It was a literal quarter size glass full!  Then another bartender says "Oh did you want the 5 ounce or the 8oz glass of wine"!? Well, if there was a choice should the brain dead over bleached bartendress that helped me in the first place have told me that??   Never going back as a Native or a Tourist!!!!

yxHywl-7Sa7bjWlXIahirg.review_text: My family had lunch at Fog Harbor during a recent vacation.  The meal was a general disappointment.  We ordered 2 entrees - the salmon salad and the fish & chips.  More on the food in a moments, but first the highlights.  One, the view is wonderful.  Two, the service - though quirky- was generally good. Lastly, the sourdough bread is incredible.  Unfortunately, the good food ended there.  FIrst, the fish & chips.  The fish was greasy, and the breading far too thick.  Also, the fries tasted as though they were cooked in dirty oil leftover from shrimp poppers or something similar.  As for the salmon salad, the salmon was unevenly cooked, and the salad both bland and overdressed.

b76FcjQd1RkpnP6I-ajhjw.review_text: My fiance had the lobster special and I had the clam linguini. The food was pretty good with an awesome view. The price was decent. The only thing was the waitress wasn't very friendly and took a long time to attend to us, but the food made up for it. I also had  scoop of vanilla ice cream with drizzled chocolate on top and that was amazing all in itself.

LR9lb4Qk3Q2s85e5Fsw8sQ.review_text: This was my first meal in San Francisco and I was pleased with my choice.  Touristy?  Yes.  Still worth it.  I started with a drink from the bar.  A rarity for me.  My drink has a cucumber basil infusion and tasted fresh.  We went straight to the meal... No appetizer for us.  We traveled all day and were hungry.  I had the garlic roasted whole dugeness crab.  The garlic and olive oil bath was similar to al mojo de ajo, except some of the garlic was caramelized.  This is a garlic lover's dream and I enjoyed every bite.  The plate also has fingerling potatoes and corn on the cob-- all fresh.  I sopped my potatoes and the table's sourdough bread in the garlic bath, too.  This is a messy meal, so not something for something for a first date or someone in a hurry.  The service was attentive.  Our drinks were continually refreshed and our bowls for the crab shells continually replaced.  There is a children's menu and crayons and paper table cloth to color on, too.  This occupied my children through our time consuming meal.  My 11 year old wanted fish and chips and thought the children's menu would not be enough.  This is the only area where I would have liked more server guidance. The adult portion was huge.    I tried my daughter's fish n'chips. The batter was light and flaky, and had good flavor.  The price was perhaps a little higher, but I cannot say it is out of line for the area.  My crab was $39, my daughter's fish and chips was $17.  My drink was pricey-- around $10.  Last, the view was pleasing and the restaurant is designed for most seats to have a view.

VQNyzu8XJ42AruXFOko2nA.review_text: An excellent restaurant to relax in on Pier 39. The second-story location of the restaurant opens the view of the entire harbor, and of Alcatraz from every corner of the place.  The greeting staff was very courteous, and the service inside was exceptionally warm and professional. The chef's special was salmon stuffed with shrimp and crab- a novel concept, entirely delicious! The stuffing was just rich enough to delight, but not too overpowering. The dessert platter looked fantastic, and picking just one was a challenge. The lava chocolate cake is pure indulgence!  The servers could be more attentive to the customer's drinks.  In the high-traffic tourist place, this restaurant provides great service and dining at a very reasonable cost.

h7marJdRDTRzbbcQH-x3pA.review_text: Came here on a rare night with my sisters and we stumbled upon this place. We sat at the bar until our table was ready. Staff was attentive and friendly. Drinks were good and made exactly like we wanted. The prices and portions are average, for a restaurant on the wharf. The Clam Chowder and the Seafood Cioppino were our favorites, for an extra charge they will crack the crab so you don't get messy. Best of all, they have a nice fireplace with comfy seating that you can relax and warm up before adventuring back into the cold.

i6gHLGdG8NXypNMOLGUVdg.review_text: Great food and even better view. Really good service too.

kyibXtzCBKBbJSUtmmRdxQ.review_text: It's ok, clam chowder is thick if you like that.  Beer is cold and people are nice.  Prices are reasonable for seafood in a touristy area.

K7RH6M4PnzHNe8AYdApEEA.review_text: 3.5 stars for the food 3 stars for the server service 1 star for the hostess attitude   I went here for the first time because supposedly they serve the best clam chowder according to other Yelp reviews. I got 3 dishes and they were pretty good, but not something that I really want to come back again for.  Clam chowder: pretty good and not too creamy, but didn't have enough clams   Crab & avocado salad: delicious dressing with fresh crab meat. It comes in a HUGE portion so it's basically a main course.  Garlic Chile Crab: the sauce was amazing and it's great for dipping your bread in. But the seasoning didn't sick well to the crab meat.  Our server (Amy) was decent and attentive, but the hostess (I forgot to get her name) was so rude. She asked us to wait for a table so we sat outside near the fireplace to wait for like 15 minutes. She came up to us with an attitude and asked "so are you ready now?" I'm thinking what is wrong with that girl because she was the one who asked us to wait there. While walking to our table, she rudely said "well, I have this one stable for you so you can sit there or like I guess I can move you too if you don't like it. Whatever." I guess certain people don't care about their jobs. I will definitely get her name next time.

fjEukWsKu9k8E0gJuRwf7w.review_text: I had the salmon house salad..it came with two little tomato, salmon, mixed greens, bacon...lemon vinegrette and ranch dressing..i gota admit it was pretty good..the salmon was cooked perfectly..it was on top of the bacon and onion..i didn't even know..and man I haven't had real bacon for so long..it taste crunchy..  The dressing was a bit greasy..blah..fat..but it went well with the overall dish. I came here for lunch on a Friday and it wasn't crazy packed. The bread was nothing special..the butter wasn't either..  I really want to try the crab soup next time..the décor is nice enough to get me to come back.

ibUClVZhrNl9PYlHAAXT9g.review_text: I'm going to try and be fair with this review.  Sure the place is in the MOST TOURISTY area of town and the prices do reflect that, but that being said the restaurant is comfortable, has professional staff and a great view of the golden gate bridge so you expect to pay more.  I sampled a lot of appetizers while I was there.  I thought the oysters, shrimp cocktail, ahi tun, crab and avocado with mango salad and calamari were all excellent.  My fellow diners were really impressed with the fresh sourdough.  Is this a towny restaurant, no, but it was a good choice for a large group of business people from out of state.

lTom1MhX38nCrYaCsvMrkg.review_text: You can do a lot worse in a touristy area. Very tasty. Great service. Highlights: crab cakes, cioppino, crab Louie salad, good burgers. We had a party of 12 and had excellent service. I'd reco in the area.

nbwAhN8VMnLvrNBvb1keuA.review_text: I really enjoyed dining here. We had a great view of Alcatraz, server was prompt and courteous, and food was great. Just a little too much garlic on everything... The best part was the dessert. Creme Brulee was fantastic! I can't wait to go back.

P0i4-c8SBYBvCnpX-XA-kg.review_text: Just ate here yesterday for the first time, I loved it. I have to confess that we decided to eat here because our parking garage said they validated parking, so we got 2 hours free :). We just wanted a good bowl of clam chowder, in a bread bowl, of course. We got right in, and got a window table, and the view was amazing! The server (I think she said her name was Clementine, maybe?) was there promptly to take our drink orders and had our iced teas and water out in a flash. We ordered 4 clam chowder bread bowls ($10 each, not bad for a nice restaurant on the wharf) and we had those in less than five minutes, so so so so so yummy! It was the best clam chowder any of us have ever had, (we've tried a lot of clam chowder). We will definitely be back and recommend this restaurant to others!! All in all, great view of the wharf, great service, awesome atmosphere and DELICIOUS food!

mmaE7ZZxYiite10QSvWEOA.review_text: Going to school in rural Pennsylvania made me crave for some good, comforting SF clam chowder. I've gone to the Pier Market for chowder in the past, but thought I'd try this place. I was happily satisfied.  Clam chowder - very good and full of tender bits of clam. It's not life changing or the best ever, but well worth the price.  Steamed mussels in the curry/tomato/white wine sauce - savory, cooked perfectly and absolutely flavorful. Dipped my bread in that sauce too.  Crab cakes - light and fluffy.  Complimentary sour dough- warm, fresh, chewy, delicious!  Venue- gorgeous view of the pier/sea/boats. Clean interior. Nice and cozy ambience.  Bill was ~$50 for two people.  Helpful Tidbits:  1. Recommend making early reservations if you want to see the sunset! 2. Free sour dough so why order a bread bowl of chowder?  3. A bowl of chowder with bread is pretty filling. We felt really full after finishing 2 other appetizers. Glad we didn't order more. 3. They will validate 2 free hours at the parking lot at dinner time.

vSgLX23Zl5sGljme077b3A.review_text: Rating 5: It was a great experience and food was delicious!  I'd go here again for a special occasion.   I made a reservation for Sunday lunch and made a request for a table with a good view, since it was for a special occasion: my dad's birthday.  Upon being seated, I looked around and realized that they really did save one of the best seats in the house even though the rest of the area was full, plus, they wrote happy birthday on our paper table cloth, and of course they offered me to pick any of the desserts on their menu for my dad!  I was very pleased!   Food: My family ordered the lobster mac n cheese, the cioppino, and the clam linguine.  There was also perfectly fresh and warm sourdough bread.  The lobster mac n' cheese had a fair amount of large chunks of lobster, so I was pretty happy.  My mother was very happy about the cioppino; it had a nice range and variety of clam, mussel, fish, and some crab legs, plus, she reported everything was very fresh. Plus the soup was delicious. My dad is a quiet man so I didn't hear much about the linguine, but it looked great. Overall, everything was very good. The dessert we got for my dad was the apple crumb pie + ice cream on top, which was great!   Price: Fair for the freshness of the seafood and the occasion.   Service / Experience: As written above, everything was perfect.  Our waitress was always nearby, brought everything as requested, and was very pleasant.  The view is of the bay, Marina, and Alcatraz.   Extra: They will validate your Pier 39 parking for 1 hour for lunch, 2 hours for dinner.   Thanks Fog Harbor Fish House, I'm very happy I brought my dad here!

vSzkOeEvATax2ODfJz3EdQ.review_text: A friend was visiting from India so wanted to show off with the food available in SF. I had an option of Boudine or this place, and i selected FHFH because I had never visited here before and thought, well, two birds with one store. We started off with drinks: Alcatraz Escape and the Blueberry Ginger beer drink (don't remember the name). AE was OK, I liked my blueberry ginger beer concoction. We then moved to the starters: Blue cheese garlic bread, Fried Scallops, Crab Cake & fries. Special shout out to the fries! Just the right amount of crunch and softness that I like in my fries. CRAB CAKE was the bomb, LOVED IT! Blue cheese garlic bread was tasty. The fried scallops did not do anything for us and we left that plate almost untouched. The dips we got with each of the dishes was awesome! Unfortunately, after the above dishes we felt stuffed and did not actually try the sea food platters/ entrees that we set out to originally have. Well, then again, there is always a next time!

jWtsx9S2IrgqII6yn-iWpw.review_text: First time visited was 10 years ago on our honeymoon trip to portland.  Nothing seems to have changed since then.  Nice clean restaurant with good food and people.  But it can get pricey when you have large group of people with you.

vZG7gb5IGO_4kkx6voDEfg.review_text: We stopped in here after wandering around the wharf for a bit, looking for a late lunch, some drinks, and a nice view.  We were seated right away and our server was very attentive throughout the meal.  My boyfriend's clam chowder in a bread bowl and an Anchor Steam was just what he was looking for and he was very happy.  I ordered a shrimp appetizer that was very flavorful and a cup of chowder.    We had a pleasant experience here and thought the food was good as well.  Nice alternative to the boisterous Bubba Gump nearby.  Nothing to blow you away, but a nice place to sit and relax for awhile.

tlF74D0tq6R4rSdMPbwt4w.review_text: All the food we ordered was great. The service was fast and the servers were friendly. We are local SFers  so we were skeptical at first, but we are definitely coming back!

BskjkKH4d1_1nsXizJ_cKw.review_text: Yes, 4 star is for Fog Harbor. I went with my Fiance to have dinner a few days ago. We went on a little mini adventure for food. Our frist time at the Fog Harbor. THE CUSTOMER SERVICE WAS EXCELLENT!  although the food was not as great, i come for a good experince of customer service and i got that from the bar and NELSON was our server. awesome server! I got a fish and chips with fries and it was not what i expected. Ive had BETTER fish n' chips. my partner got herself a bowl of clam chowder and baked oysters. She liked the Oysters, since she wanted to try something out of the ordinary. she said baked oysters was OK.   Her Clam Chowder on the other hand, she took 2 bites and she was done! she said the clam chowder tasted like its been sitting out to get it to our table. Basically she said the chowder was not what she expected. she was expecting something delish since we are at the Harbor and they are known for their chowder.   Overall, i will probably give this place another chance for a 2nd come back. MAYBE their other entrees are better.

oOEv1P4X6oNNhQakqQtndQ.review_text: I have tried the seafood in several restaurants at Fisherman's Wharf in San Francisco and this is the best so far! I had the baked scallops appetizer and the mixed grill seafood dish, plus I sneaked a taste of my friend's clam chowder. The food is amazing! The staff was very pleasant and our waiter was exceptionally friendly and attentive. I highly recommend Fog Harbor Fish House in San Francisco!

zr_gsXhtJNxgRYpLl1t2zw.review_text: A bit overpriced but what can you expect from a restaurant located in a tourist trap area? Having said that, the food was excellent and the ambiance was wonderful as we were seated along the window overlooking the bay.   Tip: if you purchase tix to the aquarium of the bay or the San francisco magic show held at the aquarium's theater, there is a 15% discount to this restaurant as well as pier 39 seafood restaurant and the wipeout grill.

uzwAWPFlzzSUgQNrJg5d_A.review_text: the view was amazing. a lil pricey. I ordered the crabcakes, my bf ordered the trout, i think it was supposed to be a fillet (grilled) but it had a lot of fish bones. the staff was friendly.

5SmTUjXss-FdDDSjtoJ2cw.review_text: For a vegetarian, this place is very limited on it's choices.  I could basically order a salad or some plain pasta.  I went for both.  The salad came out first and was enough for a table of four to share as an appetizer.  Beautifully prepared, I got a mix of all the flavors in each bite.  I was pleased.  Next came the pasta, and let me just say that it was the most delicious bowl of pasta that I've ever eaten!  The sauce was a basic olive oil blend, no red sauce.  It came with sun-dried tomatoes, spinach, and basil on top.  Portions were plenty and I left feeling satisfied, not too full.  I was told by my omnivore friends that the seafood was great as well.  Definitely a great spot after spending a day at Angel Island and Alcatraz, and with the spectacular view a great place to treat out of town guests.

Ve0LUwcrzxL7w0RYgY4Aaw.review_text: Definitely an A-OK spot for lunch. Being from San Francisco originally, it's always fun to come back and visit my parents and see the city. Because they live across the street from Pier 39 it made sense to walk over and find a spot to eat. Typically I'd avoid a place so filled with tourists but they raved about Fog Harbor's views and so off we went. The views were indeed lovely! We looked out across the bay to Alcatraz and saw lots of boats sail past.   The food was by no means bad but I think because it's a large restaurant in a heavily trafficked area, some quality gets lost in the mix. There must've been at least 60 other people dining at 3pm. The interior of the space is beautiful, the staff was very professional and polite and the food was good. Nothing wowed me but if you're from out of town and you want an affordable option that's not divey or cheesy, Fog Harbor is perfect.   Expect seafood options like clam chowder in a sourdough bowl, crab cakes, shrimp louie, and even lobster. Other options include salads, sandwiches and lots of seafood pasta. Definitely something for everyone!

Y8NE-yilQrV30JsP4N6Tvw.review_text: The steamed mussels were one of the best things I have ever had! Also tried a few salads, linguine with clams, clam chowder and baked oysters. Visited twice in our trip. My husband had a few shell pieces in the pasta on our second visit but other than that we didn't have any issues. Baked oysters were probably my least favorite.

S6AsbltNu60qIb0Yl2UjCg.review_text: An alright seafood restaurant. Lots of menu choices to pick form..I had a hard time deciding. For appetizers, I got a bowl of clam chowder and shared a dish of baked oysters. The chowder was pretty good, not the best, but still full of potatoes and clams. The oysters had a strange flavor. I would not get it again, but it was edible. For my dinner, I got the Ahi tuna; it turned out to be alright too. I was expecting a bit more flavor. Atmosphere was nice and service was also above average, but next time, I'm going to try another restaurant on the pier.

VnMAmbek5X2Ghel-JWN23A.review_text: The location of the restaurant and the views over the Bay greatly help the rating for Fog Harbor Fish House. We made reservations for two on a Friday night and were seated within minutes of arriving--make sure to request for a table with a window view as the view is breathtaking.   As for the menus, both the food and wine lists were extensive with multiple options and lots of specials. The sourdough bread that they serve is absolutely delicious and probably one of the best breads that I have tasted. We had the Steamed Clams as our appetizer and that was definitely the best dish of the night--most likely because of the amazing chorizo butter sauce. For our main courses, we had Swordfish and the Lobster Mac 'n Cheese. Although both were good, they were not anything special which was very disappointing (especially considering the price).  In the end, I would recommend this restaurant simply for its location and views but I don't think I would go back again for the food other than appetizers.

gk5qVp_heVVp2qIfDvrfrA.review_text: This is an upscale restaurant with a nice view of the bay located at Pier 39. The server was very attentive and gladly took the 20% discount I found from the "California Welcome Center," which is located on the 2nd floor. I ordered the Fried Combo which was $20, and it came with a hefty plate of fried calamari, octopus, shrimp, filet, and chips. It also came with cole slaw which was too spicy because of the overload of horse radish. The bread bowl clam chowder was delicious, but the bits of clam meat was not sufficient-it can be more accurately described as potato soup with clam. The downside to this restaurant is the ridiculous taxes they charge. The tab was charged a 3.5% heatlh fee on top off of the price of the meal which is then taxed at a sales tax of 10%. Overall, the food was great and the dining was pleasant.

qQ_rDvogQyXSMEe41maQ6A.review_text: We sat at the bar for a quick lunch on a busy day at the pier.  The bartender was awesome!  Super friendly and fast.  My son had the salmon, and it was delicious.  He won't eat fish if it's not super fresh.  I had a whole dungeoness crab, and hubby had fish and chips.  Delish! Hard to stomach the price when you aren't used to SF prices, but worth it when you want good seafood.  Great views too!

66JCCGQBbVvo33FMaabLpQ.review_text: We came to this place largely on the reviews and it did not disappoint.  We came at 2:30 pm.  Still a very busy time but no wait.  Every seat has a terrific view of the harbor and GG Bridge.  All the staff were wonderful, especially our server, Ashley.    All of our meals were top notch.  The clam chowder was superb.  It had just the right amount of creaminess to it.  The blue cheese garlic bread was original and an excellent side to wet the appetite.  The seafood penne did not disappoint.  And if you are thinking of getting the dungeness crab, spend the extra $2 to get the garlic roasted whole dungeness crab.  To die for!!!  And if you are looking for a healthier alternative, the dungeness crab mango cerviche salad was just as delicious.

Nun2tsAdXkcOLXBM4PG9XA.review_text: Lunch cost $85 and included a somewhat controversial "Sf Emp Ord 4%" tax that I did not notice until after I got home. Google the quote for more information like I had to since I am from the east coast. Then we paid tax on the food bill subtotal + Sf Emp Ord 4% for a total bill of $93(rounded). Fog Harbor bill includes a suggested gratuity amounts. The suggested gratuity excludes this controversial tax, as it should. It does not feel right also for a tax to include this Sf Emp Ord 4% either (taxing a tax); a double tax situation.   Controversy aside, the food is very good-unequivocally. The Wedge Blue Cheese Salad with bacon was perfect with the sourdough bread. We had the fried combo(calamari, fish, & shrimp), 2 orders. I prefer the squiggly ends of the calamari. My companion likes only the rounded pieces. We traded and ate the pieces each of us like since each plate had some of both. Forgo drinks, if you want to be frugal. Our food came to $52, not bad considering this is SF, Fisherman's Wharf & on the pier. The view is tax worthy. The ambiance of Fog Harbor & the pier area in tax worthy. So freak, perhaps taxing patrons directly for employees health insurance is okay too, just as long as the employees get all the money and none of it magically improves Fog Harbors bottom line.  The folks making all the wonderful food appear deserve health insurance. That is not a controversy for me.   We were seated at a window table for 2 looking at Pier 42 from Pier 39.

7VE9IHnRMokkuPic6OMThA.review_text: Wonderful meal with a wonderful view.  Don't let the touristy area fool you.  This is a top notch seafood restaurant.  Fresh fish, great service, and the people are much nicer than over at Scoma's!

1-rTuP6bBdOyXI3gXIjvEg.review_text: I ordered the ahi tuna and it was absolutely delicious. Our server was nice and the view of the pier was beautiful. However, one of the waiters there was a bit rude when I asked her questions. For example, we asked her for two straws and she turned around, didn't say anything, came back with our straws and left without a word...even though I said thank you. Other than that, the restaurant serves good food, along with beautiful scenery.

eBH9-CdtLcOQ6Znp7VQVJQ.review_text: Came here to eat a crab. Pretty big legs, lots of good meat, fresh as can be. I got steamed veggies, and a salad. The service as a tad bit slow, not the warmest, but I was content.  Pretty pricey.

cIofonsOncByjjfeUAg80A.review_text: So what if this is a tourist spot?!  I love to watch the tourists, and it was especially funny to see these people with their large cameras fixated around their necks, sportin' the Hawaiian polo shirts, too-short shorts, and Birkenstocks... in a restaurant with cloth tablecloths.  My friend and I were going to get a table like these tourists, but opted to just sit at the bar because well, we were really just wanting to drink and have a good time.  Thank goodness for great drinks, free bread, and a nice bartender.  It made for lots of laughs, but I felt like the 3 of us were the only ones in the entire place having fun.  It's ok to laugh here in the City tourists- try it!  Although it was a good time out, I think next time we'll take the bartender's suggestion and go to John Colins...

nFhlUwLhcGwOtPksX5MPdw.review_text: Nice atmosphere. Poor service. Mediocre food.

BO6n8rptfrEdcg0EIA0cmA.review_text: Our waiter was amazing. I feel like a bad customer because I don't remember his name and he told me twice! I really wish I can give him a shout-out, so here is the best I can do: he's from Hawaii, looks Filipino-ish, has family in Los Angeles and is probably the best, most polite, most sociable waiter I've ever had (without being obnoxious!) So there Fog Harbor Fish House, give him a well-deserved raise!  My boyfriend and I walked all the way through Pier 39 and no other restaurant was calling my attention. I finally spotted two restaurants upstairs, and right when I read the menu for Fog Harbor, I was convinced. My cheffy boyfriend is very picky as well  (though he'll never admit it) and I knew it was a good choice for the both of us.  The crab menu was super impressive. The crab season is about to end and they offered a page worth variety of crab entrees if you're into it. I ordered the crispy calamari before we sat down by the window with a great Golden Gate Bridge view, and it came out within 8 minutes or so. It definitely did not disappoint! They served it with a delicious aioli and the calamari were thicker chunks with light and crunchy batter.  With me being prego, and already having had my 3rd 6oz low-mercury dish for the week, I unfortunately had to go with a non-seafood option. I only say "unfortunately" because Fog Horn looks like they can serve up a mean seafood dish. I chose to go with the Chicken breast sandwich with shallot aioli, bacon, avocado, lettuce and tomato. It was perfectly juicy and flavorful and the aioli brought the sandwich together, setting it apart from what a Chicken BLT w/ avocado would taste like.  Tony ordered the Fog Horn Burger medium rare, with a half glass of red wine. The Fog Horn came with caramelized onions and Tony asked to substitute the jack cheese for blue cheese instead. It also had 1000 Island Chipotle on it and he seriously savored every single bite. The blue cheese swap definitely made a huge difference. I had one happy chef man sitting in front of me!  All in all, we spent $50. With the presentation, the wine, the amazing service, the freshness of the food and the promptness of the food arrival, I was impressed and beyond satisfied. I would recommend this place and I would definitely come back.

7gNtYzygF7dB8e7k1mWdjA.review_text: On the No1DP's last visit to see me, he made a request: he wanted to try SF's clam chowder. What the No1DP asks he gets, I just happen to be the lucky woman to tag along. I had another restaurant in mind that was a little less touristy but after some research and consideration we ended up eating here instead.  VENUE: We went on a Sunday night, just as the sun was about to set. The host put us in a table right next to the window. The No1DP and I were able to watch the people walking around Pier 39 and people just getting off the ferries. While the No1DP and I weren't able to secure a window that overlooked Fisherman's Wharf we weren't too far from those windows and we could look at the massive amount of tourists walking the wharf.   SERVICE: Service was excellent, as expected from a fine seafood establishment.   WINE: Both of us had white wines. Although I don't remember specifics on the grape varietal, I remember my wine was a little sweet and went well with my dish.  FOOD The Yelp check-in gets you blue cheese garlic bread. The blue cheese was a bit strong, but it's good for anyone that really likes blue cheese.  We got bowls of their famous clam chowder. One of the better clam chowders I've tasted, and the No1DP agrees. It may look watery when you're served the bowl but don't let that fool you. Instead we were treated to a quite creamy (and not starchy!) soup with good amounts of CLAM. They were quite generous with the clam but they better be considering how much you pay for a bowl!  No1DP got one of their special dishes lobster mac and cheese. As a New Englander, he has a right to be picky about his seafood, especially his lobster. His dish was "quite comparable to an equivalent dish I'd be served back home". Lucky him. I tried it and it's quite the rich dish - the cheese is RICH and one big bite can make you significantly fuller than before... No1DP ate less than half of his dish. The lobster was to his liking.  I got another special dish: 0.5 lbs lobster stuffed with dungeness crab. I thought this would be an excellent dish as this would combine two of my great seafood loves - lobster and dungeness crab. When I was served this dish the tail part was the lobster while the head was stuffed with the crab. The crab was quite sweet, I'm not sure if this is supposed to be how the crab naturally tastes, but the sweetness took away from the crab. Lobster was excellent, soft and buttery yet I could taste the lobster. Spinach and mashed potatoes were good sides yet were not too rich to overpower the seafood.   Dessert consisted of creme brûlée. The sugar was hard enough that I can crack it open with one swift tap of the spoon. Custard was creamy yet not too rich. The speculoos cookie they put on top was a nice touch and gave the dessert a subtle ginger taste if you eat it.   Though Fog Harbor can be considered a touristy restaurant to some, the food was still excellent. Thanks to the No1DP for another excellent eating adventure!

a86e-c7ekKX3OvTe0kPqrQ.review_text: So I think this used to be Chic's before or something and they changed the name, but the chowder, fish and chips, and calamari that we usually come back for was the same and still quite good.  I'm surprised at how bad the reviews here are, but speaking for the three dishes that I go back for, it really isn't so bad.    I went back something like three weeks ago.  Sometimes it's nice to just wander around touristy areas for no reason, so we thought of heading to the city to check out the wharf.  I ordered the same dishes I always have and did not notice anything particularly off.  the boyfriend did not like batter of the fish, but i loved it.  i also liked how the calamari is light, though i ditch the cocktail sauce for the tartar sauce that comes with the fish n chips plate.  the chowder is always good but i feel like i've had better in other places around the bay.  it's good, but nothing ridiculously good.  i'd still come back if i ever had to wander around the pier are again.  that being said, the view of the water is very nice and the general ambience of the place bumps this up to like a 3.5, really.  good service too, considering it's a tourist joint.

KA-2FWXthIgcd6iJDIs7AQ.review_text: Fog Harbor is just average. Was excited to finally eat here after reading all of the rave reviews, and chose it over "Fog City" on my most recent trip to San Francisco. I started with a bowl of their award winning clam chowder, which I must say was excellent. From there, though, the meal was downhill. Our server was not very happy at all, and it was took about 25 minutes before we ordered our food. We both got fish & chips, which we agreed was very plain. The restaurant itself is very nice and it has great views, I just wish the food was a little better.

rO1tsbUGmtvSOzdBzJaRFQ.review_text: We eat here almost every time we come to San Francisco. On those cold rainy days, you can't beat thier bread bowl clam chowder! Service is always great an there is a great view of the bay.

rt3pQ-DH_Tq_AwDFuI2usQ.review_text: Clam Chowder was deeelicious as well as the oysters!! Definitely going back when i visit S.F.

k4NFubHKPXLLiZtc4ndpmQ.review_text: Great place at pier 39. The ambience is great with an excellent view towards the harbor. Seafood cioppino was delicious, husband had fish and chips and no complaints. I definitely recommend this place! Our waiter was very attentive, only complaint was the klan of kids next to us that wouldn't be quiet!

XQBFHpXxc3sad2evo9pQTg.review_text: This place has great ambience, but the service is lacking. We had to constantly  get our servers attention along with other wait staff. I got the seafood penne which was good,  though I think the food isn't worth the $19,granted its fresh seafood. We probably won't rush back here. The crab cakes were okay and the popcorn shrimp were good.

iLE7_fiv2W_ReMtNUT2xFw.review_text: We usually have very, very bad luck on Fisherman's Wharf when it comes to food but we finally found a winner! Large portions, great sauces, sustainable seafood and well educated service. The blue cheese garlic bread was just like we make it at home...but bigger. Cannot say I'm mad about that. The swordfish and sole we had were both fresh and well prepared to flaky goodness. Though service was a little slow it was worth it. Our waiter understood what we wanted and directed us accordingly. The place was packed on a Sunday night with tourists so definitely make reservations if you're headed this way.

IY5ePfJJ_PSDiZ9-yo8seA.review_text: I reserved a table for 2 for my boyfriend's birthday and we came a little earlier than our reservation, so the hostess seated us at the waiting area for a bit. I actually got a bit grumpy while waiting since they let other people in, turns out they were prepping our table! They wrote happy birthday and birthday wishes all over the paper covering, which was a really pleasant surprise!  We had a rum and coke, lollipop drop(?), crab roll, lobster Mac and cheese, and baked oysters. We also got a free order of blue cheese garlic bread because I checked in.  The drinks were good, although a bit watered down. Garlic bread was yummy, and the oysters were super good and flavorful. Crab roll was also delicious, the bread was nicely toasted, although the sweet potato fries were kinda cold when it got to our table. The lobster mac and cheese was pretty epic...at one point I found myself saying "There's too much lobster in my Mac n cheese".   Service was excellent. They also threw in a lava cake for the birthday boy! Overall it made for a really pleasant dinner.  Btw I reserved through opentable(via the yelp app) and under special requests I asked about the birthday stuff, and they delivered nicely. 5 stars!

WDuJyy-qfDJouRRWkt88RQ.review_text: Best Calamari and Clam Chowder on the pier!!!  Lovely views and romantic restaurant for a perfect lunch or dinner date.  Definitely worth the trip for us to come out and enjoy.  I grew up just 3 blocks from Pier 39 and have such great memories here!!

X8nGV6Xm2lQBxR68K_Qdag.review_text: Fog Harbor = Best clam chowder soup i ever had!   Great service, great food and beautiful view. I will definitely come back!
