uMlX0xIG4pgp2xIQlY9PlQ.review_text: Of the restaurants on the Wharf, I think this is a good choice...  - great views - decent food (5-6 out of 10... but it is on the wharf, where most food is a 2-3 out of 10) - good friendly service - good for large parties or children - events room in back for large parties - convenient to parking garage (we took my grandpa here, he didn't have to walk far to go to dinner!)  - try the blue cheese garlic bread, its quite good... and the wine selection is decent as well, I like the 1.5 glass option for a few dollars more

TcGfQsrqHr1eqwaB1M_UmA.review_text: I usually only read review on yelp, this is my first review since I am so disappointed at such a highly rated restaurant.  It's our wedding anniversary last night and my husband want a special dinner for me. After reading so many positive yelp reviews, we decided to give it a try.  Food - we ordered seafood cioppino, fish n chips and Garlic roasted whole crab. 2 out of 3 are disappointing. The only dish which is really GREAT is seafood ciopino. The shrimps, scallops are very fresh. You can feel its original freshness even with the strong flavor soup. Highly recommended. For Fish n chips, the chips are ok but the fish is obviously overcooked and very very oily. The MOST DISAPPOINTING dish is our MOST PRICEY dish- garlic roasted crab. Once I cracked the shell and trying to take out the meat, from the meat texture, I could tell it's NOT FRESH. My husband verified that since he only tasted the garlic and butter from the crab NOTHING MORE! For me, it's even worse, it's completely tasteless, maybe with a little bit of garlic flavor. But we shouldn't pay $37 for garlic and butter!! We had crab several times before from Nick's Lighthouse food stand. We can tell the difference. Nick's crabs are so fresh and with minimal processing, no garlic no butter, the meat alone is already so tasty. Our conclusion is NEVER get CRAB at FISH House. Even the crab in the seafood cioppino is tasteless. From meat texture to taste, you can definitely tell the crabs are NOT FRESH!  Service- we are surprised to have ALL our dishes coming out AT ONCE. I don't know if that's standard practice for seafood restaurant or not. But to us, this is SO WRONG. After we finish fish n chips(the most time sensitive dish), the rest were already cold as ice. Besides that, the service is ok, not very attentive but will do when you ask.   Ambiance- the view is unbeatable, 5 stars.  Other- this's the first time I saw "SF Emp Ord 4%" from my bill.we paid anyway. I have no clue what the heck is that. After I google it, I felt like being scammed. Why should I pay for the restaurant employee's health insurance?!That should be the restaurant's responsibility! Does that mean they treat their employees like dirt so customers have to do what they don't to keep their employees live a normal life? They don't pay insurance, customers are obligated to pay for them. They pay waiters poor salary, customers have to pay a large sum to cover it(I DO think tips are necessary for rewarding good service, just don't like it when it become obligation even for poor service) And if that really helps the employees get better health insurance, I feel better with that. But according to Wall Street Journal, mostly are just scammer and go to restaurant. I don't know about this restaurant.  Conclusion-It's very unlikely we will return. If we do, we will NEVER order any crab again

BK3F1OyAv_YPPRNii0A-Fw.review_text: AMAZING! My sister flew in today and I wanted to show her a good time.  We decided on Fog Harbor at Pier 39, and we're glad we did.    I had the Ahi Tuna and it was absolutely incredible.  My sister had the crab cake entree, and from the look of orgasm that came across her face as she ate, I would say she loved it.  The restaurant venue was very nice, with views of the GG bridge.  If the food and ambiance were not enough, the service was remarkable.  Oscar was our waiter and was very helpful, and Ryan, the manager, stopped by to check on us and make sure we were enjoying our experience.  I'll definitely be back! Thanks Fog Harbor!

xUlR1OZWbrKM65dAxXRNcA.review_text: The decor was nice, but the quality of the food was very impressive.  My mom had the seafood mixed grill and I had the steak and we both enjoyed the sourdough bread.  The food was seasoned well and the portions were decent but not mega large.  Fortunately, we didn't have to wait for a table and the views of the bay/Pier 39 were enjoyable.

Pyl4L2xmEZNl1Va_tJ-0vw.review_text: Great atmosphere and  food!! Service was slightly inconsistent but all and all a do again.

BG0jH_nUwn8-iR_s50VxSQ.review_text: I was in the area and i am not a tourist, but got hungry and i knew that every place here is a tourist trap. but walking around this place looked really nice, so we decided to give it a shot. we were pleasantly surprised.    Their clam chowder is amazing so make sure you try that out. everything i tired here has been good so i wont go into detail, just go here and try everything.   The complementary bread is out of this world.   In pier 39 area i think this is one of the best places to it. In an area that is full of bland tourist traps, this really stands out as a very flavorful dining experience.   Make sure you park your car in the pier 39 lot and you can get like 2 or 3 hours validated.

2B-p9x3lx3GizW_R15uoBw.review_text: I lived in the bay area for 14 years, and have eaten a lot of clam chowder. I was pleased with the clam chowder bread bowl and recommend it. The halibut special was very good, and the crabbed stuffed lobster was good, though not excellent. The service we received was excellent and we had a party of 7. The waiting area is beautiful and comfortable with a fireplace and comfy couches, a nice retreat from the crowds. We had reservations for middle of the afternoon on a Saturday, and it was a good thing because even at 2:30 they were very busy and walk ins needed to wait. Overall a very good experience, we will be back!

3kPOK-VhFmLWHhKlXromjg.review_text: I think ill pass.  After a girls day out in Napa's winery, my friends and i decided to make a trip to the city for the rest of the day.  Our initial choice for dinner, house of prime rib, had a two hour wait and we were all pretty famished. We decided to just play it safe at pier 39.  We were debating between dining here or crab house, and finally settled for this. I ordered the calamarie and bowl of clam chowder.  My girlfriends ordered the seafood penne, new york steak, and the seafood cioppino. We all took a sample bite of each other's orders. Their clam chowder was good, but not as "award winning" as id expected. Calamarie tasted mediocre.  I actually only ate about three pieces, they werent very appetizing for some reason. My friends steak was kind of dry, and the penne and cioppino just were too bland for my liking.   Overall, i probably wouldnt come back. Prices were fair for being in the heart of a tourist attraction, but i feel like i would be more satisfied elsewhere for the same price. Pass.

CFm6FNt_wfv1Quzv3XEPog.review_text: The food was great. We came at a very busy time so we had to wait about 30 minutes for a table. And we couldn't even get a table with a good view. When we sat down I saw a window table open up and I asked the waitress if we could simply move but she had to make a big deal about it and go talk to somebody else to see if it was okay to get up and move two tables. And wow can u believe she said no! That automatically dropped her tip by $10. Her loss. I wasn't very happy about that. Plus she felt super fake. The crab fritters were delicious so was the clam chowder and the shell fish platter, honestly I was not a big fan of the lobster mac and cheese it did not appeal to me at all. The service was okay the food was good. I'd probably go somewhere else before coming back there.

YY3D4gAgrbhKuGngNDAPPA.review_text: We love coming here. We come for happy hour and enjoy a wonder meal of appetizers and bowls of clam chowder. Nice warm sour dough bread and butter. We like the oysters, spicy shrimp, and calamari. The clam chowder is great. The staff welcoming and friendly. I know it's a tourist place but hey, when I come to San Francisco, I'm a tourist!

DYJkNduguM18W6cUMfxk7g.review_text: Saved myself from eating too much breakfast so I could have the Clam chowder here at the Fog Harbor.  Ordered just the bowl of chowder, $8.00 and  was served warm bread  with it.  It is very filling and absolutely the best chowder I have ever had.  Sat at the bar, and although I usually don't like to eat while sitting on a bar stool, I found the service at the bar was incredible.  I had 3 people waiting on me, and another just came by to see if I liked the chowder.  Great place.  Will do dinner next time.

nvtFXpBauOcS-i0fMxRdIg.review_text: Beautiful view, and their clam chowder was one of the best I've ever had! And their garlic shrimp was also SO yummy. Definitely a good food spot to bring your out of town friends. :)

G4R3wdn9X-mizJemLA47Rw.review_text: Of all the seafood restaurants aboard Pier 39 I decided to dine at the Fog Harbor Fish House.  This place had a great menu with some amazing dishes. The red curry mussels were a great appetizer to the swordfish dish which was very delicious; the fish was cooked perfectly and the roasted potatoes, squash, capers, and sautéed pesto sauce was a great addition to the dish and on a personal note the portions were generous.  Along with the meal came great service from the host Travis and waitress Catherine.  Catherine was very fond of the entire menu and was very welcoming, courteous and patient.  She offered some great service for us.  This is definitely a restaurant I will recommend to anyone heading out to SF looking for a great meal, not to mention an awesome view.  Thank You!

bAFzHp_ZZlg4wNCi42MmrA.review_text: Usually the item appeals to me .Simply it is every one of the great and also amazing beautification. I really like this kind of position significantly and also endorse for its 2nd floor dinner and also wine beverage. Not too big although really feel every one of the environment involving my own house and a touch of warm and friendly services on the employees.  Foods is usually mouthwatering in my experience and also My partner and i never ever could hang on ahead the following all over again.

GjS0Zg60iXmLVLfD2VYzKA.review_text: Unfortunately Fog Harbor Fish House was a bit of a let down for us. We had a special crab ceviche appetizer which was okay. I think the problem with crab and acidity though is that the crab flavor just gets completely hidden. Entrees were not great. My wife got the mixed grill fish. The sauce was nothing like what the menu described - it was just missing. The fish was over cooked and dry. I had the seafood cioppino. The sauce tasted like canned plum tomatoes boiled briefly with some dried herbs and was over salted. The seafood was end piece leftovers. The only reason for the second star is service. Our waiter was great. I just wished he had asked us not to order!

acUNF4BuOyDQcfRFjLFQ-Q.review_text: If you want a nice sit-down meal at Pier 39, and a great view of Fisherman's Wharf, this is the place!  Only had one day to spend with cousins from Brazil and this is where we went, they liked it.  Love the fireplace and waiting area out front on a foggy cold Fisherman's Wharf day...

nDi6F-qNoJqzroBB_M_Lug.review_text: My boyfriend booked a reservation for Valentine's day. We arrived earlier than expected. They were able to bump up our reservation and seated us right away. They had a small Valentine's special menu. It has a nice setting, very romantic feeling.  We were seated close to the window but then again it was dark already. I'm sure during the day it would have been a pretty view. We ordered raw oysters, baked oysters with spinach and parmesan, steam clams with veggies in light broth and also a bread bowl chowder to share as appetizers! Those are all just starters!   For my main course, I had the filet Mignon with lobster tail ( the whole reason why my boyfriend made reservations at a seafood restaurant was so that I can get my lobster! How sweet!) My boyfriend had the fried combo with consist of fried fish, fried calamari and fried shrimp. All the food we ordered was super delicious!  Our billed came out to be a bit pricey but its okay to splurged on yourself once in a while! As a Valentine's day special, all the ladies received a single rose!

TjaaSEkFJQE6aVscNQ5jBw.review_text: We were tourists in Dec '11 and I think so was everyone else in the place.  The food was decent and it was an alright first stop - got off plane, check in hotel, get food!  We were in no position to really research and this place did hit the spot.    My husband I split a crab cake sandwich and each had a cup of chowder.  i think we waited about 30mins for a table.  It was okay not great - a lil pricey compared but we were in the hub of tourist central.

BFbHeICxneg7zTWiIUg8jA.review_text: I made a reservation for a pre-mother's day dinner on a Friday evening.  I am local to SF Bay Area, and I am usually unusure about seafood restaurants located on a touristy spot like Pier 39.  I read the Yelp reviews, and I am glad we went.  This restaurant is excellent - from the courteous/helpful team that answers their phone reservation, the food, their wait staff, and chefs.  The view is fantastic with Alcatraz and the East Bay right across.  They even provide you with a free 2-hr parking on the Pier 39 Garage!   The food - everything is good.  Their fish is cooked properly so that it is still juicy.  My daughter had the Filet Mignon, and she said it was excellent and properly cooked.  My 83 year old mom and 91 year old Father-in-Law loved their mixed grill seafood dish.  The only minor improvement is the asparagus needs to be a bit more crunchy (i.e. not too soft).   The desserts are awesome (we had the creame brulee and Tiramisu).   I also think their price is quite reasonable given the quality of their food, service, and location - I hope it stays that way.  This place has a great staff who are really attentive to their customers.   A special shout-out to our wait staff, Veronica, and the front desk hostess team (especially Ashley who helped me with the reservation)!   Any owner or business can only dream to have this excellent team!  Dined on 5/10/2013.

W2EHApKCRZSDbpxwJ7KaZw.review_text: Super small portions of their chowder in a bread bowl and the place was full up with an older crowd. At $10 a plate, I should get more than 3 spoonfuls. I was still hungry afterward. Come on.   It was tasty, but no where near "San Francisco's best" like they claim. The service was practically non-existent and we had to flag down our waiter for everything even though it wasn't very busy (maybe 5-6 other parties total?). Super disappointed and would urge you to go somewhere else.

AREZ5SxeASLK-kPM983mqQ.review_text: A great restaurant with a great view. The food was pretty yummy. Their mac n cheese was one of the best I've tried. Their calamari was spot on too except they used old oil that gave a slight bitter aftertaste. The linguini was pretty good, not the best though.

rk12aZmkYJGv-N6kFLey6Q.review_text: I'm so glad I picked this place to have lunch!  Went here with my bf last Wednesday after we walked the GG bridge.  It's located in Pier 39, on the second level adjacent to the Eagle Cafe.  Outdoor lobby of the restaurant is nice as well as the interior--great view of the pier/ocean...  Customer service is great!  Our waiter served us complimentary sourdough bread while waiting for our food--I'm not that much of a fan of sourdough bread, but this bread was an exception, only cuz it came fresh out of the oven...  For appetizers we ordered the calamari (everytime I eat out with my bf, and if the restaurant serves calamari, we'll  order it!)...portion is enough to feed 2 people. Love the seasoning and breading of the calamari--texture of the calamari is perfect! Soft, easy to chew, not too firm...  I ordered the fried combo (beer battered fish,shrimp, more calamari!, and fries). Love the taste of the fries--tastes like BK fries, fish was yummy--batter wasn't thick, but thin enough and crispy. The shrimp seemed a bit overfried but whatever, and of course the calamari was my fave out of all of em.  Bf ordered seafood fetuccine. Says it's one of the best he's ever had.  Overall great experience...I'll be sure to come back here again!

xi-ofEtyhWDL7QJ6gRI3-A.review_text: I am providing this review as a caution to other diners as my husband and I chose not to come here as we witnessed something very disturbing and quite disgusting. The open kitchen is a nice concept as it is usually great to see the chefs at their craft. At this restaurant,  we saw one of the cooks eat what appeared to be a baked potatoe as he continued to cook some other meal. This was not a "taste test." He had his fork still sitting on the platter filled with more baked potatoes. My husband gave feedback to the manager, who's response was "He shouldn't be doing that" That lackluster response is disappointing.  We will never eat here and other diners should beware!

dqflxF33RZhHAZyQi7NreQ.review_text: My dad was visiting from Florida having never been to California before in his life.  While I'm well aware that everything over at Pier 39/Fisherman's Wharf is a tourist trap, he was determined to eat there so I chose the Fog Harbor fish house.  To my surprise we actually had a really fantastic time.  I ordered calamari, he got the shrimp, and we sat at a really lavish table right by the window so he could see the whole bay.  The food was really good (although the portions could be larger given the price), and the drinks were even better.  Our waitress was very attentive, and he had the best time which is all I cared about.  We went on a Monday for lunch so the place wasn't that busy, so we might have had a different experience on say the weekend, but for the time we went, it was a great meal.

od9lQailMMWvHp6bBFhcQQ.review_text: Our waiter Kahim was the best!

q7gO_nQdtaup_-lQlh7JmA.review_text: Amazing food, service and view! I would come back in a second. Very impressed

Lij7BEvJu9Kd_K0NooPZHA.review_text: This is a great restaurant, especially for a big group (ask for the Alcatraz room) that needs / wants to unwind after a long day at a tradeshow or work in general.  Waiters are very attentive and also provide some entertainment!  Menu has a lot of San Francisco classics - clam chowder, Shrimp or Crab Louis, and tons of seafood - and they also have steaks.  I like the Pacific Sole or the Swordfish.  Crab cakes are awesome and can also be ordered as an entree.    If you want a nice view, you can request a table by the window, but this really only works if you have a small party (like 6 or less to get a booth that faces the window of a table right next to it).

dpUB6Wk_I58QdRT7W3ONlg.review_text: The view was nice, and the food was okay.

SbESSJJjixIjDUigXWDUVQ.review_text: My family and I came in for lunch this past Saturday. We ordered the appetizers listed on the specials of the day menu, crab roll, and fish and chips. The food was only okay but the location and view were lovely.  I don't mind paying a little extra but the food just wasn't worth it.

x5ak5LReap4B2EsP7RL7vA.review_text: We stopped by for dinner without a reservation and got seated in a very busy area outside the bathrooms. We were right next to the server's station with a constant flow of traffic. We were even jostled a few times by servers in a hurry. We finally asked and were allowed to move a table back out of the flow of traffic. Our server was very friendly and the manager was nice too when he stopped by the table. The sourdough bread is really delicious. Its served with ice cold butter though - I think its nice if the butter is a least warm enough to spread. I had the whole steamed Dungeness crab with fingerling potatoes and corn on the cob. I've had king crab legs many times, but a whole crab was a new experience. The crab meat was delicious but very difficult to extract from the body. The legs were typical and easier although much smaller in this type of crab. The potatoes and corn were fine. My husband had a seafood pasta dish and he thought it was good. He orders this type of dish often and said it was good but not great compared to other places. Overall, with the amount of seafood restaurants available to choose from, you can probably do better than this one.

lY8iSm6_WQkd9M3tfJAEew.review_text: My husband and I were vacationing in San Francisco and we decided to visit this restaurant based on the Yelp reviews, and I really had a taste for seafood. It was a Sunday and based on recommendation of Yelp reviews, we made a reservation on OpenTable. The only one they had available was for 5:30pm. But when we got there, there were plenty of table available so...I don't know.  They sat us at a table with a view of the water and setting sun. Beautiful. Our waiter was...a rock star. I asked for a virgin strawberry daiquiri but they brought it with whip cream which I can't have. My husband took it and our waiter brought another one on the house. We ordered one of their appetizer specials, risotto and crab fritters. We didn't like it but didn't complain. Our waiter asked how we liked it and we were honest. So he said we could order something else on the house. Who does that!? Plus he didn't hover and wasn't distant. We gave him 20% tip.  We ordered the following:  Clam chowder - delicious! Crab mango ceviche - yum Crab risotto balls fritters - okay Lobster tail - yum Seafood Cioppino with pasta - yum  I would have ordered dessert if they had cheesecake.  I wouldn't mind coming back. Good for groups, dates. There is validated parking in the garage, just remember to give your waiter the ticket. The Pier also has other cool places the check out.

TN80OluTQXjOfk7ug71-1g.review_text: Back in Maryland, where the Chespeake churns and the Old Bay Seasoning flows, the crustacean of the day is the blue crab. Here in San Francisco, the crab of choice is the stout Dungeness, a veritable wrestler versus the comparatively dainty, ballerina-esque blueies we have back where I'm from. Having had my fair share of crab in my life, devoured mostly with mallet and mini fork in hand mind you, I was ready to give the Dungeness a try.  After a long day exploring Fisherman's Wharf, a nice plate of crab cakes, some fries, and slaw just felt right. The restaurant was quickly becoming crowded so I felt lucky that my two friends and I managed to snag a window table. Tired and hungry, we were all happy to be greeted by a basket of steaming hot San Francisco Sourdough and softened butter. I've always appreciated the tart bite and hearty crust of a good sourdough in sandwich service, so the pure unadulterated experience of quality bread led us off on a good start. Hey, it's the little things in life that count. Soon thereafter, our food came out. I was greeted by a surprisingly ordinary plate of two smallish pan fried crab cakes, fries, and slaw. Unfortunately, the "ordinary" aspect seemed to be a theme as I began to eat my dish.   Strike one was that the crab cakes were merely warm and didn't seem terribly fresh. Furthermore, while I was hoping for delicious lumps of sweet crab, I instead got a pretty bland interior which tasted more of filler than crab. Whether or not it was indeed filler and breadcrumb I was tasting or it was the way the strangely finely minced crab was prepared that threw my tastebuds off is up for debate, but it was disappointing. While crisp on the outside, the inside was mushy and pasty. Luckily or not, since they were small, I didn't really have much to go through before it was gone. A truly great crab cake should highlight the quality and flavour of the crustacean that honorably served in its preparation, not of bread and onion. The fries were also a disappointment. While they were hot, they were devoid of seasoning. Unsalted fries are a sin! Why why why would you ever serve unsalted fries? Finally, the slaw and remoulade were inoffensive, which is to say, pretty unmemorable.   Moving on to the service and space, I should first point out that getting to Fog Harbor can be a little tricky. You must access it from the upper balcony level of Pier 39. Once inside, you're greeted by a nice dining space. It's open, the servers are dressed professionally, and if you get a window seat, you will be greeted by a beautiful view of the bay. Service was also good. Our server was quick, friendly, and readily agreed to split our check.   So why the two stars? Well, while the service and space were very good overall, I was disappointed by the food. My dish was bland, uninspired, and got literally beat out by bread and butter. In addition, later that night, my stomach really did not agree with what I ate. Considering I ate toast for breakfast that day, I think my cakes are the guilty ones here. I hope that I maybe caught Fog Harbor on an off day since others seem to really like this place. Unfortunately for me, it just didn't hit the mark.

iEkPA13x5bbBM6AOu8JsYQ.review_text: Came here last night after a day trip to the SF Zoo and it was really nice. We were sat right away in a booth near the great view of the Golden Gate bridge. The server was nice and friendly until the end of our visit. I ordered the Napa Landing Chardonnay which was divine and my husband ordered a glass of Anchor Steam which helped each of us unwind. Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail for starts and a clam chowder bread bowl for me. My husband ordered the Seafood Cioppino with added pasta and we both got  added deshelled crab to top our dishes off and there is nothing better than crab out of the shell! YUM! I tried catching our server for another glass of wine but he seemed really busy and didn't look my way. I ended up leaning over to catch his attention and noticed that the table across from us was trying to catch him too but he didn't noticed that they had a question about their check....we enjoyed each of our meals very much and the warm bread in the basket was delicious! If the server stayed engaged the whole time we might have given this 5 stars.

gXgQgMHtgtg3GG4XyiQSdw.review_text: The most remarkable thing about this place was the cohesive team attending to their guests. We sat near a high traffic employee intersection and I was blown away by observing the level of efficiency, professionalism and camaraderie demonstrated by these hard working folks. It was like watching a finely tuned symphony. As for the manager on duty, if he was in charge of the Gulf oil spill debacle, I suspect he would of had the leak plugged in half the time it took BP to do the job. He was spot on keeping the symphony on track during busy season on a Saturday night.  Now for the food. The blue cheese garlic bread is a must. The popcorn shrimp was excellent as was the fillet Mignon and crab cakes. The prices were right on target for being in a high traffic tourist area. There were many high and low priced items to find a comfort level with.  Being on the second floor made for a beautiful view and even though the place was humming, there was a little less traffic than below.  Of the dozens of restaurants to choose from in the Fisherman's Wharf area, we were fortunate to find Fog Harbor.

c2BxRC2pM51p-SdfuGBA9w.review_text: Went here the other day for dinner expecting an overpriced seafood place with a view and marginal food.  What I got a was a restaurant that had a solid price point and very very good food!  They bring fresh sourdough to the table and the waiter was pretty attentive.  I ordered a bowl of clam chowder and split it with my girlfriend (and needless to say dipped the sourdough in the chowder), it was a huge portion!  For my entree I got the Ahi Tuna with garlic mashed potatoes, this dish was really on point!  You have to cook Ahi Tuna just right or it will by too dry or overdone, not this tuna, it had a perfect sear on the outside and it was nice and rare on the inside!  They serve it on a bed of sauteed onions green peppers and the mashed potatoes with an Asian inspired soy-teriyaki tasting sauce.    I was very surprised to find a pretty good (and not insanely overpriced) restaurant in Pier 39, would definitely eat here again!

mIIO4NxyCksoaONsit5hnA.review_text: Food is good, but a bit pricey. You can see out the window though to the water so there is a nice, relaxing view. Touristy.   I had the crab roll as recommended by the waiter-it did not disappoint...until I got the check-it came out to be $19 for a sandwich and fries. If i had paid attention to the price maybe that would have deterred me to choose something else. But it was good. I'll say that. And it's a hefty portion. I can't make that meal myself so worth it.

oXBEj_MQfFbtcxywO2d4jw.review_text: Excellent service! Food was great and very fresh! We ordered garlic butter crab, fresh oysters, clam chowder in bread bowl and fried combo! It was plenty for two people, but we manage to finish most of it! Would definitely go back!

U50UvCcyr8YFsjrVAgjnzA.review_text: A touristy spot but definitely worth visiting! The view from Fisherman's wharf was beautiful and the food and cocktails were great. We loved the crab and seafood pasta. We went to celebrate a friends birthday and got a free dessert as well!

1elkcUBwXGH34B3M3n69MA.review_text: My husband and I were not impressed.  The Fish and Chips were bland and the Fried shrimp were over cooked.

KriLZpXgLNFYgh3LdD985Q.review_text: Excellent Dungeness crab and great views!! Wait staff was awesome very informative. I would highly recommend the crab

Az_r_GIpgrSjrdOQ4cYrjw.review_text: I've been to Fog Harbor twice so far (the only two times I made it to Pier 39 in the past year) and felt the service and food was incredible both times. The view is great--I could even see a sea otter swimming in the Bay from my seat! The restaurant is very well-kept and clean (including the restrooms).  I ordered fish both times, and had the sustainably harvested salmon this past weekend and it was perfect! I was also in a big enough group that we ordered almost every different kind of dessert and I enjoyed every single one. :)  Although this would be a great place for a nice date, I'd find a slightly quieter place for an intimate, romantic date. The restaurant was bustling even in the late afternoon.  Definitely recommend it ... and save room for dessert!

k2Arb_0lH9leKEgnXnR6Ng.review_text: I am here now enjoying beautiful views.  What is important than the views is the fact that this restaurant is one practicing and certified in sustainable food.  Local fish sources, grass fed beef, and fish caught fresh.  As a pescatarian and conscience person, this Fog Harbor stands out, in service and food.  I hope more restaurants follow suit to what their excellence taste like and looks like.

jjpRf68hqmFWhHNdKked9A.review_text: I visited the bay this past weekend for my birthday and decided to book a reservation here for lunch on the pier. I came in expecting delicious fresh fish, and I left feeling a little disappointed.  Having a reservation definitely helped because it was quite crowded and we only had to wait a minute or two. Our server was friendly and checked in on us just enough - not too frequently, and not too little. We got a free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread from checking in on Yelp, and it was so delicious! (Thanks, Yelp!)   After a pretty long wait, even with consideration of how many people were there, we finally got our food. My boyfriend ordered the Ahi Tuna, and it was cooked basically perfectly. His mashed potatoes were also pretty good. I ordered the fresh salmon, since salmon is my absolute favorite thing to put into my stomach. It was not as large as my boyfriend's tuna. It was like a little strip, which I wouldn't have minded if it wasn't over-grilled and burnt. The moist parts tasted good, but for the most part, it was very dry. The smokiness of the greens under the fish were good on their own, but as a part of this dish, it made everything taste overcooked and burnt. I wish I had ordered something else instead.  All in all, it's pretty good, but I'm not sure if I would come back again. Especially since I'm not a baller (lol) and the salmon was not as tasty as I had hoped.

2jxxBNs1TA-p1R3SMEN90g.review_text: Convenient place to eat if you are at the Pier. Menu has a lot of variety, so the restaurant is great for groups!

-jGEw1j1mSXaNllJ7eNwPg.review_text: The best jumbo shrimp cocktail on the pier! All for under 15. Great service and environment.

tQnKR0-pH5w0UXhO9qjyMA.review_text: We ate at the Fog House on our recent visit to SF. Me and my husband love seafood so we were pretty excited. We were a party of 6 people and we were seated immediately. Our server was attentive and helpful while explaining about the dishes. We bumped into a friend while we were there and on his recommendation we got the Red Chili Prawns and a clam chowder bowl as appetizers. It was a hit! The prawns were fresh and the seasoning was a thai-like preparation. Oh so yum! I got their crab cakes for the entree, my husband got their mahi-mahi with citrus butter and a friend got their fish and chips. The crab cakes were good and crispy, slightly bread-ier ( if I may use that word ) for my taste but the meat was fresh. The remoulade sauce which came with it was nice too. My husband loved the mahi mahi which was so fresh and moist that it was melting in his mouth. The citrus butter sauce was light and refreshing, not too buttery which was good. The mango salsa which came with it complemented the white mahi-mahi well. The fish and chips had some really fresh fish but they could have done with some more seasoning like some more salt or some paprika. One of our vegetarian friends got their Spring Salad with the pomegranate dressing which was pretty well made. Overall we really enjoyed our lunch experience here and will definitely go back!

hSF13x9LL95rmASKmeQZ0Q.review_text: It's a tourist trap, but it's not too bad.  The food was decent, better than most tourist traps but not great considering the wonderful seafood available in San Francisco.  I ordered the seafood sampler plate. Both fish were overcooked slightly but the flavor was great. The clam chowder was very good, with lots of clams and not too many potatoes.   The best part of my experience was my server, Haiman. He was very nice, genuine, and helpful. He made the boiling hot dining room and stuffy, touristy atmosphere worthwhile. Without his service this place would be 2 stars.

FThLp5E46r-Jv3Bz-J2UcA.review_text: Definitely the best clam chowder I've ever had!   It's a great restaurant smack in the middle of the wharf. Great views, prices are reasonable and the service was fast and friendly.

4KpcFxWlqFkmOGCrMXEgVQ.review_text: One of the best seafood restaurants on Pier 39. Very reasonably priced. The oysters tasted like the ocean. My only pet peeve was that my table did not get any bread!! As we were leaving we realized everyone who hadn't started their meal yet were given complimentary bread! But not us!

Z_JQpx279FLIymcCnNk5JQ.review_text: This was kinda late but i had to leave a review. I came here with my boyfriend on forth of july to see the fireworks. We yelped this before we came to the pier and gave this place a try. I know they were busy and i didnt mind the wait for an 1 hour and a half. Luckily there was a lounge so my boyfriend and i were able to rest. When we were seated we thought we got the best seat because it was at the corner near the windows. We can see the fisherman wharf but on my right, people from outside can see us which was awkward. So the waiter was very sweet and was kind to take a picture of my boyfriend and I. Since I LOVE the picture so much, i had to give him a tip. So anyways, 1 star for the service. Food....however.... Was HORRIBLE. My boyfriend order the Surf and Turf, medium rare. Nope. It was well-cooked. Then he ask the waiter for a recommendation for a heavy wine. My boyfriend thought it was all right. Wasn't heavy for him, but everyone is different. So for my food. I order the Caesar salad (idk the full name but it's close to it). Maybe it was me, but I have never really experience not having my lettuce cut so i had to cut them myself. I asked for chicken too but they only gave me like 8 small pieces and 3 croutons.....I was upset. I had way better salad at other places. Other than that, if you love oysters, you gotta try the baked one. IT WAS DELICIOUS! +1 Star. If i knew it was that good, i would have ordered three instead of that salad -_- but nope. The osyter appetizer came after our dinner. But yeah i don't think i'll come back :l

GPjKCPiNVVxdPM_XC3cAgg.review_text: First time trying this place as recommended by our group. They have an award winning clam chowder which u must try! Pretty amazing especially with the sourdough bread bowl! Everything else was also great. Their oysters are by far some of the freshest and tastiest I've ever tried! Our server went above and beyond to make us happy. We were very pleased. The only bad thing I would have to say is that they don't have outlets so if you need to charge your phone they offer portable chargers at $100 added to your table as a deposit or form of insurance, we thought they were joking. Overall it was a great experience and wouldn't mind coming back.

-in2D0VQ0tApfmfK0I0RfQ.review_text: Hard to believe such a great restaurant in a touristy location. We came on a Monday around Christmas and the wait at lunch was 45 minutes!  The clam chowder was very good - lots of clams, not too many potatoes, nice bacon flavor.  The kids had the salmon - though small the filet was fresh and cooked correctly (i.e. not over-cooked). I had the crab roll - the restaurant didn't bother with a lot of fillers and they didn't skimp on the (dungeness) crab meat either. The wife ordered the crab salad - also very good: fresh ingredients, lots of crab, not too much dressing.  Service was efficient and friendly. We sat at a table with a fantastic view of Alcatraz.  Can't wait to come back to try some of their other dishes (cioppino, for example).

km85xKVg_nEx0CJT0uSMRw.review_text: This place has really good calamari and clam chowder sourdough bread bowl! And a nice view

w-eGoyyLHi1jlDglSolkMg.review_text: Love Fog Harbor!  Great food, great views.  The chocolate cake is to die for! The waitstaff is very helpful and friendly.  Miss Madison rocked today and we had a blast!  Thanks, be back soon!!!!

6D-hjThsY3UZALI0rke8AQ.review_text: I can't say I've had food any better. (May have had some just as good, but not better.) I had the Ahi, excellent taste, my boyfriend, the salmon - loved it. We also had the bread bowl of clam chowder and Cesar salad combo which we shared and truly enjoyed it. The sourdough bread was terrific. No room for dessert but they leave little biscoff cookies (some of my favorites) with the check.

qoqDxok6DkNITMHsQ_YnuA.review_text: First off the atmosphere was nice, had a great table overlooking the pier and Alcatraz.  We started off with a cup of chouder which was very good.  After that I dont have much good to say....  We ordered the Crab Linguini & Fried Prawns.  The prawns were ok, the beading could have been seasoned better.  The linguini was extremely bland, very disappointing.  Tried adding salt and pepper to make it better but still wasnt very good.    The waiter was less than attentive, our glasses remained empty most of the time and never got a refill until same time we were getting the check, and had to ask for the refil.  A near by table seemed to get a lot more attention not sure if thats because they were dressed better and he thought they would tip better, but doubt I would return.

Ju5QHprf8I-dhbWndmjSkw.review_text: Sitting by the window is an experience.  You get a great view of the bay, GG bridge, and "the Rock."  The service was also great.  The hostesses were nice and seated us quickly, and our waitress was very attentive and personable. Our waitress even wrote down restaurant recommendations for us.  But, I've gotta knock off stars because the food was just average.  In fact, the crab cakes were below average (if you've ever had a crab cake from Legal Seafood in the Boston area, you'll understand - every other crab cake will be below average).

P2gPF-xvGCdf8T5abxH_VA.review_text: A perfectly adequate place to get food. The place looks clean, the server was nice enough, and the food was edible and not bad for any particular reason.

THpdwTb37PglZswyUW0orw.review_text: This was a great choice for our lunch.  The best dish was the crab topped clam chowder.  The soup was delicious and the crab was plentiful.  Even though served in a small cup, it was quite filling.  I did not particularly care for the crab cakes though others at the table enjoyed them.  The burger was average but then it's a seafood restaurant so we didn't expect any different.  I don't normally like sour dough bread, but it was very fresh and I enjoyed it very much.  Good service.  I would definitely return.

r8gJ47mAsvkIWeh_Yn65hg.review_text: Excellent seafood and great customer service! I ate the Pacific Sole fish and it was fantastic! One of the best dishes I've ever had!

eTidg3pTf9ZvxCgV15HLwQ.review_text: There are so many touristy (and mediocre)  restaurant choices near Fisherman's Wharf, so we were surprised to have enjoyed such a wonderful dinner at Fog Harbor. I really enjoyed the cioppino, which had a good variety of fish, crab, mussels, clams, shrimp and scallops. Others enjoyed the crab cakes and steak too. The view at sunset topped off the meal.

TmhFYYTHodJnrubq9IeFNA.review_text: Had a wonderful time here. We got an awesome table overlooking the bay, probably because we had reservations. Nice to watch the sunset while enjoying dinner.   The restaurant itself is very nice, loved the decor. It's on the 2nd floor of Pier 39, first restaurant as you enter from the front. Loved the fireplace outside as you wait on comfy sofas.   Food- we started out with the Crispy Bay Scallops.. yum! And Blue cheese garlic bread which I really liked. There was so much on the menu it was hard to decide LOL. I ended up ordering the Fried Combo (fish, calamari, shrimp, fries, cole slaw). Everything was delicious, and it's a big dish. My partner ordered the Cioppino, which was truly amazing. So good! I wish I had ordered it also. We ordered 2 cocktails each but maybe we're raging alcoholics because we thought they needed more alcohol LOL. Next time we'll order wine instead.   And yes we'll definitely be back. Pier 39 is tourist-y and we're locals, but no matter. It's actually nice to feel like we're on vacation in our own city! I will definitely take my visitors here, it's a winner. Oh and awesome service!

jzG5b7yQ80QqcrHhUD0FqA.review_text: Yummy food. Great service. Wonderful restaurant overall. Had the Lipstick Lemondrop, Crab Spinach Dip, cup of Clam Chowder, and Chicken Breast. Since I am not a mushroom fan, I asked our waitress to hold the sauce on the chicken and she suggested a creamy butter sauce that they use on one of their fish dishes. It was delicious!  Definitely a must try.

4m9NXICYBC5i9t4aTt-I6w.review_text: I stopped by here earlier this year with my wife and her parents for dinner.  To be honest with you I wasn't too happy about heading here as I thought it was going to be a touristy place with a ton of tchatche due to its location on the pier.   However, by the end of the visit they had me and I truly enjoyed eating here.  We started off our meal with the blue cheese garlic bread that was compliments of Yelp for checking in.  I loved it and it set the tone for a meal which would include good fish and lots of bread.  As a matter of a fact I think that I OD'd on the sourdough bread here between the garlic bread and then the complimentary bread which I ate a ton of both before the meal and then dipped into the leftover broth from cioppino.  The bottom line for me is that I would stop by here again in the future if I was in the San Francisco area.  I really enjoyed the food, especially the bread.

1yg2fxUfTB-qLykvE3FY_A.review_text: We just got to San Francisco and were wandering around looking for a good place to eat dinner. Thought this may be touristy but the reviews seemed pretty good.  We loved our waitress Nicole. She was very friendly and helpful in helping us decide what to order. She also was very accommodating as we substituted rice for potatoes, etc.  The drinks were a bit disappointing. My husband said his margarita was ok. I had the Lombard and was disappointed, didn't have much flavor, mostly tasted the club soda. Our son's fiancee had the ginger coconut cooler and it wasn't too flavorful either.  The sourdough bread was great. My husband had dungeness crab as an appetizer, it was excellent. I had the pacific sole with rice instead of fingerling potatoes. It was so good and more than I could eat. One son had the trout and the other had the ahi tuna. Our son's fiancee had a salad-think it was the chili lime shrimp salad. Everyone loved their food.  A bit pricy, but we are in a touristy area. Overall, we enjoyed our meal and the service.

x0ufaAxxrUqjXLcleOvT8A.review_text: Ok so I've been in the restaurant business for over 15 years and I NEVER do this because I know how it is. Bad day, fluke experience, whatever but this place was ATROCIOUS! We started with some beer/wine once we finally got service...the drinks were good once we got them after our appetizer had arrived....the was the start of the bad meal with horrible service.   We ordered the baked oysters to start because they resembled oysters Rockefeller which we love no matter what type of oysters they are. What came out was a weird cream based, over sauced oyster plate. I was ok with eating them until I got to the last one which was totally and completely rank! I'm not a huge oyster aficionado but not only did it taste as though the cute sea lions down the pier had pooped in them but it smelled totally stank (which I actually thought was either my servers breath or a fellow patrons unfortunate gas at first...a little harsh and I feel bad for ever thinking that but I never thought an oyster or any seafood for that matter could smell that bad) Ruined the rest of the meal...the only reason I'm giving 2 stars is because my Salmon entree, which was a special with veggies including Brussels sprouts which are some  of my favs, was pretty good after I sucked on a lemon, downed my entire water, and shot some tobacco sauce in attempt to get the bad oyster taste out of my mouth. Little did I know that would be the only water I would be offered throughout the rest of my meal...  Super unfortunate because I'm a huge foodie and love using yelp but this turned out to be an awful choice. Would have walked a bit further into the heart of Fishermans wharf to try different food or the street car (cods something...) everyone is raving about.

Kk9PaAVJG3esQ_cOmSfmHQ.review_text: I like this place. The hostess was nice and our waiter let me charge my phone close to the ceiling why my phone dangle and killed the killer view we had. They know how to treat their guest right! They sat us immediately up stairs over looking the bay and it was really nice since we went there for my GF bday dinner. we didnt even asked for it but the hostess read our minds :)  important points:  1. food is decent but i didnt get the dungenous crab they had. my gf liked her crab sandwich though. their fries are friend with special oil making the fries rich and flavorful. 2. great View upstairs. water front, good view of the bay. 3. food is mid range $ 4.nice ambiance. 5. When you ask for a dessert menu, they bring out a tray of the desert they serve! looks amazing!

ak684BnCWd1dBO5DLzn7vg.review_text: know this place from few years ago, food was good.    Yesterday, we decided to go there ... had the worst service. Didn't get pass the hosts and walked out.

GG7PBcb-PbDKVb3jo-G7lA.review_text: We were seated promptly via our Yelp/Open Table reservation. All dishes were presented well. The lettuce of the Crab Louis looked like it could have been fresher. The portions were decent, except for the most expensive entree of the night -- Crab-stuffed Salmon -- at $33. Service was excellent; otherwise, I would have given them three-stars. Overall, a little spendy for what you got, but it is on Pier 39.

606Y-ca75UEryJIKmtc8wQ.review_text: Food was pretty good - I got the sole fish. Little heavy on the tarragon, but that's just me.

nlcaC4xoSEzVaLWXNi5ggg.review_text: Great food and an awesome view...the mixed grill was wonderful! The only reason I didn't give a five star review was because our waitress was like a sad emo girl who hated life and her job... Other than that, it was great!!!

UMVPBTth2Qj_coidEXjIcw.review_text: Brought the future father in law here looking for some good seafood close to where he was staying and we were all pleasantly surprised, especially by the service.  Khaiman was our server and definitely took care of us that night offering excellent suggestions and frank feedback on specific dish details that we really appreciated.  All in all, the service he offered really made the experience.

mEydf5fMjZuajdgjQXQP7w.review_text: Attended a retirement luncheon here and must say the views are fantastic.  We were in the private dining room and it can be a little tight if you have over 30 people.  We had submitted out menus earlier but it still took awhile to receive our appetizers.  The clam chowder was pretty good and I was glad I didn't select the Caesar Salad- it was two pieces of lettuce and  a crouton.  A co-worker said Caesar must've gone broke! The salmon and shrimp were both delicious and moist.  We also enjoyed cheesecake for dessert.  Service was good and they constantly were refilling our water glasses.  For a nice dinner with a great view of the sea lions and Alcatraz, I would definitely return.

b68abECX_1r65zqF56wvdg.review_text: I had the Crab Cake Entree with sautéed spinach & roasted fingerling potatoes; my boyfriend had the Fried Shrimp; my brother had the Swordfish; and my sis-n-law had the Garlic Roasted Whole Dungeness Crab (w/out all the nasty stuff from the shell)....we all enjoyed our meals. Good food, great service, nice views, and not very expensive!!

yhEpYHXZjF-JxvqrKWNbUA.review_text: Because of Katie I'll give it a 2star.... I'll come back to give it another try but I hope she won't be my server again....

Gh_Lgs1tszufiauilR8CGg.review_text: The fish and chip are simply.... AMAZING! Golden brown crust with moist flakey white meat, this is a must try! The only reason why I'm giving this place 4 stars is because of the lack of attention to detail. Out server was very friendly and brought us our water, after inspecting one of the glasses we noticed it had a couple "floaters"... We asked for a fresh water. The waiter returned with a smile and a "fresh" glass. After another inspection we noticed the 2nd glass has even more "floaters" than the first. We inquired for the 3rd time about a fresh glass of aqua, this time she assured it was clean... It was. I decided to quench my thirst with a Anchor Pear Ale, a fricken great beer! I took the etched glass in compensation for the dirty H20. Full belly and a cool souvenir in hand we left Fog House satisfied. Next time make sure your buss boy isn't using the water pitcher as a spit cup and there should be no problems.

Et0qEP5K0oTCpAZ0aULmpw.review_text: A huge expectation beater. Really touristy area, so our expectations were low for good food. Had some great chowder an amazing bread. Also got a blueberry cocktail that was super refreshing. Most impressive was our waiter (Khaiman). He was super warm and friendly and made us feel like we were on home soil.  Loved that all of it was sustainable too. This place just hit all the right notes.

v-ZzroeVqqgI5jgOOnUSsw.review_text: Was not expecting food and service to be as good in a tourist area. The Poke, and calamari perfect. Sourdough bread best I've tasted. Would absolutely return.

4sLhuOs4K9mov0bBj7HaYg.review_text: Stopped in for a snack at the bar during a day in the city. I had a yummy tuna poke salad that was fresh and bright and really delicious. Hubby had some clam chowder in a bread bowl. It just isn't a visit to the city for him without some clam chowder :) Would definitely go here again. Great view and friendly service too!

ADsdlWWdAXXg9mSRuBC0Pw.review_text: Fog Harbor was a lovely stop on our spring trip to SF. We were seated right away(arrived around 6 on a Friday evening) and had a wonderful view of the harbor, sea lions, and sunset. The view is undeniably spectacular.   I would have given Fog House five stars if our waiter had been a bit better, but I realize everyone has off days. Our service was less than prompt and our waiter seemed like he didn't have too much interest on our table. He seemed annoyed that we only ordered appetizer portions of whole crab.   It was a shame our waiter was such a goof because the food was delicious and simple (how I feel seafood is best).  We started with the steamed clams, I would bathe in the broth if I could. The crab was delicious and fun to crack open and eat, bib and all.  And no review of the Fog Harbor would be complete with out mentioning the clam chowder: it really was the best I've eaten here. Not too thick, clams so tender I almost couldn't believe they were clams.   All together, a great stop. For a bottle of Chardonnay, clam appetizer, three appetizer clams and three cups of clam chowder our bill was around $200, as a heads up.

yEijvmDU_mQTj5LLG57zTQ.review_text: This is a classic tourist trap where the decor is nice and the location is in the busy fisherman's wharf in SF. Problems started from the moment we were seated. We requested a table near the window which the host granted us but then as we sat down, the manager came over, leaned over over the host at our table and admonished him something to the effect to check if the table was reserved in the future. During the course of our lunch, we noticed the manager being all over the staff, as discreet as tried, about every little thing. It was just horrible mgt and the place was horribly run. Our waiter, while a very nice man, was very inexperienced (which he admitted). Towards the end of our lunch, his inexperience became outright annoying as we had to raise our hands or flag down the staff for every need. We ordered clam chowder (very good), crab linguini (very rich, creamy, and not so good..you have to crack the crab to get the crab meat), and a crab sandwich (very greasy). Overall, the food was mediocre but the crab linguini was very disappointing. To top off our lunch, we were presented with the bill where they charged us a %3.5 surcharge to help the place cover their staff medical coverage. WTF? I've never seen this before. When we asked about this, our waiter said it was a new law which was complete bull crap. Anyway, save your money and go elsewhere.

AnVJ3OtdFLBspi5XxlqMqQ.review_text: My boyfriend and I had lunch here on our first day in San Francisco as tourists and I will have to tell ya if we ever visit again we will be returning here no matter how touristy everyone else seems to think it is!!   The food was great and our server David is probably the best waiter I have ever had the great pleasure to meet. He obviously loves his job and the interaction he is able to have with his guests ( and I mean guests, we were not just mere customers to him).   We started off with the Red Curry Steamed Mussels as appetizers with the fresh sourdough bread. My boyf is Sinhalese and knows his curries and he really liked this dish, I loved it!!  The mussels cooked perfect!  We then moved on to a special they were offering that day, steel head over cheese ravioli and cream sauce that was truly to die for and the Seafood Cioppino which again with the sourdough was very good.   We had a couple of the hot drinks from the bar that were good however when 1 turned out to be too strong for us we ordered something else and fully expected to pay for it and were pleasantly surprise to see it not on our bill.   Dont know when I will get a chance to visit San Fran again but u can be sure I will be stopping by here!!

q-zcBRObGdiAMScvBIy2tQ.review_text: Good food and great view. Entrees probably average about $15-$20. I ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bowl which was wonderful. My friend got crab that she really enjoyed as well. I would recommend this restaurant.

OPoUR6nKMow0Wk23emHPew.review_text: One of my favorite places by far!!!  My 5 favorites on the menu:  1. Crab Cakes: crunchy on the outside, so soft and moist on the inside. Its good for the appetizer and for the regular meal as well.  2. Ahi Tuna: a BIG chunk of tuna (Seasoned on the outside of course). It was laying on a bed of wild rice and sauteed vegetables with this light soysauce/teriyaki flavor that just added soo much flavor to the tuna. if you are a tuna fan, you will LOVE IT!!!   3. Fog harbor burger: My first "sweet" burger ever. This burger is so juicy and tender (i usually get it medium rare). the caramelized onions add such a bursting flavor into my mouth... and the saltiness of the bacon balances the taste.  4. Prawn ravioli: i usually get this w/CIOPPINO (type of tomato sauce) sauce on top. I've noticed that the raviolis change in size once in a while from small to big-- but no matter what the size is... this dish will forever be my favorite pasta dish at Fog Harbor.  5. Seafood Cioppino: This dish is VERY flavorful. I see alot of tourists trying out this dish but for me personally, i wish i could've just had all the seafoods out of its shell. I didnt even bother eating the crab legs because i didnt have tools to crack them with.. but everything else was easy to eat :)   The service is fantastic and the hosts are super friendly! :) :)   Oh and before i forget---  Dessert recommendations: Lava cake and tiramisu!!!! I love the creme bruele.. but the caramelized topping can be often too chewy for me.  ENJOY! hope this helped!

swqSj4zuamI_HFfPTj63Hg.review_text: Came here with my girlfriend and had an awesome time. When we got to the restaurant there was quite a bit of people out front waiting and so we assumed that it would take a while to get seated, but they had us in and eating within 15 to 30 minutes.   The service was great all around. The guy filling the water probably stopped by the table every couple minutes filling my glass. Even if it was half full, he would fill it back to the brim. Our waiter took our orders and was quick to bring out our food.   They started us off with some free bread which was surprisingly delicious, but after polishing those off, we ordered Clam Chowder in a bread bowl and some sort of sampler/combo dish which came with fish&chips, calamari, and shrimp. The clam chowder was amazing, but the bread bowl it came in was pretty normal sourdough. The fish&chips were delicious and the batter they used was flaky, but not too oily or crispy.    A little on the pricey side, but was expected because it was a tourist-ey area. I would definitely come back to this restaurant again if I could.

Js5HfzUPQLALBUQm_lyLCA.review_text: Great food! Highly recommended steamed whole crab and jumbo shrimp! The dinner made SF trip better!

xoJV_T6LRUNJDKXvwUue6A.review_text: Very impressive! Scallops were good if you like them fried. Mixed Grill was great as well as the Fish and Chips-not too greasy! Dessert was wonderful. They have an interesting Chocolate Martini and a great Apple Crisp. Though the food was great, the best part was the view of the bay. Definitely try to get a window table. Enjoy!

UvRUygcyvpJuHh1BiZrrbQ.review_text: Went here on Saturday night with my boyfriend. We ordered the chili shrimp appetizer oh my this was so flippin good! You have to like spice and heat for this one but were huge spicy fans. The sauce it comes in is excellent when you dip your sour dough bread in!  For our meal we ordered the whole garlic crab it came with corn (didnt really like) and potatoes. This was sooo good and so big! Great Great Great.  This place has excellent views as well. Its pretty touristy though which I didnt love.

U0W-ukKnBMgKAXAHviTNTQ.review_text: Overall, a great experience but unnecessary for the hostesses to keep us waiting outside in the cold while they set up our 15 minute table in an empty restaurant.   Oysters- fresh and tasty  Cioppino with linguini for extra $2- yummy and large but wished they provided more pasta Garlic fried crab- overly drenched in butter and lackluster in flavor  Service- great

6Bhp3IqrSIKHTUoVKgsXRQ.review_text: Walked in with a California hoodie and SF Giants hat. Knew this was a bit more upscale by looking at the other diners and the table setup. But not worries, as more tourist came in after we did. I ordered the Grilled Everything. It included shrimp, Salmon, and Swordfish. Tasted great. My girlfriend got some delicious crab cakes which I happily sampled too. Where we sat we got a nice view of Alcatraz and the window was slightly open, letting in some cool air. I did notice most of the people sitting near us as international tourists. The table next to us was French (know some of the language) and they ordered the Maine lobster. They were waiting for an hour at least. We left and they still did not have their food.

vuwG0TcxYFH6RYFFc15lgQ.review_text: Good seafood spot for being in such a touristy area. I had the Sole which was flavorful and light. Desserts looked delicious but I didn't have room for one. Decent prices for the area too.

4-WV8bA6Zfc4JR8vLBdvPQ.review_text: I was impressed by the reviews and wanted to have some good seafood while in San Francisco, hence the visit to Fog Harbor. It was good but for the price I expected more. My fiancé and I came for lunch on a Monday. I made reservations online, which was great because I probably changed the date and time at least three times. It wasn't too crazy during our visit and we were able to get a table overlooking the harbor, so four stars for that.   However, I'd rather have an awesome meal than a good view, and that's where the issue is. We shared a small bowl of claim chowder, a Blueberry Press cocktail, and ordered the fish and chips and a spring special, the Alaskan halibut. The clam chowder was very tasty although it didn't have as many clams as I'd hoped. But still very good. And with the crunchy sourdough bread? Yes, very very good. I ordered the skinny cocktail, which is some locally distilled vodka, blueberries, lemon, soda water, and Splenda. They gave me the regular by mistake, which has ginger beer, and I quickly noticed. The regular was very good and much better than the skinny (unfortunately he whisked the first one away rather than letting us keep it). But in neither drink could I really taste any of that locally distilled vodka, so three stars on that one since the drink was $12.50. For that price I should at least taste some vodka!  On to the main courses. The fish and chips came with coleslaw and fries and were very good. It had large chunks of well cooked and nicely battered (Anchor Steam) fish, but I would expect all of this for a price of $17.  I ordered the seared halibut, which came with quinoa arugula salad, tomato relish, pine nuts, and dried cranberries topped with a citrus buerre blanc and crispy leeks. The quinoa salad was delicious; it had a great flavor and the ingredients really went well together. But the main attraction, the fish, was a disappointment. It had a good texture but was lacking in flavor and was also dry. The presentation looked amazing but it fell short of my expectations.   Our server was courteous and prompt with the service and apologized twice for the drink mistake. Overall okay but I will try something else next time I visit the city.

APjcziyr3GTM3L7yfhA74Q.review_text: So I took my family here over the weekend and it was actually pretty nice. The dining room over looks the water, and we sat in a booth next to open windows which was great. We started with oysters and bubbly and I had salmon salad which wasn't over cooked!  If you must go to the pier then this place is a good bet ;)

1k7yJFHBBUsRsvc-QKon_g.review_text: We held a lunch here to celebrate sending my brother off to the Navy.  We had very large party, and though larger parties often get stuck with one server, we had several waiters in and out of our private section regularly.  Even the manager, Greg, checked in with us several times to make sure we had everything we needed.  Never did we have to search them down to ask for something extra, they were consistently available and more than happy to accommodate.        The food was fairly priced, particularly for the quality and the location.  Great spot following a cable car ride, or right before a leisurely walk down the pier.        We were there with a large party, but I can see it being the perfect spot for a party of two as well.  Enjoy!

Zk0-wvM40P8F7tSah2v61w.review_text: Did not like the hostess attitude towards my friends and I. We are all in our 20s, of ethnic background, and because of that I think the hostess place us all the way in the back next to the bathroom in a pretty much empty restaurant. I had clam chowder which was nothing special. Entree was linguini with clams which was watery and clams were not cleaned properly. Did not even finish quarter of it.   Although our waiter provided exceptional service I will not be returning.

MidZG6cGiVxDGw96WEmJmw.review_text: Service was excellent, appetizers were great. The food was just okay. Sometimes salt goes a long way.

Dp6OQOY3XBgkGM4rgtZvYQ.review_text: After a quick four and half hour bus tour of San Francisco we had a couple of hours left before having to leave port for another destination on a cruise. After doing some research I came across Fog Harbor Fish House at Pier 39 on a travel website which had a lot of positive reviews.  Upon arrival we waited for about fifteen minutes before being seated (for a group of three) at a corner not far from the Crab House.   We ordered two cups of clam chowder, and one in a sourdough bowl. Apparently the basket of bread was sourdough, so the sourdough bowl wasn't necessary. The chowder was great - as the restaurant claims - "the best in San Francisco. "  We also ordered  Crispy Bay Scallops, Dungeness Crab Cakes, and Fried Combo (breaded fish, calamari, shrimp, french fries and cole slaw). Based on the description lots of calories for sure.  The scallops, calamari and crab cakes were the best of the lot.  It felt like we consumed two meals at once given the portions but it was a great experience. A great way to finish a brief trip to San Francisco.

CcrnWI3OyY8ki7xfkTNLxA.review_text: The service is great! Even with the high volume of people who come into this seafood house of deliciousness, the staff maintain their can-do attitude!   I really enjoyed the Ahi Tuna, the wasabi aioli and stir fried vegetables compliments the Tuna very well. The view of the Bay was nice especially around 5:30 when the sun starts to set.    It's obvious that the folks who work there really enjoy what they do and are professionals. I would expect no less from a Mom & Pop restaurant that has been open for over 6 years.  I am glad that I took a visit to the California Welcome Center which is right next to the restaurant. They gave me plenty of information on places to dine and visit around  San Francisco.

msOVLjTebf51njN6n22CiQ.review_text: The one star is for the location and ambience of the restaurant.  We came here yesterday for lunch.  I ordered the crab melt and my hubby got the fried calamari.  Half way through my crab melt, I started tasting vomit in my mouth.  The vomit taste was so real that I seriously thought maybe I vomitted in my mouth and I just didn't know it.  So, I ate few more bites and the taste got worse so I had my husband taste the crab melt and he said the seasoning tasted bad on the melt.  I also got a stomach ache from the crab melt that afternoon.  My hubby couldn't finish the fried calamari because it was way too acidy.  I am very disappointed at their food.  Our waiter never came back to check on us after bringing the food to the table nor did he refil our water and drinks.

BighBfV7maUUIgfH4Ew_vA.review_text: Definitely in the tourist area. Tried to make reservations, but they said they were full and to do a walk-in instead. Walked in and was able to sit down right away. The service was alright. Ordered calamari, raw oysters, and clam chowder for appetizers. Calamari was nothing too special, but the clam chowder was delicious. Hands down, the best in town as they mentioned. As for entrées, had ahi tuna and king salmon. The tuna was seared and the salmon was crispy on the outside. Both were good, but will try other places around the area first. Btw, for parking, park in the structure across from Pier 39. They do validations.

CR8kQqfMzOqZwL-boCoMiw.review_text: Yumm! Went here during vacation with three of my girlfriends. Our waiter was super nice and on point with service. Food was bomb too! The oysters were super fresh and their complimentary bread was super good!

Qeb_7rkSskwiP9jLmqijsA.user_location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
Qeb_7rkSskwiP9jLmqijsA.review_text: i will come here again. i love Best clam chowder!! very delicious!

gfKS6dEYi4NYo_O4h1Lidg.review_text: I had the cioppino for the first time and it was tasty and flavorful. The portion is big enough for two or a very hungry person. Great service, very attentive waiters. Reservations are available but we walked in (two of us) with no wait at around 5pm on a Saturday.  Beautiful view of the wharf if you are seated by the window.

xQXUG94oRQxYUHZwS6Cwzg.review_text: What a beautiful restaurant located on Pier 39! I'm glad the boyfriend and I went here over the weekend while we were in SF.   The view here is to die for -- I'd come here for just the view alone. Alcatraz and the ocean is in sight; two things that I love! This restaurant is also located within walking distance of where you board for the Alcatraz tour, so it's a good option if you're doing the tour before or after you eat.   I ordered the Claim Chowder Bread Bowl with a side salad and a glass of the House Merlot. My food and wine was pretty solid and I ate it all. My boyfriend ordered their chicken dish and he didn't seem too impressed with the food. I'm guessing that the food is either a hit or a miss here.   Service was decent -- the waiter came by to check on us often. I like that.   All in all, decent place for a restaurant in a touristy area.   Cheers!

XGXv-SR2bUoZTQCVRZh_LQ.review_text: Great ambiance, poor service, mediocre food.  Great view of the piers and ocean. The server was extremely slow, inattentive, and one of our party received her food 5 minutes earlier than the rest of us. When the food arrived I was underwhelmed. Unimpressive.

mIsmD27pBtgDSkexo2zMBg.review_text: Great fish and chips.  Great service.  Great view.  Loved this place.  Fresh made bread and had my favorite wine.  Recommend highly.

_vkdtvvuxmkjgsKqLk2szg.review_text: Awesome food and bartenders! Came here last Thursday for company party and appetizers were delish!! Tried beef on skewers with orange marmalade, mini lettuce wraps and bruschetta. . Also for main entree, steak was the best for me- cooked to perfection along with pasta and Salmon.

FXH0V3aHyy1-EIzycMHqDg.review_text: Great place, right in the heart of tourist country! Great views, nice bar, great food! Had the snapper special, very good and light. House salad was good. Co worker got chowder and fish n chips. He said chowder was ok, good, but not the best. Fish n chips is HUGE! Come hungry for those! Waitress was very nice and helpful. Kept the waters full at all times.

aTFO07pamSxg5T3VMWMH5Q.review_text: I give 5 stars alone for being Seafood Watch friendly however the experience was not great. I went with four guests on a Sunday night. We were seated in about 40 minutes when we were told 20 minutes and after we ordered it was over an hour before our dinner arrived. The waiter and the manager came over to our table several times and apologized. We were starving and were not offered bread and my drink from the bar was never refilled. When our food finally did arrive my table mates ate very quickly and were done before I really even started on my pasta which turned out to be cold and flavorless. The 1/2 crab on top was divine, however. The three other plates were cleared before I even touched my food as I was waiting for our waiter or manager to come so that I could tell him. The manager apologized and brought me a chicken ceasar salad as I requested because I didn't want to have my table mates sitting watching me eat which would have made me feel very awkward. The manager ended up taking my meal off and giving us a discount because it took so long. My dinner the next day was great because I had the crab that I would have had with the pasta the night before. Everone else said that the food was good but they couldn't really tell because they were so hungry! The entire experience took about 2.5 hours with probably 5 minutes or less being taken to actually eat.  I will be back to try Fog Harbor again and I hope that I won't be going on a busy night.

5i2N8iaD17NFwXhxVpoMaA.review_text: I had some delicious oysters as an appetizer then a chicken dish that was amazing. The waiter was very knowledgeable about wines which was very helpful.  The best part must have been the service, it almost seemed like we were the waiter's only table.  The wait was a bit long but we put in our name before our whole party arrived and got in just as they were calling our group.  It was a good place.

1BxLEvXHe1iugR0ZBOmfPw.review_text: Great restaurant - will be back!  Well priced, great tasting dishes and best of all, they are serving sustainable seafood- and promoting it!  Must try the clam chowder and their garlic shrimp in home made sauce!   Fresh, warm bread is served with the meal which is  great touch!   We also finished the meal off with the apple crisp- which is like a cobbler!  Great views of Alcatraz also- ask for a table by the window but away from the door, if dining later in the day/night!

3g4irxK-dTBXATqnRUnwSg.review_text: Came here around 2pm with no reservation. The wait was only about 15mins.   I'll start by saying I am not a fan of blue cheese AT ALL but figured id try the blue cheese garlic bread since it was free with a yelp coupon. It was AMAZING! Exceeded expectations.   Tried some oysters from here and they were great! I definitely recommend. Next for the clam chowder and it may have been the best chowder I have ever had!!! Loved it   I ordered the entree with the crab cakes, big mistake!!! I love crab cakes but I tasted everything EXCEPT the crab so that's obviously not something I would order here again.   My boyfriend ordered the fish and chips which were exceptional! Wish I had ordered that instead. It's cooked to perfection!   I ordered a Long Island, which was sub par. It's a pretty strong drink but the purpose of the Long Island is to not taste how strong it is. I'd try something different.

_6HBVy59oQh472JpDzrlxQ.review_text: we came with a party of 25, several with specific eating needs. we called ahead and spoke to greg who assured us they would be able to take care of us. we were seated in a room with a gorgeous view. the service was flawless and the food was absolutely delicious. we never had to ask for anything, a totally enjoyable experience.

fojptcVycoRhrLUU7XSSNg.review_text: Trying to get a table on a Friday night is damn near impossible.   My boyfriend took me here for a sea food platter for two: crab, muscles, oysters, corn, scallops the works.  The bread was fabulous and the clam chowder was perfect.  Although I did enjoy my dinner here, I suspect this is the type of place for upscale tourists to dine at during after hours.  This place comes with a price tag as everything here is pretty pricey.  The only thing that you'd be happy with is validation for parking if you park in the garage across the street.

u60Iv8mCW5ILazQru_B_EA.review_text: Best chowder and great service! The Meal was fantastic! Service was over delivered. The bar tender made the most delicious Moscow mules! We were sat before our reservation and the fire works topped it off!

5hUsoCeKX42G4mWpw5wq0w.review_text: Came alone on a moderately busy afternoon, went into this very upscale-looking seafood restaurant. Seated at a two-spot. Spent 15 minutes watching waitstaff whiz by my table at 20 mph not giving a glance to me. I was dying to use the restroom, so I got up and returned to find that my table had been given to someone else in the 30 seconds it took to do my business. Oh well, not like there weren't five other seafood places on the Pier to choose from...

XGugZqZTY1Hi56ew497eVw.review_text: Pleasant place on Pier 39 of Fisherman's Wharf.  It is everything you expect from a touristy San Francisco restaurant.  On July 3rd I was surprised to find it very easy to get in.  We were seated and served promptly.  Solid seafood cuisine (my chowder was superb).  The sourdough bread was out of this world (but hey, if you are in San Francisco you expect that).  The view from our table was the bay.  Absolutely stunning in the moonlight with Alcatraz sitting out there quietly.  A little on the pricey side but I walked away happy.

NQnkFYJidv0mjQWTQA_eKA.review_text: My girlfriend and I had the crab, mango, and avocado ceviche as well as the garlic dungeness crab. The food was phenomenal and worth every penny! We also got a bottle of moscato wine, which was delicious. We asked to sit by the window, and the staff was more than accommodating. The view was beautiful.   If you're looking for a great place to splurge for awesome seafood, stop here.

6BrwoM6sms7g3rhDFXzyUQ.review_text: The location of this restaurant is killer.   After spotting it yesterday morning, I took the long trek back down to the pier in search of the beautiful view and a fantastic seafood dinner.   Beautiful view - check.   Fantastic seafood dinner - not so much.   The crab appetizer was tiny. The wines offered boring. My salmon was overcooked, my mahi-mahi had zero seasoning, and the rice was completely dry. The food overall was bland and unadventurous.  The service was good however so I gave them a star for that.   Final Verdict: Nothing to write home about!

WRkQE9-Al-vXOa_8aYOs9Q.review_text: My sister and I had the great pleasure of visiting SanFrancisco recently.  This was our first time to SanFrancisco, seafood has always been a favorite of our family.  We live on the Texas Gulf Coast, so anytime we have the opportunity to eat fresh seafood from the West Coast we jump on it.  Our visit to Fog Harbor did not dissapoint, we reasearched restaurants in the area before choosing and we have never been ones to dismiss a restaurant based on it being a "tourist" spot.  Instead, we went with consumer ratings and as usual we were not disappointed.  We had a great waiter his name is Tim, we arrived in the late afternoon during the week and Tim was able to spend time with us and share his receommendations of places to visit in his city.  The food was amazing, we had the scallops with a Quinoa salad and the dungeness crab.  We are both looking forward to our next visit, hopefully we can bring along some friends.

fTWtXca0hmdjLQFvkrNDPw.review_text: Located on the top deck of the Pier 39.  Came in on a Saturday evening for dinner. I have patronized the restaurant two times.
