Each time ordering wine or bringing a bottle of wine.   Each trip I had to wait to be seated but wait wasn't too bad. Host was correct on the time.   Seated and menus were provided promptly. Practically no wait was resulting for placing order. Initial drink delivery was prompt. The wine or corkscrew and ice were delivered promptly. Another trip a Manhattan. Manhattan was made nice and stiff.  Food order was taken and again no really a wait from order point to arrival. We had a free garlic bread coupon to which the wait staff was happy to apply to the whole table of eight of us.   Food order included chicken pasta, and seafood (paired with seasonal vegetables). Both time the staff was able to serve the sides separately due to a seafood allergen with my woman.   A warm fresh side of bread is provided free. The free garlic bread was properly portioned for group enjoyment. Chicken pasta and fish were flavorful and filling. Seasonal vegetables were tender and good on their own.  Drink refills and staff were good to refill and check on the table.  Towards end of meal, check and bill were closed promptly.   Good: Flavorful food, refreshing drinks, great service. Best cork fee on pier.   Bad: nothing to date.   Overall four stars. I'll be back.

aQkADfJ4poI6EVBokV2Hew.review_text: I came here for a late birthday lunch on Sunday and my experience was not at all what I hoped for.  First of all the waitress I had was beyond rude I think because we were a big party of 8 she figured she didn't have to provide good service since she would be getting her tip anyway.  She cut me off a few times, didn't bring crayons out for my daughter to color and when she brought out the "birthday dessert" she told my guests "uh aren't you guys gonna sing?" because apparently the waiters don't sing. She also promised my husband that the dessert would be on the house but they charged us for it which I didn't realize until we already left and it was too late. Also she was rushing us when the bill came and said "I need to know how much is cash and how much is card" and was hovering over us until I told her to come back and wait until we figured that part out. I regret not getting her name to warn others.  I also regret not complaining to her manager but I didn't want to make a big deal in front of my guests.    I would've given a higher rating if the food was good but I ordered the lobster and I was not at all impressed. So I wouldn't recommend this place, there are much better restaurants down the pier a little ways.

j7MgNFeLAm_0AWfjNHHcuA.review_text: Crowded, with a view.  All along the pier, it's hard to pick out a restaurant that will actually be good for the price you pitch (it's San Francisco, you've got to make every dollar count if you want to make it a few hours). Fog House Fish Harbor was one of our first choices because there wasn't a line in front, and the lobby looked welcoming (albeit overly dressed-up like a hotel, I'm not kidding)  We were seated immediately, but the crowd that occupied the restaurant would be daunting for any staff, and I knew right away that this would take awhile. High over the waterfront on the clear day to see the whole Bay, the view from anywhere in the room was fantastic. But even I got a bit bored waiting for the waiter (I'm hilarious).  We ordered two Sourdough Chowder Bowls and their Salmon Flatbread. The former didn't stand out to me, but it's getting increasingly difficult to tell the difference between the dozens [and DOZENS] of chowder-serving locations. The Flatbread wasn't shabby, but shabby doesn't cut it for $13.00 (it's four triangles...small triangles)  Better places for better prices, but perhaps their crab and lobster put up a better meal's experience. Cheers.

VyMTtfwKskXZBbnB0ijwsQ.review_text: First time in SF so I wanted to have the best clam chowder bread bowl experience. This IS a tourist trap!   For three people, we each got the clam chowder bread bowl, a salad, the tuna ahi poke, calamari and two cocktails. Total before tip comes to about $95 dollars. Not worth it for appetizer meals.   Although the chowder was good, nothing about it was outstanding from the rest of the chowders. I wish it contained more or cost less. What makes up for the price is the view of the bay; but depending on where you were seated it wasn't much of a view.

Prp_rRpeLUdvlJKMkxIVoA.review_text: My wife and I had a great time! We were anxious to find some great clam chowder while in SF and this place did not disappoint! The sourdough bread bowl was incredible! The best we've had while on the West Coast.   Our service was very good. It's clear the service team knows they provide great food and it shows in how they take care of their guests. Our waiter was very knowledgable and efficient. We did have to do a little bit if waiting but only because we went on a busy Saturday in early August. All that in mind, the service was very good.   The prices are not cheap but not overly outrageous. We got what we paid for and left happy!

sEyHTyMF3nQ0kMjAEZx6Tg.review_text: On Pier 39, yes a touristy place, but we were doing the tourist thing! Great views of the dock, fresh oysters, cold beer, creamy yummy clam chowder, crusty sourdough bread, yummy I am in heaven!  They have a great seafood menu of every crustacean, Dungeness crab, fresh fish, and items for the land lovers too.  Great white tablecloth dining and servers.

bnZgu29f1ZnLH_exbTZptg.review_text: This place was really awesome. We made reservations even though it was located in the heart of Pier 39. I was looking for a delicious restaurant that didn't have a strict dress code. (I'm 8 months pregnant and don't have the widest variety of formalwear) ;)   We decided to try several appetizers, and then split a dinner instead. It turned out to be an excellent decision. The meal starts out with a perfectly prepared sourdough bread, it was so delicious. We had the calamari, I really enjoyed the dipping sauce and found it the batter to be delightfully crispy. My fiancee, didn't agree with the breading, as he prefers the light crispy kind. We also split the steamed mussels, they came in a delicious broth that was savory and delicious. We both agreed, these were absolutely amazing! We followed it with an order of raw oysters, and they were so fresh and delectable. They were a bit small, but the freshness and taste really made up for any shortcomings. We also shared a cup of clam chowder (how could we not?), and via others suggestion used the free sourdough bread in place of the bread bowl. We noticed a bar patron eating some amazing looking sweet potato fries topped with blue cheese, which you NEED to try because they are to die for! Upon further questioning with our waitress, there is a little happy hour bar menu that you should ask for if you happen to get the chance! For our main course, we split the cioppino. It was stocked full of delicious fish, crab, mussels, and shrimp, and featured a savory and thick tomato broth. It was really delicious, my fiancee found it to have too strong of a "fish" taste for him, but that's what made it awesome for me. For dessert we had the creme brulee, and it was perfectly caramelized on top, and creamy thick and fabulous... they really know their way around the dessert area!   The entire meal only set us back about $150 which was pretty awesome for location and the amount of food we ordered. Make a reservation and ask for a window seat, the view is beautiful. If we happen to make our way back to the San Francisco area, we will definitely be back!

3ps0DhIiH6BljSkbTyAM2g.review_text: Considering the restaurant is among the touristy restaurants at Pier 39, I had an idea of what I was getting myself into. Either way, my date wanted Cioppino and this was a recommended spot.  Parking is validated for 2 hours after 6pm, so that helped a lot.  The cioppino comes out in a big shallow bowl.  The maitre d accommodated my request for a window seat (+1 star).    As for the food and drinks, our server recommended a sweet white wine to pair with our cioppino.  I might go for dry next time as I feel it would have been less overpowering.  Nonetheless, it was still good otherwise.  The restaurant offers you crab de-shelled for easy eating for an extra few bucks, which is the first time I've heard that being done.  All in all, it was a great meal.

nicGnkYxQLXQFHAcNp4rsA.review_text: First restaurant I went to during my work in the Bay Area. This place did not disappoint. Many natives have told me that Pier 39 is overrated. I say this place certainly is not and may be slighly underrated. It met my expectations and at times exceeded!   I took my girlfriend here and we both loved the place. We got a window seat that overlooked the bay and the golden gate bridge in the far back. The service was great and on top of that, we checked in to get free garlic bread. The staff are great and again, impeccable service when we were there in February.  Now let's talk about the food. Their sourdough bread to start was perfect.  Definitely recommend the clam chowder IN a bread bowl, and the Crab was amazing. This place has some of the best seafood I've had at a reasonable price for the area. Oh and I forgot to mention their drink menu, amazing. They have amazing mixed drinks and wine selection. I personally even liked their "fruity" drinks that most describe as "feminine".   Do yourself a favor and stop by this restaurant if you are looking to sit down and enjoy a nice meal whether alone or with company.

h500Ce4x1x_hpm_Kzl3FJw.review_text: Great location, right at Pier 39. Decent food with reasonable price. My friends and I had a great time there. The view is also splendid. Make sure you get a table near the window to the sea. Also, make reservation ahead of time!!

hYeZ8eAIWV2DluhxYaIUuQ.review_text: HUGE portions. $17 for fish & chips and fries. It's one of their most popular dishes for a reason. Fish was extremely fresh and the beer batter was crispy and sweet. Our sever was super nice and charged us Happy Hour prices for our second round of drinks even though it was past 6pm. Be careful of their freshly baked sourdough complimentary bread. It's easy to overstuff yourself before your mail dish arrives.

Ox2kgNuC4gbZJ5NOFVIUIQ.review_text: In town from San Diego with my brother from ATL.  Tried Fog Harbor out bc we were at Pier 39.  Great place, reasonably priced, good service.  We got the Mussels Curry appetizer which was delicious, the Field Green salad which was huge and very good, and the Sea Food Penne which was a vey goo choice as well.

j5_pB7dDxJw-TQYEQsOUnw.review_text: Came here based on reviews. It was tasty! I got the whole crab and my husband got the lobster tail stuffed with crab. Both were awesome. Don't forget to get your fun book of the Pier 39 website for an extra 20% off coupon. Definitely helps because this restaurant is on the pricey side. We will be coming back in the future to try the lobster mac and cheese.

s7amtDNqnO78zdY0SvkpUg.review_text: My boyfriend and I decided to take a day trip to the wharf and decided to try this restaurant out.  He had a mixed seafood pasta that he said was really good.  I had the mixed grill plate with shrimp, salmon and swordfish. It also came with mashed potatoes and mixed veggies.  I thought the seafood was very fresh and delicious.  We both started the meal with a cup of clam chowder and both agreed that we could have eaten a bowl.  It was the best clam chowder that I ever can recall eating.  It was perfectly thick with potatoes and loaded with clams.    Our server was very nice and prompt.  We never had to ask for a refill.  It was a tad pricey, but what isn't on the wharf of San Francisco.   2 cups of chowder, 2 entrees and 2 cokes ran us right about $85.

PvBmRN4suldo06Kcz2-vcw.review_text: Food just okay.  Quite expensive for a small crab.  They also cleaned all the tamale out of most of their crabs.  Not good if you like the tamale like I do.  Same price as PPQ and was only half as good.  Also had a crab melt that had too much mayo and a little too runny.  Popcorn rock shrimp was the best.  Perfect seasoning and had a good kick of spiciness.  Clam chowder too thick.  Jumbo shrimp cocktail, no so jumbo.  Ahi tuna with wild rice was well portioned.  SF sourdough bread awesome.  Server was funny and happy even on a super busy night.  But he didn't check on us often.  Hey its pier 39, tourist central.  What can I expect?

ElYRDR7d1iPBKPHuoh9sMg.review_text: Ambiance was nice, service was not awesome and food wasn't good but wasn't bad either. The view is absolutely incredible though!  After a long afternoon in the rain at Alcatraz we were STARVING when we got back around 3:30. I looked up trusty Yelp reviews that had been spot on for the last 5 places we ate. Considering this place had 4 stars and a bazillion reviews we thought it would be great! Well... It was just OK.  Our waiter took over 10 minutes to greet us and take our drink orders and by this time we knew what we wanted to eat.. then after another 5 minutes came back to confirm our drink orders and they didn't arrive for another 5 minutes.   Now we've been here 20 min with only glasses of water, did I mention we were incredibly hungry??!   The bread and drinks arrived and literally on top of that was the appetisers. Calamari was nice. However for a place that prides themselves in Crab Season - their crab cakes were shit. From Maryland and I work at a high end seafood restaurant, these crab cakes were not very nice.  Then we had burgers (I know it's a SEAFOOD restaurant but we wanted lunchy food) and they weren't very good. We didn't finish them.   Since we arrived during the lunch-dinner transition our waiter changed, but we got sort of lost in the transition where no one came by to check on us long after we finished. To the point that I stacked our plates myself to let them know we wanted our check!   Now, I am a server, I have high expectations for such a highly rated restaurant but I was disappointed by the service and quality of the food.

hEOISZusQ8Tyd3sC9aUQYw.review_text: this place was amazing!! after the chipotle festival we came here for dinner. since we didn't have reservations we had to wait about 20 mins for a table. Luckily, two seats opened up at the bar. our waitress was great, super sweet and took really good care of us. i can't remember her name but she works at the bar and has great make up :). so we ordered drinks, i had chardonnay and the bf had an IPA. we ordered calamri as an appetizer. th e calamari was good but the main event was the shellfish platter for one and the bfs surf n turn. needless to say it was more than delicious. my boyfriend absolutely loved his steak and i was in heaven with the fresh shrimp and awesome crab. the little corn on the cob that came along with it was great also. i'm by no means a professional when it comes to eating crab. i get all messy and stain my shirt but i don't care!!! needless to say it took me a while to eat the crab but it was sooooo good and i had fun. our tab came out to 150 but it was sooo worth it! the service was truly great.   since this place is super busy on the weekend, i strongly recommend reservations. next time we hope to get  a table by the windows. also the best parking has to be the pier 39 structure since it directly connects the third floor to the restaurant and they validate.   all in all, it was a great day in the city by the bay!

WecuAsHBDZGj7Z6_sJcQAw.review_text: This is not a four stars yelp for all of Fog Harbor. I wasn't that impressed with most of the menu (nothing too original, Pier 39 pricesfare), the by the script service (nice, but felt like a standard spiel), or even the complimentary two glasses of wine given to my grandparents for their 60th anniversary. Nice gesture, but bringing just two when there were four of us at the table? Awkward. But drink up gparents!  All said, none of the above is what I remember most about eating here. That memory is saved for an outstanding cioppino. A ridiculous amount of seafood simmering in a perfect tomato broth. Sis and I got one to split, they were kind enough to bring it on two plates, and each half was easily enough for one person. It was simply fantastic, enough so to recommend coming here just for your own, and perhaps getting one all for yourself.  Just make sure to bring some extra champagne if you are celebrating. Cioppino all over yourself is awkward enough.

Oi5ITZhtmM1CeZHCNThIEQ.review_text: Our clam chowder came fully loaded with PLASTIC SARAN WRAP in it.  Yummy.  We also ordered the ahi poke appetizer (decent) and the crab ceviche (no flavor).   Service was slow- we waited 10 minutes before they were ready to take our order.  The room was crowded - they packet everyone into one room like sardines even though there were other empty rooms, which made it tough to have a conversation and tough for the servers to move around to the different tables.  After the discovery of plastic in our clam chowder, the waiter apologized and also had the manager come over to apologize (and make excuses for why there was plastic in the chowder).  They took the chowder off the bill, which was the least they could do since we only ate a couple spoonfuls of it anyway.  They really should have offered us another appetizer or more $$ off the bill... but they didn't.  2 stars (instead of 1) for the view and location on Pier 39.

18hyCEjxo0ngQXiWR5VOPg.review_text: The view is great,  the booths are roomy and the food probably would have been satisfying, but the service was terrible.  I sat in a booth for 15 minutes and not one person came to the table.   I asked one person and he said he was setting up a table, one waiter was showing up at the table nearby four  times, and one table was seated after me and got their order.  Maybe they do not prefer single women.

pv7yUP2F4vN0WanV_kWWnw.review_text: Dropped into the bar for dinner on a Monday evening.  The restaurant wasn't too populated and we were two alone at the bar.  The service was great and friendly and our food came out quickly and was delicious.    Tried the ahi tuna poke which was a nice fresh dish with some great spicy sauce artfully drizzled along the plate.  We also had the calamari appetizer which was cooked perfectly and was definitely more fish than batter (the way it should be!).  Also had the shrimp chili lime salad.  This was a good portio and the salad was good, there were only about 5 or 6 shrim around the edges of the plate - they were nothing special, I even left a few behind.

74JiWH2Uy4LMX-qFuSurqg.review_text: Gorgeous views, friendly service and delicious food!   Location - great location! Conveniently located at pier 39 on the 2nd floor  Service - staff from the host to the waiters were very friendly.  We were seated quickly and at a nice window table with gorgeous view.  Our waiter was nice & thoughtful without being overbearing.    Food - food was fabulous!  We had the grilled salmon, crab stuffed lobster and crab & avocado salad.  ALL of our dishes were completely devoured as they were just scrumptious!  Portions weren't significant, at least not the salmon, but can't complain.  It was all good.

mh0LA3jd2sr1xrOutXKmiw.review_text: Wow is all I have to say. Every single thing we ate was out of hand. I suggest skipping out on the appetizers and just saving room for your meals. Lobster mac and cheese, garlic crab everything was out of hand good!

MsEjPwiyNRylbIRrNsJM3g.review_text: Great food. Great view. Great drinks. Dungeness crab melt and clam chowder were fantastic.

bS2dAwe3z9J2vjQJwMq9BA.review_text: My wife and I went for Dinner.  We had to wait a few minutes for a table, not a long wait at all.  We had a nice view from our table and the waiter was attentive and friendly.   We shared scallops and calamari as appetizers, she had crab cakes for her entree and mine was the Shellfish platter.  The calamari were very good, they were fresh, had a good remoulade and pleasantly spicy batter.  The scallops however, were not good, they're obviously frozen with a thick, greasy unseasoned batter.  The crab cakes were good, with a lot of crabmeat.  The shellfish platter included a half Dungeness crab, 5-6 peeled shrimp and 5-7 clams and mussels.  It's all swimming in an eighth-inch of melted butter, crab juices and garlic.  How can it not be good?    Next time I'm in SF, I'd come back, just wouldn't order the scallops.

jLNfs3GhvQw6mfRrU5Ngyg.review_text: Honestly, when I first looked at the number of stars this restaurant had, and that it had two dollar signs, I was a little hesitant because we already spent some money that day, and we didn't want to splurge for lunch/dinner.  I went to the Welcome Center, showed them my AAA card, and picked up the coupon book which offered 2 hrs of validated parking and 20% off at Fog Harbor Fish House, and a few other restaurants. Since we had the 20% off, we decided to try this place! And I'm SO glad that we did.    We arrived around 2:30 and were seated right away.  There was a good amount of people in there, but it wasn't busy.  I loved the front entrance because it was very peaceful and elegant.  Once seated, I knew I wanted a Bread Bowl because that is what was highly recommended on Yelp (and it was only $9).  My boyfriend had the salmon that was stuffed with crab.  We were given a bowl of bread which was so good and I almost ate all of it until I remembered that I was also getting bread with my meal.  The view was gorgeous outside our window.      My boyfriend ordered a chardonnay, and I want to say that it was the floor manager who helped him pick one out.  He was very knowledgable and helpful, and knew exactly what he was talking about.  We ordered the calamari for an appetizer.  This was a FULL plate too, it wasn't just a few pieces.  They really were generous, and it was delicious.  Our food arrived about 10 minutes after we got the appetizers.  Of course the bread bowl was delicious, and my boyfriends salmon was amazing!  The salmon wasn't dried out, and the crab was fantastic.    The service is also good here.  The waiter checked up on us and had no problem when I gave him the coupon.  He also validated our parking which we didn't need (because you can't combine the 2 hr validation with 1hr of restaurant), but he did anyways!    Also, one more thing:  my boyfriend and I have also eaten at crab house which is right next door.  And we loved that place as well, but if you want to save some money, you get quality food at a lower price at Fog Harbor!  We will definitely be coming here again soon.

O98OvniMRlKF_lllMajzFQ.review_text: Boudin was a cluster so we headed upstairs to FHFH for a snack.  So glad we did.  We opted to sit at the bar and were promptly taken care of.  The chowder in a bread bowl was amazing with a little added pepper and a little bit of tabasco.  The parmesan risotto crab fritters were a tad over fried but were delicious nonetheless.  And the baked oysters - I could eat several dozen of them!

QP_7afgk74UF7NmOLq9TIA.review_text: I had a great experience eating dinner here! Jeremy, who is our waiter did an excellent job, despite the fact that he spilled wine on the table. We all make mistakes, right?  He was friendly and very professional. And had a great smile! We all loved him. The manger also was very accommodating! He gave us a free bottle of wine and a desert :)  Overall, our experience here was fantastic!

hUeApA1vTs0O4no2d7J71Q.review_text: Went yesterday when we were craving some fish and chips - we saw that theirs is made with anchor steam and were sold!  The fish and chips were great, but slightly too salty. The tartar sauce was the best, it didn't overwhelm the fish as most sauces usually do!  Ryan got the angus burger and it was great as well, the bun was just slightly too soft and got a little soggy.  The best part of the meal was the amazing clam chowder!  I will be going back just to have that clam chowder in a bread bowl!

85ioJ7FiiKsYJVYskq0TUA.review_text: I wasn't that impressed.  My wifes Chili LIme Shrimp Salad was greasy,  the shrimps overcooked to hell and just not as light as the name suggests.   My seafood penne was OK,  but I could knock up  something as good with my eyes shut (in fact the mirepoix was way too chunky to extract much flavour and of course didn't cook through).  Daughters fish and chips was good  though as was the Calamari.   Service was good, the view was good and the location of course, but coming from near Marseille in France,  where you can eat great seafood the meal was disappointing.

fy1nQY7skoADZGaOFm7XeA.review_text: We went for dungeness crab, and oh boy we got a huge serving of it. It was delicious. The location is really nice, service was great. We had a couple visiting from Australia and this was a great introduction for them to great San Francisco food.

ZcTzBUuuXyDGmdsVulpl5w.review_text: The most delicious and fresh oyster and yummy steamed clam. Try these you never regret!

znsQWzwtma_PdIE2qjdX8g.review_text: Came here with a large party of 14. The service was actually really good and I was impressed with our waiter. The entrees my boyfriend and I ordered on the other hand was terrible. We got a scallop appetizer and the blue cheese garlic bread. Both were decent. My boyfriend ordered the crab cake dinner and I got linguine with clams. My boyfriend's crab cakes were burnt and cold when they came out. The menu description for my linguine should have said "small portion of linguine and a couple clams." For $18 it was way overpriced for pasta and literally like three clams. Not to mention they didn't even clean the clams and the whole bottom of my plate was covered in gritty sand. Since we already had to send my boyfriends food back and his family seemed horrified that he did, I didn't complain about my sandy pasta, but when the waiter picked up the dish, I am surprised he didn't notice the thick layer of grit left on my plate. We won't be back.

tcXbDFbFKrEA3Bks_zAm0Q.review_text: I never go to Pier 39 unless I have visitors who want to go and I am so happy to find this gem in the total tourist traps. The food is fresh and of high quality, especially comparing it to all the junk on pier 39. THe chowder was loved by everyone at the table.  The crab cakes were very good and not the disgusting frozen heavily breaded patties with hardly any crab. These were full of crab, green onion, peppers- full of flavor! Everything we had was good, the service was very good and the view was gorgeous!

-kkTUHFUHTF5kHpKU_b47A.review_text: was delicious!  they have great drinks, their portions are large, and everything was very fresh!

wprM2IRXww535QrStF6-IQ.review_text: Looking for a restaurant in the Wharf that wasn't a total tourist trap, but would satisfy my lady's desire for seafood, I found Fog Harbor through Yelp. We weren't disappointed.  The food was excellent, and service was stellar throughout. Our waitress was attentive without being a hovering presence, and took care of everything from corkage (it's only $12; you might do well to bring your own bottle) to dessert recommendations (more on this later--holycarp). When we asked for more lemon, she brought a plate of six nicely arranged wedges.   We started with the clam chowder in a bread bowl, which we shared. It was, as others have noted, creamy, full of clams, and not too salty. Of course you must not only dip the small wedge-shaped bread top, but also eat as much of the bread bowl as you can handle without jeopardizing your ability to put away dessert.   Next came a half-dozen oysters, raw on the half-shell, with cocktail and wasabi sauces. Despite being an aggressively openminded eater, I'd somehow never had oysters before. Without the benefit of further experience, I think it's safe to say this was a good place to start. The oysters tasted very fresh, nice and briny, with a much more pleasant texture than I'd imagined.  For the entree, I got the special salmon (stuffed with crab) and Em had the mixed grill (salmon, swordfish, and prawns). Again, everything tasted absolutely fresh. All the fish was cooked perfectly--my salmon was just opaque, tender-firm and flaky. The swordfish, which I don't normally like much, was juicy and delicious. If I must pick a gripe, I'd take issue with the mixed vegetables--they were overcooked (to my taste; some of the zucchini strips were completely soggy) and unimaginative, though still a step up from the simply steamed carrot, cauliflower and broccoli you'd find at many common seafood joints.   The dessert tray offered some interesting selections alongside a couple old standbys. In addition to the expected creme brulee and apple crisp, there was a pumpkin bread pudding, some kind of individually baked chocolate cake, and a pumpkin cheesecake. My girlfriend is currently obsessed with pumpkin to what's likely an unhealthy degree, so we got the cheesecake. Moreover, our waitress said it was to die for. She never lied--eating it was like biting into the spiced flesh of an angel, only sweeter and less sacrilegious.    Two appetizers, two entrees, corkage fee and dessert came to just over $100. You can easily pay more for less in the heart of San Francisco's #1 tourist trap. If you're not on a budget, and you want to enjoy some well-prepared seafood with minimal frills and gimmicks, you might give Fog Harbor a try. We left thoroughly stuffed, and very happy.  PS: Parking is $7/hr in the nearby Pier 39 garage, but dinner will get you 2 hours free if you remember to validate (NB: I did not remember to validate).

J2752iXa_1ZPQtiQl5yZ0A.review_text: First, go to the visitor's center also on the upper level and get a 15% off coupon for this place. Then, make a reservation on OpenTable so you get seated near the window.   This is a nice little spot with a beautiful view of the Bay. The food quality is decent but nothing amazing and the mixed drinks are a little diluted. I would know as I get tipsy easily since I hardly drink which wasn't the case after a mojito here.  I had a 1/2 crab (eh, ok, but way overpriced due to supply/demand) which was plenty with a beat salad (very good) and shared a bowl of the Clam Chowder (delicious) with my boyfriend who has some fish in a wasabi sauce that didn't taste that excellent.   So this isn't a cheap place, but it's not a bad restaurant to check out and the service is very good.   3 stars for food. 2.5 stars for mixed drinks 4 stars for service 4 stars for atmosphere

fL-4k0fpIqZU4OM4kryFlA.review_text: Fast seating. Exceptional Clam Chowder. The salad left a little to be desired but the calamari sauce was a hit! The crab legs were a tad on the smaller side but very delicious. The view is incredible and the wait staff was very cordual. My friend really liked the cucumber basil gimlet.

Yi8LctBGqLL2ZDfd2jcmqA.review_text: The location is great, with great views from a window seat. The sourdough bread was good, the clam chowder was great, and the oysters fresh. I had the mixed grill for my entree, and the salmon and shrimp were good. The swordfish was a little dry, as was the wild rice.  I had the tiramisu for dessert, and it was much better than expected.  My only complaint was the bar - mixed drinks seemed watered down. Go for the Lagunitas IPA.

mRrbijKHVfbfC2scMyxzbw.review_text: Had the crab legs-  Was ok not overly impressed.  Wouldn't really send anyone here as a go-to place.  Environment was nice and a pretty good view though.

d9JuPUj2XDiBp0gW5mS8tg.review_text: We randomly found this restaurant and it looked amazing so we walked in. The place is beautiful and it has a great view. I was able to see Alcatraz for our entire lunch it was pretty cool. Our waiter was really nice and we were starving so he offered the best appetizer they have which was the blue cheese garlic bread and it was one of the best if not the best garlic bread I have ever had, but also the most expensive. We both ordered the crab cake burger and at first it tasted really good and then I felt like it was missing something and I just couldn't even finish it all. I did not think their food was a good as I expected considering the prices but the view and the garlic bread made me feel better...

Ame-ew14ml2jmUhDs_OyfQ.review_text: Good service, excellent Seafood. Make your reservation here to save time. We got an amuse buche for reserving online. We had scallops on the half shell (probably not worth the money, but still good). My entree was delicious: mixed grill. Swordfish, salmon and shrimp all cooked to perfection. Delicious asparagus side and garlic mashed potatoes that were strictly okay. Fresh, homemade sourdough on your table is warm and soft and crusty and delicious. I also had their yummy tiramisu, apple crisp, and a skinny coconut ginger cocktail, all delicious!

buPCp80zdVrYWeWnnvghRg.review_text: My girlfriend recently sampled Seattle's clam chowder and when she returned she craved for more.  Aiming to please her, we went to Fog Harbor Fish House after scouring yelp reviews after review.  All the hard work paid off.  We ordered the free Blue Cheese Garlic Bread which was free with the first Yelp check in.  One clam chowder for both of us and the Mixed grill (Grilled salmon, swordfish, and shrimp w/ vegetables and a carb) to share.  The clam chowder was very good, was abundant with clams, very creamy, was a bit heavy on the salt.  Dishes made a bit too salty is a common complaint of ours.  Our dinner entry came split on separate plates, a very nice touch.  The shrimp was a bit on the salty side, the salmon was very good, and the swordfish was delectable.  A nice ending to a stroll through Fisherman's Wharf while playing tourist.  Will return for more clam chowder and will order just the grilled swordfish.

pCfU9qBjNQaHdQ-lyGmGDQ.review_text: So rarely get to this part of town - but when visitors are staying nearby and have mobility issues, why not eat close?  Having tried a few places on Pier 39, I think this is the best choice.  View is EXCELLENT, service is very good, food is above average (tho not outstanding).  I had a rare tuna salad - it was quite good though not something I would crave.  Everyone else had some form of fried fish.  They all thought it was very good.  (Looked fine to me but nothing special.)  Overall, it can be a great experience when you need to be in this part of the city.

I7dKPFaSQBCg_zPtp-yOSw.review_text: Love this place. Visiting SF for the first time and found this on Yelp.   Food was inexpensive and tasty.   Starters: $16 place of two pieces of crab cake. Massive serving around 150g each.   Main: $23 for a huge plate of mixed grill seafood (prawn skewer, a palm sized piece of grilled salmon, and a palm sized piece of sword fish, topped with brocolli and wild rice).   Value for money! Highly recommended.

J5Zt-gesMF7ZXPcZziiswA.review_text: We went here for a girls night put dinner. Amazing food and staff! The view is awesome! Our server was extremely helpful and friendly. She made a lot of recommendations and was very attentive. Highly recommend the seafood grilled combination, wedge salad, clam chowder, and seared ahi tuna. They also have fresh complimentary house-made sour dough bread! Although, this was not the best clam chowder I've had (best is pikes place clam chowder in Seattle, Washington) it is pretty darn tasty! I wish I had room for dessert, but I was stuffed already! Great food, ambiance, and great service, what more can you ask for?

n5zHIJwSXmAJQgBi0svsHw.review_text: Great food today for my husbands birthday after Alcatraz tour. Our waiter he was very friendly and trued hard to keep up since they were packed and seemed shirt handed. Hostess passed our name up after we told her we would be at the bar so it took awhile to get our table. Service was slow but the waiter his personality made up for it.   Lucky for us the food was worth it too

DiB0cdtt-UURvXmQe8YqrA.review_text: This place is great.  The food is excellent, the service was great, the drinks and bartender very awesome, and the GM stopped by my table a few times to tell me about their best dishes and chat for a minute (I was traveling alone).  They were all very nice and the food was top notch.  I went to their biggest competitor on the pier with great food, but it was not as good and the service was not good at all and the bartender stunk, too.   Fog Harbor was awesome and I will definitely go back.  Their crab, crab cakes cakes, lobster, scallops, soup and excellent drinks were all phenomenal.

98Y3R6QPOufhxvO8uPyYkw.review_text: Great views, great food, great service! Miyagi oysters, score :) Portions are quite large, so beware of over-ordering (or just get yummy leftovers to go). Wine list is reasonable also - the Syrah was a winner!

lSxPkKtUdBOraDWMcRSNlQ.review_text: I always shunned Pier 39/Fishermans Wharf for it's extreme touristy'ness. I never liked places like this, but when, on a family outing, we found ourselves eating at this place "out of convenience", I quietly also ate my words. The place looks nice, staff was friendly, we got a table pretty much immediately, and the food was both good and totally reasonably priced! It made me wonder what it is I am paying so much for in so many hipster joints in Frisco these days, because the food is not that much better.

hM4AngQxLItlImgA-7ZF8A.review_text: Delicious dinner, awesome view of the bay, and the desserts had us all reaching for each others' plates to share. Thanks to Greg and Zarah for a great afternoon meal.

2qKOL7C7WbG_M3EOWvTFxA.review_text: Sure, it's in a touristy part of town, but do I live in SF? Nope...so that would make me a tourist! No?  So we went over for dinner, after a long day of training. The view is really nice, and I recommend a table by the window so you can see the bay, and in some parts even Alcatraz (maybe not romantic, but still a cool sight).   We started off sharing a couple of appetizers: Shrimp cocktail and crab cakes. Both were good!  Entree I had the Mixed Grill which brings Grilled Salmon, Swordfish and Shrimp and a garlic mashed potatoes. Everything was grilled perfectly. My favorite was the swordfish but the other two (and that mash!) were great too.  For dessert we had the chocolate bread pudding. Big enough that three of us shared and it was just the right way to end the meal.  Customer service was great. Our waiter accidentally switched up the wine orders and gave them to the wrong people. He felt so embarrassed he apologized the rest of the night. It really was no biggie, but he wanted to make sure he made it right.

Q1iFdH7YGX5eWp_ZF_EORg.review_text: Go for the view and the location at pier 39. Food is so so.

YvBvdwVjfSlcVKrOjjPt4g.review_text: I was not that impressed with this place. Don't get me wrong the food wasn't bad, but it just wasn't  4 star worth either. I ordered the sole and the BF had the salmon. The meal wasn't too bad. We weren't  blown away either. All in all, for the price that we paid, we would have expected a better meal.

ghYSbxQuYxL1Dn68iMJf6g.review_text: This is a really nice restaurant with a great view.  The seafood and sourdough bread are excellent.  The prices are ridiculous.   I didn't know that the week after Christmas was such a crazy-fest in San Francisco.  Every place you go is packed with foreigners and tourists, and 99% of all restaurants are understaffed for the rush.   We sat at the bar, and there was a single bartender handling all the drinks for the restaurant, as well as the entire bar and several tables in the bar area.  To top it off, she was pregnant (quite far along), and I have no idea how she did it, but she kept us in food and drinks.   I was shocked that two appetizers and four drinks totalled $70.00, but I'm on vacation, so I chalked it up to a once-in-a-while fun allowance.  If given a choice, I probably wouldn't return to this place, though.

Sm9p2M-EPPmg14ww33D0YQ.review_text: The food was pretty good, but the ambiance was almost unbearable if you are trying to avoid packed/touristy places. We had the crab cakes which were my 2nd favorite only to San Juan island (in WA) and the ahi tuna (ok) and the garlic crab (ok but maybe too butter rich).   So food good, worth price et cetera et cetera.  But ambiance we felt like we were packed like sardines.  I've been to plenty of nicer restaurants which deuce food seafood and don't feel so cheap by putting people together. That said the service was very nice. I just wouldn't go back.

l0U0PfzzVMm9s4KshP6T0w.review_text: This is a fantastic seafood place with a view of Alcatraz, the Golden Gate bridge and  San Francisco Bay and is easily one of the best waterfront dining experiences I've ever had. The prices are up there because it's a high volume tourist area, but you won't  mind paying for the quality. It's as close as you'll find from ocean to plate.   The dining room is enormous and formal, however there are all kinds eating here. The waitress was fantastic and frequent to check in. There is tons of natural light from the enormous windows and the dining room is immaculate.   The menu features all your seafood staples, but the award winning chowder and roasted jalapenos with scallops are favorites. Make this a destination restaurant, if you're in town.

jghrw3cCQzmmSU4trcspVw.review_text: Great food, great atmosphere.  I had the mixed grill seafood plate and my husband had the fish and chips.  Both were delicious.      We got free blue cheese garlic bread when we checked in thru YELP.  The garlic mashed potatoes were good too.  The service was a little disorganized - food that wasn't ours was brought to our table, I got rice instead of the mashed potatoes I ordered, and we were asked twice if we wanted dessert instead of bringing us the bill which we asked for.  But all in all, a great experience.

3l5lrs0_voc3cZz_UiLeZA.review_text: This place was delicious!  I bookmarked this restaurant for our upcoming San Francisco visit and am very  happy we were able to stop by.   We came for a late lunch today after visiting Napa. The place was still quite busy around 3pm.   We got seated by the window so we had a nice view of the bay.  We started off with cup of clam chowder soup and crab and spinach dip. This was probably one of the best clam chowder soups we've ever had. The dip was alright.   For our main entrees I ordered the seared ahi tuna with mashed potatoes and veggies. It was excellent! The soy ginger glaze, in addition to the other sauces I can't recall, worked really well with the dish. The presentation was sooo pretty I didn't want to eat it.  I was extremely satisfied with the dish :)  My mom got the mixed seafood plate (swordfish was yummy!) and my sister got the seared halibut with quinoa and arugula (very tasty as well).   Too bad I'm not a San Fran native otherwise I'd make repeat visits!

OwIK3xxbfSSm7P4hjvC7Mg.review_text: Went here with my husband for an early lunch.  The food was very good and the wait staff was friendly.  Nice sized portions for the meals.  Sorry I missed the clam chowder, but the Mixed Grill was not to be missed.

CzbWbpZDwwy2OfLJI830qA.review_text: We have been here several times, but it has been a couple years (on previous visits food was great too)  They have re-modelled the entrance a bit since last visit, nice, actually more tables inside as a result.  One thing I first must mention in a positive way, this restaurant is a bit more upscale than alot of the burger/cafe-type places in the area, which is nice.  Perfect setting for that special occasion, or to impress an out-of-town guest.  The staff all seem sincerely helpful, prompt service, friendly, fill empty glasses, confirm your order when it is placed, etc.  The prices are what I would call "competitive", and given the atmosphere, nice view, cleanliness of the restaurant,  I would say the prices are very fair. I ordered the salmon entree - DELICIOUS, best salmon I have had in a long time, very fresh, prepared perfectly, and the wild rice was nice and flaky with bits of fresh herb also.  My partner ordered the Mixed Seafood entree, and that was great too - the calamari was delicious, deep fried, but not too greasy.  Their portions are generous - I was almost tempted to order the sourdough blue cheese/garlic bread, which sounds delicious, but I didnt, because I knew I would get stuffed on that before the meal came - I got stuffed on the entree alone! The views are great from this restaurant, and I really dont think there is a "bad" table in the entire place.  The bar area looks nice too - we ate lunch at the Bar one time, and I remember the nice Coffee Drinks they have.  So after 3 or 4 visits and no negative issues, I would say safe to take anyone here with no fear of feeling like "gee, we've been here before and it was good" and have regrets about saying this!

0rixSfaeisfQn92w3xiP_A.review_text: We celebrated my husbands birthday here this weekend. Dinner was very fresh and fun right off the water. We had a beautiful view of Pier 39 and the sea lions. The shellfish platter comes piled high with crab, shrimp, mussels, and clams, in garlic butter.  I highly recommend the platter and it was fun to eat and very fresh! The clam chowder was delicious!

k3dbwpzE_70xaVC1g-JKYA.review_text: Ok I'm giving this  resto Two Star for their food! Had high expectations before dining at this resto but now....  The Salmon and Linguini with clams that I ordered DIDN'T TASTE FRESH at all. Total DISAPPOINTMENT! Definitely needs major improvement on food prep...  Would give Charlie (our server) 5 star for being so attentive!  5 star for the view and location of the restaurant. Its in the heart of Pier 39.

zy1DpD7pC4dzrSecLZ8cKg.review_text: We were disappointed. My wife's salmon was tasteless. My fish and chips were average at best. Especially given how good San Francisco food can be, we feel that we made a mistake coming to the Wharf.

CBG3um4DlmwtSphCo5ENBg.review_text: This is probably one of the nicest restaurants on pier 39. The ambiance appeared very classy but there are so many casual patrons that it didn't feel too uptight.   There was about a 30 minute wait on Thursday night. They have a nice cozy fireplace to sit by while looking over the menu. There are no buzzers so you have to wait near the restaurant to hear your name called out.    Once we sat down, we got a lovely view of the pier with the sea lions. The fresh sourdough bread was delicious! Crusty on the outside but soft on the inside.   I ordered the clam chowder in the bread bowl with a side caesar salad while BF had the swordfish. The clam chowder was tasty and definitely not salty. That's always been my biggest problem with clam chowder. The caesar salad was forgettable... it was served on the whole romaine hearts. I would prefer if the lettuce was already chopped for easy eating! BF enjoyed his swordfish and the portion was generous for the price. We definitely did not leave feeling hungry or guilty!

oAaArT9e4sOy1OZatiydTw.review_text: One of my favorites. Food is excellent it's delicious and presentation is superb also service is top notch.  The staff was friendly. In addition to being a phenomenal manager, Greg is an amazingly cool guy. He was chatting it up with all the diners, asking questions about the experience, and thanking them for coming in.  I looove this place.

uojZ2-O3HHCBZ0sGT_Eeiw.review_text: If yelp can add negative stars I would! I mean the place is supposed to be formal and professional right? I mean after all we're paying for a pretty expensive food. With market prices. I don't mind that but when you have a server with a sarcastic attitude that's when I mind. It was my friends birthday and wanted to make the night special for her but she ruined it! If you have issues on your own personal life then deal with it at your own time !  Manager if your reading this her name is Katie and maybe you should do something about that before someone experience such bad service again!

WI8aJ-Longj0nCQRUvAZQA.review_text: We were absolutely starving & didn't care if this place was touristy, we needed food!   Lucky for us, our meal was absolutely amazing. For starters, the bread basket is so good we had 3. Warm sourdough - what else could be better? For my entree I ordered the clam chowder in the bread bowl & Ryan ordered the crab cake sandwich. The chowder was fabulous with big chunks of clams. Ryan's sandwich was very good - so good it was gone in no time.  We had a great seat by the window & our waitress was very nice. I'd definitely go back!

ldwJGT7KAR_d-0kAZ0R54g.review_text: Sat down at the bar right away, recieved prompt service, order the ultimate dirty martini-- delish and my gf ordered the basil cucumber gibblet--pretty refreshing.  We order fries to snack on and the came out immediately.  My gf and I were chatting and mentioned charging our phones and the manager gave us two portable chargers.  Great service, friend staff. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is the bartender didn't entertain my joke.  Hahahah! Will come again to taste their main entrée.

4Do6WKxYC8L_hsk0QsQ6lQ.review_text: This is a lovely restaurant with a beautiful view by the bay. My bf and I came in around 8pm on a Thursday. We made reservations, but was seated 30 mins prior to our reservation.   We got sat down and was instantly stunned by the different selections of seafood plates. Before we ate we got a beer and cocktail and ordered our food. While we waited we sipped down our drinks and ate some bread and butter. We got the baked oysters, seafood cioppino, and seafood combo.   As we got our food we were amazed of how big the dish was. The first dish we tried was the baked oysters. Must admit that it was pretty good! My boyfriend had calamari, fish, and fries. My dish consisted of clams, mussels, fish, shrimp, and crab. I was also looking forward to the pasta part. I wish they added a little more noodles to the dish. Other than that, it was great and fulfilling.  The service was okay. I know they tried their best to go above and beyond for great customer service, but I felt like we were waiting more than we had to.

8Qo6HgnVxYeD5K3N-6FxmA.review_text: We at pier 39 and decided to have clam chowder since it was a chilly day in SF. This place is always good. My clam chowder was a little cold but the manger fixed the problem in 2 minutes and I was able to enjoy my chowder. It's a nice restaurant with great views try to get a table by the windows. I also had crab cocktail which was delicious. My friend ordered the seafood ciopino and had them make it spicy, that was bomb I would recommend it that way if you like spicy. Enjoy

Ry1Rctmgp2jfBxtmc0NQyg.review_text: Food -Can I just say that everything we ordered today was delicious?!! Everything was freshly prepared. You can tell that you're not being served premade food that has been sitting there for a while.  -Fish & Chips ($17): YUM!! Very fresh. This reminded me of a 10x better version of the fish in McDonald's filet-o-fish (I'm a huge fan of that fast food sandwich). It came with a generous amount of fish, french fries, and cole slaw.  -Crab Roll ($19): The sandwich was a bit smaller than I expected, but it was amazing! The bread part reminded me of the outside of a grilled cheese, and the crab part was kinda like a dungeness crab salad. It also came with a side of sweet potato fries + more crab. -Clam Chowder in Sourdough Bread Bowl ($10): Comparable to Boudin's but I might like this one even more. -Garlic Roasted Crab ($19): I didn't try any of my dad's entree, but I'll include a pic of it. He said it was very tasty. -I also loved the free bread that we got before our meal. It was still super hot, fresh, and crispy right from the oven. WIthin 5 minutes, our table already finished the first basket of sourdough and had to ask for more.  Ambience -Right next to the water at Pier 39. We had a great view of the ocean, Alcatraz, and also the sea lions. -Cute, simple, classy -Nice fireplace outside in the front of the restaurant  Service -Great!! The servers here are all very friendly and helpful.

l6g90Ia5xFtcE3D6HeDuvg.review_text: Came here for happy hour at the bar and we were not given the happy hour menu. Nor were we informed there was happy hour going on even though the hostesses claim there was one. It was not until the couple next to us asked for the HH menu did the bartender presented them with one. By that time, we were almost finished with our food.... Oh well. We should've asked ourselves. Additionally, the bartenders, while pleasant and personable, were not very attentive even though it was not very busy. Bustling doing other things than tending to their customers. Or maybe we were not given attention due to our low orders of alcohol. That could be it.   The food, nevertheless, was very good. I ordered the Salmon "Club" Salad after seeing the diner next to me eat the same dish. The salmon was moist and not too dry. I would definitely order it again... that is, if I decide to go back. Good service leads to re-visits. Take note, managers.

fRFspes2RDHzJrxuQT2drA.review_text: We had a table by the window which really didn't matter bc there are so many windows that any table could have a good view of the bay.  I met some friends from outta town there and they seemed to like the place.  Which was a plus for me.  I have no complaints about their food.  I ordered crab cakes for an appetizer and they were what I expected...nothing fantastic, just good.  I had the trout which was actually good...considering I don't eat fish much.  One of my friends ordered lobster and lost her appetite bc I think she said there was lobster poop.  Lol.  I'm not a regular lobster eater so I wasn't sure if that was really what it was.  Waiter was nice except I could tell he wasn't too thrilled to see that the  lobster wasn't eaten, which shouldn't matter since we paid for the meal.   Anyway, nice atmosphere.  Got a nice view of the Bay.  Food was satisfying.

CPPBdwW6EuEAXFklbUc7qg.review_text: Got sick from the Fish and Chips or the Beer?! Careful

L4S915BUVypnswOLWUWlYw.review_text: This is such a good restaurant at Pier 39. Prices are an average of $20 per Entrée but the food is really good.  Atmosphere 5/5: Great ambiance and cozy restaurant with fireplace and good seatings next to the bay area. They don't have any outside seating tho. Food 5/5: Food is definitely great there. I tried the 1/4 Crab Languini that you can ask to be out of the shelf for an extra $4. We had as well the Mixed Grill which looks to be a little bit small but good! And last but not least, the Clam Chowder in a Sourdough is priceless. Service 3/5: I never had perfect service at this place. There's always something that goes wrong, misunderstanding or takes time to bring the receipts to cite a couple examples. Too bad for a restaurant of that quality that the service isn't at that level as well.

2t5_cQ2MOECngiMlDh6eaQ.review_text: Excellent service.  Super tasty clam chowder, calamari, and blue cheese garlic bread.  Very reasonable price for Pier 39.  Highly recommended!

gOYXtO9hfHvvME3A7gdziw.review_text: I came here with a second time on June 10th, 2010 for my birthday.  I had a great experience.  The waitress was very attentive and was awesome.  The only issue I had was when I told the receptionist I had a reservation on OpenTable and she wasn't too friendly...  Didn't greet us really or say anything.  We were seated, but waited for about almost 5 minutes before being asked about what we wanted.  However, after that, the experience was awesome.  Food was excellent.  It, overall, was a very pleasant expectations for the most part...  Thanks to my great waitress who was awesome!!

jh0O3VbAQK_IHaefJqBmRQ.review_text: The service and the views are great but the food was horrible! I had a crab louie, the crab meat was shredded like what you find in the bottom of canned crab. Actually I've had canned crab that taste better than what they served. I had them add prawns which also were lousy. Dressing was bad too. I live in SF and should've known better than to take out of town guest to this place.  It was expensive and not worth it. I'd never go back. The bread was good.

-ToLhFdQkztubd-1dzfIaA.review_text: Best clam chowder & calamari we had during our vacation!!

XBx9Q09VUk5Fd9sHaEDJhA.review_text: Beautiful view of the harbor. The service was  professional and inviting. This trip the food was good but not out of the ordinary. We had the market price Salmon and Mixed grill. The presentation was acceptable but not exciting to the eye. The taste was just not over the top. Absolutely no wow factor. I also got the clam chowder. Again the taste was good but not great. If you want an awesome view inviting ambiance and welcoming attentive service. This is your place. Mila, Thanks for a your wonderful table service.

YlrnEeKf-8zoqExJE13l5w.review_text: We came here to celebrate our engagement and our friends' wedding and had a wonderful time! We made reservations so out wait was less than 5 minutes, and that gave us a chance to take a few pictures in front of the pier 39 Christmas tree, so it was a welcomed wait. Our server was really sweet and patient. They have a delicious selection of appetizers, featuring many with crab, and the drinks were really good! (I had a pumpkin pie martini which was really good!)  We split the seafood penne pasta and the surf and turf, both of which I would highly recommend. The view was gorgeous and it didn't seem like there were any bad tables in the place.  We had a wonderful time having a celebratory dinner here and would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice evening at a tasty restaurant. I am definitely going back here!!!

L_zNp9X95z9NERL2vzGiwQ.review_text: We didn't have a reservation but were told they take walk-ins so we called as we got close to the restaurant and they said there was no wait time but once we parked and walked to the restaurant they had filled up in a matter of 10 min max and told us the wait would be 45 min- 1 hr long so we waited. An hour and a half later we were still waiting. Someone in our party finally complained and we were seated. By that time 2 hours had passed and mind you we had kids in our party. They comped a few drinks but we ended up getting ripped off when we had to pay $24 for parking because only 2 hours were free with validation and that was the time we were waiting for our table. Food was ok but we shouldn't have had to wait 2 hours when they said 45-1hr. We could've gone somewhere else but we had already waited for so long! They should've comped us more for having to wait as long as we did and not tell us there's no wait without considering parking time and walking to the restaurant.

WpjLsGe2v9-g_cMdAOOLYA.review_text: Headline: Remarkably good burger for a fish house.  I am in San Francisco on business this week, and - due to the ridiculously high hotel prices down by the Moscone - staying near Fishermans Wharf.  We needed dinner, and picked this place.  Good choice, all things considered.  I ordered the Fog House Burger.  If you are going to put your restaurants name on it, it had better be good.  To be honest, I was expecting to be underwhelmed.  Let's face it, this place is in a tourist area and serves fish.  How good could it be?  Fortunately for me, this burger came out as ordered, with a perfectly toasted bun, caramelized onions and bacon on it.  The fixings (limp piece of lettuce, two slices of tomato and a couple of rings of onion) were ok.  The fries were hot and crispy, and they have malt vinegar (which I love on fries).  Overall, this was a well-executed burger, which surprised me.  My wife had the prawn ravioli.  We were expecting the prawns to be inside the ravioli.  However, the ravioli were cheese ravioli - tasty on their own.  The prawns were perfectly cooked, and the spinach was tasty.  The sauce was sweeter than expected, but very good.  My wife was mopping up the remains of the sauce with the supplied San Francisco sourdough (which was way too strong, as is normal).  If you find yourself down at Pier 39, you can do a lot worse than this place.

Ed3QqEYdS3wRCreauK003Q.review_text: If I could give this place zero stars I would! This place is the most disrespectful and unorganized place I have ever been and I didn't even get to try the food. Made a reservation for 9 people and they refused to seat us at 8 people because we needed everyone there. I would not mind waiting if the restaurant was not 90% empty! Makes no sense. On top of this when we had everyone, they made us wait saying they needed to talk to a manager before seating us. ?!? Wtf?!  A couple comes up to the restaurant and asked to be seated 5 minutes into my party waiting for the manager and they sat them nooooooo problem. The absolute worse service by far. They need to hire new hostesses who know how to do their job. And manager that never showed up...you suck the worse!

J9BPdPum6yOEiOoag--UDQ.review_text: Great food, like really really great! Wonderful atmosphere and staff. Also have out of this world aged manhattan, must try it!!! Only down fall was server didn't come by often enough and we sat a long time

-WgI2su8Qa-zatW1i_TC8Q.review_text: The food was good but the service was BAD. The waiter didn't refill our drinks,  food took awhile to come out, and got one of our order wrong. When we asked for our ticket that even took some time. The people next to us said the same thing.  Only thing was the food.

76PBjJin4vKqLunRm-HHEg.review_text: Very disappointed in this restaurant. Should have read more reviews before attempting this one. Hubby had the shrimp scampi, which was floating in what looked like a yellow watered-down butter "sauce" and tasted about as good. My calamari had no flavor at all. Still hungry, decided to try dessert. Well, that was just about as successful as the meal - flavorless creme brûlée with a burnt tasting caramelized crust. An expensive waste of food.

p_514Yo8SndKB7dCvGdvWw.review_text: Walked by here one time after my cousin's Gf's bday dinner at Bubba Gumps and I wanted to check it out one of these days. I was like.."this place looks cool to chill at...juander how it is." Decided to take my friend who luckily is down with the Pier frisco touristy crap even though she is from the bay and not the out of town decent.   Sorry...I aint one of those stuck up critics who gives a damn about a great ambience because I am one who makes the best out of any situation.  I guess when you walk into the joint.... its all stuck-uppie high class or whatever for tourists...but i ignored that fact since i just wanted some brew, good calamari, and a new spot to check out. Maybe it was just kinda dead for the night...(cuz it was a tuesday when we came through)...but i felt like I was sitting in the lower section of a Warriors game being too loud or something.   I was like.."Oh..you think its okay that we laugh this loudly? It is okay to have a good time right?"  I think it was appropriate because the bartender seemed to appreciate our company. She informed us we were different from the typical customers.   There are tables there for a sit down dinner and stuff, but I decided it be best to chill at the bar because I thought it would be more fun.   The bartender we had was really sociable and rocked a friendly smile...so she provided a comfortable atmosphere. She even made us one of her famous cong-cock-shong...the all so famous....PBJ. it was good...nothing strong..just smoov since we were knockin down 24oz pints of brew and vodka tonics on the side.   i'll definitely be back juan of these days. maybe when i feel like being pier 39 tourishy or something.  I dont ask for much in life if my satisfactions for calamri and brew are fulfilled...so i give this spot a five holy smackonlies. an extra hi pibe to the bartender. thanks.

ww860DlZeRsZHVu19dva1g.review_text: Fog Harbor offers a fantastic dining experience. I had the pleasure of eating here over the weekend just before going to see the symphony. When you arrive you are greeted by a host or hostess and are told you can wait for your table in the outdoor patio area. This area is a great lounging set up complete with a table for your drinks and a beautiful waterfall for ambience. I was promptly seated even though the pier was quite busy and it was mid evening. One of the big attractions is a wall of windows that face the bay. This offers A great view while you enjoy your dinner. Our properly dressed waiter introduced himself and offered to get drinks and an appetizer for my family and I. We quickly received our refreshments and a wonderful bread basket accompanied with soft butter. Our calamari appetizer arrived shortly after that. Both the bread and calamari were excellent starters for our dinner. Our empty plates were taken and exchanged with our entrees of the night. My girlfriend had ordered the clam chowder bread bowl, I ordered the swordfish plate. The bread bowl lived up to its name, a classic San Francisco must. The sword fish was wonderfully cooked and served with delicious potato fingerlings and sautéed shallots. Both plates expressed a wonderful presentation of placement and color. Unfortunately we were in a hurry and did not get to experience dessert. The staff at fog harbor seem well dressed and organized. I did not see many dirty tables waiting to be cleaned and reset. Our waiter promptly brought us our check and offered to validate it since we had used the parking garage. There was a problem with our ticket and it took longer than usual. He knew we were in a hurry so for our inconvenience he graciously discounted our bill. Excellent food, great ambience and attentive service is a recipe for a pleasant dinner. Fog Harbor is a must if you are in the San Francisco area.

ZvYv9_BqsPmmY9GRfAF2cg.review_text: Yes, it is a touristy restaurant in an extremely touristy area. However, even tourists like to eat well.  The food we ordered (the Fish & Chips, the Clam Chowder, the Kids grilled salmon) were all fantastic. The view was nice, the service was good, and the prices were to be as expected. I wouldn't drive out of my way to go here, but I sure wouldn't turn it down if in the neighborhood.

2c46Ds6WvOJTl6d2hmTRvQ.review_text: The wait was about thirty minutes, not bad for dinner time. The food pricing ranges from about 12-35$ per plate. It was amazing food, service, and had a great ambiance. My server was Jason, and he recommended the best dish and was super kind and helpful! I'll be back for sure!!

K9RFAFSaZUY2InwIun7fbA.review_text: I was on the ferry back from Alcatraz and wanted a bowl of clam chowder especially on a cold rainy day. I walked in around lunch time and it wasn't busy and sat at the bar. The restaurant is all windows and has great views if you sit at a table. I ordered the soup and salad combo and also if you check in on yelp you get a free bleu cheese garlic bread (!). Everything I ordered was really good especially the garlic bread. If I ever go to fishermans wharf again i'd def come back and recommend the restaurant.   Also, my favorite part was the customer service, the two bartenders were friendly and attentive. I'm traveling by myself and a friendly conversation was a plus.

uaBQ9Tvfe4vNj09ao5VHiw.review_text: I'll be honest, we came here to get our parking validated and we only had clam chowder and the crab/mango ceviche. As already noted, this is a typical touristy restaurant but I'll highlight a few of the positives:  -Fresh and free sourdough. With that being said, skip the bread bowl with your chowder and use the free bread. -Good views of the water from almost any table. The whole place has wide windows that ket in natural light. -The table cloths have paper on them, I have no shame and asked for crayons. Who doesn't love doodling before dinner? -Friendly staff  Overall I have had better chowder and the $16 ceviche was pretty average. Oh and it came with literally five tortilla chips on the plate. Five...not to be negative but I was not sure if that was the restaurant being fancy or cheap.

WcuGUc953j9w0PDx3UwNAw.review_text: Super busy on a Saturday night at 6pm. We were able to get seated fairly quickly though.  The calamari appetizer we ordered came fast and the dip that came with it was the highlight of the dish. Crab stuffed lobster was next.  The lobster was delicious but i wasn't a fan on the crab mixture which was strange since i love crab.  I also didn't like the garlic mashed potatoes either,  they just tasted strange to me.  My dinner companion thought they were delicious.  Now the best part of the meal. .... dessert.  I happened across a chocolate cake.  I don't normally go for chocolate but it was the best dessert option.  You know the fudge inside a molten lava cake?  That's exactly what it tastes like!  The entire thing and it doesn't have a cake texture,  more like a thick pudding.  Worth every calorie and more.  I honestly believe it's the best thing I've ever eaten,  in my life! It's a must have,  I may go get another today!

KZCyrN7dTQBpx1rs6qp99Q.review_text: I would give it 3 1/2 stars if I could. At the end of the day....it's better than not bad. A little touristy for my taste but thats what you would expect from Pier 39. I probably won't go back but only because I know there are dozens of better places nearby.

YldZ3bmtbWAy18D9SmLKZg.review_text: I recently took a group of 17 for appetizers and cocktails during a team building day in the city.  We ordered crab cakes, crab dip, stuffed artichokes and calamari.  The food and service were good and from what I heard the drinks were good as well.  The atmosphere was a little lively for a Wednesday afternoon but we were on Pier 39 so expect crowds.  What I really liked was that they cold accommodate us without reservations and the food did come out promptly.  It's a little pricey and the food is not what I would call healthy but it was fun to stop and have a little treat right there on the pier.

z20FNsqFmnL45AAggYLXeA.review_text: During my trip to San Francisco - my friend and I stopped here on a Sunday evening. I'm grateful we did!  We sat at the bar after we put our names on the list to be seated. The drinks I had were excellent! I had the Lombard Lemonade and the Lipstick Lemondrop...mmmm. I also liked that they had "lower calorie drink options" on the menu. (Since I was on vacation - the calories didn't count - but just in case for another time where I'm on perfect diet behavior)...  Once we were seated, our server was very attentive and provided excellent service. The complimentary bread was delicious - or maybe I just love sourdough. For my entree, I had the mixed grill -  which was perfect because I couldn't make up my mind on what kind of seafood I wanted. It was plenty of food, but I didn't finish the meal miserably full.   The ambiance of the restaurant was pretty nice too; I liked our view of the bay.   When I come back to San Francisco, I'd love to eat here again!

__XoLCyPKQ7LHo4qR8Q4tw.review_text: Right on Pier 39  Clam Chowder: They say it's the best, It was good but wasn't Jaw dropping. It  taste like better than average clam chowder.  Good: Quick Seating, Near the big Parking Structure.Nice view of Alcatraz(if there windows are clean)  Bad:Can be on expensive side but really what you would expect given the location.

_p0Y3fNkPF2dWxudP60Bbg.review_text: Amazing crab cakes (Remind them to bring you the sauce that should come with it). Super delicious chocolate cake.

1VL37A_wk_t67j-WdDecpA.review_text: We had a light lunch here on our last day in San Francisco and thoroughly enjoyed it. I had the Red Chili shrimp which was very spicy and very good. The sauce was so flavorful that even though I usually skip the bread, I used it to get even more of the sauce. Hubby had the clam chowder bowl and thought it was solid and second only to the chowder at Scoma's during our visit this time. It was fun to watch the sea lions while we were having lunch and then to walk around on the pier after eating.

tti8GTHZpXNQBAwdjgsu2Q.review_text: It is a tourist trap, do not eat there, do not waste your time and money. We tried this restaurant because of the free Pier 39 Parking validation, a bad idea...  Our lobster tails were not only overcooked and chewy, but also pretty small (not acceptable for $32 each + tax); Our broccoli was spongy and waterlogged.  The service was very fast but not really friendly and welcoming. We were ignored and our waiter also forgot to bring our wine. What a poor service there.  He quickly tried to apology while giving us the check to get a decent tip, very awkward.  This restaurant ruined our night and I would not recommend it, even to my worst enemy.

PudHHX-t2zpxkRgDrHsnyA.review_text: very clean, great food and service. Worth the money!

UFnKmgINmdvAaHgiDTWtWw.review_text: I honestly just went to this place because we had a group of 8 in our party, and it was the best compromise amongst what everybody wanted for a Saturday lunch.  Seafood is better at the small hole in the wall places, but those only seat like 10 at capacity and don't take reservations.  So I came into this place knowing what I was getting to myself into, and still the food was just ehh.  I got a chowder bowl, which was okay at best.  You can honestly get better chowder by walking down the wharf a little bit and getting it from one of the stands.  I also got a seafood pasta dish which was good but definitely not memorable (probably why I can't even remember exactly what it's called).  I think I spent like $45 total with a beer on top of those 2 dishes so this place is definitely not on the cheap side.  In the end, it's basically one of the touristy spots, and you should only expect as much.  If you have to, then it's an okay choice, but it wouldn't be my first choice, or second, or third...

wvB9Rzn3BHzUUMUzLL4u2w.review_text: We had an early dinner and a nice view of Pier 39.  For appetizers, we had the dungeness crab cakes and our daughter had their award winning clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl.  Hubby had the pacific sole with fingerling potatoes, spinach, peppers, tarragon & capers.  I had the mixed grilled salmon, swordfish and shrimp, with citrus buerre blanc, wild rice and steamed broccoli.  Our daughter had the kids meal fried shrimp & french fries.  The food was delicious, and we were too full for dessert. A couple of hours later, we were able to enjoy the fireworks display over the bay.

748mK2uclV1lBuoiPhEj1w.review_text: This is an outstanding restaurant that offers the very best that San Francisco can  give. It's very pricey but the food is just amazing. I ordered a warm spinach salad and swordfish. The swordfish was moist and delicious on a bed of ratatouille. My husband had the ahi tuna and he was shocked at how perfectly it was done. We have barbecued ahi tuna at home and there's no way he could reproduce what he had that night. The service was stellar and the staff were very accommodating as they put us at the bar even though we didn't book ahed of time. We were able to enjoy a full meal at the bar. It turned out to be a great way to meet people, too! We really enjoyed the spectacle of basil martinis being made - basil leaves were crushed with a glass pestle in a thick glass filled with ice cubes. They seemed to be a popular drink!  Highly recommended to anyone visiting Fisherman's Wharf!

er7n0l-Nc545hL2MdREXXQ.review_text: My family loves this place. Great views, good food and spacious enough to accommodate groups with kids. Nice environment tucked onto Fishermans Wharf. Love the Popcorn Shrimp.

Ru9W4oeGaRfBvVLLUzR_Hg.review_text: Fog Harbour has the best service, food and atmosphere on the Wharf.  I highly recommend that you give it a whirl when entertaining your family, friends and loved ones. Superb clam chowder and cucumber basil martini.

4jr4z3ZpKpAWEN1TT6D_ow.review_text: I like this place a lot. I had a shellfish for two shared with my husband. It was delicious but don't eat dessert. Your server brings you samples and they all look terrible...our waiter even recommended other places for dessert.

qJTDoQFAKKg2bH-B5tLsXQ.review_text: The food is off the chain!  My favorite is the swordfish with the delicious potatoes!  I also have my favorite desert, the chocolate cookie with ice cream....

-Jv-JX6Ll9z7JFxUWkn6xQ.review_text: The bf was looking for some good ole San Francisco clam chowder, and we naturally went to Yelp. Being that we were at Pier 39, we were led to Fog Harbor. We took a seat at the bar and were quickly attended to with menus. The female bartender said the bread dough is from Boudin's Bakery, who supplies it to all the restaurants. What's special about their sourdough is that the water used comes from the bay.   We ordered the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. Boy, it sure hit the spot! The base was nice and creamy with a good amount of clams. We polished off that bowl, so the bf asked for another cup.   Tip: visit the California Visitor's Center next door to get a coupon for 15% off your total bill.

8TuZ5jO1_tjaISwlmt1h-w.review_text: Wow, I'm on a strict Diet and normally that annoys people but not here. Both my server Justin and the manager Brian were accommodating and most importantly were smiling the whole time. Amazing views and food was incredible (had the grilled Salmon(no butter) and added grilled corn. Should have taken a picture... just arrived in San Francisco for work and have been traveling all day and now leaving with a smile in my face. Was in a Rush and it only took me around 30 minutes to get this great service...

fM_UsuFAYu2TVUqJiYAKsg.review_text: Enjoying a few short hours in this fantastic city via a cruise ship...looking for that one fantastic seafood meal, we ended up here thanks to a glance at Yelp via cellphone before the battery expired.     Encouraged by 4-star reviews, and in need of dungeness crab we walked up the stairs to this restaurant and were promptly seated.  Then we waited.  For a long time.  Finally a server appeared and she was very friendly and informative.  Unfortunately I didn't take her advice.  Wanting easy dungeness goodness, I ordered the dungeness crabcakes. We ordered chowder to share, and husband went with fried shrimp platter.    DON'T do what we did.  We soooooooo ordered wrong.  After a couple trips to the restroom which enabled me to see all the awesome food here, all I can say is DON'T order what we did.   Order ANYthing ELSE.      Chowder was okay, decent and husband's fried shrimp was okay. My crabcakes were two giant FRIED cakes of lots of filler. Sooooo NOT what I wanted.  But again I blame myself.  The server had steered me in a different direction and I (stupidly) didn't listen.     Sadly, we left feeling like we had totally ordered wrong, had not had that terrific San Fran seafood experience, and must come back and redeem ourselves next time.    Do try this place...most importantly DO listen to the server for recommendations, and follow their advice.  Otherwise, you might have a pricey ($62 before  tip) lunchtime mistake like we did.

oa8ryTDdohg7HlYfF38Owg.review_text: Parked in Garage across from the pier, walkway above street was nice and they validate ,sweet. We were seated right away.  Waitress made our night and the Manager was super wonderful, just checking to make sure all was to our liking.  Food was yummy. Good Evening with Family.

unmWEIGOGdHsZ6Xu7gnPcw.review_text: Excellent food and service.  Fish and chips were delicious.  Family enjoyed  the fried shrimp, fried calamari, and garlic crab.  All prepared well and tasted awesome.  Reservations quick and services timely.

w8VFfEWLk1KWVDSBr-J6IQ.review_text: Amazing food and drinks! amazing staff & service!  I will def go back!  Clam chowder and crab cakes were amazing!

2bHSZhM0huV8LRh3YHaOSQ.review_text: Hey you guys guess what?  The food here was actually pretty damn good!  I think this is the first meal I have ever had at Pier 39 (aside from maybe a breadbowl of chili from a Boudin cart when I was a kid).  We were done up all cute and knew we stood out like sore thumbs, but so what.  We're local and we can play tourist if we want to.  In all fairness, we were in the area to see a show across the deck, but I'm really glad we stopped in to Fog Harbor for dinner first. The views ARE great - we looked out onto the boats at the pier and Alcatraz in the distance. The service was a bit crap - absentee and completely non-engaging or interested; Lizzie noted that the other tables were getting much friendlier service. The food was solid.  Is it expensive?  I dunno, the prices seemed pretty standard for SF prices to me, especially given its waterfront location - everywhere with views is a little pricier.  If I recall it was almost $90 for the three of us - we didn't order that much food, but did have wine. Three of us split a bottle of Pinot Grigio and shared our food.  Originally, we were all going to order the exact same thing - the halibut with herb butter, wild rice and veggies, which is why I had to branch out a bit.  I ordered the chili garlic prawns which were fight over worthy.  We must've eaten an entire loaf of the nice hot sourdough bread they give you just sopping up all the broth to be sure we didn't miss any of it.  I also got the spinach salad which was totally skippable.   Liz did not like her fish, rice or veggies and left a bit unfulfilled.  Mel and I however seemed more into it.  I actually thought it was pretty damn tasty and ate all of my share with no problem - the fish was cooked perfectly, the rice was a good texture and the veggies weren't swimming in oil or butter and were also cooked well. I would absolutely eat here again and I really think it's an excellent bet for any tourists in the area.  Just keep in mind that entrees are $20-$30 - McDonald's pricing it is not, but it's totally in line with SF and a waterfront property at that.  Also, try not to have a heart attack at the 3.5% health surcharge which is much higher than most other spots in the city.

2fN8mN7uUjOw-QqtcgYqXQ.review_text: Taste: 4 Value: 3 Service: 4  I came here with my gf on July 4th last year after looking at all the different restaurants. Unfortunately, there were a ton of people at Pier 39, and every restaurant had a wait time of at least 30 minutes. I think Bubba Gump had a wait time of nearly an hour? We ended up choosing this place since it looked pretty nice, and the wait was only 15 minutes.  To be honest, I don't remember exactly what either of us got, but I remember the food being okay. I think we probably both got a fish entree dish. Will update this if I happen to go again sometime. The view was pretty good, and so was the service.

jo6Ebpjbf4MG_jiNa_Jcow.review_text: I found this on Yelp and decided to go because of the reviews- I was not disappointed!!  I had the shrimp scampi and it was fantastic.  My friend had the clam chowder in a bread bowl and raved about it.  We also had the fried calamari appetizer and it was outstanding.  The atmosphere and the view were certainly wonderful.  We had great service- I'll certainly go back next time I'm in the city!
